name: Parole
description: Two players attempt to make a chain of words and cross the board. Your adversary can and will try to break the chain and steal your words. Whoever reaches the other side of the board despite this handicap, wins the game.

name: Ghetto
description:
Ghetto (possibly also called "Smelina") was a Monopoly variant set in the Terezin (Theresianstadt) Ghetto in what is now the Czech Republic. The game was designed in 1943 by Oswald Pöck, an engineer who was confined in the Ghetto at that time. Pöck produced the game for children who were confined in Terezin, and the game was passed from one child to another as they were taken from Terezin to the death camps.

Two copies of the game are known to exist: one at the Yad Vashem holocaust museum and another at the Beit Terezin museum.

name: Feilong
description:
From publisher`s website:

Feilong (pronounced fay-loong) is a question-based game designed for players with limited, intermediate, as well as extensive knowledge of China. Its three decks of question cards are arranged in three levels of difficulty. Players with a very limited or a Beginner's level of knowledge play the game with Deck A; Intermediates with Decks A & B; and, Experts with Decks A, B & C. The game's goal is to stimulate curiosity and encourage all players to eventually "graduate" to playing Feilong with all three decks.

TO PLAY

Players start by deciding if the game will be played by the rules for Beginners, Intermediates, or Experts. They then select one of the "Tours in Time & Space" listed in the Rules Folder and enter the chosen tour's eight destination numbers (i.e., space numbers on the game board's playing track) in the blocks at the top of the Score Pad. Players advance around the playing track by correctly answering questions and outwitting opponents that exploit the game's strategy options. The first player to "visit" (i.e., land on the space of) each of the tour's eight destinations and enter the map of China in the center of the board wins the game.

name: Longhorn
description:
You play a "trail boss" working for a ranching outfit and your job is to drive a herd of cattle to market and well them at the best price. You start off with 12 cowboys, 500 head of cattle (and can hunt for more), and head north, driving your herd over the long, dusty miles to Kansas. You'll have lots to deal with along the way, but with a bit of luck and cool judgment, you'll make a handsome profit at the end of the drive.
The game board shows Texas, the Indian Territory (modern Oklahoma) and Kansas, along with parts of other states and territories as the were in the early 1870's. Several cattle trails important in the early 1870's are shown, although many more trails, especially in south central Texas were used at different times.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Finger-Flick Sports: Football
description:
Description from box:

Finger-Flick Sports: Football is an incredibly exciting and interactive sports board game that mirrors the play of football itself! There's no counting spaces or rolling the dice to score. With Finger -Flick Football you run, pass, kick field goals and PAT's, make great defensive plays, and score touchdowns - all with the flick of a finger.

Finger-Flick Sports: Football has something for everyone - it's fast, exciting, challenging, and lots of fun. Best of all, this game is an enjoyable way to bring friends and families together.

Finger-Flick Sports: Football comes with everything you need for great family entertainment! And, it's easy to play - all it takes is the flick of a finger and you're in the game!

name: Depth Charge
description:
Earned 5th Place in the 2005 About.com and GameTable Online Deduction Game Design Contest.

Per the rules of the contest it only requires common gaming items and printed materials included with the rules.

Flavor text from the rules - “It’s time once more for naval exercises on Lake Ashtapada to test what the new crewmen have learned about using sonar. They will be split into two teams, Red and Black, who will set three targets to represent mines for each other to find. The first team to find the other’s mines wins the trophy; the other will be scrubbing toilets.”

Online Play


Super Duper Games
categories: Abstract Strategy, Deduction, Nautical, Print & Play

name: Peeko
description:
The object of the game is to find the hidden five-letter word with the least number of guesses. The numbers or keys to the five letters of the word are hidden under sliding panels. Open one panel at a time until a number of numbers appear. Write the letter in the position indicated by the number. Who can complete the word in the least number of guesses?

1964 Vintage Peeko Family Word Game #4986 by Watkins-Strathmore Company.
Made in U.S.A. by Western Printing-Lithographing Co.

Box Quotes:
"Contains 192 games, "magic slate" score pad, and stylus.
"192 word games for the whole family!"
"Open the Window, Find the Hidden Word!"
"Peeko is fun to play alone or as a group"

Game Includes:
Peeko Game Unit
Contains 25 sheets (4 word searches per sheet on front and 4 word searches on back)
Score Pad
Stylus
Peeko advertisement

name: The Gourmet Game
description:
Publisher's description:
Fascinating and completely different, THE GOURMET GAME takes you to fine international restaurants to dine in the grande manner. The object of the game is to win gourmet awards by composing meals from a variety of mouth-watering dishes.
Each player has his own board, which is in the form of a menu. Dishes include classic haute cuisine and are name in English and French (you'll soon learn the French words and their correct pronunciation). Six cards are dealt to each player, and as a player takes new cards from the deck or does discarded by his opponents he gradually puts together a gourmet meal. To win, however, he must order the right dishes and beverages, and must prevent other players from ordering. Both skill and luck are required. A budget of $100 and other restrictions make the game all the more exciting. Two to six may play.

name: Borderline: Africa Edition
description:
This Crazy Eights variant was designed by TV star John Davidson and his wife.

Players start with hands of 8 cards which come from a deck consisting of nations from Africa, bodies of water, and wild cards. The cards have the name of the location on one side and a map on the other side, showing contiguous locations.

The object is to void your hand by playing a card with something that shares a borderline with the last card played. Wild cards when played are automatically considered a match and can then be named as any location in the deck except for those in the player's hand. If a player cannot play a contiguous card, cards are drawn from the deck and added to the player's hand until a card can be played.

Instead of drawing, a player can play a card that does not share a borderline and hope to not be challenged. Challenges can happen after any play. If the challenging player is correct, and the card played does not share a borderline, then the challenged player has to take back the card and take a card from the challenging player's hand. If the challenge is incorrect, the challenger takes a card from the deck and the challenged player gets another turn.

name: Nexos
description: A deduction game where the goal is to connect two words or names (depending on the starting and finishing card). Good answers make players movement. The board has three paths with three lengths and all the players agree if they want to make it short, medium or long. The first player finishing the board is the winner.

name: Fiesta
description:
Age: 4+

Description:
You're the party host, but you've got the ingredients for you skewers totally mixed up. Have your guests help you sort them all out. The winner is the one who skewers all their ingredients first. Mmmmmmà..delicious! 4 skewers and 40 ingredients in four colors.

name: Battle for Andromeda: Conflict for a Trillion Suns!
description:
The game is set on a grand strategic level with each player controlling a civilization. There are six civs supplied, all with the same basic units, and each culture has "secret weapons" which give the ships some differences.

The starships come in various classes which are similar to the various naval ship classifications but on a much larger scale.

The turns consist of 14 phases covering the movement and combat for non-mobile unit, major mobile units and minor mobile units. There is also an Industrial inter-phase every third turn which is used to adjust the amount of resources available to each player.

The rules contain many special cases and details but with no index looking up any specific clause is difficult.

According to a Galaxy-Foundation Games catalog, they licensed Taurus to produce an initial print run of 6,000 copies of this game. It is not known if GFG did any further print runs.

There were further games in GFG's strategic series: Deliverance From Beyond the Stars, The Xenon Empire's Star Wars: Crusade Against the War-Lords, and The Collodian Conspiracy: Science Against Chaos Unleashed. These games used Andromeda Foundation Official Battle Manual, which is a slightly changed version of the Battle for Andromeda rules, as the series rulebook.

There was a companion tactical series of games beginning with Warriors of the Dark Star: The Age of the Neutron Wars.

From the GFG catalog (reproduced verbatim):


The Battle For Andromeda - Conflict for a Trillion Suns, is the title of the over-all Strategic Series. It is on these boards that the history, the fleets, the hundreds of worlds, star systems, space armies, etc., are covered. The player handles FLEETS, LARGE SCALE DECISIONS as a RULER-COMMANDER of an ENTIRE CULTURE. He is concerned with over-all scientific Progress, the Huge Wars, and their effects and the mass movements so shown in the "BFA" Scale.

name: Controversy!
description:
(From the web site)

Think you know where your friends stand? You may be surprised. Everyone has an opinion, so here’s your chance to show off yours – pro, con, or “what if?”

Tackle tough issues of the day, like whether men are responsible for putting the toilet seat down, science vs. religion, and Seinfeld vs. Friends.

Tell it like it is – or how you’d like it to be. Air your views and change minds – maybe even your own.

WHO KNEW BEING RIGHT COULD BE SO MUCH FUN?? (tm)

Teens & Adults. 3 or more players.
publishers: New York Game Factory, LLC, Reveal Entertainment, Inc.

name: Barbie Meets Ken in the Game of Their Dreams!
description:
"Barbie is planning a trip to an exotic location. She has such a fabulous lifestyle, she is spoiled for choice of ... six glorious places to choose from.

And getting ready for the trip can be just as much fun! Barbie has six things to collect before she is ready to meet Ken in the place of their dreams."

Circular gameboard has establishments Barbie must visit to complete her Collectors Card. The first player to collect all six items and arrive at their final destination is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: La Chasse au Vampire
description:
In a random place in Eastern Europe, travelers are gathering to fight the evil vampire.
There is a day/night cycle determined by a sand glass. In daylight, travelers move twice as fight as the vampire. During nighttime, it is the opposite.

The players must bring all 4 artifacts into the vampire lair to kill him and win... but they do not know which artifacts they carry until they reach the crypt, or when they are bitten by the vampire. But some artifacts are actually vampire cards, than can turn a traveler into a vampire, unless he gets a blood transfusion by a fellow traveler who has a compatible blood group !

The vampire wins if he can turn all travelers into vampires.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Björnen sover
description:
The title (The bear is sleeping) is a well-known children's song in Norway and Sweden. The game was first released in Norwegian in 2002, and in a much improved Swedish version in 2004. In the original version, the players try to collect gold coins without waking the sleeping bear; in the later version they gather blueberries instead.

Before the game starts, circular tiles are randomly placed face down on the board. In the original only the central 20 spaces are covered, in the later version all 44 spaces (not counting the four starting spaces). Players roll the die and move their pawns on the board. If they land on a face-down tile, this is revealed and acted on, and then turned face down again. If it depicts 1, 2 or 3 coins/blueberries, the player may take that number of couns/berries from the pool. The remaining symbols differ between the editions:

Norwegian edition: If a bear tile is revealed, the bear wakes up, and all players currently in the lair lose one coin. If a player lands on one of the bear paw symbols (printed on some of the non-covered spaces, not found on a token), two face-down tiles may be swapped.

Swedish edition: If it is a bear tile, the player loses one berry. If players stop on a face-up troll tile, the player may pick up the tile and use it to defend against the bear. Face-up bear print tiles may be used to swap two face-down tiles around (so that if players remember where the 3-berry tiles are they can use this to their advantage).

When all coins/blueberries are taken, the player with the most coins/berries is the winner.

Contents of the Swedish version:
Gameboard
44 wooden gameboard tiles
10 spare wooden tiles
27 wooden blueberry tiles
4 pawns
1 oversized die, numbered 2-2-3-3-4-4
Rules

Contents of the Norwegian version:
Gameboard
20 cardbord gameboard tiles
20 cardbord gold coins
4 pawns
1 die (not stated if this is numbered 1–6 or 2–4)
(Rules are printed on the back of the box)

4 years and up (Norwegian version is given as 5+, but is actually slightly simpler than the Swedish marked 4+). Language independent.

name: Das Boote-Spiel
description:
The map shows All of Germany and neigbouring Countries or parts of them (such as Netherlands, Czech Rep, Austria...) with all its channels, rivers and seashore. Each player picks a haven. Objective is to visit all other players havens and be home first. There is no random element - the speed is determined by the currents and the speed of the boat (which can be changed from turn to turn within certain limits). Movement is hindered by the water gates which are quite numerous along the channels. The water gates can only be passed in certain "days" (=turns) and with certain speeds.
So, to win you have to consider not only the length of the route taken, but also the timing dictated by the water gates.

name: Fame Alias
description:
"In other words, a game that requires you to know the well known."

A team game about knowing famous people, both Finnish and international. A member of the team tries to describe famous persons, without mentioning actual names or certain keywords: Red cards have a picture of a person and a couple of keywords (eg. Jimi Hendrix: "guitarist, Woodstock '69") while Blue cards have 3 choices of a person with text only and the keywords underlined. Team mates then try to make as many correct guesses as possible in a limited time frame.


This game is one of the earlier re-implementations of Alias.
categories: Party Game, Racing, Trivia, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game

name: Fischerspiel
description:
Cooperative children's and family game for players 5 years and older. The game includes 2 more strategic variants.

The players work together to catch all the fish before the wind reaches strength 12. Players roll the special die and move their boats accordingly. Fish are caught by moving the required number of boats to adjacent spaces - bigger fish (2-4 points) require the corresponding number of boats; only small fish (value 1) can be caught by one boat alone. Rolling the wind symbol increases the strength of the wind by 1; bringing an even number of fish into the harbor reduces the strength of the wind by 1. Players win if all the fish are caught before the wind reaches strength 12.

Contents: 1 board, 1 special die (showing 1-4, star, wind symbol), 6 boats, 12 fish (1-4 points each), 12 wind markers.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Marines versus Zombies
description:
From the item's listing:
"Trapped in a crumbling city, surrounded by brain eating zombies... Can the gallant marines make it to the helipad for evac before they become lunch?" Marines versus Zombies is an exciting game for two or more players. A group of marines has been cut off from base and must struggle to find the helipad and escape. The map is constructed from 25 face-down tiles, randomly laid out in a 5x5 grid which allows for a unique game every time.

Marines vs. Zombies is a 46 page book with everything you need to run complete games.
categories: Horror, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order

name: Elmer Layden's Scientific Football Game: College Edition
description: Dice driven game. Use 3 dice to determine results of each play. 30 plays constitute each quarter.

name: Stack
description: From the back of the box: A player's task in the game of STACK is to reach the other side of the board with either a single block or a stack of blocks under the player's control, by means of stacking, splitting or attacking by tactical moves. The first player to reach the other end of the board and remain on that circle, without being taken on their opponent's next move is the winner.

name: Operation: Market Garden – 1944
description: This is a variant on Axis & Allies (mostly Axis & Allies: D-Day) which allows players to replay Operation Market Garden during World War II. On the Allies side are the US and UK and on the Axis side is Germany. Like D-Day, this game includes Fortune, Order and Theater cards to be used by players. Maps, charts, and rules are all provided but you must provide your own playing pieces.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: First Past The Post
description:
First Past The Post seeks to provide a light and enjoyable take on the British election process. Parties fight to win and keep control of constituencies while keeping voters happy with their stances on a variety of issues. It’s a cut-throat and aggressive business but one party will do just enough to get elected by being “First Past The Post”.

Influence the voters, change your own party's beliefs on the issues that count and try to win over the floating voters in the local and general elections!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Political, Print & Play

name: Professor Noggin's  Prehistoric Mammals
description:
From Giant Beavers to Woolly Rhinos. discover the land of prehistoric beasts. Learn about the fascinating fauna that once roamed the earth and swam the seas.

Card.topics.include:
Ambulocetus
Ancylotherium
Andrewsarchus
Basilosaurus
Dinofelis
Dorudon
Entelodont
Extinction
Four-tusked Elephant
General Topic Card
Giant Beaver
Giant_Shortfaced_Bear
Indricotherium
Leptictidium
Macrauchenia
Mastodon
Megaloceros
Megatherium
Moeritherium
Neanderthal
Pleistocene Epoch
Propalaeotherium
Saber-tooth Cat
Stone Age
Tasmanian Tiger
Western Camel
Woolly Mammoth
Woolly Rhino
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Prehistoric, Trivia
publishers: Éditions Gladius International, Inc., Outset Media

name: Fairy Meat: Components Pack
description: The component pack expansion for Fairy Meat provides additional materials to accommodate up to 8 more players. The bundle contains fairy cards, life counters, twinkle counters, and kill counters for use in the game.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures, Wargame

name: National Treasure Board Game
description:
"The Clues Are Right In Front Of Your Eyes."

This was a press kit of sorts for the film, it contains trivia based around the film, such as questions about other films with Nicolas Cage and some historical trivia related to the film's plot.

Contents: National Treasure Playing Board, 4 Markers, 1 Deck of 30 Trivia Cards, 4 Sets of four Monument Cards, 1 “All-Seeing Eye” spin wheel, 1 Winner Card In Sealed Envelope, and DVD of promotional materials. The box measures 11 x 21 1/2.
categories: American Revolutionary War, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Wagon Wheels To Oregon
description:
"A fun-filled, easy to play, adventurous skill and action game, that projects the pioneer spirit of making a goal. Setting forth on a journey of many unknowns, hardships, pleasant encounters with Indians and more; only to find that their very goal could prove more treacherous by nature than that of a bow and arrow.

With the visual amazement of illustrated cards, players will be entertained and stunned by the game's twisting of fate, while reliving moment through trails and triumphs of pioneers long past."

Contents:

112 Illustrated Cards
4 Trail Markers (Game Pieces)
1 Game Dice
Gameboard
Instruction Booklet
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Missúm!
description:
Rules for conducting miniatures combat on the world of Tekumel (the setting of the RPG "Empire of the Petal Throne" and the more recent "Tekumel: World of the Petal Throne"). These 1:100 figure scale rules for 25mm minatures succeeded the earlier "Legions of the Petal Throne" booklet.

These rules were first published by The Imperium Publishing Company and have been reprinted by Tita's House of Games. Later supplements contained army statistics for the armies of the major human empires and non-human races. Another, more detailed, set of Tekumel miniature rules, "Qadardalikoi," was published in 1983.

name: Qadardalikoi
description:
Rules for conducting miniatures battles on the world of Tekumel (the setting for the RPG "Empire of the Petal throne" and the more recent "Tekumel: The world of the Petal Throne"). These rules for 1:100 figure scale 25mm miniatures battles are much more detailed than the two earlier Tekumel miniature rules sets: "Legions of the Petal Throne" and Missum!" Qadardalikoi also includes campaign rules and is compatible with the army statistics contained in later supplements.

First published in 1983 by Tekumel Games, the booklet has been republished by Tita's House of Games.

name: Stratgol
description:
Stratgol© has the objective of simulating the action of a real soccer match, allowing to recreate game situations with the same level of excitement of the real thing.

Dice play an important role, helping to work out issues when uncertainty must be present but not to the point of making it a chance game. The decisions of when and how to execute your movements and the administration of your tactical points will have a greater impact on the final result.

The rules were designed according to the FIFA rules. A full length game usually lasts 90 minutes. This is a game for two players.

The game was released in June/2006, and is only available in Spanish.

name: Monopoly: James Bond 007
description:
This game is licensed to thrill as the world’s foremost super spy teams up with the world’s most popular board game. Vie to own all 21 James Bond films, including The Spy Who Loved Me, The Living Daylights, Goldfinger and the latest release, Casino Royale. Celebrate every aspect of the Bond world – the villains, cars, gadgets, MI6 and of course, the Bond Women. The world is not enough as you attempt to bankrupt your opponents and OWN IT ALL.

The James Bond 007 edition of America’s favorite board game comes complete with 6 collectible pewter tokens featuring Odd Job’s Bowler Hat, Rosa Klebb’s Shoe, Aston Martin DBS, 007 logo, Acrostar plane and the Lotus submarine car. Rules include a 60 minute speed play option for a shorter game with the same amount of fun. Get ready to experience the adventure of a lifetime with the world’s greatest secret agent! It’s Bond. James Bond.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Thunderbird 50th Anniversary
description:
Drive down memory lane in 22 of the most classic T-Birds ever built.

Enjoy this collector’s MONOPOLY game as you compete to own the most popular T-Birds of all-time. Relive 50 years of rich T-Bird history, from 1955 to 2005 as you celebrate the golden anniversary of one of America’s most beloved cars.

Buy the 1963 and the 1965 10th Anniversary edition; sell the 1995 40th Anniversary edition and the 2002 Concept Car and trade the 1980 25th Anniversary edition and the 1956 Early Bird. Wheel and deal until you bankrupt your opponents and own all of the title deeds. This is your chance to own them ALL before this classic Thunderbird is retired, so put the pedal to the metal!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Åkar-spelet
description:
Åkar-spelet is a promotional game released by the Swedish branch of Esso, now a brand of ExxonMobile, around the time when the company was sold to Norwegian Statoil in 1985.

Players take on the role of one of four hauliers; the bus, the truck (pictured as a dump truck for some reason), the excavator or the soda van. In each round of the game, players draws a mission from the deck matching his or her role and then take turns to throw dice and move their playing piece around the board to complete the mission and get back to their respective headquarters first.
Along the way they have to avoid red numbered squares, 83 in total, that correspond to a bad event, like a parking ticket, or could make you draw a Chance! card that are divided 50/50 between good and bad. They also have to avoid refueling squares that make you go to the very nearest fuel station and pay for fuel before you may proceed. Players are however encouraged to buy different kinds of Esso solutions that make this cheaper or even make you immune within a radius of your headquarters.

The number of rounds played are variable between one and ten and the goal is to have the most money when the game is over. The first player to complete the mission each round get a bonus, the second a smaller bonus and the third an even smaller bonus but the last player, no matter if second, third or fourth, instead get a late fee for every space left on the mission. Red numbered squares often make you lose a turn or charge you a fee while the five good Chance! cards often give a sizable reward. Missions also often give a cash reward for one or more steps or a larger reward when completed.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Die Angelschlacht 1944
description:
Die Angelschlacht (the pivotal battle) 1944 covers the 25th SS PG\12SS Panzer division's counterattack on June 7th against the strung out Canadian forces west of Caen. The 12thSS struck with 45 tanks and quickly advanced causing a panic to the allies. The Canadians had little armor and were out of artillery range. The battle lasted 6 hours and the SS advanced only a few miles but this attack delayed the allied advance for another 30 days! The game has over 280 counters and one 11x17" map, rulebook. Include in the game are unique random events that makes game play never the same. For those interested in historical or what games, player's may choose to do either. The game contains many scenarios.

Each hex is 200-250 yds, each turn is 30 min. Units are company level, each with a morale and movement rating. Actual fire strengths depend on the unit firing, type of attack, range to target, and weapon firing. New rules cover random events, anti-aircraft fire, air units, M10's, Panther tanks.

name: The Dvina River Offensive: Final Blows in North Russia, August 1919
description:
By August 1919, the British 45th and 46th Battalions, together with over seven river monitors and gunboats mounting up to 9" guns, over 25 aircraft (mostly DH9A bombers) were in place for the final blow on the Red virus known as Bolshevism. By this time, the French and Americans had all left. It was now a British show and one that was destined to leave a bloody nose upon the Reds. At least that was the plan! As the troops gathered along both sides of the Dvina River (the river was very large), the opposing forces were as determined. The Reds fielded the 3rd Brigade\18th Division amounting to the 160, 161, 162 Regiments, numerous large artillery barges, six fighter aircraft, many gunboats, lots of mines, trenches. The overconfident British had not factored in the effects of Mother Nature, which as the battle wore on, smiled too often on the Red forces. Clearing BOTH sides of this major river ( think Mississippi) and advancing hundreds of miles to Kotlas (the main Red base) in hindsight, seemed like a crazy idea, but at the time, was a tempting objective. And so it was. The Dvina River Offensive had it all: dogfighting aircraft, ground combat, naval surface action, naval bombardment, bombing, machine guns, artillery, river monitors and gunboats, unpredictable river currents, water levels, sandbars, floating mines sent down by the Reds, foul weather, balloons. The offensive lasted four days. One part went extraordinarily well-another part nosedived into hell-both sides get to enjoy this game!

Game scale is 750 yds a hex, turns are 12 hrs, 10 in all. Ground units are platoons, artillery batteries, single aircraft include: Sopwith, Spad, Avro, DH9A, Re 8, Neuiport, M20 and Short. River ships include: monitors, gunboats, each representing one ship. Ground units include Lewis guns, MG, Stokes mortars, leaders, infantry. There are two game maps, one covers the ground action and the other the air to air combat at a different scale (50 yd a hex). Aircraft are rated for speed, bombing, size, maneuver, altitude. Thus, the game is really two games: an operational ground game, a tactical naval and air to air combat game!
categories: Civil War, Wargame, World War I

name: Hab acht!
description:
Hab Acht ("Pay Attention") is a interesting memory variant, because it's motifs are printed on both sides of the tiles! There are 9 motifs printed on 36 tiles. Each front has a different backside, which means that every possible front/back-side is included in this game. Each motif is also printed on 9 task-tiles and every player draws 1 task-tile before the game begins.

Object of the game is to reveal all 8 motifs which match the task-tile. This can be quite difficult, especially, when you not also try to find "your" 8 motifs, but when you simultaneously try to inhibit certain motifs to come up, which apparently are being sought after from some of your opponents...

name: Dynamite
description:
snip from introduction:
" The Draw-Place deck face down in center of table. Each player draws one card at a time. First one to draw a dynamite card is the dealer.

The Deal-The cars are dealt one at a time beginning at left. With two players, deal seven cards to each. After all hands are dealt, dealer turns up the top card and leaves the deck face down beside it.

Object of Play-To get rid of all cards in your hand. the first player to succeed wins that round and the others must record their score according to the cards left in their hand."

As the name implies, their are rock, scissors, and paper cards. In addition, there are dynamite and double take cards, all of which come in assorted colors.

The short of it is, think Rock Scissors Paper meets Uno.

name: Robo Bash
description: A free game included in the Dork Tower #14 comic book. Each player controls a RoboBasher (mechanical vehicles with differing attributes in Firepower, Armor, and Speed), moving it around an arena trying to destroy all the other RoboBashers. During each round, a player can use a limited number of "Power Dice" to boost the values of their RoboBasher's attributes.

name: Don't Quote Me: Sports Illustrated Edition
description: Players attempt to move their piece around the track the fastest, answering questions from five different categories from the realm of sports: Team, individual, vintage, names & numbers, and sidelines. Players may have to identify quotations, pick three correct answers out of four, list items, and answer other trivia questions. Covers a wide range of sports questions, including even TV shows, movies, and obscure sports.

name: Alaska Dyke Life
description:
A limited edition poster/game, with only 400 printed. A roll and move game featuring localities within Alaska. Art/game produced by Anchorage artist Kenna Bates.

Game takes place on a 23" x 34" poster (suitable for framing). Game pieces and dice not included.

The object of the game is to "collect as many girlfriends as you can!". "Girlfriends" = points, which are traded among players as they move onto different spaces.

Proceeds from the print/game are to support athletes participating in the Montreal Out Games.

name: Typhoons & Turtleships
description: Typhoons & Turtleships. Two player card game simulating the various attempts of the Japanese and the Koreans (Chinese & Mongols too) to conquer each other across the Sea of Japan. Players alternate being the Attacker. If the Attacker wins both the Naval and Conquest phases he wins. Strategy favors the defender, but the attacker only has to win once. Players share a deck. Some cards are specific to a certain player or a certain phase. Good filler game. Educational on an offbeat historical Topic. Complete Rules and link to card set available at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/TTS.html
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Medieval, Nautical, Print & Play

name: Narro
description:
The name of the game is derived from the German word "Narr", which means fool or clown.

The game is played on a 12x12 board. Each player has 3 red, green, blue and yellow playing pieces, but one player uses the round pieces and the other the square ones. Each field of the board shows one of these 4 colors and the pieces can move only on fields of their color.

Object of the game is to capture all opposing pieces and still having 2 or more own pieces on the board. Captures are made by jumping over opposing pieces.

name: Boats
description: This game set was designed and developed entirely by trans-Atlantic email between Mike Roberts and Kate Jones. The ideas and messages grew and flew feverishly for months, and at last stopped at 101 beautiful and challenging figures formed by matching the boat-shaped tiles by color. The 36 tiles comprise all the ways 6 colors can be paired. Here's a sample tile. The 13 islands in the 11" tray are fixed in place. Outside the tray 100 other exquisite lattices await. Several competitive games are included.

name: Serenity: The Unofficial Board Game
description:
From the creator of the game:

"I made up a game based on Firefly and Serenity, in which you fly around the 'verse looking for work and trying to put together a crew."

"You try not to get pirated by other players, avoid the Reavers and Alliance, and try to earn credits. "

There is a preview here: http://www.fireflyfans.net/sunroomitem.asp?i=10704

Game can be downloaded here: http://docs.google.com/leaf?id=0Bz_OJBPpg5bKNWMyOTMyMzktMmNm...;hl=en

Home Page: http://www.coroflot.com/micjwelch
categories: Adventure, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Twist & Hold 'Em Poker Cube
description:
From the packaging text:

"Twist & Hold 'Em Poker Cube features an entire deck of cards on one cube. Your 'hand' is the side that's facing you and the cards are 'shuffled' by turning the rows cube-style. Take anywhere for fun for the whole family!"

Pressman #1493 is basically a Rubik-style cube with stickers having playing card denominations on the faces. Also included are two six-sided dice. One of the dice lists a series of rotation instructions, and the other is the usual pip layout. Both dice have faces in six different colors that correspond to the centers of each face on the main card cube. The values of the central cube spaces increase by twos from 2 to Q (12) and progress through all four suits (hearts & spades are represented twice). The edge pieces are always two cards with a numerical difference of two and are always different in color. Similarly, the corner pieces progress in increments of two, half of them clockwise and half counterclockwise, and always two black and one red or two red and one black, with like colors never in matching suits. Rules for playing variants of Texas Hold 'Em, Black Jack, Vegas, Spades, Chicago Hi/Lo and Rummy are provided, but others could probably be adapted.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Dice
mechanics: Area Movement, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Art of War: Tactical Warfare in Miniature for Pre-gunpowder Armies
description:
Short version of the game is: It plays fast. Usually a battle takes about an hour. It doesn't really matter how the figs are based. Its fairly bloody. Figs are pulled as they are killed. It has the tactics mechanisms built in, so you really only need to worry about what the army you're running is capable of. We strive for historical accuracy, and have a pretty high success rate for duplicating real fights.

* Basic rules, plus a Crusades mini-campaign appendix including 9 armies lists: 62 pages. The Basic Rules are comprehensive, and include siege warfare rules and rules for special weapons such as elephants, chariots and pavises (a large convex shield of European origin used to protect the entire body).
* Standard 15mm to 40mm frontages used: no rebasing of figurines required. (Although singly-based miniatures work best, multiple-figurine bases work OK in most situations.)
* Plus 84 additional pages of seven period appendices listing over 160 more armies:
* Greek & Macedonian Armies
* Ancient Armies of the Bronze Age
* Ancient Armies of the Iron Age
* Ancient Roman and Italian Armies
* European Dark Ages Armies 500 to 1000 A. D.
* European Medieval Armies 1000 to 1460 A. D.
* Chinese, Huns, Mongols and Japanese Armies

Download version can be purchased at www.wargamedownloads.com

name: Wise Guys
description:
Wise Guys is a collection of 10 spelling games that utilize the same board and letter tiles. The letters are divided into three groups: Blue tiles (vowels-A,E,I,O), Green tiles (common consonants & "U"), and Pink tiles (less common consonants & wild "infinity" tiles). Certain spaces on the board have a color & symbol that might affect scoring or word placement.

Some of the games are simple and suitable for young spellers, while other games are more complex. The winning condition for most games is either (1) to score more points than opponents or (2) to use more letter tiles than opponents. Players face their own letters in the upright position based on their seat at the table, and, in most games, your letters cannot contact opponents' words. When scoring is based on points, the letter value is based on its color -- one point for blue, two for green and three for pink.

name: Think: Chronos
description: Think: Chronos deals mainly with time management, so a book about this topic is included. To make things easier Wolfgang Kramer designed a game around this topic. Players use their set of movement cards to travel around the game board to pick up tiles connected to 'different aspects of life'. Most important thing (and the connection to the time management book) is to try to collect an equal number of points in all areas to maximize the final score.

name: Seeräuber-Spiel
description:
The board shows 4 harbors on the corners and the pirate's island in the middle.

One player plays the pirate and the other players take the role of normal seamen.

The normal players have a home harbor and 5 ships, which are loaded with 5 different goods. When a ship successfully reaches a foreign harbor, the good is sold and the player collects the income. The unloaded ships must all return to their home harbors.

The pirate had only 1 ship. He tries to capture ships and steal the goods, if they are carrying freight.

Movement is very unusual; it is done with the help of wooden sticks of 3 different lengths. How many sticks can be taken is determined with a die roll.

The game ends, when all ships are either captured or back in their home harbor. The richest player wins the game.

name: Celebrity Mania
description: Describe a celebrity in 30 seconds or less by writing as many one-word details as you can. You may use the Celebrity Details book if you need to familiarize yourself with the celebrity. The first person or team to get four of their Celebrity Disks on the board, in a row, wins.

name: Laura-2
description:
Two to six family tribes from the planet Laura get bored with their own planet and set off to find a bigger and better home in outer space. Not much later, they all descend on an unspoiled planet which they call Laura-2. The land grab and inter-tribal bickering starts as soon they settle into, and on to, their new home.

A simple abstract placement game for 2-6 players that is played in two phases. In the first phase players scatter their 18 tribe members and 2 item counters (a throne and a private saucer) on to the circular planet's surface. In the second phase the Lauranians will swap places until one tribe manages to get all family members unified into one single group that includes their own flying saucer and chief's throne.

In the settling phase, the first player places one counter in the defined central area of the board, and each subsequent player places one more settler as the previous player next to other Lauranians on the board, until all counters have disembarked. In this phase, no tribes may form a family group larger than 4.

In the relocation phase, in turn, each player will swap two tiles as long as they contain one own family member and the 2 tiles are lying in a straight line on the board. But a family member that is part of the tribe leader's group, including the tribe leader, can only be prized away by swapping it with another tribe leader. When you move your tribe leader more than once, you unnerve the other families, and each other tribe leader will see one of their own people take shelter under the tribe leader's throne, making it much easier for them to keep their family together.

The flying saucer can be used for one of two special moves that replaces the normal swap-2-tiles turn. One is to lift it up and move it in a straight line to land on an empty space besides a friendly tribe member. The other is to beam a family member in a straight line on to an empty field besides the saucer.

Throughout the game, no move is allowed that would leave the entire Lauranian split into two groups at the end of a turn.

Publication history: this game appeared in Spielbox magazine (2/1984 apr-jun), as one of the earlier entrants in the "Spiel zum Herausnehmen/Game to Remove" series.

name: VIP Game
description:
"VIP Game" is a Pachisi/Ludo-variant with "flying start". That means, that no special number must be thrown to enable the start of the pawns

Besides that, all 4 pawns of a player have different starting positions spread over 2 sides of the board (per player). The pawns are numbered, so that their starting position is always clear during the game.

name: Wiggly Worms
description:
The 'board' consists of a molded plastic apple with an internal timer mechanism connected to a series of variable cams. As the timer runs down the cams push the wiggly worms up and down out of holes in the apple.

The worms have colored tails. At the setup players are shown where all the worms are. During play, players try to grab worms of their own color as they appear. The player who grabs the most worms with tails of their own color is the winner!

Or, as it says on the box: "The crazy fun filled memory game - you've got to be quick to grab your worm".
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Memory
publishers: F.X. Schmid, Mattel, Inc., Peter Pan Playthings, Spear's Games

name: Primus
description:
Primus is deducted from the game Neutron from Robert A. Kraus (I). But while Neutron is for 2 players and heavily unbalanced, Primus is for 2-4 players and by using 4 instead of only 1 neutron it is a really great enhancement to Neutron.

The whole board is 8x8 spaces, but the outer rows and columns serve as home bases for the players only. The game itself is played on the 6x6 inner part of the board.

The 4 neutrons are placed in the middle of the board. Object of the game is to get the most points by moving these neutrons to the home bases. The neutrons are worth 3, 6, 8 and 10 points, depending on the order, when they have been captured. That means, the first captured neutron gives 3 points, the second 6 and so on.

After all, Primus is much better balanced than Neutron and the clever point values forces the players to think at more than just at capturing every reachable neutron.

name: Break Away
description:
Break Away was originally published in the July 1983 issue of Games magazine, and was reprinted in Spielbox 4/87 as part of the "Spiel zum Herausnehmen/Game to Remove" series.

The board has 5x6 spaces and each player has 7 playing pieces. At the start of the game, all playing pieces are placed on the board, but not on fixed locations. In fact, one player places the pieces on the board and the other player chooses the color he wants to play with.

Object of the game is to "break away" all your playing pieces: as soon as a player manages to have all his 7 pieces isolated, that is with no own neighbors on all adjacent spaces, he is the winner.

The number of spaces a piece must move is ruled in an unusual way, too: 1, 2, or 3 spaces, alternating with every move of each player (resulting in 1-3-2-1-3-2-1-3-2... for a single player).
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement
publishers: GAMES Magazine, W. Nostheide Verlag GmbH

name: Armageddon
description:
The game "Armageddon" was included in Spielbox 3/83 as part of the "Spiel zum Herausnehmen/Game to Remove" series. The introduction refers to Armageddon: Das strategische Fantasyspiel, because the Spielbox game plays in the same fantasy world, "Magira".

Armageddon has rules for a simplified game as well as for an advanced game. Both versions are played on a 17×20 hex board showing Magira with 1 fortification in the middle and 2 on the sides.

The easier version is played with 12 axe men, 12 pikemen and 12 swordsmen only. Object of the game is to capture the fortress in the middle of the board. All types of warriors have the same movement factor. Combats are decided by the throw of 1 die, but several bonus point are added to the throw. One of them is a kind of Rock-Scissors-Paper effect, because an axeman fighting a pikeman, a pikeman against a swordsman and a swordsman against an axeman gets 1 bonus point.

The advanced version adds several new units (archers, horsemen, veterans, horses), enables ranged attacks, combat support possibilities and faster movements. The victory condition stays the same.

There is also a variation, where a siege of a fortress is simulated.

name: Quadriga
description:
The game "Quadriga" was included in Spielbox 4/81 and is the first game of the "Spiel zum Herausnehmen/Game to Remove" series.

It depicts the chariot races in ancient Rome. Up to 8 teams race around the track twice to determine victory.

Several obstacles and narrow curves make it difficult to drive the chariots. Therefore, accidents are likely to occur and since completely destroyed chariots stay on the track where eliminated, the difficulties even rise further.

Included to the game is an additional scenario. It is based on the novel "Sagare" from Tanith Lee and it includes many aspects from that novel: earth, air, water and fire obstacles as well as furious archers.

name: Tom and Jerry: Adventures in Blunderland
description: This is a children's roll and move game (actually, spin and move) based on the cartoon Tom and Jerry. Four colored spinners are included with the game. The pieces are cardboard stand-ups for moving around the board.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Kiss My Ass
description: Players are dealt all of the cards in the deck and the starting player takes a card from the person on their left. They can either kiss that body part of the person who they took the card from or leave it in their hand. When you lose all of your cards, you are safe. When the next to last player is out of cards the loser is the one holding the Kiss My Ass card.

name: Stick 'em Up
description:
The game consists of a deck of thirty-two oversized playing cards. Each card depicts a sheriff, a gunman or an ordinary cowboy. Each player is dealt a card and looks at it secretly.

When it is a player's turn, that player returns the card to the bottom of the pile and draws another if it is not a gunman or a sheriff. If a player has a gunman, that player can choose to eliminate another player by saying, "Stick 'em Up!" If the chosen player responds by revealing a card whose cowboy doesn't have his hands up that player is eliminated. Responding with a gunman or sheriff eliminates the player who is taking a turn.

If a player reveals a sheriff on his turn, all players holding gunmen are out of the game. The last player remaining is the winner.
categories: American West, Card Game, Party Game

name: Kikeriki
description:
The players have a chicken (or the rooster) with 6 different colors in front of them. Each color contains a hole, in which little balls with the according color have to be placed. Inside the cap of the game are 22 eggs, each egg having a ball with one of the six colors inside. In turn the players draw an egg and open it. Additionally to the colored eggs, there are white balls (joker) and a black ball. If a player draws the black ball, the chicken has to be cleared of all the balls collected so far.
The winner of the game is the one, who completes his chicken first. If he cries out: "Kikeriki, der Gewinner ist hie!" he gets the rooster in the next game.

name: Final Straw
description:
Final Straw is a card game of modern (mostly American) school shootings. It is darkly satirical with artwork somewhat reminiscent of the work of Jhonen Vasquez (Zim, Johnny the Homicidal Maniac).

In the game each player is a killer and they score points by eliminating classmates, teachers, law enforcement and other figures before they, themselves, are taken down. These points are negatively affected by things that distract from the actual reason for their killing spree - trench coats, video games, roleplaying games and so forth - that people can blame rather than the actual cause.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Horror, Humor, Political

name: NFL Gridiron Trivia Challenge
description: Monday Morning Quarterback? If you love the NFL and think you know football better than anyone else, here’s your chance to prove it with the new NFL Gridiron Trivia Challenge board game. To win, you’ll need more than football knowledge and luck on your side because strategy is what separates this unique trivia game from the pack. Every move must be calculated – offense or defense – just like the real thing. For NFL fans who think they’ve got game, it’s time to snap on your chin strap, adjust your shoulder pads and start calling the plays in the new NFL Gridiron Trivia Challenge. 1,500 questions, 5 categories and only one winner!

name: Whipping Bobby Lee
description:
From the publisher's site:
Not a game but a set of rules for figure gaming in the American Civil War period: table top ACW rules.

Disappointed ? Well you won't be if you've tried other sets of rules and found them cumbersome, over complicated and very time consuming. Whipping Bobby Lee provides a command system that captures that sense of 'not being able to do everything that you'd like at once' and focuses you on to making decisions about how to prioritize your needs given that you've a shrewd idea of what the opposition might be likely to try.

The rules can be used for one off battles or you can use the Campaign system to orchestrate a series of encounters.

You'll love the Rebel veterans by the way, but they are expensive so don't go thinking you can have an entire army of them.
categories: American Civil War, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Chronicle of the Three Kingdoms
description:
[Not to be confused with the 1986 game Chronicles of the Three Kingdoms ]

Published in Chinese in Hong Kong, this game comes in a box, with 520 full color counters, a glossy paper area map of China, 13 pages of rules and 69 cards, mostly event cards, some probably province ownership cards. There is also a double-sided sheet of what looks to be errata.

name: The White House Game
description:
Have you ever dreamed of being the most powerful person in the World? Stop dreaming, and play The White House Game! The winner becomes President of the United States of America.

In The White House Game each player becomes a candidate for the nation's highest office. You have $700 million in campaign funds and you must use your skill and cunning to plan an election strategy that will win the confidence of the country.

name: Equate Junior Tile Set
description:
This tile set contains 176 tiles including whole numbers with more 0s and 1s than the Original Tile Set, fractions with denominator 2, the four basic operations with more addition and subtraction tiles than multiplication and division tiles and equal symbols. Packaged in two ziplock bags. Recommended for ages 6 and up.

Expands

Equate
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Math, Number

name: XIG: The Sorcerers Sword
description:
In this original and distinct game expanding from the world of XIG: The Four Elements, players challenge each other to complete a Sorcerers Sword while battling to control the rings of the four elements: Earth, Fire, Water, and Air.
Each player begins the game with 36 shuffled tiles. Each tile is potentially a piece of their sword which requires only 30 tiles to complete. Every tile represents a different Sorcerer. Specific Sorcerers allow the players to cast spells as the tiles are put into play, as well as displace their opponent's tiles.
Tiles can be linked together in many combinations as long as they don't break elemental rules (for example: Water cannot be linked above fire since fire would then be extinguished). Element combinations allow the players to obtain, or steal rings which can give the controlling player certain game advantage.
The first player to complete their sword wins.

name: Monopoly: Chicago White Sox 2005 World Series Champion
description:
From the Publisher:

“Let’s Go, Go-Go White Sox!” 2005 marks the year the White Sox™ brought a World Series® Championship back to Chicago and ended an 88 year drought! The MONOPOLY® Brand is proud to present the Chicago White Sox World Series Edition of the world’s most famous board game. This collector’s game captures and brings to life the glory of the 2005 World Series Champions, the Chicago White Sox, featuring photos from the 2005 playoffs. Some of the greatest moments in playoff history have been forever preserved like defeating the defending World Champions Boston Red Sox™ and winning 4 straight games against the Angels™. Players such as Paul Konerko, Mark Buehrle and Jon Garland make for exciting play in this classic game of risk taking and deal making. The tried and true White Sox fan can now buy, sell and trade the best of the 2005 White Sox, in an effort to own and control one of the most famed seasons in White Sox team history.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: El Juego de la Pera
description: The board game adaptation of one of the "consolation games" seen in the popular spanish TV show "Un, dos, tres... Responda otra vez". A game of proofs and questions in wich the first one who attains the "Repera", win the game. The mechanics are close to the game of snakes and ladders.

name: Donald Duck Card Game
description: This game appears to be one of a set of games that were produced in small, matchbox sized boxes. The game looks like a small book, and has Vol 1. on the spine, which suggests that there may be others in the set. There is no publication date, but this is probably fairly old.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Bunte Trikots, Blitzende Räder
description: This game had several releases. It was originally released by Spika, a game publisher from Karl-Marx-Stadt (now Chemnitz) in East Germany (DDR). Bunte Trikots is a cycling game with a 47x34cm. board with an indoor oval cycling track (with 100 spaces) on it. The original version from 1959 had a blue background, the 1964 version a grey background. In the '60s a Belgian version (also with a blue background) was released in both French and Dutch language. There are 6 plastic cyclists (one for each player) that move after rolling a die. There are different rules for in total 5 different disciplines that can be raced on the track. Vintage game for collectors and cycling lovers.

name: La Serpiente Multicolor
description:
This hard to find Spanish cycling game has cut-up cardboards who figure as the cyclists, there also are cardboard-signs. The game has a board with a track divided in different sections. Players also can alter the outcome of the race by playing tactical cards.

Free download from http://www.cyclingboardgames.net

name: Grailnah
description:
The aim of the game is simple: the first player who has one of his Knights land on the center of the board has won in his quest for the Grail.

But be careful - your opponent has the same aim! He will do everything in his power to slow you down and to move his own knights forward ...

name: Feuerberg von Sabine Erdmann
description:
The families around fire mountain are going out in a storm to bring fire back to the caves. You have to place little pieces of wick in the cracks in the board from your cave to the fire (tea candle) in the middle. Your cave contains a match and whomever's match lights first wins. There are also some marbles than can be placed to block routes.

38 cm ceramic board

Adult supervision required***

name: Tembo
description: Help to protect the elephant. Look after the game reserve, stop bushfires, help with diseases or catch poachers.

name: Geld & Börse
description:
This is an economic game, where players try to be the richest player after a certain amount of time.

The board shows 3 round tracks. The outer track has 25, the track in the middle 21 and the inner track 17 spaces.

Players move around the board on one of the chosen tracks. They can purchase bonds (20 provided) or shares (10 provided each) of 6 different companies, when they land on the appropriate spaces. Some spaces pay dividends to the share owners, some request taxes, some are spaces, where players can gamble to earn or loose a lot of money.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Battle Armor
description:
The plasma burst exploded too close for Chaves to feel comfortable and so he kicked in his jet booster to move to a new location before the enemy could pin point his position any closer. As he leaped into the sky, the booster jets sending him high over the alien trees, Sgt Chaves made a quick recon of the battlefield as it appear below him. Sensors marked on his heads up display where each of the other four in his squad where located and where the enemy troopers where positioned, or as best he could tell from what his scanners were telling him anyways.

As he leaped over the terrain, he became exposed and incoming fire began to pelt off his armor. Best to stay low he figured as he hit the ground running. Over his communication link the lieutenant was yelling at Private Jones to lay down suppression fire on the enemy set up on the low hill to the right. Another day in the Core, Chaves sighed, as he headed off to that same hill to kill more of the enemy.

This is Battle Armor, the second Mini Game by Bad Baby. Wars in the future will be fought by heavily armored warriors. Powered Battle Suits will rule to battlefield as each man can pack the firepower of a battalion. Mobile, heavily armored and capable of laying down a path of destruction like no other weapon ever made, the Powered Battle Suit will rule the future of warfare.

In Battle Armor you take control of a single man, or a squad of battle suit armed warriors, as they fight their endless and bloody wars in the future. Everything you need to play the game is included, rules, full color counters, map boards and terrain tiles.

Fast, easy to play and quick to learn, Battle Armor will supply you with endless hours of fun.

PDF can be found at:
www.wargamedownloads.com
www.rpgnow.com
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Capulets & Montagues
description: Card game for 2-6 Players. Each player controls a noble house in 13th Century Verona Italy. Each Family is described by the Traits of: Blood, Wealth, Favor, Dignity, and Vigor. Players share a common deck. Each turn 7 cards are drawn and players take turns picking cards they want. Cards will modify a players traits up and down. The Leader in a Trait will gain Prestige Points. Vigor Determines Turn order. Blood Cards anger the Prince of the city and may lead to punishments. Favor can be used to avoid punishments. At the end of 10 turns the player with the greatest Prestige wins. Complete rules are available for free.

name: Portfolio Junior
description: A fun fast-paced game where young players compete to fill their Portfolio Junior puzzle card by simply purchasing three distinctly different shaped puzzle pieces. Kids move their Piggy Bank playing piece around the board acquiring Lemonade & Ice Cream Companies, Airport & Baseball Stadiums, and Cookie Jars & Piggy Banks, located inside the colored spaces. Bull and Bear Junior cards add fun and excitement, directing players to move forwards or backwards or collect or pay money. First player to complete their Portfolio puzzle card wins!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Pseudon's GiveAway
description: Pseudon's Giveway is a promotional "game" given away in very limited quantities. The game includes a set of Pseudon business cards, and includes rules (in Dutch) to use these cards to play a simple negotiation game.

name: Foodie Craze
description:
The game is simply a collection of 400 multiple-choice trivia questions about food. The questions are in ten different food-related categories, such as "American Classics", "Pot Luck", and "Extreme Cuisine".

The rules suggest several different ways to play the game and score, including a round-robin, every-person-for-themselves game; a couple team variants; a solitaire version; and a category-based version not unlike Trivial Pursuit.

name: Piraci
description:
A short cardgame from Udo Peise, released in Poland by Trefl.
Overtake the other treasure hunters!
The players offer around a laid out card. Who reacts thereby fastest and most skillful, receives the card and takes points for it. This succeeds best "with heart". Sometimes however the Pirate is near and takes the treasures.
The player with most points of treasure wins.

name: Blow Your Cool
description:
Played on a large (approx 4 foot x 4 foot) vinyl mat. Players try to blow plastic balls across another player's "loser line". You must try to prevent other player's ball from crossing your line or you earn 1 loser card. Be careful if you touch your ball you earn 2 loser cards.

The game ends when the 45 loser cards are given out. The player with the fewest cards wins.

name: Our Navy
description:
This game from the Wing National Game Company of St. Augustine, FLA was indeed copyrighted in 1898.

[The box says this game was published by Parker Brothers.]

The game consists of a Battle Ground with 31 Navy Paths (31 circles) each of which are intersected at 5 or 6 places by other paths. These intersections are called fighting positions. Red, White and Blue designs across the battleground are called Line of Shot.

The game comes with 9 white and 9 black washers that represent Battleships from two Navies.

Each navy changes form (moves) in turn. Only one move is allowed at a time. The sinking of an opponents ship occurs when you manage to get two of your ships on the same line of shot as that of an enemy ship, with your nearest ship half way between the enemy and your back ship. When the range is so short that your two ships and the enemy lay in 3 consecutive positions then the enemy is captured and not sunk. When that happens you may remove the captured ship and place any of your ships in one of the starting positions. This allows you to fix placement errors by returning your ship to the start.
publishers: (Public Domain), The Wing National Game Co.

name: Shieldwall
description:
The game takes its theme from the formation of the Saxon Shieldwall in an abstract form. The pieces reflect this being resin cast representations of stylized Norman and Saxon Infantry.
The objective of Shieldwall is to capture positions to the rear of the opponent's flanks. Offensive pieces can only attack in pairs and the defending pieces can be formed into stronger units called Shieldwalls.
The Designer claims that the rules are easy to learn yet the depth of strategy belies its apparent simplicity.

name: Discovering Wargames
description:
Small paperback book serving as an introduction to miniatures wargaming and also containing rules for use from the ancient period up to the American Civil War (1 rule set for the whole lot !)

Rules are based on rolling a one die for each group of six figures when shooting, or counting heads and multiplying by a die roll in melee. Also includes rules for differing formations and for morale.
categories: American Civil War, Ancient, Book, Medieval, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Vincent Time Path
description:
Directly from the rules:

By offering cards for completion the players jointly create a path that takes them through various periods taken from the life of Vincent Van Gogh.
The first player to get rid of all his cards is the winner.

Contents of the box:

48 cards
4 brushes
4 holders
1 dice
rule book
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: The Crime Club Card Game
description: The game contains 50 cards – 6 suits of 8 cards (split into 3 detective and 3 crook suits featuring characters – such as Hercule Poirot – objects and locations) and 2 jokers. The game is played in two parts. During the first part of the game players collect a hand that will enable them, during the second part of the game, to take as few tricks as possible.

name: Qwijit
description:
Qwijit is an abstract strategy game where you place stones on a grid. It comes with two games. In the first, you are attempting to capture the Qwijit stone in the center of the grid. In the second, you want to place more stones than your opponent.

Qwijit was originally produced as a gift to the attendees of Mike Young's wedding. It is now available a free print-and-play game at http://www.interactivitiesink.com/cardgames
publishers: (Web published), Interactivities Ink, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Dallas Scene
description: A Dallas-themed, Monopoly-style game with modified rules centering around dealing with some of the Power Groups who control businesses in Dallas (Circa 1970s).
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Pennant Race Baseball Game
description: Players roll 1-4 dice to simulate pitching, batting, and fielding. 22"x26" plastic playing mat lists the results of the various combinations of rolls.

name: Drinko
description: Drink up! This classic drinking game is made for over-21 fun! Featuring a Plinko-like game board with six round discs and six matching shot glasses.

name: The Teen-Time Game
description:
A self-described "game for pre-teen and teen age girls and boys," this game is all about inter-personal relationships. Boys and girls start at the same point on the board and advance using a spinner to determine the number of spaces to move. Depending upon the square on which you land, you may gain points, lose points, receive other information ("Boy meets girl") or instructions ("Advance to mall"). Some squares instruct you to draw a bonus card, which will also give or take away points, grant another turn or deny your next turn, you may even draw the "Engaged" card.

At two different points on the board, the girls' path and the boys' path diverge. Girls, may then land on a square that says, for instance, "Break heel dancing. Lose 1 turn." Boys can suffer no such fate, but can only gain points, lose points, meet girl, break up, etc.

Winner is the first player to reach a pre-determined number of points.
publishers: Tee Pee Toys, Jessup Paper Box Co.

name: Vilajet
description:
Vilajet is a Hungarian game about the Turkish-Hungarian Wars set in the medieval times. Unfortunately it is only Hungarian language, but easily translated into English.
The game map represents about 100x100 km territory near Lake Balaton, and shows little villages, towns and cities. In those times between these two countries there at peace, but there were a lot of border disputes which eventually caused a battle to be fought. Those are simulated in this game.
The players should build armies in their castles, improve their current defenses and collect taxes from villages, while trying to work against the enemy opponent.
Battles are one of the unique features that this game has. When you have a battle you take the "battle" map, and place your army there. On the strategic map you only have one counter, which shows only the name of the army, but you have to administrate, what kind of troops that army consists of (250 Hussars, 85 Infantry...etc). On the battle map you take the corresponding counters, and play battles with them, writing down casualties. Every unit has different fighting/moving values. The sieges are also great! Another map is used (there are about 6 different castles), and modified by the defenses you have built since the start of the game. It also has some extra rules, which make sieges fun. (for example when you go for a siege, you have to decide how much grain you will bring with you)

The good side of the game is that the Hungarian and the Turkish sides really differ from each other, and need completely different playing styles.

Of course, the game has a downside. The amount of administration needed to play might cause the casual player to never sit down and play a game.

This game is great in Hungarian history, and shows those times, which were so full with death, battles and instability.

name: Battle of Guararapes
description: Battle of Guararapes is a wargame for two players with cover the first and second Battle in Pernambuco(state of Brazil), in Brazilian colonial era, against the Dutch domination. The Pernambucana Resistance march with 2000 man against an enemy better equipped and in superior numbers. In April 18th 1648, the battle begins!

name: In Other Words
description:
Players can play individually or on teams to answer clues on cards. There are two part, three part, and four part clues. In the game, new words are created from a series of other words. The concept is best illustrated by an example, as follows:

The basic series of words:

Faucet - donkey - sapling

Is a Word-Clue for the word:

Tap - ass - tree

Tapestry
publishers: Irwin Toy Ltd., Tedesco Enterprises Limited

name: Nerd Trivia
description:
Most trivia games cover the boring stuff: history, geography, sports... who cares? Nerd Trivia is the first game to tackle trivia about what's truly important: D&D, Lord of the Rings, Star Trek, Star Wars, and much more. It's nerd, or nothing!

The GM reads a category and a difficulty of a trivia question. Bet on which of your friends you think knows the answer. Then the question is read, and everyone answers. Anyone getting it right scores points. If you pick someone who gets it right, score bonus points. If you were the only one to pick that person, score extra points. But if three or more people picked that person, no bonus points...
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Activator
description:
Activator is an abstract strategy game designed for a piecepack and piecepack pyramids. It is played on a 4×4 board, and has a few other aspects in common with Plateau.

Players' pieces and stacks move according to the number of pieces in the stack: A single piece moves one space orthogonally; a double, up to two orthogonally; a triple, up to three orthogonally or diagonally. Moves may only be through empty spaces. Pieces and stacks may merge or split as part of their move. Each player also has one activator, that rides parasitically on the opponent's pieces. It moves up to four spaces orthogonally, from one opposing piece to another, and it is not considered a piece.

A player's activator empowers her pieces/stacks in the same rank or file to capture opposing an opposing piece/stack when they move. Additionally, any pieces/stacks in the two spaces where the activation lines of the players' activators cross are immobilized.

You can win the game one of two ways:


Occupy your opponent's home space with one of your pieces/stacks for an entire round.
Reduce your opponent's forces to one piece/stack to win immediately.

name: Mixo
description:
If one says “the small one of night to you”… Doesn't that speak to you??? But if it is said to you that this expression contains at the same time the beginning of a first expression and the one second end with a common point between the two… Does that inspire to you more??? The small prince… Night flight… Antoine of Exupéry Saint A play with 460 contracted expressions and 920 titles or expressions to be found.

Si l’on vous dit « Le petit de nuit »… Cela ne vous parle pas ??? Mais si l’on vous dit que cette expression contient à la fois le début d’une première expression et la fin d’une seconde avec un point commun entre les deux… Est-ce que cela vous inspire plus ??? Le petit prince… Vol de nuit… Antoine de Saint Exupéry Un jeu avec 460 expressions contractées et 920 titres ou expressions à retrouver.

name: Armies At Lutzen
description:
This game simulates the battle of Lutzen during the 30 years war.
The main part of the game consists of four decks: German, Imperial, Swede, and Fate. The first three are unit decks and the last is an administrative deck. The Imperial and Swede Decks (and to a lesser extent the German Deck) are composed of various kinds of cards (Unit cards, Tactics cards, Terrain cards, Tactical Leader cards, and Commander cards).
categories: Card Game, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Heinz Sielmanns Expeditionen ins Tierreich
description:
Insightful discoveries in the garden. Kids learn which animals are to find in (European) gardens, what they do and what they eat, who their foes are and why we should protect them.
The game consists of a map showing a garden with a biotope, markers in 6 colors, 6 dice, and 32 cards with animals and of course the rules.

name: Homogenius
description:
From the press release:

Homogenius, the gay trivia board game, celebrates gay culture and explores the contributions that gay personalities have made to theater, music, movies, television, publishing and politics. The object of this board game, which comes packaged in a stylish trunk-like box, is to “come out of the closet” by correctly answering a series of gay trivia questions in two categories: Rumor and Potpourri. Players start “In the Closet” and whoever gets “Out of the Closet” first wins. The game includes 355 question cards, 6 game tokens, 1 die and a colorful game board.

name: Si se la puede... Gana
description:
This game is based on the TV show of the same name. The players divide in 2 teams. They have to do a series of ability tests to win the game.

The game comes with a lot of elements like a tennis ball, balloons, an ice maker, paper clips, etc, and you also will need others things like a newspaper, matchbox, etc.

This is a very fun game were you have to use your ingenuity to solve some of the tests, and use your physical abilities to win others, all against the clock.
categories: Dice, Math, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Racing, Real-time, Sports

name: Infinity
description:
From the press release:

Infinity is a fast-paced game in which students, families and friends can show off their spelling, vocabulary and card playing skills while improving their English. The deck design allows for a variety of exciting games, including Alphabet Soup, Crossword, Stack ‘Em, and Letter War.

name: Soldiers of the Queen: Wargame Rules, 1879-1900
description: [From the inside cover] These rules are the product of extensive research into the colonial battles of 1879-1900, and into the battles of the Great (Boer) trek. We have been playtesting for over a year and find that these rules fulfill our design parameters i.e. realistic, fast and fun. We have tried to make them as simple and as easy to learn as possible, and yet retaining a high degree of realism.

name: John Ridgways' Round the World Yacht Race Game
description:
John Ridgways' Round the World Yacht Race Game
2-6 Players
Ages 10-adult

From the introduction in the rule book:
Members of the crew have spent long hours developing this ingenious Round the world Yacht Race game. It reproduces many of the hazards and strokes of good fortune that the sailor faces in such a venture. The handicap system gives a fair chance to everyone.

Contents
1 Game Board (in 3 pieces)
30 Luck Cards
30 Hazard Cards
6 Plastic Yachts
2 Dice(1 Red, 1 Blue)
6 Yacht Cards
7 Score Sheets (Wipe clean)

Object of the Game
Select a yacht and sail it around the world in the fastest possible time, collecting the minimum handicap score.

Gameplay
Players select 6 ports that they will visit on their circumnavigation.

The two die are use to determine movement (Red = North/South, Blue = East/west) and moves may be completed in any order: the only restriction is that you may not double back

Handicap points are gained from:
a)the yacht itself
b)hazard cards
c)every turn taken after the first boat arrives back in Portsmouth
d)the cost of the yacht
e)ignoring dice rolls/moving only part of a roll

Hazard and luck cards are gained from wind systems and pressure zones

At the end of the game the yacht with the lowest score wins
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: 1812: L'Ankou
description:
1812 L'Ankou is a generic wargame at the time of the Napoleonic Wars. "Blue" against "Green" on a Brittany-like map. The rules are based on those of "1812: Les Arapiles" published in a previous issue of Casus Belli.

Published in Casus Belli #50. You need Casus Belli #41 for the Standard Rules.

name: 1812: Caspara
description:
1812 Caspara is a generic wargame at the time of the Napoleonic Wars. Two armies land on a small island and fight for it. The rules are based on those of "1812: Les Arapiles" published in a previous issue of Casus Belli.

Published in Casus Belli #49. You need Casus Belli #41 for the Standard Rules.

name: Rapunzel's Revenge
