You can choose how many floors of the tower needed to win, so you can shorten the game. The maximum number of floors is 6.

name: PERKO! The Game of Name Dropping and Name Swapping
description: Players (or teams) try to be the first to discard all of their Namer cards (cards that contain common surnames) by making matches with Gamer cards (cards that contain letters). For example, the Namer "Washington" could be matched with the Gamer "G" by saying "George Washington". It's not always that easy, however, as the Gamer letter is not in their control. Players need to be creative - some examples (with Gamer letter in parantheses): (M) Martha Washington, (U) Washington University, (D) Denzel Washington, (R) Washington Redskins, (P) Washington Post, (O) Olympia Washington. Matches can be ANY two-word proper name (person, place or thing) agreed to by the group (including songs, movies, friends, etc.). Strategy is imperative, with turns being extended by matching Namer-Gamer colors. Players may need to draw additional cards or trade cards with other teams. Very challenging game that requires a great deal of creativity and quickly becomes quite addictive. Game contains 275 Namers and 275 Gamers.

name: Властелин Мира (The lord of the World)
description:
«Властелин Мира» отлично сбалансированная настольная стратегическая игра в жанре фэнтези от украинского производителя! Яркая, динамичная, многовариантная игра! В ней учтены плюсы и минусы различных систем. Миниатюры выполнены в классическом масштабе 28мм

The lord of the World - ukrainian wargame, well balanced, dynamic. All minis are made in classical scale - 28mm.

(Some text rewritten for English clarity)

"An excellently balanced strategy table game in the fantasy genre produced in the Ukraine. A bright, dynamic, highly variable game! It takes into account the pluses and minuses of different systems. The miniatures are executed on the classical scale of 28mm."

name: Robin Hood
description: Calder Craft, a daughter British model construction of the manufacturer Hinchliffe Models, lets in this 2-Person 'Adventure Game' the fight between Robin Hood and the sheriff of Nottingham again up-purchase. Task of the player is to bring Maid Marion of the lock into the city Nottingham while the player of the men Robin Hoods must prevent exactly this.

name: Warcanto
description:
Warcanto is a skirmish wargame, that brings new ideas to the fantasy battlefields. Crucial role of the warband leader and sophisticated rules of his development, together with alternating sequence of operating warriors and enhanced system of interaction with terrain features, make Warcanto an innovative way of enjoying the fantasy game with other fantasy enthusiasts. All of that taking place in Duæl - classical dark fantasy world created and developed by Dwarf Tales Team.

Novel system of issuing orders and heroes' experience trees introduce the elements of RPG into the fantasy miniatures game, ideal for playing single battles as well as the whole campaigns. Now you can make a truly unique hero, that fully represents your own approach to battle and tactical intuition. Complex experience trees, different for each race, give you the possibility to create unyielding fighters, respectful commanders, stealthy sentinels, expert marksmans and many more. Warcanto brings you right into Greatland - huge continent, which have witnessed many glorious victories and shameful defeats over the millennia. Here you can experience the eternal conflicts between different powers that have been trying to seize Duæl and conquer its nations since the beginning of time. Dwarf Tales Team proudly presents the fully playable game with three distinct races - proud Dwarves, mystical Lidds and nomadic Org'kka.

name: The Pirate Game!
description:
The Pirate Game! uses card drawing and board elements to allow players to outfit a sloop, sail the caribbean, and compete to amass the most gold by the end of the game. For 2 to 4 players, a game has 12 turns, and lasts approximately 120 minutes.

Players collect cards through visits to port and spending orders during their turn. Players use cards to pursue and fight merchant ships and to avoid being robbed by other players. As the game progresses, players use the proceeds from theft, or the buying and selling of cargo, to add crew to their ship (adding those crews abilities to their own), to repair damage, and to add cannon.

The winner has the most gold at the end of the game.

The boards are two sided, one side devoted to the standard game and the reverse to rules variations specifically for two player contests.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Junior Painter
description:
This game is very similar to Pictionary. A sand timer is running while one player is drawing a picture of an item drawn randomly. The other players (or teams) try to guess what it is. The first player or team to guess correctly moves forward on the board. There are different rule variants: One in which only one player draws throughout the entire game; one in which teams alternate to have one of their players draw for them (and only for them).

Noris first published this game as "Junior Painter" in 1989 before renaming it "Gut gemalt ist halb gewonnen" in 1990.

name: Sherlock Holmes
description:
This game is made after classic detective Sherlock Holmes. You start at the start square and move along spaces. Some spaces have pictures with Holmes and other characters. When you step onto that picture you take one card with that picture and read that information under there. Then you need to decide where to go based on information that is know to you. You move like that and you need to reach finish. When you reach there, you can check out the solution. Was you way the right way or you missed something?
There are about 1500 ways this game can go. 5 (cards for each space) times 30 (pictures) and 10 (different paths). At the beginning (like in clue) the solution is chosen and investigation can begin.
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Verso
description:
Verso is played on an empty 8x8 square board.Each player has 9 Othello-like stones off board.
1.Drop Phase:On this first phase,on each turn each player drops a stone on an empty cell.
2.Move Phase:When all the pieces are on the board(and the goal was not achieved yet)each player moves one of his pieces to an adjacent orthogonal empty cell.
Capture:When two friendly stones have,in-between(orthogonally or diagonally),a line of enemy stones,the moving player swaps the color of one of them(unlike Othello where the player would swap all enemy stones).
The player that makes a(orthogonal or diagonal)5 in-a-row wins.

name: Frontier Tycoons
description: In Frontier Tycoons, players take the role of entrepreneurs and tradesmen at the peak of the American industrial revolution. The government has numerous lucrative contracts up for bids to help develop a rich national marketplace. Manage your money wisely, trade with due diligence, and be ready to capitalize on opportunities when they arise. In the end, the tycoon who has earned the most prestige will be the winner. Come expand the horizon in Frontier Tycoons!
mechanics: Set Collection, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Backyardigans: Cadê Você?
description:
This is a game that tests your memory. Players move the pieces around the board and reveal the Backyardigans when they pass through the revelator. The players must memorize where each caracter is located to be able to catch them later in the game. The first player to capture all the caracters corresponding to his/her cards win the game.

The game components are one board integrated with one small roulette, twelve cards, twelve special plastic caracters and one rule book.

name: Allegiance
description: Allegiance "The Constitution Game" Political Game that is used to help Students learn and appreciate the Constitution.

name: Battle of Tsushima Strait (1905)
description:
A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students. The game is designed to be played on a 5x7 foot table or any similar flat surface. Free print-and-play paper miniatures (flats) are provided for use with the rules.

The simplified order of battle only includes Battleships and Armored Cruisers; the impact of Destroyers and Torpedo Boats is represented abstractly. The Japanese fleet consists of four Battleships and eight Armored Cruisers. The Russian fleet is composed of twelve Battleships and three Armored Cruisers.

From the rules:

"The Battle of Tsushima Strait was one of the most decisive naval battles in history . . . Of the 45 ships in the Russian fleet, only two destroyers, a light cruiser, and six other smaller vessels survived the ensuing battle, while the Japanese only lost three torpedo boats. Japanese casualties were approximately 600 compared to the 6000 Russians killed or wounded."

name: Get off the Beach
description:
A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played with 1/72 scale miniature figures or paper figures. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are provided for use with the rules.

"On June 6, 1944, the liberation of France began. Americans, and their allies, launched a massive amphibious assault on the beaches of Normandy. The attack took the Germans by surprise. In some places the Allies faced light resistance. But on Omaha Beach the Americans faced a fearsome German defense consisting of concrete bunkers, mine, barbed wire, machine guns, and artillery."

The game is scalable for various sized playing groups. The Germans receive one bunker and the Americans receive three squads for each lengthwise foot of mapsheet depicting the beach. There are no German soldier figures - just American landing craft and soldiers versus German bunkers, artillery, and obstacles.

name: Kwick Kursk
description:
A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using micro-scale tank miniatures or paper figures. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are provided for use with the rules.

"The German invasion of the USSR in 1941 was, at first, a smashing success. However by 1943 the German army was on the brink of disaster . . . Hitler decided to gamble on a massive armored assault designed to force the Soviets out of the war before the Allies could open a new front in Western or Southern Europe. The Soviets anticipated the German attack at Kursk and prepared the battlefield with dense mine fields, trenches, and well hidden gun positions. They also assembled an enormous reserve force . . . The battle of Prokhorovka, near the end of the Kursk campaign, was the largest tank battle in history."

While the rules are very basic, they incorporate concepts such as unit activation, opportunity fire, heavy/medium tank formations, artillery, and air strikes.

name: Devils Don't Surrender
description:
"In 1861 France tried to make Mexico a part of her empire . . The battle best remembered by the French occurred in 1863. A small detachment of the French Foreign Legion (FFL) was sent to escort a supply train. The force was intercepted by a large force of Mexican cavalry and infantry. The FFL retreated to a walled farm near the village of Camerone. They were surrounded, low on ammunition, and outnumbered 50 - 1 . . . The incredible courage of the Legion at Camerone is remembered every April 30 when the FFL celebrates Camerone Day."

Devils Don't Surrender is a miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with up to a dozen students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played with 1/72 scale miniature figures or paper figures. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are provided for use with the rules.

The game requires 45 FFL figures and 90 Mexican figures. French units have a single figure on each base and move independently, while the Mexican units have two figures to a base and start grouped in formations of nine bases.

name: Make 'em Eat Snakes
description:
"In 1836 Texas was still a part of Mexico. But the Texans revolted against the autocratic rule of President Santa Anna. The most famous battle of the Texas War for Independence occurred at a crumbling old Spanish mission on the outskirts of San Antonio. Davy Crockett reportedly said that the Mexicans would 'eat snakes' before they got into the Alamo."

This miniatures wargame is intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale miniature figures or paper figures. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are provided for use with the rules.

Designer's notes: "The rules for this battle are adapted from 'Remember the Alamo!' by George Knapp, which appeared in MWAN 100 . . . For the most part the changes I have made are to simplify the game so that they will work well with my students aged 10-13. The battle can be completed in less than two hours. The Mexicans will suffer a much higher casualty rate than they did historically, but the game moves quickly and is fun."

name: Battle of Isandlwana (1879 AD)
description:
"During the reign of Queen Victoria Great Britain built an impressive empire that spanned the globe. One of their most colorful military campaigns took place in 1879 when the British provoked a war with the Zulus in South Africa. The British expected a quick and easy victory but the Zulu warriors were no push overs . . . Isandlwana was the most disastrous defeat the British ever suffered at the hands of a native force."

This miniatures wargame is intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale miniature figures or paper figures. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are provided for use with the rules.

"A British commander can claim victory if any of his units survive the battle. The Zulu objective is to loot the British camp and wipe out the British infantry."

name: Washing of the Spears
description:
"During the reign of Queen Victoria Great Britain built an impressive empire that spanned the globe. One of their most colorful military campaigns took place in 1879 when the British provoked a war with the Zulus in South Africa. The British expected a quick and easy victory but the Zulu warriors were no push overs . . . Isandlwana was the most disastrous defeat the British ever suffered at the hands of a native force."

This miniatures wargame is intended for classroom use with two teams of students. The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale miniature figures or paper figures. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are provided for use with the rules. The game also requires a standard deck of cards which is used to determine unit activation.

name: Battle of Waterloo: Hougoumont (1815 AD)
description:
"Napoleon's stunning comeback from exile faced its great test when his French army fought the British near Waterloo in Belgium. The British line was anchored on the right at the walled farm known as Hougoumont."

"The French started the battle with an attack on the farm designed to draw British reserves away from the center, where the main French attack was planned . . . Wellington, the British commander, credited the defense of Hougoumont with being the key to the victory."

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures mounted two per base.

As an alternative, free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules. Print-and-play walls are also available for use to recreate the boundaries of the farmhouse.

The rules encompass ranged and melee combat, morale, charges, reserves, and breaking down doors and gates.

name: Why, These are Regulars!
description:
"The battle of Chippawa (1814) was a landmark victory for the US army, marking the first time it defeated the veteran British regulars in open combat."

"When Winfield Scott's grey jacketed 1st Brigade was first seen the British may have mistaken them for militia. Watching them under fire, however, it became obvious that they were in fact well trained regulars. The US and British lines faced each other at close range, exchanging musket and cannon fire. After both sides suffered terrible casualties it was the British that withdrew."

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures mounted two per base (except for Commanders, who are based singly). Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules.

These streamlined "fast play" rules encompass unit formations, charges, commanders, morale, and terrain.

name: Ram Anything Painted Gray
description:
"The Austro-Prussian War (1866) was fought between the Austrian Empire on one side, and Prussia and the Kingdom of Italy on the other side."

"The largest naval engagement occurred near the island of Lissa in the Adriatic Sea. There an Austrian fleet of ironclads and steam powered wooden ships fought a larger Italian fleet. The Austrians caught the Italians unprepared and succeeded in 'crossing the T' of the Italian fleet. The heavy side belt armor of the ironclads was invulnerable to gunnery, and the most effect offensive tactic was ramming. The Austrian fleet emerged victorious."

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students. The game is designed to be played on a 5x9 foot table using miniature ships. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are provided for use with the rules.

Concepts covered in the rules include ranged combat, ramming, raking fire, turrets, and crippled ships.

name: By Jove That Will Do! The Battle of Salamanca (1812 AD)
description:
"The battle of Salamanca in Spain was a part of the Peninsular Campaign which lasted from 1808-1814. It was as a result of Napoleon invading Spain and putting his brother on the throne of Spain. It also resulted in a British general in winning fame and glory. Wellington would begin his winning streak in Spain."

"Salamanca was the most decisive battle of the entire war which smashed Marshal Marmont`s French army. Although the war would continue for two more years, the French were put on the defensive, as the British, Portuguese and Spanish troops harassed the French until they were pushed back over the Pyrenees mountains into France."

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students. The game is designed to be played on a 1.5x1 meter table using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures mounted two per base (except for commanders and cannons). Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules.

The streamlined "fast play" rules encompass unit formations, charges, commanders, and morale.

name: Viva San Martin!
description:
"Jose de San Martin led the battle for independence against the Spanish in the southern part of South America. His efforts were instrumental in the liberation of Argentina and Chile. His greatest victory came in 1818 at the the Battle of Maipo in Chile. In this decisive battle he defeated the final Spanish offensive and secured the freedom of Chile."

This miniatures wargame is intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures mounted two per base, except for commanders which are mounted singly. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules. Each side has one overall commander and assorted infantry, cavalry, and cannon units.

name: Across the Andes
description:
"In 1819 Simon Bolivar led his army across the Andes and began the campaign to liberate Colombia (New Granada) from Spanish rule."

"He achieved his goal with the decisive battle of Boyaca. Simon Bolivar's rebel army launched a surprise attack which cut the royalist army in half as they crossed a bridge. The Spanish were routed, opening the road to Bogota. Battle of Boyaca Day is celebrated in Colombia every August 7."

This miniatures wargame is intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures mounted two per base, except for commanders which are mounted singly. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules. Units portrayed in the game include infantry, cavalry, militia, rifles, and cannon.

name: Mimelen
description:
Preparation:
1.Select one of the three packs of playing cards. The maps with images used as the other cards would be difficult for one or more players not so well read.
2.Sit somewhere where the players enough space have their role to play.
3.The players go sit in a circle so every one player whose turn it is good to see. The board is put down in the middle .. The hourglass and the dice for the youngest player down.
4.The pack of cards was selected vice versa (i.e. with the text down) next to the sign down.
5.The players choose a pawn and put in the triangular box at the start board.

The game:
1.The youngest player starts and throws the dice.
2.He draws the first card from the pack. The number of eyes of the dice determines the number of category on the card to be portrayed.
3.He remembers what to portray, flip the hourglass and goes as long portraying until the hourglass is completely gone.
Caution! All gestures and sounds are allowed, but words can express absolute last resort.
Players who have not read so well do not on the numbers of the dice to watch and the picture images on the card they have drawn out.
4.The other players try to guess what is depicted. Each player must answer if he to turn (the first player left of the guesser and then continue with the clockwise (note):
- If a player gives a wrong answer, the turn the hands of the clockwise to the next player.
- If a player gives a correct answer, he may be pawn on the board and put forward two squares, the guesser his pawn one square put forward.
- If no player has given a correct answer before the hourglass is gone, nobody should be oppose pawn. In all cases the turn then to the hands of the clockwise to the next player.

Winner:
The player who first reaches the last slot is the winner. It is not necessarily to arrive with exact number of spaces.

name: Saviors of My Country
description:
"The decisive battle in the war to liberate Venezuela from Spanish rule was fought at Carabobo in 1821."

"The royalist army held the high ground so the rebel army under the command of Simon Bolivar was forced to attempt a bloody attack. With the help of British volunteers the rebels won the battle. After the battle Bolivar, who was born in Venezuela, called the men "Salvadores de mi Patria" (saviours of my country)."

This miniatures wargame is intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules.

The streamlined "fast and easy" rules encompass unit formations, charges, commanders, and morale.

name: The Fate of a Continent
description:
"By 1824 the liberation of South America from Spanish rule was nearly complete. The last remaining seat of Spanish power was in Peru."

"The final battle was fought on December 9 at Ayacucho. Shouting 'Paso de vencedores'(onward to victory). General Cordoba led the right wing of the rebel army in the attack that finally broke the back of the royalist army. This decisive battle marked the end of Spanish colonial rule in South America."

This miniatures wargame is intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules.

Infantry and cavalry figures are mounted two to a base. It takes six bases to make an infantry or cavalry unit, with an infantry unit representing about 400 men and a cavalry unit representing 200. The Rebels begin with 15 units and the Royalists 19.

name: There Stands Jackson
description:
"When the American Civil War began both sides were expecting the issue to be settled quickly, by one decisive battle. The Union was enlisting men for just three months! The first battle took place around Bull Run river (the battle is also known as First Manassas)."

"The battle was a chaotic affair. Neither army had been properly trained, and the bewildering assortment of uniforms led to confusion. The main battle centered around Henry Hill. General Jackson's brigade occupied the hill and held the position against a series of piecemeal Union attacks, leading to the comment 'There stands Jackson, like a stone wall.' Jackson had his nickname, and the Confederates had their first victory."

"This scenario focuses on the fight for Henry Hill from noon until about 4 PM, when Early's Brigade arrived to seal the Confederate victory."

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x7 foot table using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules.

The streamlined "fast and easy" rules encompass unit formations, dismounted cavalry, terrain, line of sight, charges, commanders, and morale.
categories: American Civil War, Educational, Miniatures, Wargame

name: We are the Flank
description:
"The Big Fight for Little Round Top. Fast and Easy Rules for Replaying Part of the Battle of Gettysburg."

"The Confederate attack on Devil's Den and Little Round Top was the subject of considerable controversy. It began late in the day and was marked by confusion and a general lack of coordination. The terrain was partly responsible for this."

"Oates' 15th Alabama was given the difficult task of assaulting up the hill. They ran into Chamberlain's 20th Maine, which was defending the far left flank of the Union army. Several charges were turned back. Finally, with his men low on ammunition, Chamberlain ordered a bayonet charge, which finished off the weary confederates."

This is a miniatures wargame intended for classroom use (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale miniatures. Aspects covered in the rules include infantry formations, sharpshooters, protective cover, commanders, charges, and morale.
categories: American Civil War, Educational, Miniatures, Wargame

name: General Lee, I Have No Division!
description:
"Pickett’s charge [at the Battle of Gettysburg] will always be remembered as a tragic desperate maneuver."

"After the failure of the Confederate artillery to destroy the Union defenses, and the quick counter fire from the Union artillery, Lee entrusted Longstreet with three divisions: Trimble, Pettigrew, and Pickett. Those three divisions charged across a field of fire a mile in length, and up a sloping hill towards the muskets and cannons waiting for them at the top . . . The day ended in defeat for the Confederates. Pickett’s Division was utterly destroyed."

This is a miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with students in grades 6 to 8. The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale miniatures. Two orders of battle are presented - one for a fast play game of 45 to 90 minutes, and a second order of battle for a longer game.
categories: American Civil War, Educational, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Great Northern War: Lesnaya (1708)
description:
"The Great Northern War (1700 - 1721) was a military struggle between Sweden on one side, and Russia, Denmark, and Saxony-Poland on the other."

"In 1708 Charles XII launched an invasion of Russia, determined to capture Moscow and force the Tsar to accept a peace treaty that favored Sweden. Peter the Great ordered a 'scorched earth' policy to deny supplies to the Swedish invaders."

"In September of 1708 Tsar Peter learned that a Swedish force protecting their supply train was separated from Charles XII and the main Swedish army. He pounced. Peter lead a flying column to attack the Swedes while the main part of his army blocked Charles' path to Moscow. The battle took place near the village of Lesnaya."

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played on a 7.5x5 foot table using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules.

While the fast play rules are relatively straightforward, they still manage to encompass a number of historical aspects that affected the battle. The rules cover unit formations, terrain, charges, morale, commanders, and differences in the battle tactics of the Russian Dragoons and Swedish cavalry.
categories: Age of Reason, Educational, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Lexico LT-ENG
description:
From the publisher:
Lexico is a game and a dictionary combined in a unique and fun way. Beside its excellent game value, it also has a huge educational value and is of interest to anyone who wants to learn languages. Lexico features altogether 9000 commonly used words from five different categories: Human, Living environment, Nature and hobbies, Science and technology and Common words. The words are divided into 3 difficulty levels and the idea is that every player plays the difficulty level best suited for his/her language skills.

name: Wehrmacht ‘47
description:
This supplement for the WWII Micro Armour games adds various experimental projects such as the German E series vehicles. It expands the sequence of play to include ATGMs and also includes examples of painting models as well as weapons tables and 10 scenarios.

1 - Who Owns the Night?, May ‘47
2 - Defense of Aleksino, May ‘47
3 - The Empty Land, July ‘47
4 - Grapple at Grachevka, September ‘47
5 - Wadi El Ahmar, Fall ‘47
6 - Welcome to Casablanca, Fall ‘47
7 - Return to Hell, January ‘48
8 - A Hell to Pay, June ‘48
9 - Assault on Manduwan, Iran
10 - Get a Piece of the Rock, September ‘48
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Circle's Winner
description:
Are you more cunning, devious and brilliant than your friends? Are you sure?

Now you can prove it...

You only know the identity of one piece on the board - yours. And your goal is to simply move the piece to the center circle before any of your opponents pieces reach there first. But wait, not so fast. If anyone finds out which piece is yours you're sure to lose!

A simple game with simple rules; yet requiring a not-so-simple strategy of guile and cunning to win.

Practically the easiest "print and play" game possible. Just print, scrounge up some unique pieces (or cut out the ones provided) and you're ready to play. -> SEE THE FILE BELOW


Note: At present only the basic board is uploaded. Additional boards with unique scoring systems will be added later.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Deduction, Print & Play

name: Usuthu! The Battle Of Rorke's Drift 1879
description:
Tactical level simulation for 2 players of the famous action which took place during the Zulu War of 1879.
One player will take control of the British garrison defending the mission whilst the second player is the Zulu Induna seeking to to overrun the station whilst his warriors are still fresh, to gain a quick easy victory to make up for his impi missing out at Isandlwana

name: Małe zoo
description:
Every child loves to visit the zoo. Admire the magnificent animals, exotic specimens, endangered species. Now all these things can happen on the game board. Each player is the owner of the zoo, he must make to the zoo was full of animals.Be careful with the amount of space at the zoo since we have limited. During the game we decide whether it is better to have large animals such as elephant or a giraffe or more animals, but smaller. Pride of every zoo are rare animals (Panda bear, or Chameleon).
When the zoo will be full of animals, it's time to exchange specimens with other players, and visit our zoo visitors in giving us the victory points. The player who collects the first set of their number to be the winner.

name: Sword of Fire: the Battle of Lutter, 27th August 1626
description:
After having passed most of the summer season waiting for event, Christian of Denmark decided to stir himself up and join the other part of his army to combat Tilly, left a little unmanned after having lost several detachments to guard conquered cities. His movements where to slow, and when the two armies joined battle, Tilly was probably a little superior to his opponent. Christian was unable to avoid the clash, and he suffered a defeat.

Each combat unit represents from 250 to 1500 soldiers, and it is rated, from left to right, for combat morale and movement. Each infantry strength point is around 150 men, each cavalry strength point around 80 men. Each leader is rated for Command (indicating how many activation chits that leader has) and Movement.

Each hex is about 75 meters.
Each turn is half on hour.

Contains:
6 page rules
11x17" map (in 2 8.5x11" parts)
1 player aid
216 counters and markers
categories: Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Super Sadistic Advanced Empire Builder
description:
Empire Builder is a classic crayon-rail game by Mayfair, with many followups now available. The core idea of Empire Builder is that players to draw their train routes over a map of the United States. Players start with enough money to build short lengths of track, and by running their trains and delivering loads to various cities acquire more cash to expand their networks.

Super Sadistic Advanced Empire Builder (SSAEB) is an improved and much more challenging version of the base game. Numerous changes have been made: the payoffs on the contract cards have been lowered, the event cards are changed to be much more challenging, two new train types are added, and upgrade costs are increased.

By modifying the basic Empire Builder game with this expansion set, players will have a more challenging and longer game, but one that is more satisfying for hard-core gamers. SSAEB is for die-hard Empire Builder fans only!
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Busy Bee
description: A little luck and skill are needed for this game but it also trains colour recognition and memory. The two different ways of playing this game offer variety and plenty of fun. The players take turns pushing the bees into the slots in the beehive. As soon as a bee "flies out" the player takes it and puts it down on his/her card. Depending on which variant of the game is being played the winner is either the first player to fill his/her card with bees or the last to do. The players should sit side by side so that they can all see which bee is being pushed into which slot.

name: Princess Hide & Seek Game
description:
The colorful Princess Hide & Seek Game is a memory and matching game for children ages 18 months and up. It was published by Cardinal Industries with a Disney Princess theme.

Children match easy-to-handle pictures in large plastic frames with magical Disney scenes on four separate game boards. One board represents a tea party in a garden, another represents a scene in a room full of toys, a third represents a fancy dress ball, and the final board is a playground scene. The faces are popular Disney characters.

This game can be played solitaire or in a group with each child using an indivdual game board.

Includes 4 boards, 20 tokens, and rules.

Cardinal Item # 57714
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Quadrix
description:
Quadrix - The MONEY For WORDS Game

"Quadrix is an exciting new idea in word games; A perfect blend of skill and luck" David Prinz (On Box Cover)

From the Rules:

The object of the game is to win money from other players through the use of word-building skills. You can make money in four ways:
(a) By completing legal words on the word board through placement of letter tiles;
(b) By placing letter tiles which may contribute towards legal words on the word board;
(c) By challenging an opponent who then fails to prove that the letter tiles they placed on the word board can lead to legal words;
(d) By proving to a challenger that the letter tiles you added to the word board can lead to legal words.

name: The Famous Dick Turpin
description: From the Publisher: In this game players are highwaymen, trying to make their fortune by holding up the 'Silver Flyer,' a stagecoach making its winding way across England and into Scotland. Players ambush the coach to rob the wealthy passengers on board. But beware! The passengers may fight back. Worse, you may even meet another highwayman at your chosen hide-out - perhaps Dick Turpin himself - who has the same plan but has no intention of sharing his ill-gotten gains with anyone else!

name: My Son the Doctor
description:
Want to make Mama proud? Become My Son the Doctor. Let Mama impress her friends. Become My Daughter the Movie Star. Maybe you'd rather have money and influence. Become My Son the Tycoon. How about...would you like to rule the world? Become My Son the Politician. All it takes is a little luck...a little concentration and knowing when to keep your mouth shut!

(From front page of the rules.)

Drawing on traditional Jewish humor, this game encourages players to aspire to their Mama's dreams of becoming somebody. Players begin at home with Mama and through the course of the game, pick up Odd Jobs and Tools of the Trade. Once the player gets to their target profession after acquiring 4 Good Tools for that Trade, they win!

Movement on the board is via dice, one specifically for each dimension, with the player choosing the direction. Landing on a free Odd Job gains the player both a random Odd Job card and a random Tool from a profession of their choice. If a player lands on someone else's Odd Job and they get to steal a Tool. Being lazy will cause a player to lose a turn, and sometimes it's best just to Go Home to Mama. However, if a player can catch a Lucky Break, then end up on a square of their choice, which is the best way to land a profession!

The mechanics are simple, but remembering who has what can be more difficult as cards are constantly being exchanged.

name: Roll 'n' Rock
description:
The Rock 'n' Roll Trivia Game

The board for this music trivia game represents an old-fashioned LP record. Players start at the outer rim of the 'album" and move to the center just like a phonograph needle.

Questions include categories like Artists, Titles, and Off The Record which covers other areas of the music industry. This game is designed for 2 to 6 players and follows a typical trivia game format... a contestant reaches the final space and must answer a tough question to win.

Includes the LP record style board, 6 LP tokens, a die, cards, rules, and a storage insert.

(c)1984 Universal Distributors

Made in Canada

name: The Great Walleye Tournament Board Game
description:
The object of the game is to proceed from the marina, trying to avoid the Red Hazard Squares in the channel on the way to the Lake where you will fish.

The Lake consists of the six fishing areas, as related to actual Walleye fishing. Here each player can participate in simulated angling.

Each player or team is required to catch one weighted Walleye in each of the six areas before returning to the marina on their way back players try to finish first avoiding the Red Hazard Squares, as well as the Special Weight Deduction circles.

The tournament champion is the player or team which holds the greatest total weight for their six Walleye.

(Taken from the back of the box)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kingdom
description:
Issue game of Game Link #2.
Designed by Yasutaka Ikeda.
Light card game of fantasy adventure.
Including characters, terrains, monsters, events, skills, items.

92 cards and tokens for characters, money, skills.

The game describes the characters' adventures in the world where the witchking controls.
Play actually proceeds with rolling dice and moving your character according to the roll then resolve the adventure card there. The terrain and your skill will affect the adventure card. You can get some money, item, or skill when you win the monster arose from the adventure card.

The character must collect 15 golds, or 3 emblems or eliminate the witchking to win the game.

Playable in an hour or so.

name: Christmas in Hell: the battle of Ortona
description:
Solitaire game (player takes the role of the Canadians) on the famous battle fought in the street of this small Italian city during late December 1943.
The game uses an area map, platoon level units, machine guns, tanks, booby traps, minefield, and so on. Low to medium complexity. It is a print and play only game, with 2A4 map, more than 400 counters, 8 pages of rules and a turn record track

A board game on the famous battle of WWII, where Canadian troops were forced to fight a fierce battle inside the street of the small city of Ortona against a few very determined German paratroopers.

For the Canadians, Ortona was the bloodiest battle of the Italian Campaign. The once pisturesque ancient village on the Adriatic coast has been reduce to rubble. Canadian and German troops clash daily, in bitter, house-to-house fighting. Snipers, booby traps and land mines were a constant threat as every building gained brought about a terrible cost in blood. Matthew Halton of the CBC refers to Ortona as the "The courtyard of hell". The capture of Ortona, known to those who fought it as the "Italian Stalingrad", is considered among Canada's greatest victories during the war. While both sides agreed the town was of little strategic value, the world press transformed the battle into a matter prestige between the Allies and the Germans. "For some unknown reason, the Germans are waging a miniature Stalingrad in hapless Ortona" wrote one war correspondant.

The game feature two A4 full colour area maps of the battlefield, more than 400 full colour counters, 8 pages of rules and a sheet for recording the game turn and reinforcements.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
publishers: (Web published), High Flying Dice Games, TCS Games

name: Lokalspelet, Kampen om stan: Linköping
description:
This is a Monopoly clone. The publisher Lokalspelet i Skandinavien AB did a lot of these games as promotions for different cities in the 1980s.

In the middle of the board is a photo of the Linköping and around that is a lot of the stores in the city. You can buy stock in them, and you can get cards that ask you questions about the city.

name: Deck of Dice
description:
From the Publisher:

Deck of Dice is not a single game so much as a game system. By using a unique set of dice players can adapt any classic card game into a dice game! The games play much faster and have twists that only dice can bring (like being able to re-roll your hand.)

A set of six dice per player allows for the potential of any combination of 6 values in six suits to be rolled. The suits in Deck of Dice are Hearts, Spades, Diamonds, Clubs, Coins, and Blanks.

The game includes a sheet of labels to attach to standard six-sided dice allowing for 2-6 players (each with their own distinct colour) along with a die for rolling trump (in those games requiring it) and player screens for keeping player's hands secret.

Included in the base rule booklet are adaptations of seven classic card games: Hearts, Euchre, Knockout Whist, Crazy Eights, Go Fish, My Ship Sails and Red Dog.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Game System, Print & Play
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Cabaret Pret
description:
A trivia game with the theme of Dutch cabaret.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: Two Bit Hack
description:
Upgrade your computer; hack your friends computer; get the most Valued Productivity out of your machine!

2 to 4 players compete to get the most bang for their buck for their machines while slowing down other players. This card game features 120 cards and lets players manipulate the deck and their luck to activate their card functions. But other players get to activate their functions in the same register #, even on your turn, and cause havoc with your plans. And the deck stacking isn't the only way to activate your card functions.

As with all computers, random factors can cause you benefits or issues. So, dice also activate function #s. And as you replace your hardware, you get to fun your functions one more time as well. There are combinations of actions that can lead to very interesting results and evolved complexity/depth. Overall the game can be very deep, but is still accessible and easy to learn.

The game plays via rounds and is only very loosely "turn-based". Players can buy and use actions/cards even when it's not their turn. There are game balancing mechanics to help losing players catch up.

This game falls into the Race for the Galaxy, San Juan, Glory to Rome, category of games in that you build your own arrangement of cards in front of you, and try to build combos. Cards are bought via hand discards, but Two Bit Hack has a very unique method for how card functions are activated. This aspect is most similar to Settlers of Catan. Also, cards in hand are not only your money, but also your method of activating your functions with certainty. Or you can leave things more up to luck and leave more cards in your hand for purchasing.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Memory, Variable Player Powers

name: Life Style
description:
Trivia game about gadgets and life style.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

name: Pas touche la mouche
description:
Crush wasps, mosquitoes and hornets which pass at hand. But, attention: the fly is nice so don't touch the fly! Well, not all of them, some flies are evil. Also be careful with swarms, as you do not always know what you crush.

(from the publisher web site)

The "insect" player mixs tokens (1 hornet token,1 mosquito, 1 wasp and 4 flies) in the center of the table taking care that none overlaps or is in contact with another then takes one of his cards and puts it in front of him back side up, so it is visible to all. He is then free to distract the attention of the players by any means until the moment when he turns the card revealing one or several insects. The action the players will need to do depends on the insect on it.

If it is a hornet, mosquito or wasp, the first player who puts its hand on the correponding token or on a fly gets victory points. A player making a mistake loses victory points.
If it is an evil fly, only the fly earns victory points.
If it is a nice fly, no insect must be harmed !
As for the swarms, usually the most numerous insect on the card counts. But if there is only one nice fly, the card is considered as a nice fly card.

(personal sum-up based on the rules.)

name: Theatron
description:
A game of travelling theater companies in the Roman empire. Each player must try to perform in every city the best play according to the demands of the public and the festival it takes place there.

The game is played in different rounds. Each round the players play cards in order (the first player will play the city of the performance, the second will play the festival and the third the public). Each city card, festival card and public card has associated a symbol and a number value. There are three different symbols for cities, three different for festivals and three different for publics. The number values are all from 1 to 3.

After all the players have played their cards they must choose a plot to perform. They all have 6 plot cards to play, and every turn they play one and get a new one from the deck. Every plot is a combination of 3 symbols (one city symbol, one festival symbol and one public symbol). So the players get points for each symbol that matches the requirements stated at the beggining of the turn.

After 12 rounds have been played the game ends and the player with a higher score wins the game.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: Ace Raiders/Dead Sneakers
description:
(From game rulebook)
In Ace Raiders/Dead Sneakers, each player acts as a team leader in charge of a six-man raiding team. Each night, the players attempt to out perform each other by sending their raid teams into the nearby Robot outpost to recover alien weapons and technology. Whoever recovers the most valuable tech is named ace raider for the night and earns promotion points. The players have ten nights to gather as much as they can and get promoted ahead of their peers. Because in ten nights, all of those recovered Robot weapons will be used in the first organized offensive since the invasion ended. The highest ranking team leader will earn his place in history as the hero who established the foothold mankind needed in finally overthrowing the brutal reign of the alien invaders.

Ace Raiders/Dead Sneakers is an entry in the Sneaky Sci Fi Game Design Contest - WIN GG.

name: Morpion Solitaire
description:
A simple but deep solo game played with pen and grid paper.

Starting from an initial cross pattern of 36 marks, score one point for each mark you can add to the pattern that can be joined with existing marks into a non-overlapping line of five.

name: Sixth Sense: A Game of Perception
description:
Sixth Sense: A Game of Perception challenges a player's perception of others on two levels, and rewards those players willing to take social risks in a tongue-in-cheek atmosphere. There are no wrong answers and the topics include Self-Image, Sex, Marriage, Money, Morality and Politics to name a few.





QUESTION: What is the greatest motivator for most adults?A. Love
B. Hate
C. Fear
D. Money




Score points by:
MATCHING the answering player (2 points) or predicting as part of a MAJORITY (+ or - 6 points)

name: Skull Island Adventure
description:
The twisted marble track game.

Try to guide your way safely around the treacherous obstacles of the scary Skull Island as quickly as you can!

(from the box)

Consists of an obstacle course along which players guide a marble using levers to manipulate the different parts of the track.

name: The Dream to End All Dreams: World Cup Soccer
description:
Solitaire Statistical Replay game on World Football, it permits to replay in less than an hour any final edition of the most important soccer competition in the world, from 1930 to 2010.

Rules and flow of play are simple, but accurate.

To play match, each team simply compares his attack value versus opponent defence value. Then, each player rolls three dice to see how many goals he scores.

There are several data that have been used to rate the various teams for each edition of the World Cup, and an element of randomness has been added, to give much flavor to the replay of the tournaments.

Simply put, you compares the Attack rating of one team against the Defence rating of the opponent and viceversa, to get the number of goals scored by each team.
You may complete an entire tournament in less than an hour, but you don't have much chrome: simply the result.

A separate expansion set contains 23 different competitions taken from UEFA Eurocup (from 1980 onward), Copa America (from 1989 onward) and Africa Cup of Nations (from 2000 onward).

Another separate expansion set contains data for Champions League (from 1991 onward) and UEFA Cup/Europa League (from 2004 onward) for a total of 25 tournaments.

name: Shuffle Shot
description:
From the box: "Shuffle Shot is the origional pro tabletop shuffleboard game."

Over a series of turns players either individually or in teams glides weights across the board into a scoring field incremented at 1, 2, and 3 points trying to earn the most points without going off the board. Rules include several scoring variations.

name: Piratas. La Isla del Tesoro
description:
From the top of the box:

"Fun simulation game. The Spanish defend their Galleons and the Empire around the Caribbean Sea. The Pirates dealt ships, plunder towns and look fabulous treasures. Take the risk, glory awaits you... or you will be hanged!

From the back of the box:

This game attempts to replicate the time when piracy in the Caribbean Sea had its peak: between 1665 and 1730. Playing, you can attack a galleon at sea, and also tackle some gold coins for this charge, as indeed happened. You can also attack and loot a city to pay the service of the governor of another nation, which also happened in those years. While trifle, think that you are a current unscrupulous pirates and as such, and as such will be the "hanging" if you are caught. Nor forget that your goal, as it did then, is to land and wealth enough to retire to live like lords the rest of your life. If they do, you will have a serious chance to win the game.


De la tapa de la caja:

"Divertido juego de simulación.
Los Españoles defienden sus Galeones
y su Imperio por todo el Mar Caribe.
Los Piratas abordan barcos, saquean ciudades
y buscan fabulosos tesoros.
Juégatela, te espera la gloria... ¡o la horca!

De la trasera de la caja:

Este juego intenta reproducir la época en que la piratería del Mar Caribe tuvo su mayor apogeo: entre 1665 y 1730. Jugando, podrás atacar un galeón en alta mar, abordarlo y además cobrar unos doblones por ello, como en realidad sucedió. También podrás atacar, rendir y saquear una ciudad, al servicio del gobernador de otra nación, lo que también sucedió en aquellos años. Mientras juguéis, pensar que sois unos piratas sin escrúpulos y actual como tales, ya que como tales seréis "colgados", si os capturan. Tampoco olvidéis que vuestra finalidad, como ocurrió entonces, es conseguir tierras y riquezas suficientes como para retiraros a vivir como grandes señores el resto de vuestra vida. Si así lo hacéis, tendréis serias posibilidades de ganar la partida.

name: Light and Learn
description:
Big Bird helps children discover: Letter matching, number matching, and counting skills. Instructions in English and Spanish. Ages 3-6. contains: big bird magic wand, 10 two sided activity cards, instructions.

The object of this game is to point the "Big Bird" pen at a number, letter, or math problem and he will teach you what said number, letter or math problem is. Through constant repetition of this game, the child will begin to learn his/her alphabet and numerical system. You are finished when you have memorized everything that Big Bird has taught you. The point of this game is to give the child a jump start or aid in the his/her schooling. This game is a simple and fun way for children to learn there basic letter and adding skills.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The MY Deck (fan expansion for Agricola)
description:
(From the website)

This is a fan created expansion for the card game Agricola. This print and play expansion contains 15 Occupations, 11 Minor Improvements, and 1 Major Improvement for Agricola.

You need Agricola to play.

Original content for The MY Deck is © 2009-2010 Michael Young. Agricola is TM and © Lookout Games.

This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Share Alike 3.0 License.
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Farming

name: Golf: The Game
description:
GOLF: THE GAME plays just like the real game of golf. You will have drives, putts, and shots from fairways, bunkers, rough, and water. You can hit shots out-of-bounds, into hazards or water, or score eagles (two under par for the hole) with the best shots of your career. Scoring is also just like the real game of golf.

You will be asked questions on the rules of golf (coded to the 1984 USGA rule book), golf history, major tournaments, famous players, courses, and general golf knowledge. Since almost all the questions are true/false or multiple choice, you may find a non-golfer being the winner of GOLF: THE GAME.

CONTENTS:
contains one two-sided playing board, eighty game booklets (40 Front Nine [green] and 40 Back Nine [blue]), 147 Go For Broke cards, 50 Pro Play cards, score cards, six denominations of play money (500; 1,000; 5,000; 10,000; 25,000; 50,000) , two dice, and four player tees.

name: Iceminers
description:
A complete reworking and reimplementation of my previous game "Diamond Mine". It is played on Martian Coasters, with fewer overall required pieces, incorporates a simple dice element, and the attacking of other players. Replay value should be much higher than Diamond Mine.

Players will be moving towards hidden caches of variously colored gems and delivering them to specified areas of the board to be able to score them as points. Players must carefully choose how to use their movement points (rolled randomly each turn).

Opaque Icehouse pieces will conceal colored pieces beneath, and pieces may only be delivered in a particular area of the board, so depending on what is found, when and where it may be worthwhile to abandon those pieces and explore more or to simply race to get them delivered for points. However, players must also beware that other players could steal those pieces at any time, and may want to, as pieces of a player's own color will count for double points!

IceMiners is a redevelopment of Diamond Mine.

name: Atlantis-opoly
description:
ATLANTIS-OPOLY is sold in the retail gift stores found throughout the beautiful and vast resort, Paradise Island, Bahamas. An endless stream of happy visitors has made ATLANTIS-OPOLY a staple in the resort’s retail planning. The game has gone through several printings. It has been a real bonus for the Company to take advantage of Late for the Sky’s manufacturing capabilities, allowing updated amenities to be featured on the current games. Short production runs can be practical!

Publisher's Description
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Assault of the Dead: Tactics
description:
From the Rulebook:
Assault of the Dead: Tactics is a tactical board game with roleplaying elements, The game combines thematic elements from the Assault of the Dead game but with a combat system unlike any other previously seen in the series. In contrast to Assault of the Dead: Tactics has a character building system (that includes Perks, Weapons, and Survival kits) as well as support for solo play.

Assault of the Dead: Tactics is set in a fictional zombie-infested city called Cloverdale. The game's story follows through scenarios, unfolding part of the city map allowing the players to explore new and dangerous areas. As the story progresses, you and your allies discover a sinister effect behind the zombie outbreak.

The game-play of Assault of the Dead: Tactics differs in several key areas; Characters move on a battlefield composed of circular tiles; movement and actions are determined by the character's Perks, Weapons, and Survival Kits he carries. Battles are low luck; a character can use any number of actions to attack, with attacks always hitting. During battle, whenever an attack is made, dice rolls determine the number of damage points the character can 'spend' on hits and weapon crits. Deal enough hits, and the Zombie is defeated leaving behind a Survival token -- used to buy actions or resupply your character.

Like the original Assault of the Dead: Tactics adjusts the level of reaction from the Zombie side based on how well the characters are doing. Do well and the game spawns more zombies, makes them aggressive, and more powerful. Do poorly, the game will end your misery soon enough.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Golf Strategy 2008
description:
Golf Strategy 2008
“Golf Strategy 2008” is a game of golf and is similar to golf in every detail.
“Golf Strategy 2008” is a game of skill and luck that requires the player to choose
strategies more effective for him to get the best score.
You can play “Golf Strategy 2008” alone, in pairs or more players to organize real golf
tournaments.
The proper use of the instruments inside the packaging of “Golf Strategy 2008” makes the
game brilliant and charming.
Enjoy yourself.
The pack of “Golf Strategy 2008” contains:
– 18 floor plans of many holes, color and scale, laminated
– 3 rulers meters distance and direction; 1 for par 3, 1 for par 4, 1 for par 5, in transparent
plastic silkscreen.
– 11 dices
– 1 pen
– An eraser
– A dash board – based game that contains dices and floor plans of holes.

GENERAL RULES
To play alone, in two, three or four. You can play in pairs or teams of four players and
organize real tournaments. The player, or team, wins the game playing fewer strokes like
real golf.
How to play the hole.
1 – Draw with the pen a mark on the green where you want.
2 – Divide the green in three areas, using the pen
3 – If you play in two or more players draw the order of play.
4 – Playing is simple
a) choose the ruler meters corresponding to par the hole.
example: par 4, ruler meters 4
b) set what tee color you will start from all 18 holes
(indicator blue, white, yellow, black, red).
c) The player who will start first must use the ruler to measure the distance and
direction, matching the hole corresponding to 0 (meters).
The ruler meters can be moved on the course as you prepare.
The player chooses the distance.
Each distance shown on the ruler is equivalent to golf clubs distance.
The ruler cannot be moved.
d) At this point the player will launch simultaneously the three dices “SHOT”
indicated on the dashboard and read the result.
The player will find the hole on the ruler to be marked with the pen.(Extract from the rules)

name: Ab durch die Mitte
description:
The game consists of eight tiles with three pictures on each of them. There are also 24 picture cards showing the same pictures. A path is laid out with the tiles; the cards are placed face down around the path.
The active player flips over a card. If the picture matches one of the three on the tile in front of him/her and, he/she can move forward to that picture on the tile and flip over another card, etc. If there is no match, it is the next player's turn. If the picture is already occupied, the active player ends his/her turn as well. When the last player has left a tile, that tile is taken away and placed at the end of the path, so that the path keeps getting longer and the players have to remember several pictures in a row if they ever want to reach it. The first player to reach the last tile is the winner.

The theme of the game is the German TV series "Bernd das Brot".

(User summary by HilkMAN)
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Lauras Geheimnis
description:
own description:
A memory variant based on the Laura books (Baumhaus Verlag).
The goal is to uncover the 12 tiles in the right chronological order, then the winning child may retell the story with the aid of the motives of the tiles.

Amigo press release:
Eine ganz besondere Memory-Variante ist das Geschichten Memo Lauras Geheimnis. Zwölf Karten mit den kindgerechten Illustrationen von Klaus Baumgart liegen verdeckt in der Tischmitte. Nur wer alle Karten in der richtigen Reihenfolge nacheinander aufdeckt, kann das Spiel gewinnen. So entwickelt sich aus der Bildersuche nach und nach eine richtige kleine Geschichte, die das siegreiche Kind schließlich anhand der Bilder erzählen darf.

name: Flags The Game
description:
User Summary:
Before starting, the players decide the number of countries to "complete" in order to win the game. To complete a country the player must obtain all all three types of cards belonging to said country. The three cards are the flag, the coat of arms, and the capital.

There are two phases of play, the "road" and the "boardwalk".

The Road:
Players roll the dice and move their peg along the road traveling through 85 countries that existed during the mid 1980's. When players land on a country, they must choose which card they think they can correctly guess. When the player guesses correctly, the player obtains said card.

The Boardwalk:
A person can only move to the boardwalk when they have the necessary number of cards. For instance, if the players agreed upon 3 countries to complete, the player must obtain 3 cards of the coat of arms, 3 of the flags, and 3 of the capitals (it doesn't matter if they are of the same country or not). During the boardwalk the players have chances to take away cards from other players and to correctly guess the remaining types of cards of the countries the player has already obtained cards for.

From the Box:
Capitals - Flags - Coat of Arms in Flags The Game

For the teen who has to learn geography!
For the adult who wants to know more!
A fun game for everyone no matter what is your knowledge about geography.
You can play easily and with fun, because, Flags The Game makes a brain without strain.

Publisher:
RDN Games division of Publibec Limited
Sorel, Quebec, Canada J3P 6K5
publishers: RDN Games division of Publibec Limited

name: Catch Me!
description:
In Catch Me!, the objective is to capture the most amount of cards.

Each turn, a player plays a card to either:

1. Start a new pile, or
2. Capture one of the already existing piles.

However, the card you play must be the same number or the same suit but with a higher number. Also, you can only capture the pile at the beginning of your turn.

The player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

Arclight Edition was attached to GameLink magazine issue #4.

name: Anti-King Chess
description:
Anti-King Chess is a pair of variants played on the standard 8x8 chessboard with the standard pieces, and one more piece per side. The Anti-King is a King that is in check only when not attacked by opposing pieces. The goal of Anti-King Chess is to checkmate either your opponent's King or Anti-King.

This game was voted a recognized variant on the chessvariants.org website.

name: El Peregrino
description:
Boardgame about the Way of St. James. The players try to be the first to reach Santiago de Compostela with 10 stamps of different stations along the way. Basic movement is dice-driven. To proceed faster, the players have to answer trivia questions about the pilgrimage. Event cards add an element of luck.
Each player can choose a means of transportation (horse/feet/bicycle). There is a spinning arrow which determines the weather - each type of weather influences the speed depending on the means of transportation.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Klatsch Bang
description:
A good overview and quick hands gives payoff!

Many slightly different card pairs litters the table face down. When the cards are turned you need quick reaction. The quickest player wins the pair.

At first glance this looks like a game of memory, but the card pairs are a bit different. One player starts by turning one tile, and play continues this way around the table until two matching tiles are face up. As soon as anyone sees the match, everyone tries to smack their hands down on the oldest matching tile (i.e. not the one just turned). The quickest can claim the tile pair.

Note: Tiles are _not_ turned face-down again, so the amount of face up tiles increases during the game.

The game ends when the last pair is gone. The winner is the one with the most claimed tiles.

name: Cosmic Chicken
description:
So this is a children's dexterity game in which the players' goal is to gather "asteroids" (marbles) into their bins. There is a "Commander Kikeriki", an anthropomorphic chicken astronaut, flying a spaceship in the middle. He's the one that distributes the marbles, which are in the beginning placed on a sort of platform behind him. Each player's bin is connected to said centre through bars, and has a slider with a small receiver in between.

When the game is turned on, the chicken begins to vibrate wildly, randomly opening up to let the marbles loose. The players try to lift up their bin and slider in sync with this openings and try to collect marbles from the chicken. Whoever has the most in the end wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Science Fiction

name: Tower Defence
description:
Tower Defence, is a quick, easy to play and easy to customise game of vertical tile placement.
This 2 player game involves building Defence Towers, as high and well armed, as possible to beat your neighbours Tower.

You score points for every tile placed and you can also score points for each weapon you have.

Players take turn laying sections down to build a high and well armed Defence Tower. These sections each have a point value which are added together at the end of the game. The weapon sections also have a seperate value, which equal the number of dice thrown to add to that score. The winner is the highest Tower value plus weapon score.

name: Invasion
description:
Old french abstract game of ground battle for young players.

Goal: Grab 4 of the 10 vital centers of enemy player(s)

Components:
- A grid map with roads, rivers, mountains and lakes
- A cache used for hidden pieces deploiement
- 44 pieces per country (4 minefields, 4 missiles, 16 infantry, 8 paratroopers, 6 tanks and 6 engineers)

Gameplay :
At start, each player secretly deploys his pieces using the provided cache. Then players alternate turns playing 2 pieces each turn. A playing piece can move or eliminates an enemy piece, not both. There is no stacking allowed.
Each piece has its own capacities :
- Minefields don't move but blocks enemy and friendly movement except engineers. They can be eliminated by engineers or missiles however.
- Missiles don't move, are removed when used to destroy any enemy piece in play or to unoccupied bridge on the map.
- Infantry can move up to 3 squares horizontally, vertically or diagonally. They can eliminate other pieces (except mines) by jumping over them horizontally or vertically like in checkers.
- Tanks are treated like infantry but with a 5 squares movement and "jumping" allowance.
- Paratroopers are infantry which can once per game be moved up to 6 squares before being played
- Engineers are infantry which can destroy minefields or when placed on a river square be used as a bridge by other pieces.

name: True or Bluff
description:
From the back of the box:

True or Bluff - The Game of Utter Codswallop

True or Bluff is a game of weird and wonderful word definitions!

This game challenges you to identify the correct definitions from amongst a set of false inventions... ...the truth from the codswallop!

Each word has been provided with three definitions and a fourth must be created off the cuff... You have to uncover the true answer whilst also revealing your opponent's crackpot creation!

Instant fun & laughter for those who love word play!


Contents:

Rules
4 True/Bluff flash cards
Score pad
Pencil
50 double sided True or Bluff cards

Gameplay:

The game is played by two teams, nominally of four aside but smaller or larger numbers can easily be accommodated. It is essentially a game version of the TV show Call My Bluff.

Each True or Bluff card contains an obscure word and four answers, a) to d), one of which is true and one of which is the phrase 'Your definition.' The cards are double sided with a different word and answer set on each side, giving 100 words in total.

Each team takes it in turn to read out the word on the card followed by the four answers, one of which they must make up on the spot (they have 2 minutes to do this although it usually takes much less time than that). The other team then has 2 guesses to try and work out which is the correct answer whilst trying to avoid the definition created by the other team. There are 10 rounds of this so each team has five turns bluffing and five turns guessing and at the end the team with the most points wins.

Scoring:

If the guessing team gets it right with their first guess they score two points. If they get it right on their second guess they only get one point.

If the guessing team gets it wrong with both guesses the bluffing team gets a bonus point. Additionally, if the guessing team picked the bluffing team's made up definition for either guess (even if they subsequently got it right) the bluffing team gets two more bonus points.

name: Traxi
description:
Traxi - Het grote verkeersspel (in Dutch) or: Traxi - The great traffic game

Aim of the game
TRAXI is an educative game, that in a relaxing and nice way tests (car)drivers, cyclers and pedestrians and learns them about presentday traffic. A game for adults and children, a game for young and old. An ideal addition to traffic education.

Short description
The trafficlights and trafficsigns can be switched by a shifting mechanism in the board. Drivers whom drive to fast or to slow must pay fines.
By driving wisely and by paying attention a player can earn money.

Winner
The player possessing the most money after the agreed upon playingtime wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Club: DJ Set
description:
It's a Saturday Night in The Club and lonely hearts are still looking for love. This time the heart riot under the strobe lights can truly take place as The Club has hired the best DJ in town to help people get into the "right" mood. Will the DJ's tracklist help you become the clairvoyant cupid who can join the right souls in order to keep The Club as the hottest place in town?

The DJ Set extends the basic The Club game, but it also comes with King & Queen of Clubs which is its own game using the same components as The Club. For the base game, there's also new stickers for tiles to ease the point scoring.

name: Maan Roos Vis Geheime Woord Spel
description:
A Fun and Educational Game for 2 Players!

Goal of the game: Find the secret word from the other player before he finds yours.

Rules:
Put the playingboard between the 2 players. Each player receives 16 chips of the same color. Choose a playingcard together to play with. There are 2 copies of each card, one for each player. Place the chosen card under the holes in your playfield. You can see all the words from the playingcard in the holes now.
If you choose a blue playingcard for example, you both choose a blue wordcard. You recognize your own wordcards by the white or black triangle in the corner of the card. Player 1 chooses a card from the stack with white triangles, and player 2 from the stack with the black triangles. This is your secret word your opponent has to search for. Put the wordcard against the sloping side of the playingfield, so your opponent can't see it.

The first player to guess the word from the other player wins. On your turn, you ask your opponent a question which he can answer with yes or no. For example: Does your word start with a "B"? If your opponent answers no, you can put a chip on every word on your playing card that does not start with a "B". This goes on until only one word remains. He calls the word and wins!

name: Captures
description:
In Captures, each player has three leopards (the targets) and a cube (the hunter) with one side open. Your goal is to capture as many of your opponent's leopards as possible while being the last player to have at least one leopard in the wild.

On your turn, you move your hunter cube to try to catch an opponent's leopard. You catch a leopard when your hunter is on the path of an opponent's cube and the leopard is in its open side.

In the end, players tally their points — 1 point for each captured leopard and 6 points for each leopard still free — and the player with the highest sum wins.
publishers: MB Jeux, MB Spiele, Milton Bradley

name: Animal Mastermind Towers
description: In this exciting vertical version of MASTERMIND designed for kids, players secretly stack their animals into a tower. By asking yes or no questions, they skillfully try to get inside their opponent’s mind. The game can be played at three different levels. The first player to break the code of his or her opponent wins! Your favorite animal friends like pigs and bunnies, furry monkeys and lions, and fish and crocodiles join you on this fun adventurous game. Winner of the prestigious 2010 Top Fun Tillywig Toy Award! Check out the video featuring Animal Towers on ABC News Hottest Fall Toys.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Deduction, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: Broadway Toys LTD, Jumbo, Pressman Toy Corp.

name: Professor Noggin's Baseball
description: Learn all about one of North America's favorite past-times. Professor Noggin's series of educational games encourages kids to learn interesting facts about their favorite subjects. Each of the thirty game cards combines trivia, true or false, and multiple choice questions about the history, rules and traditions of baseball.

name: 2012: The Day of Fallout – Commander
description:
2012: The Day of Fallout - Commander
Free, tactical board game for 2 players (print and play)

Lead one of two armies: Human Section 8 and Arkanian alien race. Fight for domination over the Last District on Earth.

Section 8 is last hope of mankind, has powerful offensive units. Arkanians - insectoid invaders form space with heavily armoured units trying to take over the earth.

Phases of game:
- draw to 3 cards on hand
- recruit units
- realize special missions
- move units on board
- attack
- Victory Points counting

Victory is achieved by:
- collecting victory point's
- destruction of all enemy unit's on board
- winning three of the four opponent fields (starting field's)

Game in Polish and English language version.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Where shall we go?
description:
This game takes us across the map through the large cities of Europe and the adjacent Mediterranean countries. The aim is to be the first player to put down all of his Citycards. You can do this by working the shortest route between cities. The more often you play the game the better you will know your way about the map, the better you willbe able to select your routes critically, and the faster you will be able to put down you cards.

The game is a variant from Explore Europe but without dices.

name: Football Card Game
description:
From the box:
Hours OF FUN for 1 or 2 players. Play at home or carry along to play while traveling.
