YOU CALL THE PLAYS! Run...Kick...Pass. There are touchdowns, pass interceptions, fumbles, penalties, field goals, in fact, everything but a water boy.
All the thrills of a real football game are enjoyed while playing this game. Never two games alike.

Play using regulations football rules of your choice: high school,college or professional rules. Se enclosed cards with rules on how to play and instructions on easy way to keep track of te first downs, line of scrimmage, etc.

name: Storm the Castle
description:
From the designer:
"Storm The Castle - Print, make and play this adventure game. You are a knight and you have to storm through the castle and overthrow the King! Along the adventure you run into guards, wandering beasts and more. Totally free game that you can print up, assemble and play. Including a paper dice if you don't have one."

From the Rules:
"You progress through the castle by rolling six sided dice. Whatever number shows on the dice is the number of squares forward you can move. If you land on a square with a red number in it you must refer to that number in this [the] rule book and follow the instructions."
mechanics: Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rochester in a Box
description: This is a Monopoly clone based on the city, Rochester, NY. Board Squares are replaced with local businesses & landmarks.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: 9 Minutes to Takeoff
description:
T’was 9 minutes to takeoff and all round the castle,
Elves were scurrying about dealing with hassles.
Bernard, the head elf, screamed out in fear,
4 undone tasks might cancel Christmas this year.
“9 minutes ‘til Christmas! You, you, you and you,
Listen to me now, I will tell you what to do.
Get 4 bolts to repair Santa’s sleigh,
It can’t land on rooftops with a broken runner, OK?
Get 24 cups of flour to the baker right now,
Some of the Gingerbread men were mistakenly shipped to Fuzhou.
8 golden bells from the reindeer harness are missing,
Please get this fixed before the Big Man has a hissy.
From Santa’s red coat, 4 buttons are lost,
We must find and replace them, whatever the cost.
These things must be done, but a bad storm is near.
If we can’t do them all in 9 minutes, there will be NO Christmas this year!”
Ready for the challenge, the team sprang to its work. . .

9 Minutes to Takeoff is a cooperative game for 2 – 4 people, ages 8 – Adult, lasting 30 to 60 minutes. This game was designed as an entry in the BoardGameGeek.com 2010 Christmas Print and Play Game contest.

Your team of North Pole denizens must work together to prevent the greatest tragedy of all time: No Christmas. A blizzard is heading for the North Pole and snow is making certain areas impassible. To win you must work together as a group to clear the snow around Santa’s Castle so that you can complete the four required tasks and return to the castle by flying reindeer before time runs out. If however, the countdown clock runs out before you can complete your tasks, there will be no Christmas and Everyone, Everywhere will lose.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Modular Board, Trading

name: Quiz Spiel
description: Players have to answer trivia questions of different categories. A pawn moving around on a board shows which category. The first player to answer 10 questions correct wins the game.

name: Americana! Travel Edition
description:
From the Back of the Box:

Looking for the Real America? Here's a card-capture trivia game with a huge heaping of awesome questions from every corner and generation of the good ole' U.S.A.! Keep to the easier road with Civil Lore! cards, or take to the backroads with really tough Cannon Fodder cards!

Trivia Categories and Descriptions from the Back of the Box:

Secret Natures - Native American Myths, National Parks, Legendary Creatures, Amazing Oddities

Town Halls - Iconic Americana, President Lore, Crazy Laws, Holiday Traditions, Regional Customs

Country Roads - Folk Heroes, Roadside Attractions, Farm Life, Appalachian Ways, Old West Sayings

Modern Airwaves - Radio Days, Behind the Scenes, Classic Television, Business of Hollywood

Urban Scenes - Streetside Games, Urban Legends, Fads & Trends, Great Ballparks, Literary Gems

Futurescapes - Technocultures, Origins of Everyday Things, Sci-Fi Snippets, Future Visions

name: Kampf der Saurier
description:
Fighting Dinosaurs

Two Triceratops meet in a narrow canyon.
Neither of them will give in and so they start a fight. Every rock is essential now. Who is the strongest one in the end? A game of dice for two players that train your skills.

Players throw the dice. This is the number of spaces you are allowed to push your dinosaur forward. The aim is to push the Triceratops of your opponent off the plank.
On the plank there are also rocks between the dinosaurs. If a rock falls of the plank your turn ends and you are not allowed to finish your move.

Components:
2 dinosaurs
20 rocks
1 plank
1 dice with a sticker sheet.

This game is part of the T-ReX World line of die Spiegelburg.

name: Weg mit dir!
description:
All pieces are magnets in a transperant covered plastic maze. On your turn you roll two dice and use a magnetic stick to move your pieces. There are holes with different values for the different players. When a piece is fallen in a hole it will be scored. Game end when one player has only two pieces left.
You can "accidentally" move pieces of other players.

name: Wyvern Pass Not
description:
Wyvern Pass Not is a tile placement-solitaire game for the Decktet. It is an adaptation of a flash game by Sandhill Games Ring Pass Not

You are a great mage, represented by the excuse, taming the wyvern; put it in front of yourself in a way that the little fool is standing up. As the mage you need to create a ring of protection before the wyvern breaths fire upon you. Well a wyvern, or a balrog, or whatever please you because the nature of the Decktet you could represent whatever battle, or characters, or universe that please you, well, always when the story to represent must be the creation of a protection against a superior physical or magical power.

The player must create a ring of eight tiles (Decktet cards) in a perfect circle with perfect links to win. Each link is formed by two cards that share a common suit. The player takes the tiles/cards from a drawing pool of four cards. The player can deal new cards onto the drawing pool but this will deplete its maximum number of cards by -1. If the player deplete all his drawing pool, or form a ring with not-working links, he loses.

Rules at the Decktet wiki:

http://decktet.wikidot.com/game:wyvern-pass-not

name: Austria Quiz
description: A simple quiz card game with 107 cards. Each card covers a specific topic about Austria with 4 questions, the first being the easiest and the last the hardest. Players try to answer the questions and score points according to the chosen difficulty.

name: Ten in the Bed
description:
An entertaining number game

Each player takes a bed card and the remaining cards are shuffled and dealt out 4 to each player. Players look to see if any of their cards add up to exactly 10 (e.g. 5+5, 2+3+4+1, etc). If the player has a 10 then they put their cards to bed. Teddy cards are wild and can count as anything; roll over cards allow you to exchange cards from hand. Play continues until all the cards have been picked up, and each player counts the number of 10s they have 'put to bed'.

name: Tohuwabohu: Einfach tierisch
description:
Tohuwabohu: Einfach tierisch is one of four party games in a new line from Ravensburger for 2011, two of which are credited to designer Laufriedo Steinstätter.

In this game – the title of which translates to something like, "Chaos: Simply Beasty" – players must imitate various animals: Hang from the door frame like a chimpanzee, lay an egg or two, sing like you're one with nature. Whatever you do, do it quickly as you're not the only wild animal at the table trying to score!

name: Eisenbahn-Spiel
description:
Each player attempts to connect two railway terminals with his pieces. The player who is first to complete a continuous connection is the winner. The railway stations possible during each game are determined by throwing letter dice. If, for example, "F" is thrown, the piece belonging to that player can be placed on Faido, Filsur, Fiesch, Flamatt, Frutigen, or Frauenfeld. It is permitted to interrupt the connecting routes of other players with your own pieces.

-from back of box

name: Ferris Bueller's Day Off Board Game
description:
Tongue-in-cheek board game designed by artist, Max Dalton. Similar to Candyland, but re-themed for a Ferris Bueller universe. Retro chic pop culture rolled up in one.

The object of the game is to travel along the path through dice-roll results from field 1 (which is marked as START) to HOME. The first player who successfully lands exactly on HOME is the winner. Many fields have special hazards or benefits for players who land on them.

name: Shih Tzu-opoly
description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

LIVELY, ALERT, FRIENDLY... MEET THE SHIH TZU!

The ancestors of today’s Shih Tzu breed are among the most ancient of dog breeds. These dogs were cherished by Chinese royals as prized house pets for over a thousand years. The word Shih Tzu means "lion" and although this dog is sweet and playful it is not afraid to stand up for itself. The traditional long silky, glossy coat that reaches the floor requires daily brushing to avoid tangles. Often the coat is clipped short to simplify care. Happy and hardy and packed with character, the gentle and loyal Shih Tzu offers a lot of dog in a small package.

SHIH TZU-OPOLY IS A GAME OF TAIL-WAGGING FUN!
COLLECT YOUR FAVORITE SHIH TZUS AND PLAY HARD!

Increase your rent by buying Toys for your dogs and upgrading them to Big Bones. Sounds easy enough until you get fleas, have an accident on the carpet, or worse yet, get sent to the kennel!

GRAB YOUR TOKEN AND ADVANCE TO GO SHIH TZUS!

Who knows! You may soon be Best in Show or going in for vaccinations! Whatever happens, keep your wag on!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Cleveland-opoly
description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

It’s impossible to include everything, but we jammed all the
Cleveland we could into this box. It’s filled with sports, music, dog bones, buzzards - a little something for every Clevelander!
Looking for a fun way to experience C-Town? Here it is!

Here’s a quick idea of how to play!

Buy your favorite Cleveland properties, increase your rent by collecting city blocks and trading them in for keys to the city. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! So choose your token and advance to Go Cleveland! You may soon be running for mayor... or migrating with the buzzards!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Dual Value Playing Cards
description: Dual Value Playing Cards have two values on every card. They can be used for a variety of new, Clever games, such as BAMM!, Think Ahead, Clever Pickin', Zig Poker, and others. There are Rummy, Poker, Trick-Trump, Matching, Set-collecting, and other types of games that can be played with these versatile cards. Two different decks are available, with different pairings of values on each card.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Memory, Set Collection, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Bible Checkers
description:
"A new way to play checkers and learn about the 'fruits of the spirit'"

Bible Checkers is a Christian-themed game of checkers with a few variant rules -- red squares are interspersed in an otherwise black/white board, no pieces are ever removed from play, and players attempt to reach the opposite side of the board's "Fruit of the Spirit" squares ("Love," "Goodness," "Joy," "Faith," "Long-Suffering," etc.)

name: Let's Grow
description:
Let's Grow The Life Cycles Game encourages deeper understanding of life cycles.
- Reinforces understanding of developmental stages of a chicken, frog, butterfly and plant
- Engages children as they race to complete a life-cycle puzzle using memory match strategies.

Players select a life-cycle game card: chicken, frog, butterfly or plant. Spin to move around the board, uncovering puzzle pieces to fill in his/her life cycle. First one to complete a life-cycle card wins!

Components:

game board
4 life-cycle game cards,
16 puzzle pieces,
4 pawns,
spinner
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Puzzle

name: Battles for a Continent: The Plains of Abraham & Sainte-Foy
description: Battles for a Continent is a low-complexity, tactical, print-and-play simulation of two Seven Years War (known as the French and Indian War in the United States) battles fought outside the gates of Quebec City: The Plains of Abraham (1759) and Sainte-Foy (1760). Battle scenario designs and OOB research were done by Dennis L. Bishop. Two sets of counters, one 22" x 17" map. The rules include stack disruption, leader effects, defensive fire against melee attacks and more. Included is a separate bonus game: Braddock's Defeat: The Battle of the Monongahela
categories: American Indian Wars, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Zirkus Stapelix
description: Zirkus Stapelix takes place in a circus setting. The active player flips open the top card from one of the three stacks (showing 1, 2, or 3 balls depending on the degree of difficuly of the card) in the middle of the table and memorises the arrangement of the playing pieces (animals, director, balls etc.) After turning the card face down, the player tries to arrange the pieces in the same order that is shown on the card. In the meantime, the other players roll dice. If they manage to roll the star symbol four times before the active player completes his/her task, the attempt ends. If not, the active player keeps the card, as long as they got the playing pieces arranged correctly. At the end of the game, the player with the highest number of balls on his/her cards is the winner.

name: Mexican Chess
description:
Chess variant played on a 10x10 board, where pawns can start moving up to three spaces forward instead of the traditional two spaces, and where there's a new piece, the Conquistador, placed between the Knight and the Bishop, that moves almost like a Knight: two spaces forward orthogonally followed by one space forward diagonally.

The game was developed in 1965 but it has never been commercially released.

name: Catch
description:
Catch is a game from the 1970s where the objective is to catch fish. Points are scored per poundage of fish and when all of the fish are caught, the player with the most points wins. There are bonus points for collecting three of the same fish as well as for collecting bait cards. The board is depicted as a flowing river and movement is governed by use of a die. Landing on various special spaces allows players to obtain bait and enter fishing contests, along with other encounters. A spinner is used to determine the outcome of these events.

From the box: "Catch - the fishing game for all ages"
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Investopoly
description:
In Investopoly, you try your luck in gold and shares. The course of the stock exchange influences only indirectly, as in through the placement of your pawn on the game board (economical cycle) and through your decision to buy or sell (supply and demand). You need to manage your perspicacity and intelligence to bring the constant up and down nature of the economy under control in order to gain shares, dividends, and gold.

Originally published in spielbox 1991 #5.

name: Le Synapse
description:
Le Synapse is a two-player abstract game played 4×4 square board. It was designed to be played with materials commonly found at home: Draw the 4×4 board on paper, making the spaces large enough to host matches. The first player places one to three matches in a space, pointing orthogonally at another empty space on the board. This is where the second player must place matches. This continues until someone can't play legally, and loses the game.

As a variant, you can limit the supply of matches to just 25, which means the supply could become insufficient to allow a legal play.

name: Bucket Brigade
description:
A game for children. 4 is the ideal number of players.
Each player has set of five buckets which can be lifted by handles that fit under the rim, 5 marbles and a 'well'. The players each arrange their buckets in a row, one end of which touches the well.
Someone says "Go!", the player must lift the bucket closest to the well and tips the marble into the well. He returns the bucket , lifts the second one and tips the marble into the now empty first bucket. This procedure is repeated until the marble in the fifth bucket has been transferred into all the other buckets. The winner is the first player to get 5 marbles into the well.
Simple but will appeal to its age range. Adults should supervise because the youngest children might fancy eating a marble.

name: Clonk!
description:
"10 lively action games for one or more players"

A collection of 10 games played using the plastic "flickers" and "pucks" where you must flick the discs into various areas of the box insert. Sometimes into the coloured areas through the small gates or other parts of the scoring surface.

Games lists in the rules are -

Simplex
Colour Box
Form Fours
Colour Fours
Vicious Circle
Spider
Rainbow
Shepherd
Yellow Peril
Fairway

Rules are in English and French.

name: Mythos
description:
A very light and simple two players card game by Bruno Faidutti, it has been published successively, each time with some additions and developmenst, in the French magazines Sciences & Vie Découverte (1999), then in the Japanese boardgame magazine Gamelink (2011), and last in the French comics magazine Lanfeust, in 2016.

Mythos, a.k.a. Battle of Gods, is a variation on the good old game of War, which tries to add some subtleties, both with tactics and bluffing.
The first new idea is that cards are played in pairs. First, each player plays a card. Cards are revealed, and then each player plays a second one, and their values are added. This makes for some interesting dilemmas.
The second new idea is that there are 6 sets of 12 cards, for six different mythologies. In each game, each player plays a different mythology. In each set, two or three cards have special effects when played, making for interesting combos and even more bluffing.
It's a two player game, but the six available mythologies make for 15 different possible duels.
publishers: Arclight Games, Lanfeust Mag, Sciences & Vie Découvertes

name: Peter Pan Adventure Board Game
description:
Adventure game set in Neverland. Become Captain Hook and his Pirates or one of the |Brave Lost Boys ready to attack at every opportunity. Help Peter Pan Remember how to fly in order to save Neverland.
2-6 players travel around a map of Neverland either by land or sea.

Objective of the game.
To reach the four hideouts ( huts ) on the gameboard, one on each of the main islands and one on the cloud, in order to win the four hideout cards and so deduce the one that is missing from the five total hideout cards. Hideout cards can also be won in battle. The first player to correctly deduce the missing hideout card wins the game.Movement is done by rolling the dice and moving by land or sea. Obstacles appear on the gameboard and each obstacle requires the correct tool card to overcome the obstacle ( cutlass,Disguise, Tinkerbell and wood )
Once the player knows the correct identity of the missing memory card then the players have to either occupy/capture locations on the gameboard.
Hangman`s Tree if Captain Hook or a Pirate.
The Jolly Roger if Tinkerbell or a Lost Boy.
Battles are fought when conditions are met on land or sea.
(Reaching a Hideout and attacking the ocupier/flag owner on land, at sea when two players are within 5 spaces of each other ).Battles are resolved by card play of either Rifapults (sea)or catapults (Land).

Board Symbols.
Players start the game with five cards shuffled from the Peter
Pan and Captain Hook deck of cards. When landing on any of the Peter Pan or Captain Hook symbols players have to buy the appropriate card from that deck and pay the treasury 2 doubloons. Players begin the game with 20 doubloons. Players may only hold 5 Captain Hook and 5 Peter Pan cards at any one time..When landing on a Treasure Chest symbol players have the option to exchange their 5 cards for new sets or receive 10 doubloons from the treasury.Obstacles also appear on the gameboard and must be passed by playing the appropriate tool card in order to pass ( Cutlass,Disguise,Raft,Tinkerbell, and Wood. )

name: My Little Panzer
description:
My Little Panzer is included in issue #18 of the Dork Tower comic book. The background is that Ken (one of the characters) and the rest of his wargaming club have fallen asleep and are sharing a dream. In the dream, they are in the French countryside with cute little versions of World War II tanks running around shooting at things.

Each player controls a wargamer who is trying to collect as many cute tanks as possible. The tanks are controlled by the player to the right of the active player, and can shoot at wargamers or at other tanks. The game ends when a wargamer collects one of every type of tank or when the wargamers wake up.

Optional rules allow for a campaign game, a mecha unit (the PanzerKampfer), and a version in which the players control the tanks and are actively trying to shoot everyone else.

name: Midnight Men
description:
Midnight Men is a highly thematic cooperative superhero game where players use their personal decks of Power Cards to neutralize the threats and plots initiated throughout the city by a Villain. The players must work together to stop the Villain before his/her Master Plot succeeds, or before the Terror level becomes unacceptably high.

Hand, deck, and risk management are key aspects of game play. The heroes each have a unique starting deck of 15 Special or Super Power cards, the latter of which come in three levels of increasing potency. These cards are used by the players to act during the game - mainly to neutralize Threat cards by matching the symbols found on them with the symbols on their Power cards. Throughout the game, the players can upgrade their Super Powers (and unlock new ones) through the use of Valour Points accumulated by facing threats and neutralizing plots.







Midnight Men est un jeu coopératif de super-héros hautement thématique aucours duquel les joueurs utilisent leurs "decks" personnels de cartes Pouvoirs pour neutraliser les menaces et complots initiés partout dans la ville par le Vilain. Les joueurs doivent oeuvrer ensemble pour vaincre le Vilain avant que son complot ne réussisse, ou avant que le niveau de terreur devienne extrême.

La gestion de cartes et du risque sont les aspects clés du jeu. Les héros ont chacun un paquet unique de 15 cartes de Pouvoirs Spéciaux ou Super Pouvoirs. Ces derniers viennent en trois niveaux de puissance croissante. Ces cartes sont utilisées par les joueurs et permettent principalement de neutraliser les cartes Menace en jumelant les symboles qui s'y trouvent avec les symboles sur leurs cartes. Pendant la partie, les joueurs peuvent améliorer leurs Super Pouvoirs (et éventuellement en découvrir de nouveaux) en utilisant les points de Valeur qu'ils auront accumulés en faisant face à des menaces ou en neutralisant des complots.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Filosofia Éditions, Z-Man Games

name: It's a Goal
description:
A card game with 44 cards, 22 representing the First Division and 22 representing the Second Division.
Players try to score goals by playing cards which have number on them. You add up the cards played and if they total 120 or more, a goal is scored (you have covered the distance from your goalk to your opponent's goal). There are special cards that provide interaction - Goalkeepers, Penalty Cards and Obstruction Cards.

name: Village Tale
description:
You and your fellows find yourselves owning plots of land in an isolated part of the countryside, halfway between two distant cities. The land is rich, travelers abound, and there is money to be had in founding a village! Will you create an economic hub, or a haven for the underprivileged? Will you foster the arts, or train mighty soldiers? When people gather and speak of your village, what tales will they tell?

Village Tale is a Print and Play Card Drafting game inspired by Satoshi Nakamura's Fairy Tale. The game takes place over four rounds of play. In each round, players are dealt six or seven cards. Each player chooses one card and passes the rest of the cards to his or her neighbor (alternating left and right each round). From the remaining cards, players choose one and pass the rest, and so on, until no cards are left to pass.

From those cards, players simultaneously play one card into one of the four districts of their village (north, south, east, and west). Any card effects are resolved. Then players play three more cards, one at a time in this fashion. Players discard their remaining cards, and go on to the next round.

After four rounds, players find out how many points their buildings are worth. Each building has a fixed value or a variable value based on the other types and locations of buildings a player has played. Whichever player has the most points wins.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Medieval, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Stop or Go
description:
A road safety game to educate children about the Highway Code, whether they are walking or cycling.
'Kerb Drill Bill' gives the advice.

This is the rarest Pepys game, by a mile. Even the guru of Pepys data doesn't have a copy. We know it existed because there were adverts for it in the back of the rules of most card games in the 40's.

name: Nationale 7: Lapalisse
description:
You are driving through the city of Lapalisse and try to collect two items and find one truth. When you get your items and truth, you rush out from the city. First one who leaves wins the game.
You move your car by pushing new tiles to the Nationale 7. When your car is in the right place you park and collect an item or leave Nationale 7 and turn to side roads in Lapalisse. You collect or lose the truth by driving to a "truth" tile.

name: The Sesquipedalian Word Game
description:
Sesquipedalian is a word game, intended primarily as an vocab-building game for kids. It shares mechanics with party games like Cranium and Balderdash. Players move through the board by rolling a die, and complete color coded actions corresponding to their space on the board. Actions include:

- illustrating a word
- acting out a word
- guessing the definition of a word
- making up definitions of a word for other players to guess
- guessing the correct category of a word (such as "astonishing actions")

The game comes with a small dictionary, with a focus on rare, multisyllabic and/or unusual-sounding words. Also included are rules for other simple paper-and-pencil games that can be played using the dictionary, including Hangman, Ghost, and Word Squares.
categories: Bluffing, Children's Game, Educational, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Acting, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zulu Storm
description:
User summary:
A straightforward, large scale skirmish game for the Zulu and other colonial wars. These rules are 1:1 ratio with each figure representing an individual soldier and are intended for 25/28mm scale miniatures although other scales can be used. Each type figure has a unique set of four abilities that are used during movement and combat (Close Combat Skill, Agility/Horsemanship/Firing Skill, Initiative). Special figures such as officers have unique abilities beyond normal infantry. The rules are simple and fast-playing with a strong emphasis on historical flavor and playability.

name: Six Pieds Sous Terre
description:
From the game box:
A Hell of a game.

Each player, as an undertaker, is going to bury the most deceased in the graveyard to win the title of most famous living undertaker in town! You will have to follow the requirements of the families of the dead and to reserve the headstones to the graveyard before burying the dead, but you're not alone: tough negotiations and bids with your competitors await you!

The richest undertaker at the end of the game wins.

name: Noval
description:
Noval is the quick playing family-friendly strategy game with suspenseful play and comfortably shaped cards. No batteries, boards, pencils, or score keeping. Play in under 30 minutes! Match or beat each others cards in a race to be the first empty-handed player! Great for family game nights or get-togethers. Noval's portable size makes it great for fun on the go. Grab the box, slide it into a pocket or purse, go have some fun!

Nine cards are dealt to each player who then select 3 cards at random without looking at their hands and place them face-down in front of themselves. These cards remain there until later in the game. Players must then match or beat each others cards to get rid of their hands and win! Cards like BURN and WILD add a twist of excitement while High cards (BRONZE, SILVER, GOLD, and DIAMOND) are used to force other players to pick up piles of cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Beanstalk
description:
A player is a islander on equatorial line. A Space elevator has bullt in your island, and you switched from a farmer to a merchant. Now, you should trade cargos from universe to grow affluent.

Each turn, the player locates 2 falling down carges what on choosen column vertically. If same color cargos connect 4 or more, these cargo come into port, then dealed out by players. Therefore, player can build buildings by paying cost(= 1 cost equals to 1 cargo). You can use special capability of these buildings.

Finally, The player who gains most cargos is winner.

name: Micro chess
description:
3x3 chess is a solved game. This game is analysed and solved by Kirill Kryukov. You can read more about 3x3 chess from his own web site about 3x3 chess and you can find more problems.

This game is designed especially as a chess training game for kids and occasional chess players. This game is not an orginal idea of the game designer. The game is played on a 3x3 board with a standard chess set. The aim of the game is to make a check mate in given number of moves. The game files include game rules for a two player game,for solo play and challenge cards. There are four difficulty levels. The easiest is mate in one and the most difficult is mate in four.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Educational, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Building Dead Guys
description: Building Dead Guys pits two players against each other in a battle to the life. Each round a new Body Part is drawn. Both players bid secretly on it, the winner then places the Part onto their dead guy. Once you have a head, two arms and legs and a couple of organs, you win. Each Body part also has a one use ability which either helps you or hurts your opponent.

name: Line Up
description:
An abstract game for 2-6 players. Contents: 90 cards showing one or more lines and curves in different colours.

Gameplay: The goal of the game is to have the fewest cards (ideally, none) at the end of the game. Each player receives 8 cards, the rest forms the draw pile. One card is then flipped over from the draw pile, and the start player tries to place one of her cards so that the colours line up with this card. Play then proceeds with the next player trying to line up one of his cards with one of the face-up cards. If a player cannot line up any of his cards, he draws cards until he can; if the draw pile has run out, he misses his turn instead. The game ends if one player manages to get rid of all her cards, in which case she wins, or, if no more cards can be placed, in which case the player with the fewest cards left wins.

name: Planet kort
description:
This is a danish card game about our solar system. The game has 42 card. One card represent the Sun. The other cards represent planets (including the earth), moons, asteroids and comets. Each card have information about the object it represents and a picture of the object.

The game can be played in three different ways; One called Build Solar System, one called War of the Worlds and one rummy-styled game.

In Build Solar System the first player to get rid of all your cards first win. Each player start with three card. The first player draws a card and play a card. Then each player in turn add a card to the Solar System by playing cards next to card on the table. Planet cards must be played next to planets they are next to in order from the Sun. Moons must be placed perpendicular to the planet they circle. Asteroids are placed in a asteroid field between Mars and Jupiter. Coments act as jokers and can be placed anywhere insted of another card. If you can't add a card to the Solar System you must draw a card insted.

In War of the Worlds each player has a deck of card and you try to get the most cards. The starting player look at the top card and pick one piece of information on the card: mass, diameter, density, speed, length of the day, temperature or distance to the sun. All players now show their top card. The one with the higher value get all the cards and put the card on the bottom of the deck. That player now look at the top card and pick a piece of information on that card. When one player has no card in the deck the game ends and the player with the most cards win.

In the rummy-styled game each player tries to get the most points by playing sets of cards. Each card has a point value printed in the rigth corner. Each player start with 6 cards in the hand. The rest of the card is placed in to deck and the top card is turned over - this is the start of the dicard pile. The players now takes turns. In a turn you start by drawing a card. Then you have the option to play a set of tree. A set must be either three planets next to eash other in the ord they placed from the sun, three moons from the same planet, a planet and two of its moons or thee asteroids. You end you turn by discarding a card. When one player has no cards in the hand game ends. The player with to highest total point value on the table win.

name: Celebritease
description:
The new outrageous fast-paced game of celebrity icons.

To play Celebritease, all you need is a knack for celebrities of all kinds, a vivid imagination, a keen memory, reckless abandon, or a couple good shots.

The object is simple: earn the most points. Fun ensues when you get just :60 to get teammates to name as many celebrities as possible. Sing, dance, draw, act, cough - whatever.

Sound easy? Sure. That's assuming you know the name of, say, Buster Keaton's pet dog. Otherwise, you'll be pulling your hair out trying to get others to say "Luke".

name: Pokol
description:
A game obviously inspired by the Scrabble board, triple and double value squares are an important part of the game.

From 2 to 4 players take part. You draw a number of tiles from the 108 (2 decks of cards in effect) provided. In your turn you should try to form legitimate Poker hands, which are added to the board crossword-fashion. The winner is the player with the most points after a given number of games. It is also suggested in the rules that this will be a good game for solitaire play.

The rules were originally published in Games & Puzzles #2 (June 1972).
publishers: Ariel Productions Ltd, Games and Puzzles (magazine)

name: Travel 20 Questions for Kids
description: Travel version of this popular classic board game including only 52 cards. Players ask up to 20 Questions to guess the Person, Place or Thing.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Party Game, Trivia

name: Doctor Who Monster Invasion
description:
A magazine that comes with collectible trading cards themed mostly on the new Doctor Who adventures, with some special cards recalling the earlier TV series. Each issue of DWMI contains a new game using the cards, which have a range of stats unique to that card. The first issue contains the games, Stat Attack, Survivor and Alien Attack, and playmats for the games.
Stat Attack is a straight comparison of stats, like Top Trumps.
The second issue introduces the game UNIT Challenge, where you can combine stats on your cards to get a higher rating.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: 2-5 Skidoo
description:
This is game #8 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series.

2-5 Skidoo a press-your-luck game for 2 players on an 8x4 board, in the family of games that includes games like Can't Stop, Cosmic Wimpout, 500, Farkle, Ten Thousand, and Pass the Pigs. The name is derived from the phrase “23 skidoo”.

In this game, each of the 4 columns on the 4x8 board correspond to numbers 2-5. During a turn a player rolls 6 six-sided dice (numbered 1-6). They pick three to add up, to beat a target number (this is either zero on their first roll, or what their last total was). The players then take one of the remaining 3 dice and apply it to one of their columns.

If a player can't apply a die to advance one of their pieces, or don't beat their target number, all advancement resets.

Play continues until a player gets all four of their pieces off the board.

name: Blulu
description:
An arithmetically paired fishing game with the Decktet.

In the Eastern Deserts, the jackrabbits are regarded as a pest and a delicacy. Lesser known is that between eating (and being eaten) they while away their time with a simple fishing game.

As a fishing game, the goal of the game is to capture cards. Each player will play two cards every turn, capturing cards using either the sum or difference of the played cards. The players that captures the most cards scores points for the round. The first player to reach twenty-two points wins the game and is granted the privilege to be the first bunny out for dinner.

The game is a reinvention of the classic Moroccan fishing game Ronda. Aside from using the Decktet instead of the Latin Deck, the game is also played with two cards at a time and bonuses are given for suit combinations played.

name: Battlefield Blast
description: Maneuver your kings and knights to the castle wall, but watch out as your opponent uses air blasters to knock your players off the board. The first player to get two of their pieces to the castle wall is the winner. Kings and knights can only move in a certain direction, so be sure to strategize before moving so as not to wander too close to your opponents air catapault.

name: LiberalOpoly
description:
LiberalOpoly follows the format of Parker Brothers Monopoly.

Instead of trading properties, as is the case of Monopoly, LiberalOpoly player's trade political favors in exchange for financial support from interest groups. Instead of Chance and Community Chest cards, LiberalOpoly features "Bushwacked" and "Meet the Press" Cards, which are an especially creative aspect of the game.

The cover image for LiberalOpoly portrays John Kerry as Mr. Monopoly, with cane in hand, popping out of the "O" in LiberalOpoly. It also features an intoxicated Ted Kennedy drunk on the lawn, John Edwards chasing an ambulance, Michael Moore eating cheeseburgers and Barbara Streisand flying over the Hollywood hills on a broom
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Saloon Fights
description:
Saloon Fights is an Old West themed game that attempts to recreate the saloon fights as they occurred in Hollywood movies. This game isn't meant to be a realistic portrayal of fights, rather it portrays the over-the-top fights of B-grade cinema. Each player in the group controls a group of six, one is a group of hardworking cowhands and the other is a group of ne’erdowells looking for trouble.

The game map is a hex grid of the saloon and the wooden sidewalk outside. Objects inside the saloon such as tables and the bar also represented which serve as movement obstacles to the players. There are a total of three maps included with the game.

Each player has 50 points which are allocated to the six men either as strength points or dexterity points before the fight begins. Fighting is carried out in order of descending dexterity (highest dexterity goes first). The men can be hurt, knocked unconscious, stunned, or killed and the game provides counters to indicate their status during the fight. The fight is initiated between two randomly chosen men who must throw the first punch at each other before any other characters can join in.

The game includes counters for townsfolk such as piano players, saloon girls, and the bartender, each of whom has strength and dexterity characteristics and may get involved in the fight. The game turns are timed based on the camera cuts of old Western movies.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Horror Island
description:
This game attempts to capture the feel of a Horror Movie in a Board Game. Players start off as survivors of an airplane crash, they know that something is wrong but not what. They must first leave the safety of the abandoned village and collect clues from other island locations. Once they have collected enough clues a Horror themed Goal is revealed that usually requires gathering certain objects and bringing them to a given location (eg. To escape from the island you must take the motor from the docks and repair it in the workshop, and return with the keys and gasoline to escape).

As the players move about the island they will come under attack from the Peril Deck. The hand of cards each player holds represents the energy they have to escape from the attacks, attacks chip away at your hand (the Action Deck also represents how much daylight is left). If you ever run out of cards in your hand after an attack you die... but the player can always return to the village to grab another survivor to wander off to find out what is going on.

The game contains a few horror themed cards including "I know what to do", "it's now or never", and my favorite for twist endings "It's not what you think" all balanced to bring a horror movie to your tabletop in about half-an-hour.

NOTE: All files necessary to play the game are located in the files section below :-)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Stacks In Action
description:
This is Game #25 in the Games on Half a Checkerboard Series

This game is a fusion of Lines of Action, Focus and Extinction Chess. In it, in order to keep pieces moving, a player must control at least one stack each containing 1 piece, 2 pieces, and 3 pieces. In order to move a stack on top of another stack, a player must have all their pieces on the board. If a player is unable to perform a legal move at the start of their turn, that player loses the game.

Paul Beykirch also was part of the design process and is listed as a co-designer of the game.

name: Scrabble: Diary of a Wimpy Kid
description:
Publisher Blurb:

Time to put your inner "Wimpy Kid" to work and your wit on the game board. The Diary of a Wimpy Kid edition of Scrabble includes 50 exclusive bonus words, new Wimpy Kid rules, and a specially designed game board that features Greg and the gang, even Fregley and those pesky whirley street kids. Zoo-Wee Mama!

Just like the well-known game of Scrabble, players will play tiles to make words on the game board, scoring points for the letters used in the word and bonus points for playing over special spaces on the board or using all letters from the player's rack in a single play.

name: Bombers Over Europe
description:
An old war game made during or after World War II. The game is a simple dice game where up to four players moving a playing piece towards an enemy city. Each player is allowed ten raids to the objectives of their choice, with the highest score tabulated at the end of the game declared a winner. If a playing piece lands on a black square during a raid, the piece is removed from the board and that turn is lost. The high ratio of black squares (40 out of a possible 179 spaces) is a depressingly accurate reflection of the high casualties facing wartime bomber crews.

The original wartime edition was printed in brown on thin beige cardstock, while the post-war version had a glossier red board with black squares. Both versions fold out to a size 16" x 11". The coloured playing pieces are made from 1/4" painted wooden dowel and the die is wooden as well. Game instructions are printed on the face of the board.

name: Tkodi
description:
User summary
The name derives from the five dice used:
Tetra - d4
Kubus / Hexa - d6
Octo - d8
Dodeca - d12
Icosa - d20

Games with the five only real dice - a collection of three games.

In "555", players try to form a chain where every bigger dice shows a bigger number.

In "Alles of niks", players try to form the longest chain of rolling ever higher numbers on dice of their choice.

In "Thodi", two players try to win dice by rolling a higher number than the opponent.

name: Party & Co XX Century
description: Party & Co edition with questions about the 20th Century

name: My Monster
description:
Pick your monster and collect all their missing shapes by reaching into the bag. No peeking! An ideal "hands on" activity to encourage tactile skills in young learners.

On their turn, a player draws a Monster Piece from the cloth bag. They can't peek in the bag, but they can spend some time feeling the shapes of the pieces in the bag before selecting one.

If the selected Monster Piece matches an empty space with the same shape and color on their Monster Board, they may fill that space with the Monster Piece. If the space is already occupied by another matching Monster Piece, then they must put the selected marker back into the cloth bag.

When a player has either placed a piece on their Monster Board, or returned a piece to the bag, they pass clockwise. The game ends when one player has filled their Monster Board with the correct Monster Pieces.

WHAT THEY'LL LEARN: Mental Imaging, Probability, Mind/Hand Coordination

name: Humanitus
description:
In this "3rd Millennium World Challenge", players move around the board acquiring and adding population to geo-political territories. In addition to sets based on vicinity, players can gain benefit by collecting members of the same "offensive group", which are linked by ideology instead of geography. Players also have opportunities to challenge others for control of territories.

Score is determined by the amount of money in hand, less debts, plus a factor for the amount of population controlled. The player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: GROPOS: Narn Regime
description: For many decades the Narn people knew nothing but slavery under the yoke of the Centauri Republic. However, greed and complacency provided the Narn the opportunity they needed to win their freedom. Now, they defend their freedom using any measures they deem necessary. While one of the youngest of the star nations in the known galaxy, they quickly claimed their space and became a major force no one angered lightly. Includes new vehicles and infantry for the Narn Regime, orbital and air support data, new weapons systems, four sample companies, newly expanded background, and more!
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame

name: GROPOS: Minbari Federation
description: This manual provides all the background and other information any Minbari ground commander needs! The book focuses on two of the most famous Minbari clans, the Windswords, who prefer armor, and Star Riders, who are heavy on the infantry. Includes army lists for both clans, as well as a variety of new vehicles including the new Heavy Assault Tank - so big it's a platoon unto itself! New weapons such as the molecular pulse cannon and neutron laser are also provided. New units include the Falsin Self-Propelled Artillery, Fire Sprite Scout Transport, Shyriech Main Battle Tank, Talishan Heavy Infantry Transport, and Tal'Horcon Air Defense Artillery. If you want to find out what makes the advanced Minbari armies to be feared throughout known space, check out this book!
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame

name: GROPOS: Earth Alliance
description: This 48-page book includes all the rules, background and unit data you'll need to fight enormous ground operations with the Earth Alliance! New units include the Valkyrie Gunship VTOL, Frey MLRS, and elite Special Forces infantry! Also includes statistics for entire companies of units such as the 270th Armored Cavalry and 416th Mechanized Infantry! If you're ready to pound the ground as an Earth Alliance trooper, this is the book for you!
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame

name: Ganovenbande
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The police in Goldtown are looking for Iggi Inkognito and his crook gang! In Ganovenbande, you have to help chase the cunning crooks. Which eagle eye can count as fast as lightning the real crooks?

name: On a Mission!
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Booty hunters watch out! In On a Mission!, you'll see who has the quickest hand and can catch the fattest prey? But be warned: Not every catch will be worth the effort!

name: Open End
description:
Open End is a communication game about newspaper headlines. At the start of each round, a partial headline is given, and each player guesses in which newspaper category the headline belongs: literature, feuilleton, media, business, travel, science, panorama, politics or sport? After a consensus has been reached, the first points are awarded.

The players then continue with each of them writing an ending for the partial headline. One of the players, the reader, collects the sentences and reads them all aloud. The players then vote for their favourite sentences, which awards points to the creators of those sentences. More points will go to the most compelling answer than to the correct answer!

name: Sam
description:
Card game with 48 cards in four suits of 12. Cards are played with the aim to acheive a total divisible by 4.
The suits are;
S = Subtraction
A = Addition
M = Multiplication
SAM = any of the above
The last card played is all that affects the current card being played. For example; The first card played (which cannot score points) is a 3. The next player could play an A5 (A for Addition) he adds 5 to 3 to make 8. This is two 'Fours' made, score two points. The next player could play S4. 4 from 8 = 4, so one 'Four' created, scores 1 point. Next player plays a SAM 8. He scores 3 points for Additions (8 + 4 = 12, so 3 Fours made) but as it is a Sam card he can also score for Multiplication (4 x 8 = 32, so 8 points scored). In this example, Subtraction would score nothing. You can see that SAM cards are very valuable.
The first player to score 100 points, wins.
The rules refer to the cards as 'Blocks' and the intention was to make a more substantial version with the cards being replaced as tiles (called Blocks) but this never happened, possibly because The Great War started and materials were limited because of the war effort in industry.

name: 24 Game: Algebra/Exponents
description:
Players win points by being the first to correctly identify how the four numbers on the card can be manipulated using addition, subtraction, multiplication, and/or division to arrive at the number 24.

This edition includes numbers, equations, powers and roots on each card. Through a combination of these there is a goal to calculate number 24.

name: Vidi Kompaktspiel
description:
This is the travel version of VisualEyes.

This game is played with twelve special dice. Each side of the dice shows a picture of an object; all the dice are different. The dice a rolled, and the players get a set amount of time to come up with words that are formed by two dice. For example, if one die shows an ice cream cone and another die shows a mountain, those could be combined into ice + berg = iceberg.

The players receive one point for each answer that no-other player has come up with. Then, another round starts. The first player to reach 20 points wins the game.

name: Rosette Riding School
description:
Juvenile horse-riding themed dice-rolling game in two phases.

In part one, "Schooling Track", players throw a d6 to move around and collect (or lose) horseshoes.

In part two, "Cross Country Track", players use a die numbered 1,2,3 to move and attempt jumps. Horseshoe cards can be used to improve a die roll.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Critical Hit! - Volume 5, No. 1
description:
Volume 5, No. 1 of Critical Hit's ASL magazine. It contains articles, variant rules and new scenarios for Advanced Squad Leader.

The following articles are included:
- Preparing for Battle (a strategy article about setup)
- Kampfschweine Designer Notes (notes about scenario CH90)
- Platoon Leader 2.12 (latest version of the Platoon Leader Campaign Rules)
- Row well and Live (ASL River Assaults strategy article)
- Gammon Bombs (variant rules for this weapon)

The following 2-player scenarios are included:
CH90: KAMPFSCHWEINE; 25 April 1945; Brandenburg, Germany
CH91: LONG MINUTES; 23 May 1940; Selzaete, Belgium
CH92: PIONEER SPIRIT; 13 March 1943; Kharkov, Russia
CH93: THE PRUSSIAN WAY; 8 January 1942; Demyansk, Russia
CH94: THE ULLA CROSSING; 7 July 1941; On the banks of the Dvina River near Ulla, Russia
CH95: SHAMBLES; 19 August 1944; St Lambert Sur Dives, Normandy, France

Also, there is a new Platoon Leader Campaign Game:
PLFH: FROZEN HELL; 25 December 1939, Kelja, Finland

and a new Solitaire Mission:
DTW-1: RECON IN FORCE; 13 October 1942; Dzerhezinsky Tractor Works, Russia
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Simulation

name: Futbolider
description:
Futbolider tries to simulate a european football team president doing this with a mix of several games. It's a board game for two players or two teams. In Futbolider you have to:
Buy properties and build sport installation and stadiu.
Sign players in order to build your team.
Score goals winning football trivia quizzes.
Disqualify your opponent using red cards.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Simulation, Worker Placement

name: Das letzte Bankett: Comtessa
description:
Das letzte Bankett: Comtessa is a limited edition additional role for the party game Das letzte Bankett available from the publisher at Spiel 2011.

In the game, each player takes on the role of a guest at a banquet for the king, with each guest secretly part of one of two factions that want to bring about the king's demise. Will the king be opened with a dagger before the poison can do its work?

As with the other role cards, Comtessa has her skills printed on the back of the card.

name: Cosmic Odyssey
description:
Join the Exploration League of Humanity (ELH) for a thrilling exploration of the galaxy. Discover new planets, moons, and space stations as the most technologically advanced exploration carrier of the ELH, the Arcturus, travels from star system to star system.

Each planet the Arcturus travels to plays out as a round where only one card may be played per player. Earn exploration credits by contributing the most to exploring the planet or give yourself an edge by upgrading your starship with new weapons and systems. You can even become the ambassador to foreign space stations, helping you build even better starships to captain.

At the end of the game, the player with the most exploration credits wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Greyhound Race
description:
A dexterity race game.
Each player chooses a greyhound (made of lead) and positions it at one end of the table. Each greyhound is attached to a length of string. The players stand at the opposite end of the table, holding the string of their greyhound. At the word "Go", each player jiggles their string, in the hope of making their greyhound advance towards them. The first greyhound to reach the players, wins.

name: Die Schatzsucher
description:
Chili, Briegel and Bernd paddle from island to island looking for treasure. Whoever discovers the right paddle cards can push the raft to the desired island, and take away the plate there, under where he suspects the treasure chest is. Whoever knocks a piece over the raft can not find a treasure. Anyone who discovers a treasure chest can uncover all the tiles of the island, they are all coins, he gets them all. Anyone who discovers a bomb, loses all coins on the island of the pirates, if there is a sand nothing happens.
If all plates cleared away, the player with the most gold wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Pirates

name: Die 7 Weltwunder Quiz-Spiel
description: 32 cards show 2 questions with 3 answers each, on the backside information and illustrations on the subject are given. Players receive quest cards and betting cards for 3 and 4 players. The quiz master poses a question to his neighbour, in case of a correct answer also the second questions - if both are correct the candidate receives the card. If the first answer is wrong, the neighbour of the candidate can risk a betting card and try to answer. If he answers wrong, he loses the card. If nobody has cards left, the player with the most betting cards wins.

name: Unsere Erde Quiz-Spiel
description:
"Our Earth Quiz Game" in English

32 cards show 2 questions with three answers each, the back side shows information and illustration on the subject. Players have question cards and risk cards, the starting player chooses a card and the candidate on his left tries to answer the first question - if he is right, the second is asked. In case of two correct answers the candidate receives the card and puts it with his risk cards. If the first answer is wrong, the left neighbour of the candidate can take over by risking one of his risk cards - if he answers wrong he loses the card. At the end the player with the most cards wins.

name: Travel Wheel of Fortune
description:
Editions vary, but a familiar phrase or name is hidden on the gameboard. The number of words and the number of letters in each word along with the category of the puzzle is on the clue sheet chosen at random. The gameboard is marked thusly. Before guessing letter, a player must spin the eponymous Wheel of Fortune to determine how much each letter, if revealed, is worth to one’s account. Every spin is risk, however, because one could lose a turn or spin "Bankrupt" which means lose a turn and forfeit one’s earnings! Consonants only can be guessed after spinning the wheel; vowels can be guessed at a cost.

A player can continue taking one’s turn until a wrong guess is made and then the turn passes to the next player. Only the player who solves the word puzzle can keep the earnings made for that round. The player who has made the most money after a predetermined number of puzzles is the winner.

As the title of the game suggests, this version of the game is designed for portability and to be played without a gamemaster to verify responses. The players can check their own responses without revealing to much of the puzzles ahead of time.

The game is a faithful adaptation to the wildly popular television series.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Ecco i puffi !
description:
To run away from Gargamel and his cat, the smurfs left their village and escaped to the woods.
The players must find them in their six hideouts on the board, bringing them in couples back to the village inside a little caddy, moving it in the paths of the wood.
This with the help (or the tricks) found in the 20 "surprise cards", to be revealed when passing near Gargamel's castle.
The player who manages to finish first his mission, moving with the caddy the assigned couples to the village, will win the game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dinosaur Dash
description:
Using images from the Natural History Museum, Dinosaur Dash is a game where players evolve their dinosaur playing pieces. Your dinosaurs start in the Triassic Period and ultimately can reach the end in the Cretaceous Period while continually evolving.

The winner is player whose dinosaurs evolve the fastest. Along the evolutionary path you will answer questions about these creatures.

There is also simpler game for children as young as five, as well as the knowledge game for dinosaur lovers from the age of seven and up.

Includes:
- 1 x Game Board
- 4 x Dinosaur Playing Pieces
- 49 x Illustrated Question and Chance Cards
- 1 x Die
- Rules

name: Blanko Junior
description:
Aim of the game at this Junior version of the original word game is to collect most of the color pyramids.
Letter tile-laying game similar to Scrabble but with some additional features. Letters may be changed in words already laid and placing a word over a single "Blanko" square allows for bonus scoring by placing letter tiles on a card within one minute time limit. Covering two or three "Blanko" squares doubles or triples word score respectively. The plastic board-surround doubles as tile racks and scoreboard.

name: Kinder Wereld Reis
description:
With this game, children learn about geography, particularly topography. On the game board an illustrated map of the world is depicted. The continents are each in a different color, so they can be distinguished easily. The countries are easy to find by numbers and colors. At the edge of the board flags are shown.

The game contains 110 illustrated cards with questions (and answers) such as: Where do polar bears live? Where is the Eiffel Tower located? Background information, continents, countries and people pass by. Players have to respond the correct country, continent or ocean and have to designate them on the world map. By doing this correctly chips can be earned. The first player who has collected 8 chips wins the game.

The rules also describe a second way of playing. Here 24 random cards are put face up in the middle of the game board. The players take turns throwing a die and moving their pawn in accordance on the flags around the game board. They have to collect cards by selecting cards from the middle which are related to the country their pawn landed on. If no such a card is available, the player just has bad luck. Once a player reaches the last field, the player with the most cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Exploration, Travel, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: 1955: College Activist Promo Cards
description: This expansion/promotion for 1955 was given to the original Kickstarter supporter of the game (as well as attendees of game conventions). In consists in two College Activist cards that can be added to the game deck. One blue version helps influence the red countries, and one red version helps influence the blue countries. For each card the player reveals and discards from their hand, they gain one influence in that country.

name: Pippi Langstrumpf
description:
Objective: be the first to collect 7 nuggets

place map into box and put your meeples on starting position (cooking cove)
knot your 12 strings to circles and put them side by side on the floor (carpet recommended)
distribute all the 12 'furniture' cards on the floor (like seen on the map)
starting position: cooking stove
draw a card out of 48 - jumping position
do NOT touch the ground jumping from one to the other
successful ==> get 1 nugget
sometime you must jump carrying the monkey on your shoulder
you may choose for another jump (max. 3 jumps) but if you fail you are going to loose all of the nuggets collected during your turn
there are 2 different cards/levels regarding jumping difficulty/distance

content: map, monkey, 12 strings, 12 furniture cards, 4 meeples with 4 stand ups, 48 (jumping) cards, 30 nuggets
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Elfenkinder
description:
Objective:
be the first to let all of your 4 flowers (=cards) reflourish
- moving by turn -
all of the flowers fell asleep
each child tries to visit one of the elves
if this elf is matching with one of the 4 flower cards the kid started with, the card is going to be flipped (reflourish)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Sino Japanese chess
description:
This board game can be played on a 9x9 or 9x10 (8x9 on the vertices in the chinese fashion) with no alternating colors.
It contains features of chinese checkers, english checkers, and chess.It offers an enticing double in the bubble set of rules.
Double opportunity for long castling and short castling for the king,
Double opportunity for pawn promotion.
Double opportunity for simple straightforward reintroduction of captured pieces from the captured pieces bin as allies in japanese fashion.
Bishop has been newly enhanced as cited with never before movements.
A newly refurbished queen with never before seen movements due to enhancements.
A newly designed Hawk again with never before seen movements due to enhancements.
The presence of the Elephant from Jose Raul Capablanca.

The object of the game is to trap and check mate the enemy king.

name: Joey Ring Game
description: Hoop-la type game. You have to get your rings on to Joey the Clown, on his arm or his foot, to score maximum points. If you miss, but the ring lands on the board, you can score points but not as much when you 'ring' him..

name: Activity Superthema Urlaub & Sport
description:
Piatnik supplement provides for the lovers of this game an extension to the basic game, the topics are new, diverse, and in this case, they focus on the issue of Sport.
1320 new terms can be combined with each of the previously released games, which corresponds to the size of the compact edition.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Sports

name: Triple Labyrinth
description: A variant of Labyrinth that comes with different games made possible by three interchangeable boards. The first is the tradional Obstacle maze game The second and third feature the themes of Baseball and Golf respectively.

name: Activity Celebrations
description: A new version of the classic game, based on the rules of Activity Original 2 and with spezial rules according to the partnership with the sweets manufacturer Masterfood - some words must be described with a mouth full of chocolate. Chocolate is not included, but 5 invitation cards for a games evening! The words on the 200 cards come from the categories cinema and TV, trends and life style, fun and leisure and stars and starlets.

name: Vroom!
description:
Who will best overcome the traffic and get to the end of the road?
Vroom! The winner is the first player to get two motorbikes to the end of a high-density roadway. The result is unpredictable since other players can block your way or bump you onto another lane at any throw of dice! This game is not for the faint-hearted...Do you have the makings of a champion?

name: QuizDan
description:
Translation from the back of the box - from Norwegian:

Do you dare to double? Who will be the leader?

Play the success from NRK (Norwegian Public TV) in your livingroom! Just as when Dan Børge Akerø askes questions on NRK, there is more than just knowledge that counts - you also have to control the game. Exploit the team's combined expertise and pick the right leader. Choose whether you want to change question or double the bet. Are you on the best quiz team in the room?

For the friends or the whole family: Two or three teams are asked fascinating questions in general knowledge. They get cryptic hints on what each question is about, and have to choose how hard they want to bet on how well the team knows the theme. Occasionally the questions will - to laughter and surprise - be about something completly different than what the players expect.

Quiz for everybody: The board game is ingeniously created, which makes the expert quizzer and the more normally knowledgeable may compete at the same level; as team mates or as opponents.

name: Chemistry: An Atom Building Game
description:
What is Chemistry: An Atom Building Game?
Students compete to create the largest atom using their knowledge of chemistry in this exciting deck building game. Each player starts out with a hydrogen atom and must answer a question based on chemistry to gain quarks. The quarks are converted into one of three subatomic particles. Players can use various discoveries in chemistry (i.e. Chemistry cards) to enhance their turn to gain more quarks.

The game is designed for chemistry students and it is a fun and nontraditional way to review for tests. So, if you want to be ready for your next chemistry test, play Chemistry: An Atom Building Game.

name: Europa Cup
description:
Action football game. The pitch and players are tinplate. The football players have their own indent, into which the ball will naturally settle. When it does, you can slide the player back, to get the football to come round to the fron of the player. Now you can use the player to kick the ball with the intention of either passing the ball to another player or to have a shot at the opposition goal.

The most goals scored, wins the game

name: Tangram Fury
description:
Taken from the the game's official web site:

“Tangram Fury” is a competitive and amazingly addictive table-top game based on the ancient Chinese puzzle known as a “tangram.” Players attempt to be the first to recreate images using the seven pieces of a standard tangram puzzle. Fun for everyone! Tangram Fury can be played individually, or in teams, with as few as two players.

Players compete against each other to be the first to build tangram puzzles shown on cards. The first player done, wins the card. The first player to earn five cards, wins the game.

Tangram Fury has two levels of play: “Fan” and “Expert”. The Fan level is easier, because the shapes on the cards have borders that show how each of the seven tangram pieces fit together to form the shape. The Expert level only shows a silhouette of the shape and players must figure out which pieces go where.

The game includes four categories of tangram images: people, animals, fish & birds, and objects & shapes. Each category is represented by colored cards. Rolling a multi-colored die determines the categories.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: Pawn Stars Payout Game
description: Pawn Stars Board Game Pay Out is based on the hit History Channel Show Pawn Stars. As in the television show it is the player's goal to get the best deal for the items coming into the shop. Each turn four items come into the shop and are placed on the playing board. Players roll the three game dice and combine the showing dollar amounts to see who can estimate the actual value of the item. The person coming closest wins the item that round. However, if the player over-estimated the actual item value they take a profit loss and log the item as trash on their score sheet. If the player winning the item that round under-estimated the item they make a profit and the item is scored as a treasure on the score sheet. At the end of the day, profits and losses are totaled up and the player with the largest profit is the winner.

name: Nouns in a Bag
description:
A party game where teams take turns trying to guess nouns or phrases being described in increasingly limited fashion by a teammate.

At the beginning of the game each player writes five nouns or phrases on a slip of paper, which are all then shuffled into a bag. Players are divided into two teams, and one team is chosen to start. It is recommended the starting team alternate between rounds to reduce the starting advantage.

The first round is timed for 1 minute. The active team chooses someone to draw nouns from the bag, while the rest of the team tries to guess the noun. During this round the active player may say anything they like, as long as they do not say the words on the paper. Each correct guess is worth a point. Then, with all the drawn papers left out of the bag, the second team does the same.

The second round is timed for 2 minutes, and is played as the first round, except instead of speaking the active player may only perform charades.

The third round is timed for 1 minute, and is identical to the previous two except now the active player may only say one word.

name: Numé Cat's
description:
Each player has a stack of green cards face down in front of him. The 18 yellow cards with the numbers are placed in the center of the table.

In his turn player turns a card face-up and reads an enigma.
The other players must hit as fast as possible on the number they think is the right answer. The fastest receives the "enigma" card.

When all the "enigma" cards have been given, each player counts the number of cards he has won. The winner is the one with the most cards.

There are 340 simple mathematical problems, divided into 3 categories : "French language and numbers", "Mathematical language" and "Operations".
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Educational, Math, Word Game

name: Shenke
description:
A playful novel game that will allow you to shape your strategies in humor and friendliness. You will find Asian natural elements: Wood, Fire, Earth, Metal, Water and Air. All these elements are connected through two cycles ancestral "Shen" (lead) and "Ke" (control). The game levels are represented by belt color (yellow, orange, green, blue and red): Everyone, beginner or advanced player, can participate.

Players tell the story with playing cards and must react and interupt for other players' stories. The goal is to be the first to play all your cards on the table
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Humor, Memory

name: Ein Wochenende in Berlin
description:
The game board shows a map of Berlin. Players roll a die and move through the city, trying to reach the famous sites (especially those two whose cards they drew at the beginning and which are marked). Additionally, taxis, buses and the tube can be used to get around more quickly, but they have to be paid for in travel chips. When a player reaches a site, s/he is asked a question. If answering correctly, the site card can be discarded and a new travel chip is drawn. When reaching an unmarked site, they can earn a new site card (if that belongs to someone else, it can be "stolen").
When a player can reach both sites they drew at the beginning and gain two more site cards and return to their starting location, s/he wins the game.

Each card has two questions, one about German, one a trivia question, so language learners can play it with non-language learners as well.

name: The Whirlpool Game
description:
Each player uses 6 men, but puts only one on the board at a time. He moves each turn as far as spun with the arrow, doing as directed on the spaces at which he stops. As soon as this man is drawn into the whirlpool, or center, it is lost and another is started.

The player holding out the longest wins.

name: Bescherelle le Jeu
description:
The game of Bescherelle is a game designed for fun around the traps and conjugations of the French language.

TO goal is to conjugate a verb or answer a question in French.
Players may get magical potions to transform into superheroes and defence against attacks from your opponents!

Award-winning and recommended by the Ministry of Culture and Communication of France.

name: Party Medley
description:
Party game. There are card slips (like tickets in size). One slip will have a word on it. Its matching slip will have another word but related to the first slip word. For example, a first-half slip might have the word 'Buckingham' and its other half would be the word 'Palace'.

The second half slips are placed around the house. Each player is given a first half slip with the word that will match one of the slips around the house. At the word "Go", the players set off to look for their match. If a player thinks he has found it, he takes both slips back to the host and, if correct, earns one point. Then he is given another slip to solve. After the host calls time, the player with the most points, wins.

name: Komm wir spielen Bauernhof
description:
From the publishers description: Who wouldnt own a really nice farm. With cow and horse, tractor, house and barn etc. Everyone can win these in this game. Guessing and luck with the dice will lead to victory. Who first gets a farm by dice rolls wins.

It is a roll and move game. Twelve cards for each player are shuffled and put on the board. Clockwise the players roll and move their pawns according the die roll. Sometimes they get to take a card, sometimes they must get rid of a card, and sometimes they challenge the other player. Challenging means putting the die in one hand and then the player guesses which hand. Correct guesses give the player a card, false guesses make him lose a card. The first player to have 7 (out of 12 per player) cards has a full farm and wins.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Geo le Jeu
description:
You need to get photos of the world to accomplish a story by answering questions.

Early in the game each player chooses a mission. Each mission is complete once player has recovered 5 photos matching the mission: 5 pictures of animals (one for each continent).

Each player moves his pawn on a game board representing the world by throwing two dice.

Next the box where it happens, he wins, loses or steals a photoby answering a question. If the answer just that question, you win the number of shots on the box (between one and three).

To win the game player must get 5 pictures related to his mission and finish her world tour.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Three Musketeers: The Queen's Pendants – Elite Guards expansion
description: A mini expansion for the "The Three Musketeers: The Queen's Pendants" board game. Consists of a sheet of rules and 2 black plastic guard figures. These "elite" guards are added to the Cardinal players reserve and are like the regular guards except for the fact that they have a higher chance of hitting and are removed from play if eliminated.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Novel-based, Renaissance
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Discover the Aliens
description:
Game play:
Each player takes a playing board, feature detector, and marker, then draws a feature card. Only aliens showing this feature live on the player's planet. Each player tries to find out the feature card that the other player drew.

On their turn, a player draws a face-down alien card and asks the other player if that alien lives on that player's planet. If the player says yes, the alien is placed on the first player's planet, if not, it is placed on the outer space area.
