The first player then crosses off any features that they can rule out on their feature detector, and it is the next player's turn.

Instead of their turn, a player can also guess the other player's secret feature. If they are right, they get a planet card and the round ends; if they are wrong, they lose a turn. At the end of a round, players wipe clean their feature detectors, shuffle the alien and feature cards, draw new feature cards and start another round.

The winner is the player who wins their fifth planet card.

In the advanced rules, two feature cards are drawn, and only aliens showing both features live on that planet, and the game finishes after one round.

name: Les mystères du cacao
description:
The game is a journey on a world map that indicates the important places in the production of Cocoa.

In his turn player roll the dice, move around the board and will be asked questions about Cocoa!

The first player to collect enough bean-cards for correct answers is the game.

name: Out of 'Sight' Football
description:
A strategic American football action game with hidden movable defenders and a fold-out stadium. Gameboard inserts are available for conversion to Basketball, Soccer, & Ice Hockey.

Before each play, the Defensive player (D) secretly sets his Linebackers -- 3 blue INDEPENDENTLY MOVABLE static-cling dots -- on a hinged, clear plastic, overlay. He then swings the overlay against side of stadium and hides the Linebackers with a large black card.

The Offensive player then studies the tacklers printed on the field, HIDES HIS EYES WITH HIS PLAYBOOK, and either marks a line on the field with an erasable pen on a run, or lifts the pen and tries to land on a pass receiver (and then runs from there). D tells him when he runs into a tackler, and then both players look at the field while D flips the overlay onto the field to see if a Linebacker tackled him sooner, caused a fumble, or batted down/intercepted a pass.

From the website:
"With an erasable pen and your EYES COVERED by a Playbook, how well can you evade tacklers, pass to receivers, or execute kicking plays? That’s the challenge of Out of Sight Football! But beware your opponent’s hidden Linebackers! They can Stuff Runs, Intercept Passes, Cause Fumbles, or Blitz when you least expect it! Includes Kickoffs, Punts, Field Goals, Sacks, Safeties, Blocked Kicks, Fake Kicks, Laterals, Run Blocking, Injuries, Clock Management, Slo-Mo Replays, and a Playbook with fifteen offensive plays plus variations (left, right, middle) for OVER 40 total play choices."

A great way to learn American football.

name: A Copa da Árvore
description:
Plant fruits and flowers, grow your tree with branches and roots and build the most complete forest!

Players start with just one trunk and should grown it and/or create more trees. Manage your hand and buy the cards available to choose between a tree filled with fruits or a tree with flowers.

The more you collect of one kind of fruit, the more you are rewarded, but beware, some branches have a bird nest or a snake! Birds fly around the trees, attacking and eating their fruits, unless the tree is protected by a snake.

The "Crown of the Tree" is a fun strategy game for children and adults. Includes a card with a real seed to plant.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Comtricks
description:
Comtricks is a 2 player only combinatorial (no luck, perfect information) trick-taking card game. In the game, players play and win (or lose tricks), and then draft cards for their hands from a 4 by 4 grid of cards, with a card being taken freeing up another card. Players score a point for each trick won, and win the game by being the first to reach a target score.

Besides what is described above, the game also has cards which will lose a trick if led, but will win a trick if it follows what was led.

The game is playable with a standard deck of playing cards and two jokers.

name: Buck Jitters
description: The card game Buck Jitters comes a deer hunting theme, yet is quite abstract in nature. Each card has two numeric values and they are compared with the opponent's card played, with the higher number winning and the lower number adding to the victor's point total. The game includes wild cards and trump cards to adjust the card values. There are many scenarios included with partnership play available as well. It is played in rounds and there is bidding involved, providing a Bridge like format.

name: Conjudingo
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Conjudingo includes three easy, fun games to help students from Grade 1 to Grade 4 work on the present, future and past tenses of French verbs. The various animals on the cards will help you check if you have found the correct combination.

name: Adventure 2: Slaves Of Zargon (fan expansion for HeroQuest)
description:
In this second exciting adverture, you and your friends as new Heroes stumble upon a mystery when you rescue a little girl and unite her with her family. Zargon's monsters are kidnapping people. In a brazen attack upon a small town the Monsters have taken Baron Redhand back across their borders. His wife asks for your help and you travel after the Orc army.
Can you and your friends survive long enough to solve the mystery of the swamp, The mystery of the missing people, will you be able to save Baron Redhand from Zargon's evil spells. Your adventure awaits...
This adventure is available in a pdf file for you to down load for free, they are made so that you can put the books together and make your new giant pit trap tile. This adventure is available at "Dragonkingdoms.co.uk" and also at yahoo groups web site "Hero Quest Boardgame" you do need to join the group to access the files for downloading. In the photos section of the site you can read all the adventures in this series to see if this is a game that you would want to play. We hope that this game will give you and your friends a lot of fun.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fantasy, Miniatures

name: Bumbling Boxing
description:
From the box "When you open the case there's a Boxing Ring right there. Wind up your player, position his arms, and let the boxing match begin. See who can land a knockout or which boxer goes down for the count first."

This is a neat little wind up game similar in style to the strollin bowlin also made by tomy however this game actually has different strategies that can be used by position the boxers arms in different positions before you wind them up for the match. it comes in a little plastic fold up case which is also very cleverly designed to open up into the boxing ring.

name: To Cry a Joust
description:
The hoof beats thunder. The crowd roars. Two knights' lances leveled, charge towards each other. Easy to learn and easy to play. You will be charging down your opponent in no time. D6 mechanics handle movement and combat.

You basically attempt to pick one of 3 cards to get a rock, paper, scissors +1 advantage over your opponent and another +1 or +2 impact advantage if you manage down most of the tilt before your opponent.

You can play one on one contests, or organize tournaments with any number of players. Paper figures and field are included to get you started quickly.

name: Adventure 4: In The King's Service (fan expansion for HeroQuest)
description:
In this adventure we created cards for the Mountain Orcs and the Iron Skeletons. These new Monsters were so much fun to have in the other adventures that we decided to expand the monster's world. At the time we didn't want to add new monster figures, we wanted to create new monsters that could still use the same figures. so we created the Hobgoblin, the Ghoul and the Uraki Orc from Lord of the Ring. Another thing that we created was more weapons for the armory and the ability to buy more potions. we took the potions from the treasure cards, the expansions series and a few that we ourselves created, we gave them all a price. and created a new store.
This is my favorite story. I hope that you will enjoy playing it as much as we did creating it. Have fun.
These games' pdf files are available for downloading. They are made in a way that will allow you to make the books and cards. The pages are available at "Dragonkingdoms.co.uk" and yahoo's group site "Hero Quest Game board" for free. You do need to join the group to access the file's section where they are stored. The photo section of this site will allow you to read the story and look at the maps to see if this game is something you would like to play.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Fantasy, Miniatures

name: Diva!
description:
Players take on the role of an emerging opera star, gaining education and training to get jobs and roles in hopes of becoming the next opera superstar!

Education and training are gained through drafting cards from the standard deck and putting these cards in play by "purchasing" them out of your hand. Job and Role cards are won at the end of each round as players qualify for and bid on the face up Opportunity cards.

The object of the game is to be the Diva with the most stars at the end of the game. Stars are earned by collecting Role cards and drawing Special cards.

name: Gunfighters & Trailblazers
description:
Travel the Old West of Jim Bridger, Wyatt Earp, Wild Bill Hickok, Calamity Jane, George Custer and Geronimo. Discover the answer to over 2000 questions in this fun-filled exciting adventure in Old West Historical Trivia.

The object of the game is to mover across the board on one of the three trails into the West by correctly answering the questions and arriving safely at your destination. You may choose The Oregon Trail, the Stagecoach Trail to the California gold fields or the Cattle Trail from Texas to Montana. This game can be played by individuals or teams. You may have as many on a team as you like. More than one team or individual may travel on the same trail.

name: Hütchen-Roulette
description: On a game gimmick with home bases for each player and flipper arms each player tries to be the first to get one one’s cones back into the home base. One player lets the ball rolling along the outer rim and thus moves the flipper arm. This arm shows how many spaces the player must pass with one of his cones. If the move ends on a flipper space the cone may end in the well at the next move of the flipper arm. If one ends on another cone, this is sent back to the home base.

name: Trivia Puzzle
description:
Trivia Puzzle is a trivia game in which players select 1 of 6 puzzles of equal size (# pieces per puzzle) and race to be the first to complete their puzzle. Players obtain pieces of their puzzle by correctly answering a question from a trivia card during their turn. During a player's turn, another player pulls a trivia card from the box and reads the category out loud. The active player then decides a factor of difficulty (1,2,3,4 or 5...1 being the easiest and 5 the most difficult) for the question as there are 5 questions per card for the topic. If the player answer the question correctly, they randomly pull that number of puzzle pieces (1-5) from their puzzle box and begin building their puzzle, at which time their turn ends. Turn passes to the next player for incorrect guesses.

Note: there are over 3,000 question and 20 categories to choose from (Science, Math, Sports, Media, Famous People, Firsts & Mosts, Games, Animals, Movies, Places, Literature, World Events, General Trivia).

name: Disney Club Penguin Card Game Fast Flippers!
description:
One of Club Penguin's first card games to play with your friends in real life. In this game you use Disney's Club Penguin characters and locations to find matches.

6 island cards are placed on the play surface face up and one see through penguin card is placed face up on each island. Each player takes a turn to flip a character card (which shows a penguin on an island) from their draw pile and put it on a common pile. All players then try to find matches with the penguins on the island cards. The first person to spot the match calls it out and collects the common pile (and add the cards to the bottom of their draw pile) and the island/see through penguin cards are removed from play.

Description from the box: "Are your flippers fast enough to catch the most Penguins! Lay down the unique see-thru Penguin character cards on the Background Island cards, then use your "fast flippers" to pick-up as many Club Penguin cards as possible!"
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: A Cartomante
description:
“A Cartomante” é um jogo voltado especialmente para o público juvenil (a partir dos 14 anos), entretanto passível de ser apreciado por outras faixas etárias por se tratar de um produto que pode ser interpretado em diversas camadas. Suas ilustrações e sua identidade visual remetem ao período que ficou conhecido como belle époque dado o fato de que o conto escrito por Machado de Assis está ambientado no final do século XIX. Os cards de maior destaque no jogo estão diretamente ligados aos arcanos maiores do Tarot de Marsella, o mais tradicional oráculo de divinação trazido para os tempos atuais e também presente no conto em questão. As figuras e personagens do conto estão representadas arquetipicamente pelo significado destes arcanos nas imagens ilustradas.

Nesse jogo você tem que proteger os seus Nobres dos ataques adversários. Para isso você tem Barreiras, Artefatos, Aliados e outros tipos de cartas.

No final o jogador que tiver mais Nobres em sua área é o vencedor.


"The Fortune Teller" is a game geared especially for teenagers (from age 14 years), however that can be enjoyed by other age groups because it is a product that can be interpreted in several layers. His illustrations and visual identity refer to the period that became known as the "belle epoque" given the fact that the short story by Machado de Assis is set in the late XIX century. The most prominent cards in the game are directly linked to the major arcana of Marseille's Tarot, the most traditional oracle of divination brought to the current times and also present the story in question. The figures in the story and characters are represented by the meaning of these archetypal images illustrated in arcane.

In these game you must protect your Nobles against the other players cards. To do that you can use Barriers, Artifacts, Allies and ohter types of cards.

At the end, the player with most Nobles at your playing area is the winner.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Monkey Business
description:
Welcome to Monkey Business, the game of product development! You are the CEO of a small, but growing corporation. The goal of the game is to reach a certain number of bananas (money in the game) and a certain number of completed products in play, both based on the number of players in the game.

You have three types of workers (cogs in the great corporate wheel) to help you reach your goal: Engineering Monkeys, Marketing Monkeys, and Operations Monkeys. Each product in play requires an Operations Monkey to manage it. Engineers are allocated to products each turn to advance development. You collect bananas every turn for finished products in play. On a product's initial release, it gets a push from the marketing department, increasing sales on that turn, so the more Marketing Monkeys you have, the higher your initial sales. Meanwhile, your opponents are hiring their own monkeys and developing products at break-neck speeds. Using action cards and VPs will help you gain an advantage over them (allowing you to crush them mercilessly, in fact). Good luck creating your corporate empire!

name: Scrum
description:
Scrum is a pure abstract board game that roughly remind Rugby.

Each player has a number of pieces that remain for the whole game (there is no capture). In addition, a special piece, the ball, is present on the board.

The goal is to bring the ball to the last row. Typically each player move consists of 2 player pieces movement. However, in special occasions, when the ball is surrounded by player pieces so that there only one exit cell, the player is only allowed one movement which consists of pushing the ball to this exit.

Even if the rules are very simple (one minute is generally enough to understand how to play), it is tactically and strategically deep.

Online Play


Jocly (turn-based, live play or play against the computer)

name: Panzer Battles
description:
From the companies website: www.panzerbattles.com

Panzer Battles (ages 10+) is a card game based on World War II armor combat in a fast and fun system for 2-8 players. All players start the game with five cards form the tank deck (their active tank units) and five cards from the action deck. If you ever happen to run out of tanks, it is game over.

Winning the Game

The goal of the game is to destroy all enemy tanks and artillery before they destroy you! the players decide what the total score will be for victory (typically 150 points). This may result in playing multiple rounds until someone achieves the agreed points to win the game.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Wargame, World War II

name: Boxing For Gold
description: Statistical boxing game especially designed for the Finals at the Seoul Olympics in 1988. The designer felt that there was a need for a quick version of his Championship Boxing game. It plays the same but has less detail. Each boxer is rated in various skills with dice and charts deciding the outcome.

name: Pixel Patch: The Real Life RPG
description:
Ever want your playing cards to be used for something more than a poker hand? Ever want to turn those hearts into healing items and those clubs into cash? We’ll, now you can.

Pixel Patch: The Real Life RPG is a 2-6 player card game that turn a standard deck of 52 cards into a a fun 8-bit RPG-influenced battle system. Players will try to work their way past their opponent’s defense through the cards they draft and grow more powerful through the games they play.

Every round, you will choose cards to decide whether to attack, defend, heal or gain influence for special abilities. You and your opponent will then decide whether to perform your action in an aggressive or defensive fashion and then draw a varying number of cards to determine your success.

This entire game can be played with just a deck of cards and a pad of paper if necessary, but player aids and guide books are also provided in the downloadable PDF.

The game ends when a player’s health reaches 0. At this point, experience points are handed out, which allow you to level up, boosting your original stats from your entrance exam and making your card drafts more powerful. All these stats are recorded on the printable booklets that come with the game.

This game is a great head to head challenge as you work to figure out what your opponent will do next and of course is immensely repayable as you work to unlock and master 11 unique classes.

Players can also boost their stats by purchasing RPG Patches from our website (listed in the links section); each one of these patches gives a different permanent stat boost to your character, without breaking the game.
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Print & Play, Real-time
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Hegemony
description:
Form a gang and fight for dominance over the city. Seize the most valuable districts, search the ruins to gather the precious gambles, make use of your units' special abilities, which are straight from Neuroshima RPG.

Neuroshima Tactics is a miniature wargame in which the players - using 28mm figures - clash among the ruins of the Goddam United States. Each player commands a force comprising of 5 to 12 models in an attempt to achieve certain goals in the allotted amount of time. The game is set in the world of Neuroshima.

Hegemony is a group of vagabonds led by more or less charismatic boss. This set contains 5 miniatures, tokens, cards and terrain elements.

name: Buteo
description:
A magnetic dexterity game for children.

Theme: The common buzzards are very excited: Soon their young are going to hatch and the parents will be busy feeding them. Who'll manage to raise their young first?

How it is played: The board shows 12 nests. The players start in the first nest and try to reach the last nest as fast as possible. Movement is determined via 7 action tokens. These are placed in a circle in the middle of the board. Only three of them are placed face up at any time. The tokens show 1-3 mice (= move the corresponding number of spaces), a fleeing mouse (= player does not move his/her bird this turn), a cat (= player turns over the three face-up tokens and shuffles them with the others, then three new tokens are placed face up), a buzzard (= player doesn't move his/her bird but gains an additional turn), or two birds with an arrow (= player exchanges position with the leading player).
Which of the three face-up action tokens affects the active player is determined as follows: At one end of the board, there is a wooden peg. On this peg sits Buteo, a wooden buzzard figure. Over the board, there is a wooden scaffold, from which hangs a cord with a wooden ball attached at the end. The active player tries to hit Buteo by swinging the wooden ball towards him. If he/she is successful, Buteo attaches to the ball with the help of magnets. Then he flies a round (because the cord keeps swinging), until he finally stops over one of the tokens (which are also magnetic). Then the action specified by that token takes place, the token is turned face down, a new token is turned face up and then it is the next player's turn. The player who reaches the final nest first wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Memory, Racing

name: Die drei ??? Kids: Im Reich der Rätsel
description:
Objective: be the first gaining three cards => winning 3 games
- acting simultaneously -
each game requires a game master, who draws a (hidden) card with 3 (out of 7 possible) suspects first;
further cards are drawn with 3 images each; after the game master has valuated (0, 1 or 2 hits) the card is placed upon the table & next card is drawn; as soon as a player knows the correct combination card is won; if guess was wrong player is out of game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery

name: The Best of Butler
description:
The Best of Butler is a real estate game unique to Butler County, Pennsylvania. Players buy properties representing local businesses or institutions from which they collect rent from game opponents. A player may expand their property by adding Investments to collect higher rents or resell the properties at a profit.

The object of the game is to become the wealthiest player and retire all other opponents from the game.

The Best of Bulter was a fund-raising project produced by friends and members of the Association for Retarded Citizens of Butler County. The proceeds enables the association to pay off the state required elevator that was installed at the workshop. This list price on the box top was $9.50 (including tax).

name: Combat 3001 (or A Fist Full of Credits): A Combat 3000 Supplement
description:
Combat 3001 (or A Fist Full of Credits) is a rules supplment for the SF wargames rules; Combat 3000: Infantry Combat in the Year 3000.

It adds the following rules to Combat 3000.

Advanced Rules on;
Weapon Profiles
Close Combat
Movement
Visibility - Awareness
Fire Modes
Gravity
Close Combat Training
Vehicles

New Lists on;
Creatures
More Weapons
Equipment



Additional Credits;
Richard Prieastly, Anthony Epworth, Steve Tiffin, Paul Elsey, Pete Harris, Gavin Denton, Andy Szazepankiewicz (Pank), Martin Parker (Perce), Andrew Phillips and Simon Elliot.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Magic Feather
description:
Game description from the publisher:

In Magic Feather, you play as one of eight neighborhood animals and move around a magical neighborhood by doing things like pretending to be a cat that swims, telling a story about your breakfast, or making another player laugh without talking – but you'll have to stay one step ahead of those pesky Crows to win!

name: Suomi-Rally
description:
A car racing game through Finland for 2 to 6 players. Players start the race from Helsinki and must visit Rovaniemi, before heading back to Helsinki.

Each player chooses a route order card he must obey, when driving from control point to another control point. The game includes also chance cards for unexpected events that may slow down or advance his race. When a player gets back to Helsinki, he must drive additional acceleration and brake test before the race is over for him.

A player with least penalty points is a winner of the Suomi-Rally.

name: Memo Extra: Slide & find
description:
There are 16 memory tiles and 15 slide-tiles in this game.
In start shuffle tiles separately and lay slide-tiles on the table. Then draw a top memory tile and roll the dice. Dice shows how many times You may swap the slide-tiles to find the picture of the memory tile. If You are successful You get the card as a point You may continue Your turn.

If memory-tile deck is exhausted the game is over and the player with the most cards wins.

name: The Little Game of Good Manners
description:
This trivia/party game can be played in two teams or with at least two players. The topic is "good manners".

The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible, by answering questions about good manners and performing tasks from the activity cards. Each card is worth 1 point. The game is over when the first player reaches the goal box. The player who has won the most cards/points is the winner.

Activity cards come in two types: "Picture Memo" and "Confusing Letters". "Picture Memo" means the active player has to memorize the picture on the card. After 30 seconds, the player on the left makes up a question about the picture, which the active player has to answer. In the "Confusing Letters" activity, there are three words on the card, with their letters jumbled. The active player has to guess the words while the timer is running.
categories: Memory, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: I Spy Quest
description:
The game is set up by inserting one of the two double sided game boards into the frame in 1 of possible 4 orientations (=16 possible configurations). Pictures will be visible through holes in the top of the frame. However, when the game begins, each of these holes is covered by a pawn.

Players take turns pulling off two pawns in an effort to find a match. Matching pictures do not match exactly in I Spy games. For example, a match might be two similar airplanes that are different colors. Or it might be an elephant toy photographed from 2 different angles.

If a match is made, the player keeps the pawns and takes another turn. If not match is made, the player puts the pawns back and the next player gets their turn.

Once all matches are revealed, the player with the most pawns wins.

There is also a set of short riddles to answer after the game for each of the 16 board configurations.

Contents: Game tray, 2 double-sided picture boards (16 game variations), reveal sheet with 16 riddles, 36 pawns

name: Where's that Chipmunk?
description:
One player hides the stuffed chipmunk and then selects one or more picture clue tiles, at least one of which should give a hint as to the animal's location. Players then seek out the chipmunk, with the finder earning the right to hide him the next time.

From the publisher:

Hide him INSIDE or OUT! Clue cards point the way. Can you find the chipmunk? Three ways to play! Each time you find him, an acorn you'll earn. First player to get three will win, and all will learn!
No reading required!
3 ways to play! Includes Rules for Beginner, Advanced & Team Play!

name: Junior Nilpferd-Party
description:
This is the children's version of the party game Roller Coaster Hippo.

The aim of the game is to collect hippo chits worth 44 points. To earn these, players have to complete challenges. What type of challenge a player has to complete is decided by die rolls and what space on the board the player's piece lands on. Challenges come in the following forms: pantomime and drawing (active player and player who guessed correctly both get a random hippo chit with values from 2-5), (un)true stories (a story is read from the card, active player has to guess if it's true), party games (various challenges), and bigger/smaller (cards with values from 1-9 are placed in a row, player has to guess if the value on a card is higher or lower than that of the previous card).

The first player to collect 44 points wins the game.

name: Munchkin Get More Loot! Promotional Postcard
description:
This item is a postcard sent (or given) to retailers by the publisher.
It has a special rule for all Munchkin games. If you possess a Get More Loot! postcard with a canceled stamp, and the current date is within one month of the postmark, then you can begin the game at level 2.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor

name: Homestead
description:
Homestead is a game of old west dueling with an added element of unit purchase. There are two different boards each with similar yet unique game-play. Side one is a town where each player is trying to either reach the other players 'overran' space or trying to kill off the other player. The game continues in a reverse tog-of-war pushing one another's units back and forth.

Side two of the board is a desert area with an open field, this side the only way to win is by killing the other players main player token. There are many more options to strategy than on the town side.

name: Lost Reich
description:
From the publisher's site:

LOST REICH is a downloadable PDF game set in an alternate history, where the Nazis fled to Antarctica at the end of WWII and secretly began rebuilding their armies, patiently waiting for the day their Reich would rise again. Taking place in the near future, armies of Allied and Axis walking mechs battle for territory and resources across the world. This starter set includes two complete 15mm mech armies (average mech height is slightly under to 4″), Allied and Axis, plus 3D terrain, 2D tiles, all necessary game accessories (except 6- sided dice) and a color rulebook. With a downloadable PDF game, once you purchase the initial product, you will have an unlimited supply of gaming miniatures and terrain, and all are customizable with either camouflage options or tactical marking variations to allow you the flexibility to create unique game pieces.
categories: Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Gute Fahrt
description:
The game about Good Driving, made in East Germany in 1960. The box image shows various vehicles but the car was fiction. The Trabant owning citizen could only aspire for such a car, a wish he knew would never be fulfilled.

The board shows a road network with dials at both ends. Each player starts in a different corner and the objective is to get back to the same corner first after having visited the petrol station. Cars move by the throw of a die. The rules of the road must be respected. When you move you may move left or right but you must keep on the right side of the road.

When you approach a crossroads you must turn the appropriate dial one 'space' to the left or right. The new sign or traffic light now in front of you must be obeyed.

name: Sonix Junior Tiere
description:
36 cards with 18 animals and one Audio CD in this Junior version.
The games of Sonix series are specifically designed to promote the following skills in your child: perception, discernment, acoustic memory, logic, observation and language skills.

Before the game must be activated the random play function on the CD player to listen to each round a new track.
Some games are old familiar games like Memory and Lotto game.
Some games are new. Players listen to CD and must be the first to find the pair with the correct animals.
Player with the most pairs at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Ab durch den Dschungel
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Did something just crack under your feet? In Ab durch den Dschungel, brave treasure hunters must find their way through the jungle, following tortuous paths, balancing on a log over a raging river, protecting themselves from pesky mosquitoes, and keeping an eye out for poisonous snakes.

In the end, though, these adventurers might find themselves a big sparkling treasure if they dive into the world of treasure hunters and guide themselves through the many different tasks that await them in the jungle...

name: Kavelspel
description:
Kavelspel is a four player game. Each player has 9 tiles of the same colour. At the beginning of the game the tiles are placed on squares of corresponding colour: f.i. blue tiles on blue squares. Each group of 9 squares (in the corners) is rimmed by a line in one of the four colours, blue, green, red or yellow.
The object of the game is to move the tiles to the corner rimmed by the colour corresponding with the colour of the players tiles.
In each move the players may move one of their tiles a number of squares (1 or more) in a horizontal or vertical direction.
From the moment a player has reached the target square with one of his tiles, he is allowed to remove one of the tiles of the opponents from his target area, thus making room for his own tiles.
When a target area is filled with eight of the required tiles of the same colour, there is one square unoccupied. The only one that may fill that square at this stage of the game is the player that needs to complete the number of nine tiles in the target area. That would be his final move. However he is only allowed to move that final piece one square per turn.

name: Kink
description:
from the designer's website:

The new game is called Kink. The idea is simple: it's a basic N-in-a-row game where the row is allowed to have a single bend in it. Put another way, the row can change direction once, anywhere along it's length. The angle of the bend formed can be right, or obtuse, but not acute.

The introduction of a Kink has two effects which I believe will make the game richer and more strategic (consistent with my experience of the first few plays):

1. The number of degrees of freedom in the winning pattern is much higher for Kink than for the equivalent standard N-in-a-row game.
2. The number of stones in a row required for winning must be larger.

To write the rule set, I modified the rules to Connect 6, which is to my mind the most canonical (and one of the best) N-in-a-row games.

Kink is a game for 2 players, played with a Go set.

1. The board begins empty. One player owns the black stones and the other owns the white.
2. To begin, Black places a single stone on any empty space.
3. From then on, starting with White, each player places 2 stones per turn.
4. The first player to form a row of 9-in-a-row wins. The row may have up to one Kink in it, which may form a right or obtuse angle (but not an acute angle). Rows may run both orthogonally and diagonally.

Note: I don't yet know if 9 is the right number. If it's not 9, it's probably 8. Play with it and report back here with insight.

name: Card City: Promo Tile
description:
This card is a bonus card given away at Spiel 2012.

It is a very easy card but gives the game a lot. This shopping center gives you 5 money every turn if it connects with a P (Parking) + I (Industry) + R (Residence).
categories: Card Game, City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: 6th player expansion (fan expansion for Constantinopolis)
description:
With this expansion is introduced into the play a new role, "MAGISTER MERCATURAE", the Minister of Commerce, as well as a new phase that will award the contract cards through auction. You can also get additional Fame points at the game end if you will be able to meet the demands of goods from around the world.

Add: a new role for the 6th player
a new turn phase
new cards
new buildings
tokens for the 6th player


Con questa espansione viene introdotto nel gioco un nuovo ruolo, il “MAGISTER MERCATURAE”, ossia il ministro del commercio, oltre ad una nuova fase che prevede l’assegnazione di carte contratto attraverso un’asta. Sarà inoltre possibile ottenere Punti Fama aggiuntivi a fine partita se si sarà riusciti a soddisfare le richieste di merci provenienti da tutto il mondo.

Aggiunge: un nuovo ruolo per il 6° giocatore
una nuova fase nel turno
nuove carte contratto
nuovi edifici
segnalini per il 6° giocatore
categories: Ancient, City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Industry / Manufacturing, Nautical, Transportation

name: Agadez
description:
An abstract game with wooden sticks in player colors, and wooden beams with drilled holes.

On their turn, players add a beam to the construct, as well as one of their sticks through one or more beams. The object of the game is to be the first to have three sticks in a row - horizontally, vertically or diagonally.

name: Das Pfadfinderspiel: Mit Kochgeschirr und Zelt
description:
From the publisher's website:

"The Scouts play - with cookware and tent" is a fast-paced card game that is like a warehouse simulator and takes the life scout for a ride. The aim of the game is to be the most experienced Scouts by collecting the most badges. To earn these badges you must e.g. "Climbing go", "perform night hike" one or simply "drying". That seems to be easy with the training and the right equipment such as the "replaced scarf" or "ASI". But beware! Your teammates can help you in your job, but also put obstacles in the way. So it's better to just in case a "fake health certificate 'in the hindquarters have.

With 118 new cards, the equipment is better and more difficult tasks.
Along with "The Pathfinder Game - We wanted to go to Great ride" there is the possibility of up to 8 players to go on tour.

"The Boy Scouts Game" is the only true journey companions for all the cubs to the warehouse manager -. And a must for all those who can not wait the next camp

name: The Star Game
description:
The Star Game is a 3-dimensional occult board game for two players. In addition to being a game, it is also used as occult sorcery with each occult initiate expected to make their own boards and pieces.

There are two versions of the game, the simple and the advanced. The simple game has seven boards placed one above the other in a spiral, with the boards named after particular stars. Each board has nine black and nine white squares, making 126 squares in total over the seven boards. Each player (white and black) starts the game with three sets of nine pieces (27 pieces per player) with each piece allowed to move across a board, and up or down from board to board, in a different way. Only some types of pieces can capture other opposing pieces, and a captured piece is removed from the boards and plays no further part in the game.

The seven boards are named Naos, Deneb, Rigel, Mira, Antares, Arcturus, and Sirius. At the start of the game, each player has six particular pieces on Sirius, three pieces on Arcturus, six pieces on Antares, three on Rigel, six on Deneb, three on Naos, and none on Mira. As in other board games, the players take turns to make their moves.

The basic rule of play is that after a piece has been moved - whether across a board or from one board to a higher or lower board - it is transformed into another piece according to a set sequence and then can be moved according to its new designation. Another rule is that pieces can only stay on the Mira board for three moves.

The basic aim of the simple form of the game is for one player to place three of their pieces on certain squares on Mira, with the type of these pieces and their placing on that board decided by both players beforehand. The first player to do this wins the game. This takes some skill and some time since not only can an opposing player capture pieces on Mira but also pieces are only allowed to stay on Mira for three moves, after which the player must move the piece. Depending on the skill of the player, to win a simple game takes from a few hours to a day or more.

In the advanced Game, each board has six (minor) boards (three at each end), with there being additional pieces (more sets of nine for each player making 81 pieces per player). There are also additional rules regarding movement. In this version of The Star Game, each board is divided into three other levels so that there are four levels to each board, making a total of 308 squares over the seven main boards. Depending on the skill of the player, to win an advanced game can take several days.

In both the simple and the advanced games, the pieces are usually small tetrahedrons (or small squares) marked with the particular abstract symbol (or the particular occult symbol) which is used to designate that type of piece.

Complete game rules are outlined in "NAOS: A Practical Guide to Modern Magick". A free software version is also available.

name: Go! Go! E.D.F. (fan expansion for  Smash Monster Rampage!)
description: This is a fan made stand alone game based on Smash Monster Rampage. Tokyo is invaded by bugs, mechs, ufos, aliens & gigantic monsters (kaiju). It's time for Earth Defence Force (E.D.F.) to defend the city. The map is divided into four sectors in which a player is assigned to defend one sector. It's a four players co-op game. You need to join other teams to defend Tokyo & rescue survivors. You must hurry! Giant bugs & mechs are all over the city. In additions, gigantic monsters (kaiju) & three huge motherships are on the way to destroy the city. You need to investigate each of the 30 buildings to rescue the survivors before it's too late. But beware!Some buildings are already overrun by aliens & bugs. You may found new bug hives & must destroy them to stop the swarms. The player who has most intact buildings left, saved most survivors & killed most aliens or monsters at game end wins.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame

name: Thunder Megazord's Card Game
description:
Simple card game set in the universe of the Power Rangers.

Shuffle the cards and lay them all face-down on the table with no over-lapping. A player turns over two cards. If they don't match, he puts them back face-down on the table (in the usual fashion of a Pairs game). If they match, he keeps the pair and has another go. He stops when he doesn't draw a pair.

The twist in this game is the Lord Zed card. If a player reveals Lord Zed, that player must return all his pairs won so far to the face-down area in the centre of the table and must start collecting again from scratch. Once Lord Zed has made his entrance, he is removed from play so that it can only happen once a game.

name: Way of the Fist
description:
The Midnight King, the lord of Piston City's underworld, has sponsored a fighting tournament. Heroes and villains from around the world have gathered to compete. Fighters who distinguish themselves in the tournament may challenge the Midnight King himself for a chance to win the ultimate victory.

Each player chooses a unique fighter to control. Players take turns playing their cards. A player may put an arena into play, fight to take over someone else's arena, and train fighting techniques. Fighting techniques are permanent increases to total fighting power, and other cards may temporarily increase fighting power during a fight. Fights are resolved by comparing the fighting powers of the two fighters. A fighter who controls six arenas fights the Midnight King and then either wins the duel to end the game or loses an arena.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Variable Player Powers

name: Versatiletters
description:
Versatiletters is a collection of fun word games where you can instantly turn any letter into another by simply rotating the card! This innovation provides greater flexibility for beginners and more strategic opportunities for advanced players.

Versatiletters contains 100 rotatable letter cards and 8 additional cards with instructions and rules for 5 games:

Word Wars I.II.III - Form 3 words with 10 cards
The Last Word - Battle until you run out of words
Keep Your Word - Find words fast and keep them
Clues and Cues - Unscramble secret words
Pass Words - You rule! (Invent your own rules for this game title and others that you can imagine, then share them with friends!)
categories: Card Game, Game System, Word Game
publishers: INversionGAMES LLC, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: The Bonkers Game
description:
Based on the Disney TV series, this game has players moving Bonkers and Fall Apart Rabbit around the board collecting different colored footprints. The first person to collect three footprints of the color determined by the magnifying glass is the winner!

This is a basic roll and move game, but you get to choose whether you move Bonkers or Fall Apart who are on two different tracks. Landing on different squares can change the color goal, cause you to trade footprints with other players, reverse direction and other zany trials.

From the instructions: Bonkers D. Bobcat and his sidekick, Fall Apart Rabbit, are about to solve another Tinseltown caper! join this wacky duo on their crime-busting adventure as they track suspicious footprints along 2 fun gamepaths. Will you be the one to help them snatch 3 matching "prints"?

name: King of 20
description:
King of 20 is a new competitive board game that is simple yet challenging. It can be played by anyone who understands basic math operations.

In King of 20 players use number and operation tiles to form expressions which are placed on the game board. The goal of the game is to receive the lowest score possible by making expressions that are as close to the number 20 as possible. A player's score is determined by comparing the solution of their expression to the number 20. For example: an expression with a solution of 18 would have a score of 2. Players must use tiles already on the board and those in their hand to form or add to expressions.

Although King of 20 is an effective educational tool, players of all ages and skill-sets can enjoy it. Young children and adults alike will love the games competitiveness, simple gameplay and sleek design.

Ishmael King created King of 20 in March of 2011 when he was a freshman in high school. He noticed that subjects such as English and History were regularly adapted into board game forms, while the subject of Math was poorly represented in the industry. The few math board games that existed were too simple or too complicated to play, or were made for an age range that was too specific. So he took the opportunity to make a game himself.

name: Only Fools and Horses Trading Game!
description:
From the box:

Will you become a successful wheeler-dealer or end up without a penny in this cushty trading game based on the hit TV series? Invest your starting cash in hooky goods, hope that they'll be nice little earners and keep out of the taxman's view as you attempt to wheedle your way to the top.

As the game progresses, you'll be able to trade, pawn and hide your items in the lock-up as you try to change them into cold hard cash. Don't forget to visit the Nag's Head for a round or 2 with your mates, and have a flutter as you make your way around the board. You never know, by the end of this game, you might have made a fortune!

name: Les 24 heures du Mans
description:
The game 'Les 24 heures du Mans' is played on a board representing the famous race circuit in France.

The object of the game is to finish in first place (winner 'performance') or by having the most points (winner 'energy').

You advance on the board by throwing one or two dice. You get points or encounter some hazards on different boxes on the track.

You have got three possibilities to throw the dice:
- one die: no risk
- two dice: normal hazards
- two dice (speed up): double points but more possible hazards

name: Alfabet Spel
description:
The game consists of a board with an empty crossword grid with alternating 2 x 2 grids in white, black and red. Each player receives 48 letters and joker tiles, some of which are black, some red and some white.
Each player now draws 7 of his/her letters into the hand. The first player forms a word on the board, then draws new letters. However, placing a red tile on a red square means the player can draw an extra tile; placing a non-black letter on a black field or a black letter on a non-black field means the player has to drop a letter. Other players follow in turn order, adding letters to the first word crossword-style. The first player to get rid of all of his/her tiles is the winner.

name: Arc The Lad Card Game
description:
This is a card game play in turns. In a turn, each player play a card from hand to the 4 row of the card. When a sixth card play to the row, the player who play the sixth card get the first to fifth cards (5 cards) and the sixth card become the new first card of the row. The sum of the victory points (VP) on the 5 cards is the VP for the player. Different cards have different VP value, some positive and some negative.

There are rules to play the card, only higher number card may be place to the cards on the table. If no card can be place, the longest row on the mat will be discard and replace with a new card from the deck.

Play continue until all players play all the cards in the hand (10 cards).

The one with the most VP win.

Component:
80 cards with number from 1 to 80
7 special card (same card back as the number card)
1 rule sheet
1 play mat
A small game box

name: SDS Pengespil
description:
SDS Sparekassen published this game, heavily inspired by Matador / Monopoly. It was published at the latest in 1983, but the specific year could not be found.

You try to earn money by building up a business empire with help from SDS Sparekassen.


SDS Sparekassen udgav dette spil, tungt inspireret af Matador/Monopoly. Det blev udgivet senest 1983, men det specifikke årstal kunnet ikke findes.

Du prøver på at tjene så mange penge som muligt, ved at oprette en masse forretninger med hjælp fra SDS Sparekassen.

name: 2000AD: Rogue Trooper Miniatures Game
description:
By the same designer and publisher of the Judge Dredd Miniatures Game, 2000AD: Rogue Trooper Miniatures Game is a science-fiction skirmish 28mm miniatures wargame based (as the title suggests!) on the Rogue Trooper stories of the classic British comic, 2000AD.

A Kickstarter project started in February 2013, successfully funded within one day of launch, the intention is to publish a hardback rulebook and a range of miniatures for both sides, of the perpetual civil war on Nu-Earth. The Nort and Souther armies are asymmetrical (army lists are featured in the rulebook; units each have a base points cost and upgrades available for additional points).

The scope of the game is intended to be from a handful of miniatures (one GI vs. a Nort squad for example) up to company level actions, including light vehicles.

The range planned for release currently includes:
GI Rogue Trooper
Souther soldier squad set (8 figs)
Nort soldier squad set (8 figs)
Nort elite assault squad set (8 figs)
Nort & Souther officer squad set (6 figs)
Souther lazooker team squad set (6 figs)
Nort snipers and Black Dome sniper squad set (7 figs)
Skorpion Battlewagon (light tank, 3 variants planned)

Troops have their own basic statistics (points cost, movement, defence and armour values, morale (called Will-to-Fight; WtF in this game!), individual abilities (traits) etc. which are then augmented by the range and damage ratings of the weapon with which they are equipped (range, damage, traits). The more powerful a weapon is, the more combat dice rolled.

Rules cover ranged and close combat, remote weapons, indirect fire, elevation, suppression, air units, fighting from and in structures, etc.

Missions can be generated within the 'Engagement' chapter by combining various mission profiles (attack, defend, probe, hold, etc) to give an alternative to simple meeting engagements of equal cost forces. Success or failure is adjudicated by victory points specific to the various missions.

NB: This information is based upon the first release of the draft rulebook, and thus may be subject to change before release.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Triumph of Nations: Wargaming Rules for Napoleonic Tabletop Gaming
description:
From the publisher website:

"In 1812, after a period of considerable victories, Napoleon found himself fighting on two fronts, suffering setback after setback. With his forces in Spain being pushed back, Napoleon launched an invasion of his former ally, Russia, leading the half-million-strong Grande Armee to Moscow and a brutal defeat at the hands of Russian forces and the bitter winter. On the defensive, Napoleon was defeated and exiled, but returned to lead his loyal armies against a coalition of European nations in a final campaign that culminated at Waterloo. "Triumph of Nations", a companion for "Field of Glory Napoleonic", provides players with all the army lists and details they need to recreate the battles of the later Empire, from the disastrous invasion of Russia to the glorious Hundred Days."

name: The Crazy Chicken Game
description:
This crazy chicken eats everything!
When you place your hand inside you'll hear wacky sounds of the many things this freaky fowl has swallowed! Remove the strange items the chicken has eaten without taking out any of the three organs!

Includes:
Chicken
7 Green Items
3 Chicken Organs
Rules
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Party Game

name: Dark Worlds
description:
DARK WORLDS is a science-fiction strategy board game of space exploration, discovery, technological development and conflict, for two to four players. Each player assumes the role of a ruler of a space-faring civilisation. Rulers are tasked with spreading the influence of their civilisation throughout the universe. This requires the control of space sectors, and the discovery of unknown worlds (planets), with the aim of colonising them and harvesting their resources.

Planets come in a variety of types. Some, due to their harsh environments, support only limited populations. Others, such as lush, earth-like terran worlds, can support vast populations and have abundant resources. The greater the population that a colonised world supports, the more precious resources (and victory points) it will yield for the ruler that controls it.

Gathered resources pay for establishing colonies, and for technological research, such as hyper - drive engines and weapons for spacecraft, and improved planetary infrastructure. Each technology developed will yield particular advantages for a civilisation, in addition to providing victory points for winning the game. Resources may be spent to hire mercenary fighters, serving your battle for control of space sectors.

Some worlds also yield rare alien artefacts, which confer victory points for the player that finds them.

Ultimately, the ruler who controls the most developed worlds, controls the greatest number of space sectors, researches the most technologies, and discovers the most valuable artefacts will be victorious!

name: Blazin' Squigs
description:
A free racing game, distributed in Game Workshop's 1997 Games Day conference handbook.

Includes cardboard tokens which may be used in lieu of their miniatures. Poke and prod your horde of cave squigs to the finishing line faster than your opponents, or even send your pack to chomp down another team.

As a nice bonus touch, the additional rooms provided fit in nicely with Warhammer Quest pieces.

name: Inte ens nära!
description:
Objective: gain as many victory points as possible finding correct answers
- acting simultaneously -
active player draws a card/reads aloud;
if your answer is correct or your guess as close as possible you score.
remarks:
game subsists on some really weird/useless questions..

name: Ace Power Trumps
description:
Much the same as Top Trumps. However, the cards are much larger (8.8cm x 14.5cm) and each card has 3 categories and a further 3 sub-categories.

Elder Earth set:
Categories (Sub-categories) - Physical (Strength, Skill, Stamina), Material (Armour, Mobility, Weapons) & Magical (Power, Force, Fearfactor)
Robo Legion set:
Categories (Sub-categories) - Mechanics (Fire Power, Forceshields, Armour), Capability (Speed, Mobility, Range) & Intelligence (Controlability, Efficiency, Identification)
Colony Ten set:
Categories (Sub-categories) - Physical (Strength, Skill, Stamina), Material (Armour, Mobility, Weapons) & Magical (Power, Force, Fearfactor)

Object of the Game: The winner is the player with either the most sets of four or the complete pack.
How to play: First decide who will be the dealer, he or she then shuffles the pack and deals it equally between the players. Any spare cards should be placed in the pot. The dealer then picks a card and chooses either a category or sub-category and calls it, the winner is the player with the highest score. he or she then collects that hand and any card in the pot, should there be any. The winning player then continues to play. The play is then taken in turns between the players.
A variant may be played by the addition of two dice. A player calls a category as with the previous game, then rolls the dice. the dice score is added to the card score to give the players score. The opponent repeats the procedure. The winner is the player with the highest combined score.

name: X-Plus
description:
There is a 2-sided tray and 25 wooden cubes what have faces with colorful geometric patterns.
The goal is to get five identical cubes in a row (line, column or diagonal).
A cube of one of the angles is removed and given to the first player. He places the cube by pushing another cube out of the tray.
The opponent takes the cube fell, chooses the face of interest and places it to the chosen location. The hardest part is to remember the faces of the cubes fell to guess the desired combination of the opponent!
The first player makes a row of five cubes wins the game.
publishers: (Self-Published), Winning Moves France, Winning Moves UK Ltd.

name: HP!
description:
A medium to fast paced casual card combat game for 2-4 players

HP! puts you into a 30-40 minute contest of elimination with up to 3 other players. You each have 10 HP and you win by being the last surviving player with HP. During the course of the game, you may take the offensive with Punches, Kicks, Fire Spells, and Ice Spells. Each Attack and Cast card has a counter. You can Defend Punches and Kicks, and you can Ward Spells. You may also use a Buff card to add additional cards to your hand.

The loose but consistent fantasy theme gives you a strong setting without forcing you to invest in complicated and intense game lore or character back stories. In other words, it's a very casual setting.

name: Global Chemistry
description:
In this game players create chemical companies in order to devellop as much products as possible. During the game, the players are confronted with economical, chemical and technical questions.
Products can be created within one of the four categories: specialties, energy, consumer products of pharmaceuticals. Through research, design, and pilot phase a final product is created and victory points are gained.
But the competition can be hard and they can make it difficult for the player to make a return on his investment for the products he's creating. The winner is the player who dominates the world's economy by creating the most products and gaining the most victory points.

This game was created as an educational game by Identity Games International bv in collaboration with students from the Technical University of Delft (T.U.Delft) in The Netherlands and with sponsorship from multiple chemical companies. On release, a free copy was sent to almost 1000 schools in The Netherlands and Belgium.

Game Play :

Players throw the dice to move around the board. There are different types of spaces they can land on :
- Products: the player can invest in the product or go to the next stage of development, paying the fee. If another player has already invested in this product, the current player can pay him royalties or go for a hostile take-over to become the market leader.
- Chance : the player takes a chance-card and may get or lose money.
- Strategy : these cards give the players an advantage (hostile take-over, protection, Nobel-prize, investment bonus or grants).
- Start : each time the player passes start, he's paid a salary.
- Artesia (bank where the player gets money), OCenW (player gets an education and passes this round) or InterChem2000group (the dice are thrown again and the player moves further on the board).
Players obtain victory points for each fully developed product (phase 4), for each market they dominate and if they win a Nobel-prize.
The winner is the player who manages to first gain the predetermined number of victory points.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Chess King
description:
Description:
Chess King is a perpetual puzzle game of speed and ingenuity. Chess King has many of the same elements of chess, but it’s not chess! With each move you make, Chess King will enhance your ability to think quickly and precisely, exercising your mind to keep it sharp. What makes Chess King exciting is after the first puzzle is completed, each additional puzzle is created by your own hand. The combination of various puzzles, time restrictions and Chess-King Locks, will make this game a fun and challenging pastime.

The Object of the Game:
The object of the game is to reach the Chess King Square before your opponent by successfully completing each puzzle (Three rotations with the King), without encountering a Chess-King Lock, before three minutes elapses.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Party Game, Puzzle
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Race, Square Grid

name: Zombielievable
description:
A card game published by EJIN Institute. This card game is for 2 to 5 players. 4 to 5 players are recommended. One player control a group of police officers. The number of police officers in one game is equal to the number of other (zombie) players. Other players are zombie players. Each zombie player has their own house for sending zombies to the police station. The police must fight against the swarm of zombies. If all police officers are dead, the zombie players win. If the police can get rid of all the zombie players, the police player win.

A longer version of the game can be played, in which each player take turn as the police player and see who is the best defender. If the polcie player wins, the number of cards remaining in the draw deck is counted. The player with the most cards left in the draw deck in the winner.

name: Haunted Castle
description: A game for pre-teen girls (although there is no reason why boys can't play). Published in an annual for Princess Comic readers. A simple Goose-type game. Roll and move but remember to obey any special square instructions. The first to get to Square 86 and roll a 6, wins.

name: Flipping Fishes
description:
Flipping Fishes is a fun dexterity race game for up to 4 players or teams. Participants have cardboard "frying pans" which they use to fan or "swish" paper fish across the raceway (floor) and onto the same color plate at the finishing line.

From the box top "A fantastic fun family race game - flip your fish along the race alne and onto the dinner plate using only the frying pan! No Touching with your hands!"

name: Guess What!
description: The game comes with 108 flat pieces of different shapes and sizes. Players take turns drawing a card that contains six items and then, within a time limit and using any of the pieces, creating the item that matches a die roll. The other players attempt to guess what is being created, and they may ask for the first letter of the item. Creator and correct guesser score either two points (no first-letter clue) or one point (clue given). Play until each player has constructed five items.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Memory Challenge: Cooking Edition
description:
Publisher Blurb:

A Feast for Your Eyes! Wet your appetite with tasty foods while you play the world's most popular matching game, Memory! Match delicious appetizers, entrees, side dishes and desserts with beautifully photographed Meal Cards. A New Recipe For Fun. Directive cards add all new game play by allowing players to swipe matches, take extra turn, or even take a peek at other cards. And for Dessert. Collect 4 matches on your dinner plate card to create a complete meal and get even more points!

name: Slap the King
description:
Four cards are revealed for the players to remember... One card is slid below the King in the middle of the table and the rest are shuffled into the deck. The King has hidden his only heir to the throne (one of the 4 cards the players just saw) and it is up to you to find them. As you draw a card into your hand and play a card to family lineage lines on the table, you begin to prove which peasants and nobles are not related to the King, the hidden one becomes more apparent to everyone, as more cards are played to the table.
Your family lineage lines on the table prove which people are not royal heirs. Players must complete family lines with a family crest card (to score extra points) before the other player slaps the King and names the hidden heir. You must decide between quickly exposing the King's secret before your opponent can play the right cards.. or making sure your family lines are complete so you score more points. As the final cards are played in a round its a matter of seconds before one player slaps the king card and names the hidden heir card.

A game of strategy, deduction and timing.
publishers: Everingham Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Swords and Heroes: Starter Set
description:
Swords and Heroes is a unique, history-based tactical game that allows players the opportunity to battle some of the greatest armies in history. The flagship game of the independent company ZAMA Game Design, Swords and Heroes challenges players in a simple-yet-engaging combat system.

The game uses a detailed “Cards and Shards” system that uses board-based tactical “shards” to represent battlefield units of the respective armies. Basic statistics and abilities of these units are represented by beautifully-designed game cards held by each player. Units range from light-armored infantry to long-ranged archers or heavy cavalry, but vary wildly based on the historical civilization chosen by the player.

After custom-designing their armies using a simple point-based creation mechanic, players field their armies and face off for the control of the board with easy-to-learn dice-based turn mechanics. Players also make use of “General’s Orders” cards that offer players powerful and unique means of shifting the course of battle. Once the enemy has been eliminated from the board, the remaining general stands victorious!

The Swords and Heroes: Starter Set comes with all of the necessary rules and game components required, as well as two Classical Age armies: The Roman Empire and the Germanic Tribes. Future expansion packs will also offer players additional armies, such as Han China, Alexander’s Macedonia, Parthian Persia, and more!

name: Hermit Crab Havoc
description:
"You are a tiny faint whisper in the tiny mind of a tiny land hermit crab - let’s face it that’s really tiny. Still god-hood has to start somewhere and all that you can hope is that your influence will be strong enough to see your crab through its next three vital moults before your rival beats you to it with their crab."

A strategy game for 2 players (though it may work eventually for more).

The Game takes place on an area of Australian Mangrove Swamp divided up into hexagon shaped spaces. Each player takes the part of a Land Hermit Crab God guiding their chosen Land Hermit Crab through their life in order to be the first to be big enough to worship at the Crab Temple.

Each player rolls 4 d6s which determine direction of movement, distance, the nature of the god gift (usually food but sometimes a shell), and the area where the gift will drop. It is up to the player to decide which die will be carrying out which role.

The Game components (which include crab pictures in a photo frame, hermit crab playing pieces and the entire board) fit onto just 3 pages (2 if you have your own tokens). Compact rules (1 double-sided standard sheet) and an optional player's aid page are also available. The board is modular so as to enable easy storage.

name: Boss Raid
description:
In Boss Raid you and a friend take on the role of Great Heroes facing off against a Mighty Boss. Choose your Heroes, Choose the Boss! Do you have what it takes to emerge victorious?

Boss Raid is set in a fantasy world where you'll face bosses like dragons, necromancers and other unspeakable beings of darkness. It also sets aside all the "fodder" of lower level creatures and brings you to the heart of why we play games like this "the Boss Battle!"

Players throughout the game will roll dice and draft them to gain resources, but be warned, the dice you do not keep gives resources to the Boss. Resources are needed to perform powers that each Hero and Boss have. The more resources you have, the more powerful your attacks can be. Players and Bosses have action decks which provide unique abilities and attributes, which can be played with the resources you gain.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Picniko
description:
Picniko is a box with two bilingual games for childrens

In the first one, called Slow Game. kids try to play all the cards in his hand, the goal is to run out of cards in hand. To do this the player must play an animal card whose name, in spanish or english, match the same first or last letter in his name that the previous played card. If the player cannot play a animal card then it must take a card from the central pile.

In the Fast Game, some dexterity is required. The goal is to be the player with the most number of cards at the end of the game. Every player is given with an animal card face down, the remaining cards are placed face up in the table. All players reveal his card, at that moment the fastest player to say the name take that card and play on top of his previous card. Is there no match in the first or last letters of the name, the card is left aside in the toaster card
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Tortenschlacht
description:
A childrens reaction puzzle game modelled after the musical chairs game: The game contains puzzle pieces for 5 cakes, each consisting of 9 puzzle pieces numbered 1 to 8 (the 9th is the central piece without number). Also 5 dice and 4 wooden cake pieces. The puzzles are sorted. The wooden cake pieces are put into the middle of the table, but their number is one less than the number of players. The players each get a special die depicting five blank sides and one side with a cake. The players roll their dice simultaneously. When a cake is rolled the player yelles "cake". All players immediately stop rolling and grab a wooden cake piece from the middle of the table. Who was able to manage to grab a piece gets a puzzle piece of his/her choice. The player who is missing out on a cake does not get a puzzle piece. The first player to complete his/her puzzle wins.

From the box back: The dice roll and the cake fight begins. Everybody grabs quickly but not everybody gets a piece. Only good reaction gets a sweet reward. Who is the first to have a whole cake wins the game. Cake fight - the lightning fast reaction game.

name: Foreknowledge
description:
This is a different sort of trick-taking cardgame, playable with a regular deck of cards (part of the deck). Part of the inspiration for the game is the concept of free will vs determinism, and the verses in the Bible texts of Romans 8.

First, the game is for two players only. Second, one player knows what all the cards are that are dealt and decides which hands are to be given to each player, stacks their hand and always leads with their hand. The other player ends up picking trump suit, without fully knowing what all the cards are in (unlike the player who stacked their hand).

Included with the game is a variant that adds bidding, with each player bidding differently.

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Battle Box
description:
Play the 3 game challenges then win the right to be the Supreme Warrior of all!

Object of the game is to collect two each of pizza and weapons tokens, and then reach the finish space to get your designated "bad guy". Each player starts as either Michelangelo, Donatello, Raphael or Leonardo, and chooses the matching Battle Card. Each Battle Card has two spaces each for pizza and weapons tokens, and a designated bad guy.

The bad guys actually are just decoration, as they all wait together in the "hideout", which is part of the finish space. Game play proceeds with each player spinning the spinner, advancing to the next space on single, linear path from start to finish that has the same color as the one just spun, and collecting either the pizza or weapon token found there.

After playing the 3 games, winning players hold a spin-off to see who be the supreme warrior.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Battle of Inchon (1950 AD)
description:
"North Korea invaded the Republic of South Korea in 1950. The UN voted to recommend military assistance to the Republic of South Korea, and President Truman sent US troops to Korea. The North captured much of the Korean Peninsula and the only hold outs were in the Pusan Perimeter. General MaCarthur proposed relieving the pressure on Pusan with a surprise amphibious landing behind enemy lines at Inchon. The landing was a major victory for the UN forces in Korea. UN forces went on the offensive and drove north until the Chinese intervened. The war ended in an armistice, with a demilitarized zone separating the two Koreas near the 38th parallel. The border remains an area of heightened tensions to this day. The Korean War is sometimes called the "forgotten war" in the United States because it comes between two more famous conflicts, WWII and the Vietnam War."

A miniatures wargame intended for classroom use with two teams of students (grades 6-8). The game is designed to be played using 1/72 scale plastic miniatures. Free print-and-play paper miniatures are also provided for use with the rules.

Forces portrayed in the game include American squads in units of 8 soldiers, with an officer, radioman and two BAR machine gunners for each squad and North Korean squads in units of 15 and have one officer and one machine gun.

name: Silhouette Junior
description:
Junior version of the Silhouette

60 tiles with with various child-oriented silhouette images on one side. These are placed on the table, face down. The active player flips over two tiles and tries to make a compound word out of the two images. If successful, the player keeps the pair and goes again. If not, the tiles are returned and it's the next player's turn.

When all tiles are claimed (or there are no other possibilities), the player with most tiles is the winner.

name: The Siege of Syracuse 415-413 BC
description:
From the publisher's website:
""The Romans knew not…how deeply the greatness of their own prosperity and the fate of the whole Western world were involved in the destruction of the fleet of Athens in the harbor of Syracuse.” Arnold

Say what? The ‘fate of the whole Western world?’ Syracuse? How?

Simple. If the Athenians had taken Syracuse, during their invasion of 415 BCE, they would have captured Sicily and become a major superpower. They would dominate the Italian boot as well, and make it much harder for a city-state named Rome to expand.

Maybe one of the oddest things about the lengthy Peloponnesian War is that, after decades of balance, the Athenians actually lost it with a campaign well away from the Greek mainland.

The Athenians have a mighty host of fleets and men, filled with confidence. The Syracusans have a long history of clinging to their independence (and powerful allies coming to foil Athens).

Combat units include cavalry, light troops, peltasts, and the heavily armed hoplites—the backbone of both sides’ armies. You the players can decide your best approaches for attack and defense, selecting from pitched battles or skirmishes…or building miles of siege walls.

The Siege of Syracuse includes:
One full color, 11” x 17” mounted mapboard
One 8.5” x 11” battle board
176 large, full color, die-cut counters
12 page rulebook

Can you extend the Golden Age of Athens or maintain the freedom of the most powerful city in the mid Mediterranean?

Part of the TPS "Decisive Battles" series

That means straightforward rules, key insights into the history behind the game, and designs aimed at one-session conclusions and high replay value. "

name: Kosmiczny Kupiec
description:
Kosmiczny Kupiec (Space Trader) is a economical board game where you get your own frigate handfull of credits and first transport assingment to complete.
During the game you get random encounters like pirate attack,space police control or exploring some alien artifact. You can also upgrade your ship with either science, weapons or transport modules.
Goal of the game is to have the largest sum of money when the last assingment is completed.

Contents of the box:

Board
23 trading missions cards
23 space routes cards
23 exploration cards
36 goods tokens
4 spaceship boards
8 science module upgrades
8 weapon module upgrades
24 transport module upgrades
Space cash supply
Dice
4 pawns to represent ships
Rules of play
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers The Good Against Evil Game
description:
Rita Repulsa is attacking! Its up to the Power Rangers to save the day. Defeat the Evil Space Aliens to stop Rita. Choose a Power Ranger and move along the board.

Object of the game:
Is to beat Rita Repulsa, evil sorceress and her gang of henchmen to save the earth.

Contents:
1 game board
8 bases
4 young (attackers)
4 henchmen Rita (defenders)
1 die
Instructions

name: Lenino
description:
This game simulates tactical battle that took place between October 12 and October 13, 1943, north of the village of Lenino in Byelorussia. Polish and soviet forces were trying to break german defense on the river Miereya. Because of the lack of artillery support and bad commands of the soviet HQ, polish 1st Infantry Division lost above suffered 25% casualties, while soviert forces were too weak to succesfully use polish victory.
The battle is prominent in Polish military history, as it was one of the first major engagements of Polish Armed Forces in the East.
