Game was published in the 1st issue of the "Taktyka and Strategia" magazine. It uses rules of the B35 system, meant for all battles fought between 1943-1945. Gathered together, whole rules of this systerm were published in the game "Bitwy II Wojny Światowej".

name: TSWW: Vengeance
description:
From Diffraction Entertainment:

"Artillery is the God of War" claimed Josef Stalin... Prove him right with the next title in the acclaimed TSWW game series... Vengeance is nigh!

Vengeance is the final instalment of the Great Patriotic War front of the TSWW game series. In the box you will find at least 5000 counters and up to 16 maps covering the scope and sweep of the Soviet front of World War II. Additionally the game will include multiple campaigns and several smaller scenarios covering the war in the Steppes of Ukraine and the forests of Byelorussia from July 1943 to the surrender of the German Reich in 1945.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Diffraction Entertainment, Ltd.

name: Doctor Who and the Doom of the Daleks
description: "Doctor Who and the Doom of the Daleks" is an as-yet unauthorized cooperative board game for 2 to 4 players. Players play as Companions to "the Doctor" and together try to rid time of the scourge of the Dalek invasion. Each turn more Daleks enter the board at different Eras of time (similar to the spread of diseases in Pandemic) and it is up to the Doctor and his Companions to "purge" them. On a player's turn, more Daleks spawn, and then the player gets 2 actions: 1 Companion action, and 1 Doctor action. Play continues until either the Daleks win by 1) killing the Doctor 4 times (the Doctor starts with 3 regeneration tokens), 2) spawning all Daleks from the supply into the timeline, or 3) taking control of 3 Eras; or, the Companions win by purging the entire timeline of Leader Daleks, AND placing Time Seals in 3 Eras.

name: Deep Space Prospector
description:
Deep Space Prospector is a real-space game that plays on your coffee table. Players are space miners rushing to explore far away galaxies and ruthlessly exploit them for massive profits.

Players randomly disperse asteroids around a central space station to create a playing board. Markers indicating power reserves are lined up to plot a course to asteroids and for the return home.

The goal is to carefully use your power reserves to travel to asteroids, mine them, and safely return to the space station. Points are earned for successful mining and remaining power. Be the most successful space prospector to win, but be wary of running out of power and being stranded in space forever!
mechanics: Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Death Before Dishonor: The Battle of Santiago Harbor
description:
“We saw what probably has not been witnessed since the days of the Armada, ships coming out for deadly battle, but dressed as for a regal parade or a festival day. From their shining black hulls, with huge golden figureheads bearing the crest and coat-of-arms of Spain, to the tops of their masts where fluttered proudly the immense silken flags…to the brightly colored awnings over their decks, they bespoke luxury and chivalry, and a proud defiance.
--George Edward Graham of the Associated Press as he witnessed the sortie of the Spanish Fleet from the Santiago Channel, July 3rd, 1898.

Death Before Dishonor is an introductory level wargame simulation on the naval actions that occurred near Santiago harbor during the Spanish-American War. The game design is meant to be simple and highly playable, yet one that portrays the historical challenges facing the combatants. Historically the US failed to bottle up the Spanish fleet, and was forced to undergo a lengthy blockade while the US Army fought the Spanish garrison for control of the city and port. The capture of key fortifications and the heights at Kettle and San Juan Hills compelled Admiral Pascual Cervera to sortie on July 3rd to prevent his ships from being sunk at their moorings by US artillery, or capture when the town surrendered. The US navy would sink all of the fleeing Spanish ships with little loss, scoring a lop-sided win.

Each copy of Death Before Dishonor is composed of the following:

• One sheet of 61 single-sided counters.
• One 8.5 by 11 map.
• This set of rules.

Players will also need a one ten-sided die (D10).

name: Viziers
description:
(From the Publisher's website):

Build your fame and glory!
Viziers is a game of foresight set in a land of trade, combat and discovery. As a Vizier to the Sultan of Arpeya, you govern an Oasis on his behalf. With some planning, adaptability, and a good record of service, you're certain to become the next Grand Vizier!

Gain the Sultan's favor by developing a prosperous Oasis. Entice the trade caravans to your domain with livestock, weapons, food and artifacts but beware the raiders and conquerors who will surely seek to steal your wealth! Build academies to make discoveries, strongholds to protect your Oasis and palaces to curry favor with the nobility. Every once in a while make an effort to set a rival back - but take care that you don't suffer the same fate!

Do you have the foresight to lay a successful path to victory, or the creativity to adapt to the changing needs of your Oasis? Can you stay a step ahead of your rivals as you jostle for ultimate power and the title of Grand Vizier?

Personal Description:

Viziers is played over rounds, as players race to first gain 10 victory points, winning them the game. Each round, cards to be auctioned are passed out to players who secretly study them before they are called to commit to purchasing the different resources necessary to win (or avoid winning) the cards in their possession and everyone else's during the upcoming auctions. The cards are then returned and resolved in the order of their numbers. Both lucrative trade and strong enemies are acquired by the player with the highest of the relevant resource, along with global events and technologies. After the cards (and their rewards and punishments) are assigned to the players, a new round begins.

name: Clumond
description: Clumond, a portmanteau of "clubs" and "diamonds", is a trick-taking game based on Ninety-Nine. In both games, a player has three cards whose suits encode the number of tricks needed to score a successful hand. This is called the "bid". Clumond's major twist is that the bid cards are not selected at the beginning of the hand -- they are whatever cards remain after all tricks have been played.

name: Il Corsaro Nero
description:
Taken from a famed novel by Emilio Salgari, and made in occasion of a movie taken from it, this is the second game on this theme appearing in Italy in the second half of the '70s.
Players get certificates by pillaging Spanish ships with their own. The player getting more certificates win.

name: Pillage!
description:
The players lead a horde of monsters attempting to pillage various civilizations in EVENIA. To win, be the player with the most “Pillage Points” by the end of the game.
Pillage! is a card game where each player controls a race of monsters attacking villages in Evenia. Each pillage deck acts as the location the monsters are pillaging; both its rich bountiful booty ripe for the taking and the powerful defenses set to stop the vile creatures.

Inside the decks are loot, goods, weapons, and other ransacking potential, but also knights, militia, mercenaries, walls, and other various things to stop the monsters’ onslaught. Many of these monsters do not play well together and will attempt to steal and harm one another just to be the winner.

The game ends when the final card is drawn from the Pillage Deck. At that time the area is considered fully pillaged and the monsters leave to search for another place to ransack.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Skunk
description:
Skunk is a trick-taking game, where players must avoid skunks. The deck has 1-10 in four colours (red, green, yellow, blue). There are skunks in the nines of the suits and in every card of the red suit.

The game play is basic trick-taking. Follow the suit, no trump, highest card wins the trick. In the end, players count their skunks. The player with the least skunks after six rounds wins the game.

name: imagine I Can... Cheese Chase
description:
The small games in the imagine I Can... collection of mini-games-in-a-tin are geared at children 3 and up.

Cheese Chase plays 2. The game contains two red and two blue wooden mice, two wooden cheese pieces and 1 die.

Once players choose their colour mice, each player will place his/her mice in a row, one after the other, at the starting line. The cheese pieces are placed 12 inches (or more for a longer game) from the mice across the table. Players take turns rolling the die and move their mice forward according to the number they rolled; the mouse in the back moves immediately in front of the mouse in the front, the number of times indicated on the dice. Game is over when a player's mouse reaches a piece of cheese.

name: imagine I Can... Castle Climb
description:
The small games in the imagine I Can... collection of mini-games-in-a-tin are geared at children 3 and up.

Castle Climb plays two to three. The games contain 21 wood castle pieces and one colour die.

Each players gets one blue castle base and one of each 6 different colored castle pieces. Players stack colored castle pieces on their base according to the color they rolled on the die. If the color rolled is already in play of if pink is rolled, that player loses a turn. Game ends when a player has built a complete castle using all the pieces ending with the hot pink piece at the top.

name: Motor-Race
description:
A children's game from the 70's.
Each player controls 1-4 cars. Skidding and collisions are covered.
Every player has the same number of cars, but each one may decide for himself, which of the cars he wants to move after the throw of the die.
The first player to get all of his cars across the goal line has won.

name: Zombie Stomp
description:
Zombie Stomp is a stand-alone miniatures wargame of redneck-vs.-zombie combat that uses the ECS game engine developed by Team Frog Studios, the same system that powers Super-Powered Miniatures Combat as well as the SuperFogeys game.

Gameplay is fast and furious, with the players having the opportunity to run through large and complex scenarios in a single session that lasts two hours or less. This allows for less time setting up to play, and more time actually shooting stuff!

The rules are free-form enough that you can build whatever scenarios and situations you wish with them.
categories: Horror, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Role Playing, Square Grid

name: De Tuin van Amon
description:
The rules from two authentic ancient Egyptian games, Senet and The Palm Tree Game, form the basis of this game. The track comes from a wall painting from a tomb in Thebes. The pawns mimic the escape of slaves from the garden.

The players are the slaves who try to escape the garden of Amon. The game consist of two phases. During the day phase the players run through the garden, obtaining Fate Cards along the road. When a player reaches the resting place with his 5 pawns, the night phase starts. The players now race for the boat at the end of the vineyard. The first player who gets his 5 pawns on the boat wins the game. Fate cards, who resemble various Egyptian gods can help you or hinder you... The gods are unpredictable!

Moving your pawns doesn't require any dice: the game uses Throwing Sticks ('Djebao' or 'Fingers'), just like in the old Senet game.

name: Dust Warfare: Campaign Book Achilles
description:
The final days of the battle for Zverograd have arrived. The three blocs send their last forces into Zverograd in final attempts to take the city—or what’s left of it —no matter the cost. The Doomed City has been transformed into a giant killing field, riddled with minefields, bunkers, trenches, and other fortifications. Life there is cheap: death awaits around every corner, in every building.

(Currently in open beta, will be available free when beta is completed, estimated early 2014)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Fancy Nancy Hide & Peek Game
description:
Help Nancy find all her fancy accessories in this 3D board game.

Build Nancy's two story house, making eight rooms that Nancy has misplaced her 16 accessory pieces in the 24 possible places in the house. The accessories are round tokens that are randomly placed in 24 slots (three available in each room).

Then the 32 cards (two of each accessory) are shuffled and players take turns, drawing a card from the pile and attempting to location the making token, showing everyone the chosen token. If it matches the card, you keep the token and the card. If not, you put the token back, and put the card at the bottom of the draw pile.

If the card you draw is one someone has already matched, set it aside and draw again. The first player to find 4 accessories wins.

For younger players allow them to look at the tokens they are placing in the various slots.

name: TriBond Clue-set Cards #2
description: A set of new clue cards for TriBond. Players are given a list of three items and must determine the common bond. Landing on another pawn brings up a challenge situation, where the winner stays put and the loser moves back. The first team to bring their three pawns around the triangles wins.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: These French Fries Are Terrible Hot Dogs
description:
These French Fries Are Terrible Hot Dogs is a party card game where players must lie to tell the truth, and convince others that their card is something else, more specifically, cards drawn by other people. Players are encouraged to be clever and to speak with a silver tongue!

During each round of the game, one person will act as the Judge and will take a card from the deck and place it face up. That card is the Target Card. Everyone else then takes a card from their hand and places that card face down. Next, each player must try and convince the Judge that their card is the Target Card by using true information about the card that they just placed down. The act of convincing the Judge is known as The Pitch.

Let's say Bob is the Judge, and he flips over the Target Card "Hot Dogs." Susan then decides to player her "French Fries" card and places it face down. During her pitch, she can say:

“Well, mine's really good plain, but people usually put toppings on it, like ketchup. Others might add chili or cheese. Oh, and you really don't want to eat it cold, it's much better warm."

Once everyone is finished making their pitch, the Judge picks the person who they feel had the best pitch, and declares that person the winner of the round. Players then discard the cards used during that round. Everyone but the Judge and the round winner draws a new card to replace the one that they just played. A new Judge is chosen, and a new round begins.

A winner is determined once a person discards all of their cards and says "These French Fries Are Terrible Hot Dogs!"
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Negotiation, Party Game

name: Riigimehed
description:
Board game based on TV-serie.

Roll the dice and move on the game board. In special boxes draw cards with special actions: like "other players move 2 steps back" etc. Who finishes first is the winner.

There are many events based on real scandals happened in Estonian politics on the cards.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Political, Racing

name: Theomachie: Die Jahreszeiten
description:
Die Jahreszeiten (The Seasons) is a small expansion for Theomachie. This expansion was available only for supporters of the game on German crowdfunding platform Spieleschmiede.

With this expansion the seasons come into play. Each season is associated with an elemental sphere.

There are two ways of using this expansion:
Variant 1: Each season increases the power of the cards from the corresponding sphere and gives access to an additional gift.
Variant 2: During the prayer phase, cards of the corresponding sphere can be taken for free from the display.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: The Gruffalo: Hide and Seek Mini Game
description: A mini board game that children can ‘race’ to find where The Gruffalo characters are hiding. If they find where The Gruffalo himself is hiding too, then they win the game. All of The Gruffalo characters are involved in this great ‘Hide and Seek’ game. Encourages social interaction Helps number and counting recognition Teaches use of memory. The object of the game is to be the first player to correctly identify all of his or her character cards and identify the Gruffalo hiding in the deep dark wood.

name: Pats baisiausias žaidimas
description:
Withstand a telephone conversation with a stranger about the secret room... Tell all your sexual fantasies... Find Mr. Beaver... Eat, lick, smell, answer, ask, drink, undress... and be not afraid! All of this is waiting in this small box full of surprises. Get tasks, questions and play cards. But beware of getting the scariest card!
(On their turn players play a card from their hand of 5 cards to score points [bananas]. Player then must answer the question or perform the task from the card to score points. The more bananas are on the card the more points you get, but the tasks are more difficult and crazy as they have more bananas on them. The game ends in two ways: when the draw deck runs out or one of the players plays "THE END" card. The winner is a player who gets most points.)

Iškęsti ledukų tirpsmą kelnėse... Atlaikyti pokalbį telefonu su nepažįstamu apie paslapčių kambarį... Išpasakoti visas savo seksualines fantazijas... Ieškoti pono bebro... Suvalgyti, palaižyti, pauostyti, atsakyti, paklausti, išgerti, išsirengti... ir neraudonuoti! Visa tai laukia šioje nedidelėje dėžutėje, pilnoje staigmenų. Gauk užduočių, klausimų bei veikėjų kortas ir pasiryžk žaisti. Gali strateguoti, bandyti išsisukti ar kenkti savo priešininkams, tik saugokis, kad pati baisiausia korta neatitektų tau!

HOBBYSHOP komandos narių kurtas vakarėlių stalo žaidimas "PATS BAISIAUSIAS ŽAIDIMAS" privers ne vieną raudonuoti ir atskleisti slapčiausias paslaptis.. Mes ilgai stengėmės, kad šis naujas žaidimas taptų vakarėlių bomba ir mums tai pavyko. Privalote jį išbandyti - drąsos čia reikės daug, juoktis dar daugiau.. :)
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Black Stories: Zeugen Ausschalten!
description:
A variant of the classic Battleship ("Schiffe versenken" in German), thematically set in the Black Stories family. You silence witnesses instead of sinking ships. This is a paper version containing 2 pads with 33 sheets each.

From the webshop of the publisher (they don't appear to have a separate product website):

Schwarz, mysteriös und morbide...und einfach unheimlich kultig:

Die neugierige Nachbarin, die zwielichtigen Zwillinge, das Terror-Trio... bei black stories müssen keine Schiffe versenkt, sondern Zeugen ausgeschaltet werden. Nur wer auch die blutige Bande und das skrupellose Syndikat aufspürt, gewinnt!
2 düstere Blöcke mit je 33 Blatt als Set!

Das Deckblatt dient gleichzeitig als Sichtschutz!

Mit Spielanleitung

Maße: 12 cm x 18 cm

name: Champions of Story
description:
5 minutes, 3 words, unlimited possibilities. A 5-minute thriller involving a rubber chicken, hot air balloon, and a watermelon?

Anything is possible when you become a Champion of Story! Select three subject cards, roll the die to determine the story genre and let your imagination run wild in this hilarious game of creativity! Anyone can join the fun, but only one will be crowned the Champion. Do you have what it takes?

Rules
Randomly, arbitrarily, or by the selection of cards (longest word or phrase) one person is selected as the Card God.
The Card God selects three subject cards and rolls the Die of Decision.

The remaining players – the Card Champions - will have 5 min to incorporate the subjects of the three cards in a story of the style dictated by the Die of Decision. The words must be used implicitly. If a selected card reads ‘a pod of whales’ then the story must use the exact phrase ‘a pod of whales’. The only modifications allowed are pluralization and possessive modifiers. If a verb is in gerund form or presented in a certain tense then they must be maintained.

When the five minutes elapse, each champion will present his or her story before the Card God and the other champions. When all stories have been read the Card God selects the victors of the round. The winners receive a number cards as dictated by the Card God, though the cards cannot be distributed evenly. Victory cards may be distributed 3-0 or 2-1. 1-1-1 is not allowed.

This is not a competition for the weak.

If the Card God so chooses he may award a Crown of Laurels to a truly exceptional literary achievement. A Crown of Laurels is worth 5 subject cards.

Once all cards have been awarded the title of Card God moves to the person to the left of the current Card God and the game continues.
The Card Champion who obtains the most cards and laurels by the end of the game, as chosen by the participants or when one champion is awarded 5 Crowns of Laurels, wins and is crowned Champion of Champions.
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Cat Dragon Press

name: Clash Fighter: The Real Time Fighting Card Game (Tournament Edition)
description:
Clash Fighter translates fighting game mechanics into a fast-paced card game where two players compete to build combos in real time! The Tournament Edition features six playable characters across 12 card decks, allowing for tournaments of up to 12 players. The Tournament Edition allows players to have a mirror match: two players can use the same character against each other with alternate costumes.

The first person to play a Clash card ends real time play, initiating a short turn based phase where damage is calculated. The goal is to deplete your opponent's lifebar while defending your own with strategic combos.

The 6-player Standard Edition is here: Clash Fighter: The Real Time Fighting Card Game

name: Munchkin Sparkly Good Fairy Shot Glass
description:
Munchkin is not a drinking game. Really.

But don't let that stop you from showing your love of Munchkin with the Munchkin Sparkly Good Fairy Shot Glass. These 1.5 oz glasses are white with the Sparkly Good Fairy in pink, and have LEDs in the base that flash when a switch in the base of the glass is pressed. The lights represent the Fairy's magic, enhancing your own feeble efforts!

Munchkin Sparkly Good Fairy Shot Glass Rule

The Munchkin Sparkly Good Fairy Shot Glass may be used in any Munchkin game or its sequels.
When fighting a monster, either as the main fighter or as a helper, you may push the button on the Munchkin Sparkly Good Fairy Shot Glass to turn the pretty lights on and then drink one complete shot* to double the combat bonus of a single Potion. You may do this as many times as you like during a game, but only once per monster, and you must discard two cards for every Potion after the first per game. You must turn the lights back off after each use, and if you forget to turn them on before the shot is poured, the effect is wasted (but you still have to drink the shot).

The owner of the Shot Glass is the sole judge of what liquid(s) may be used.

name: Trans-Clyde Game
description:
The Trans-Clyde Game was designed by David G. Watts (Railway Rivals and others) for the Greater Glasgow Passenger Transport Executive as part of publicity to show how easy it was to get around Glasgow and the surrounding areas (of west Central Scotland) using public transport.

It is a race game comprising a number of short rounds (the rules suggest 3 or 4), where each player starts from a randomly allocated railway station, and must visit three places of interest (in any order) using a combination of overground rail, underground/subway system (affectionately known as "The Clockwork Orange") or buses, then return to their start point to win that round. The person to get back "home" first scores 5 points, the others scoring one point for each site of interest reached. The overall winner is the person with most points at the end of the pre-agreed number of rounds.

The board is made up of a hexagonal base, overprinted with the main rail routes, stations and places of interest (that the players must visit). Each round has a different theme - shopping centres, scenic locations, sports stadia, etc. Players roll two dice if they want to travel by train or subway, and one die if travelling by bus. Certain die rolls will result in "incident" cards, which may force a detour, a missed turn etc.

2-6 players, but best with 3-4.

Components:

Game Board
Rules (1p)
2 6-sided dice
8 Hexagonal plastic playing pieces with a Bus on one face, and a Train on the opposite
30 Destination Cards
14 Rail Incident Cards
14 Bus Incident Cards
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Subways & Serpents: Toronto Underground
description:
Subways & Serpents is a chaotic, fast paced, 'hunt or be hunted' board game that takes place on an expanded version of Toronto's existing subway lines.

The good people of Toronto finally got the expanded Subway system they’d been waiting for. Getting across town is quick and easy! Or, it would be, if the tunnel excavation didn’t unleash hordes of bloodthirsty Serpents...

Now, cutthroat Crews of Serpent Exterminators have been brought in to clear out the Subway tunnels. You’re in charge of a Crew that has to ride the rails, eradicate Serpent Nests, take down enormous Serpents and do battle with rival Crews looking to steal their loot. Your Crew has to move fast, the first Crew of Serpent Exterminators to collect a full day’s pay wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Satat
description:
Introduction
Satat is the most popular card game in Mauritius. Its name comes from the from the Hindi "saat hant" meaning "seven hands" and it is related to the Indian game of Seven Hands (also known as Court Piece). The objective is to win at least seven of the 13 tricks, or even better to win the first 7 tricks, or better still all 13 tricks.

Players and Cards
The game plays with four players in fixed partnerships using a standard 52-card pack. What distinguish Satat from other Whist-like trick tacking games are the fact that the 2 of heart is the highest trump card of the game and the ways trump is decided.

Making Trumps
The dealer shuffles, the player to dealer's right cuts, and the dealer deals a batch of five cards to each player. The trump maker, to dealer's left, looks at these five cards and announces the trump suit. Alternatively, if unwilling to decide trumps on the basis of these first five cards, the trump maker may elect to use the last four cards to determine the trump suit.

End Game and Scoring
Normally the play ends when one team wins by taking seven tricks. However, if a team wins the first seven tricks (a 7-0 win) they may continue the play and try to win all the tricks (13-0 win). The winning team then gets to pass cards to the losing team in exchange for trump cards in a way similar to Sergeant Major.

There is no formal system of scoring and no fixed length to the game, but the players may like to keep track of how many games each team has won or lost.

Variations

Trup kasiet
In this "hidden trump" variation, instead of announcing the trump suit, the trump maker places one card of the trump suit face down. If the trump card is selected unseen from the last four, the trump maker looks at it before placing it face down.

In this variation 7-0 and 13-0 wins are more frequent, but no cards are exchanged after a 7-0 or 13-0 win.

name: Tribello
description:
Tribello is a trick-taking game of the Whist type for three players, using a standard 52-card deck.

Four hands of 13 cards are dealt - one for each player and a spare hand called the pickup.

There are four rounds of play with three deals per round. In the first three rounds the object is to win tricks; in the fourth the aim is to avoid winning tricks. The rounds are as follows. Each player has a quota of tricks. Each round, the way trumps are chosen is different.

In the first three rounds, the dealer has a quota of six tricks, the person to the left of the dealer has a quota of four tricks, and the person to the right of the dealer has a quota of three tricks. If you take more than your quota you score one point per extra trick; if you take less than your quota you score minus one point per trick below quota.

In the fourth round, the dealer has a quota of three tricks, the person to the left of the dealer has a quota of four tricks, and the person to the right of the dealer has a quota of six tricks. If you take more that your quota you score minus one point for each surplus trick; if you take less than your quota you score plus one for each trick below.

For each round, after the players have looked at their hands, the dealer decides how many cards he wants from the pickup (zero to 13). He discards this number of cards from his hand, and then draws an equal number from the top of the pickup, which remains face down. If there are cards remaining in the pickup, the process is repeated with other players.

The winner is the player with the most points at the end of the fourth round.

name: If I Ran the Zoo...Con
description: If I Ran the Zoo...Con: The Smofcon 3 game is a simulation of organizing a WorldCon event. Players form committees, perform actions, make decisions, and follow through on those decisions through the bidding, planning, and convention phases of the process using a choose-your-own-adventure style situation resolution book. By conserving goodwill, utilizing people, and balancing finances one committee will produce the most successful event and be crowned WonderCon, while the others will bear the label BlunderCon.

name: Roastmaster General
description: A card game in which one player at a time is roasted. A Roastmaster reads a Personal Statement card and then all players/roasters use a single or combination of Response cards they have been dealt to fill in the blanks of the Personal Statement. The Response cards played to complete the Personal Statement should be tailored to fit the player being roasted on that turn. After each Roaster response is read, the players vote for which line they think is best, the new line or previous line. The Roaster with the last line standing at the end of the roast competes against the Roastee to win the hand. Play continues until the number of rounds chosen at the start of the game have been played. A round is complete when all players have had a turn being roasted.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Bieten
description:
Bieten is a trick-taking card game best played with 3 to 5 players using a 33 card German suited pack.

Bieten means bidding or betting. Each player is dealt just three cards, and points are won for the best heart, best leaf, best pair or triple, best sequence, and winning the last trick. Players can bet on any of these points: if the other players concede, the bettor automatically wins the point; if they contest the point its value is increased.

At the end of the play, the score for each player is calculated and added to their previous cumulative total:

For winning a figure on which there was no bet - 1 point
For betting a figure which everyone calls good - 1 point
For winning a figure which was bet and hold, but to which no one said three - 2 points
For saying three to a figure which was bet and held, if everone says good to the three - 2 points
For winning a figure on which a raise to three was held - 3 points.

A player who held the Weli but fails to score for any of the five figures loses one point.

Everyone's score starts from zero, and the game ends when any player's score reaches or exceeds an agreed target score.

name: Rethink Tomorrow
description:
Abstract Strategy Tile laying/Card game with Climate change theme reflecting the hunt for clean energy.

The game is for 2 to 4 players aged 7 to adult.

The game was developed in cooperation with Novozymes and was designed by Steen Riisgaard.

Contents are:

Mounted playing board.

Four sets of plastic playing bricks in red,yellow,green, and blue
comprising of 8 X 1 square bricks, 8 x 2 square bricks, and 8 x 3 square bricks.

48 one square black `consequence` bricks.

36 white `Clean energy bricks` comprising of
12 x 1 square bricks, 12 x 2 square bricks, 12 x 3 square bricks.

24 Rethink cards

32 Consequence cards

1 sheet of rules.

The object of the game is to collect all the stores of clean energy printed around the board, while making the most efficient overall use of the energy required to reach the clean energy points on the board. Symbols of clean energy come in the form of 1,2,or 3 white square bricks which are taken when one of his tiles covers (or partially covers) a white energy space on the board.

On a players turn he may place either a 1, 2 or 3 square brick on the board, providing the placed brick shorter side comes into contact with a `tail end` of a previously placed brick.

The board also has catastrophe and rethink symbols which when covered ( or partially covered by a players brick force a player to draw the corresponding card from the deck which he reads aloud and all players follow the event of the card.

The game ends when either the white energy symbols on the board have been covered and collected, or each player has 10 black consequence bricks in their possession.

At the conclusion of the game players add up the totals of their Plus energy bricks that have been placed on the board, minus the black consequence bricks they have, to give a final
energy point score.

The player with the higher Plus energy is declared the winner.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Educational, Environmental
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Frenchie-Opoly
description:
FRENCHIE-OPOLY IS A GAME OF TAIL-WAGGING FUN!
COLLECT YOUR FAVORITE FRENCHIES AND PLAY HARD!

Increase your rent by buying Toys for your dogs and upgrading them to Big Bones. Sounds easy enough until you get fleas, have an accident on the carpet, or worse yet, get sent to the kennel!

GRAB YOUR TOKEN AND ADVANCE TO GO FRENCHIES!

Who knows! You may soon be Best in Show... or marching in the Dog Parade! Whatever happens, keep your wag on!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: The Hen House
description:
The completely irreverent, and somewhat crass, cardgame that pits Weasels and Foxes against steroid-enhanced Cocks.

The farm has become a dangerous place. Hens have become easy prey for the wild animals that roam the outskirts of the land. Each night the weasels and foxes sneak in to nab a nice dinner from the shelter of the chicken coop.

Lately, the farmers have not been as diligent as they should when it comes to the safety of their broods. The roosters have decided to stop their cock fighting and stand up against the attacking beasts. They band together and wait for an attack from the vile creatures, hoping their numbers can fend off the nightly attacks. All is not completely safe for the hens however, as the farmers still like the taste of poultry in their meals…

The Hen House is a fast paced card game for 2-8 players. Each player tries to defend their Hen House while trying to stop the other players from building up their brood.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Office Life
description:
In the quick and ruthless game Office Life, you play as a randomly generated office worker, competing for the interest of a likewise randomly generated boss. Each player has three attributes, and depending on the attitude of the boss, each attribute could help you a little or a lot — or could even hurt you.

During gameplay, you play cards to improve your standing or hurt other players in a "take that"-style game. This game condenses years of underhanded office politics into just minutes of gameplay. Back stab, lie, cheat, and steal your way to the top, baby!

name: Intrigue in the Royal Court
description:
Each player represents a royal family that is attempting to influence the King or the Queen of an Ancient Kingdom in order to gain the royal favor that will make you become the next most powerfull family in the land.

In order to achieve the goal the players will have 10 (Ten) Archetypes they will use to surround the Royal Consort of their color with as much influence as possible.

The player who uses with cunning the resources at his/her disposal will be the winner.


SETUP

Each player will place his/her 10 tiles with the ACTIVE (This is the side with the banner) side up in his/her Activation Zone (Area close to the player where all the archetypes will enter play or return from play)

Place the king and the queen in the middle ground between the players in the same row with 2 spaces between them.

The game will be played in an imaginary grid with each space the size of one tile.

GAMEPLAY

Flip a coin, roll a die, find your method of convenience to choose a first player.

The game will be played in turns one player at a time. On your turn you must do the following actions:

1) PLAY A TILE from your Activation Area.

The first tile played by each player WILL NOT ACTIVATE ITS ABILITY. So it is very important you choose well which of your archetypes wont be used in the beginning of the game.

A tile played must always be adjacent to another tile (even diagonally) So you cannot place a tile anywhere in the imaginary grid.

A tile played always enters the game on the side it was in the Activation Area. So if the tile played was ACTIVE it stays with the side of the banner up and if the tile was INACTIVE it stays with the side that has a token drawn.

Consider INACTIVE tiles as protected from abilities when they are in PLAY since abilities cannot target INACTIVE tiles. It´s a very good strategy to keep this in mind because an opponent won´t be able to affect one of your INACTIVE tiles.

2) ACTIVE its ability (if possible)

Tiles that have been affected by an ability are turned to the INACTIVE SIDE (the one with the token on it). Same happens with the King and Queen.

Abilities cannot affect tiles that are in play with the INACTIVE SIDE up. This means that once a tile has been turned to the INACTIVE SIDE it´s safe on the board. It can be moved as usual by its owner but will not altered by an opponent.


3) MOVE ONE OF YOUR TILES IN PLAY ONE SPACE (diagonally or perpendicularly)

Notice that the joker has a special ability that allows you to move ONE MORE TIME after you placed it. This is a very strategical ability that can make big difference when you are trying to reposition a high influence tile on your turn or when you want to remove an opponent tile as well. Under no circumstance a tile can end up or move over another tile in the table.

When you move a tile it must always end adjacent to another tile. So you cannot move it on empty space unless it ended there due to the movement of the other tiles.


END GAME & WINNING CONDITIONS

The game will end when one of this two conditions happen:

1) One player starts his/her turn with his target consort surrounded by his own tiles (perpendicularly).

The victory is total. The more you play the less this condition is going to happen.

2) The players have played all of their tiles.

Once the players have played all of their tiles comes the scoring. For this step only the tiles that surround PERSPERNDICULARLY (up, down and sides) each royal consort will count. Add all the influence numbers in the tiles, PLUS all the tokens if there are INACTIVE tiles among them (each one is worth 1 point) MINUS the total influence on the tiles your opponent has surrounding your royal consort. Compare this numbers... the player with the most influence WINS the game. In case of a tie... you are both too smart to outwit each other :)


COMPONENTS

20 double sided tiles
1 king
1 queen
categories: Abstract Strategy, Deduction, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Detective Academy
description:
At Detective Academy, you need to pay attention to the clues being offered by the strange characters seated around the table — i.e., your fellow players — in order to guess the secret word before the other detective can.

Detective Academy plays somewhat like a multiplayer game of Password, but with two people trying to guess the secret word and everyone else giving clues. In each round, two players are the detectives; the other players look at one of the 42 puzzle cards and choose one item from the list of possibilities. These players then receive a "clue" card at random, with these cards saying things like "word", "person" or "animal". The player to the left of the detectives must give a clue matching the type of clue listed on her clue card. Each detective can make one guess at the hidden word or phrase, then the next player gives a clue, etc.

If no detective has guessed the right answer after twelve clues have been given, the round ends, no one scores, and the detective role shifts around the table. Otherwise, the detective who guessed correctly scores one point and the player who gave the clue scores two points. After everyone has been detective two or four times (depending on the number of players), whoever has the highest score wins.

name: Miscellaneous Game Patent
description:
This entry is intended to collect all games that are described in registered patents but were never actually published. Each such game will have a specific version listing under this miscellaneous game entry.

Information about each game may be found in, and added to, the version entries. If it is later discovered that a game was published, it may receive a separate game entry.

name: Battle for Fallujah: New Dawn
description:
From the Rules:

"Battle for Fallujah: New Dawn is a simple, single player game simulating the second battle for Fallujah, Iraq. The game begins on day D+1, November 8, 2004. While fighting in Fallujah continued until the end of December, this game portrays the first seven days of battle in which Coalition forces took the most territory and faced the fiercest resistance. This simulation is intended to represent a modern, urban counterinsurgency operation.

As a player, your goal is to clear Fallujah of insurgents while searching the city, block-by-block. Time is of the essence. Meanwhile, you must maintain the political will and support of both the American and Iraqi governments. You will be combating insurgents whose goal is to inflict as many casualties as possible and force American 'infidels' from their city, and eventually, country. The conflict is contained within the city of Fallujah."
mechanics: Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dominó Triangular
description:
Dominó Triangular is a 36-piece set of triangular dominoes with the numbers 0 (blank) to 4; this normally makes a 35-piece set, but a second 0-1-2 was included in the opposite handedness.

Pieces are divided as evenly as possible among the players (except in a 2-player game, where 12 are left out). The first three plays are open, but they define a "circle" of dominoes which must be played to. After that the next two dominoes played (the first of which must be adjacent to the "circle") define a new circle which must be played to, etc.

The winner is the first player to play all of their dominoes, or if no one manages this, the player with the smallest total of pips on their remaining dominoes.

name: Balamari
description: The players try to manoeuvre the fishes into the four coloured caves in the play cloth. This needs a lot of dexterity, coordination and verbal communication. Beware! The fishes have to avoid the black caves. If they swim in, the shark will eat them. Who has collected the most fish after four rounds? You – or the shark?

name: Le Jeu du loup et du Chaperon rouge
description:
Both Little Red Riding Hood and the wolf want to arrive first at grandma's house.

Little Red Riding Hood crosses the woods while picking flowers. It's a memory game.

The wolf crosses the woods with a press your luck mechanic.

First player at grandma's home wins the game.

name: BrainBox: Roald Dahl
description: The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept, and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Memory, Real-time, Trivia

name: Trivial Pursuit: Junior II
description: A subsidiary card set for use with the master game. Contains 500 cards, 3000 questions in six categories: Lands and Men, Shows, Past and Present, Arts and Letters, Sciences & Nature, Sports & Games.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia
publishers: Horn Abbot International, Parker Brothers, Parker Spiele

name: Score
description: A word dice game for 2 to 4 players. Players take turns to roll the dice and race against an hourglass to spell words for points. Similar to Challenge, it is also played on a board with double and triple spaces. Unlike Challenge, it is limited to four players.

name: Welches Tier bin ich?
description:
Have I dressed up as wolf or fox, or as stork or crow? Sixteen cards are on the table, showing children dressed up in animal constumes. In addition, there are sixteen cards showing the corresponding animals. They are in a face-down pile.

In variant for young children, each child draws a card. The first player to find the correct costume, gains the card.

Older children play a question/answer game. By asking questions like "Can you fly?" or "Are you a pet?," they attempt to guess what card the other player is holding.

name: Survival!
description:
A science fiction game published in White Dwarf (Issue 21 - Oct 1980), and was later released together with The Barbarian (a game published in a previous issue a year earlier) as one of their pocket games in Survival / The Barbarian.

Survival is a science fiction game depicting the struggle of Jardine, a crashed Scout, to reach safety. Along the trek he will meet and fight various vicious animals. While Survival is an excellent solitaire game, there are scenarios for up to six players.

name: Rive
description:
Rive is a multi-faction strategic game where the contents of your customizable deck (units, actions & battlefield manipulation cards) interact with a hex-based game board.

Designed for 2-4 players, and taking about an hour to play, Rive blends together familiar game mechanics to create a combat focused, highly replayable, deeply strategic and unique gameplay experience.

Attempt to destroy your opponent’s fortress before they destroy yours by playing a variety of different units, actions and battlefield manipulation cards from your hand. Each unit comes with a corresponding hex tile that is placed strategically on the battlefield. Utilize special powers unique to your faction and to your units to give you an edge on the battlefield all while taking advantage of dynamic game board features to block or trap other units.

name: ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino – G Zestaw
description:
ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino is an educational game for two players thanks to which memorizing facts about one of the most important battles of World War II comes incredibly easy. You learn while having a great time playing it. Players get to know selected soldiers, unit badges, weapons used in the battle and most important dates. The 133 symbols placed on the game cards were carefully selected to show the Battle of Monte Cassino in a wide international perspective emphasizing the heroic efforts of Polish as well as the allied forces. The manual and game cards are bilingual Polish-English.

ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino includes 10 cards on each of which 12 different symbols have been placed. Every two cards have a common symbol. Your job is to find and name it as fast as you can. If you don’t recognize your symbol flip your card and read the information on the other side. Then place a new card on the table and go on with the game. If you manage to name your symbol you should give your card to the other player. The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino is available in 13 collector’s versions labeled with letters from A to N. Every box is a complete game set. You can mix card sets because they always match.
categories: Card Game, Educational, World War II

name: Robotrino
description:
You're a mad scientist bent on world domination. Experiments of battle to determine the strongest Destroying robot is repeated endlessly.Pilots of the most skillful robot approaches to conquer the world.

Robotorino is trick taking game to play by a special effect cards of four and numbers cards of four. It is important to guess that you are thinking of each other.

By it is order to know who is dealt a card, it deal cards face up.

Each player is set to face down robot card and effects card.

The trick battle in the order in which it was decided in advance.

name: ArchitecTown
description:
In the small town of ArchitecTown, the wealthiest families have endeavored to build a bigger mansion than others, and they have decided to hire the best architects.

In ArchitecTown, each player will get into the skin of one of these architects. They should be as quick to catch figures center of the table and so keep the cards. But beware; should only take the correct figures or else you'll lose points!

Starting with the first player and proceeding in turn, each player will reveal the top card of your deck and leave a short time so that players can see if there is a valid combination that allows take a figure. If a player gets the correct figure to keep a card or cards that made the combination, but if making precipitated and the figure does not match, you will lose a card. The player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: Monopoly: Perth
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Perth, Australia.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Rock'em Sock'em Robots Dice Game
description:
The Rock'em Sock'em Robots Dice Game tries to emulate the fast action of the Rock'em Sock'em Robots of old, with players rolling their dice as quickly as they can to get the same face on all dice — colors or icons, depending on a flip of the match coin. Whoever does this first flips one of the opponent's face-down life markers face up. Two of these markers are blank, and the other three have hits; if all three of your hits are revealed, you lose.

If you've been hit, you can try to roll "block" on all your dice. If you do, flip one of your face-up markers face down again, then shuffle it with your remaining face-down markers.

name: Duel of the Magi
description: Duel of the Magi is a deck-building game that combines fantasy board games, drafting, and TCG fighting mechanics for a complete and unique experience. Players start by choosing one of the four magi classes, each of which have a unique ability to be used during the game. While taking turns players choose sets of spells to include or exclude in the game. Once this phase is complete, the chosen cards of each spell type are then shuffled together and placed on the board in the appropriately labeled spots. Staged face-up, the cards are drafted one at a time from the board as each player builds their own customized deck of spells. Once deck building is complete, the game board is flipped over to the dueling ground side and players engage in a spell casting fight to determine the winner. Part of the dueling strategy is gamesmanship in the form of alliances and negotiations. Do what you must to ensure you survive to the end.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: La gran carrera: Car-chís
description:
Simple Formula 1 race game.

It's the only one game published by "El taller del ocio", a little spanish publisher.

The player attempts to complete the circuit, overcoming obstacles in race, trying to make your team add more points than opponents or come first.

It is a game of rolling dice and move forward with some obstacles and a penalty die.

name: Tabula
description:
Made entirely of wood and designed to be self-contained, Tabula is its own box. The game closes in on itself to become an sleek tabula, "tablet" in Latin. The name Tabula also comes from "Tabula Rasa", meaning "blank slate" - the board starts as a blank slate that then becomes filled with the tiles.

Tabula is a a simple turn-based strategy game in which the objective is to occupy the most spaces of the board. In this game, each player has access to four different type of special tiles that have unique abilities: Attack, Defense, Expansion, Jump. The game-play consists of playing either 1 special tile or two regular tiles (that have no abilities). The game ends when all the spaces of the board have been filled. Whoever has the most tiles is the winner.

Not only is this game a source of tremendous fun, but also is a beautiful aesthetic addition to the home.

name: Killer Croquet
description:
Killer Croquet is a thematic arena board game with tactical positioning, risk management, and multiple paths to victory. Fast paced and strategic, Killer Croquet is quick to learn and dramatic enough to match it's absurd theme.

6 Six of the Worlds Greatest Croquet Players have been kidnapped by a Shadow Organization known as the Pall Mall. Take on the role of an ex-soviet super spy, a time traveling steampunk cyborg, or the nordic God of Thunder as you play for the highest of stakes: your lives.

In Killer Croquet, you control a player piece and a ball piece. You get two actions on you turn that can be split up between moving, hitting your ball, and hitting the other players. When you move you can choose to move to your ball or 3 spaces in any direction. When you hit your ball, you choose a direction and a strength and then roll custom dice to see how far the ball goes: Softly (1,1,1,2,2,3), Fairly (1,3,4,5,6,8), or Wicked Hard (Both dice added together)

Pass your ball through each wicket in the correct order and direction and hit the ending post to gain the "Poison" Power Boost. Afterwards, pass your ball through the wickets in the reverse order and direction and hit the start post to win the game. Or simply knock enough players down to win.

name: Amontillado
description:
A burning torch falls upon the damp rock of the crypt where you, Fortunato, are now trapped after being lured with the promise of Amontillado. As Montresor forces the final stone into place, there is a faint ring of metal hitting the floor. Now you face a race against time to find the key that Montresor dropped inside your tomb before the air runs out.

This is a solitaire game with memory as the main mechanic. As you search for the two key tiles, you must balance your other traits as best you can in order to give yourself the best chance to escape and survive. The only additional components needed would be markers for each trait category and to track your movement on the tiles.

name: Off World Colonies
description:
In the early 21st century the Rytell Corporation created the first androids, vat-grown, speed aged, altered humans with a shortened lifespan. These androids, and the cheap disposable labor they represented paved the way for the exploration of space and Earth’s first “Off World Colonies”. Mining corporations soon began to exploit the riches of the asteroid belt between the orbits of Mars and Jupiter. In Off World Colonies players pilot mining ships in the asteroid belt finding resources needed for a depleted, desperate Earth. Players will use androids for labor and defensive armies on their mining claims. Beware the new generation of Androids - Naxos 7 - resent their lower class status and have begun to revolt.

Off World Colonies is a game for 1 to 3 players lasting 20-30 minutes.

Players have 3 action points (AP) to spend each turn in the game (in a 2 or 3 player game, the 2nd and 3rd player each get one additional AP for their first turn). Players may earn more APs as the game progresses.

A player can land on an asteroid, orbit the comet or dock at PKD Station and remain there for multiple turns if they desire. Only one player may mine any one asteroid at any one time. Multiple players may be orbit the comet or be docked at PKD Station.

On a player’s turn they may do one or more of the following, spending their AP:


Stake a Claim
Mine an Asteroid
Refuel
Refine Fuel
Defense
Claim Jump
Attack
Process Resources
Buy Upgrades


During the game androids are blind drawn from the game bag by players. If all players have completed a single turn and none have purchased any androids during that time, the first player must blind draw an android from the game bag and place it on PKD station.

Once all the number of white Naxos 7 Androids have been drawn from the bag (3 - 1 player, 4 - 2p, 5 - 3p), the androids begin their revolt and take over the asteroids and the comet, preventing players from using them.

The game ends when a specific number of tiles have been flipped over either due to being mined out or take over by the Naxos 7 Androids.

For 1 player = 5 tiles
For 2 players = 6 tiles
For 3 players = 7 tiles

The player with the highest number of credits is the winner. In the case of a tie, the player with the greatest number of androids (in the Cryopod and on any asteroids) is the winner.
categories: Exploration, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Commodity Speculation, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: Byzantium
description:
The Designer Website:

Byzantium is a card game for 1, 2, 3, or 4 players. It can thus play as a form of solitaire, or as a competitive game, depending upon how many wish to be involved. Players take turns in placing cards on the table forming an elaborate hierarchy that must obey a few strict rules. The aim is to place all of your cards, while preventing your opponents from doing so.

Use two suits from a deck of playing cards, one red, one black. Place an Ace in the centre of the table, and place the other Ace crossed over it. Shuffle the other 24 cards.

Connecting Cards:
The main gameplay consists of connecting cards to form hierarchies. To connect a card in your hand to one in the tableau, the following conditions must be met:
1. It must not overlap any of the cards in the tableau.
2. It must not touch any card other than the one it is connecting to.
3. Its short side must be placed flush against a side of the card in the tableau.
4. The touching sides must touch in their centres.
5. The two cards must be of the same colour.
6. It must be at most three cards distant from the Aces. (It must connect to the Aces, or connect to a card that connects to the Aces, or connect to a card that connects to a card that connects to the Aces.)
7. A single hierarchy (a tree of cards connected to the the Aces) cannot contain both ascending sequences of cards and descending sequences of cards.

name: Strike Legion: Planetary Operations
description:
Planetary Operations combat takes place at a higher command echelon than its ‘tactical’ game counterpart. Each vehicle or
troop stand in Planetary Operations represents a company or large detachment of troops, with units representing battalions with attached support units. The Strike Legion ‘tactical’ game uses a 1:1 representation for troops, with each vehicle representing one vehicle.
The tactical game emphasizes the differences between the quality and technology of opposing troops, and focuses on action involving forces from company to reinforced battalion strength on each side. Planetary Operations places more emphasis on the effects of a more efficient and intelligent command structure, and players can easily field entire divisions of troops and play
games to a conclusion in a couple of hours.

name: Badlands
description:
Players take the role of powerful Dons in the post-apocalyptic western city of Prosperity. They send their family members, or minions, to do their bidding and accomplish important tasks for the family. Players compete against each other to become the most prestigious family by rebuilding the city, defending from raiders, and outsmarting their opponents.

Badlands is a game involving simultaneous selection of actions, represented by minions cards, which can each be used up to once a round. These actions are taken in the order specified on the cards, and interact with each other in a way that provides players with strong opportunities for counter-play. The key to success is being able to predict which actions your opponents will select and profiting from them.
categories: American West, Card Game, City Building, Deduction
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Open Drafting, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Galactic Hegemony
description:
OverviewGalactic Hegemony is a solitaire "4X" game of galactic domination.

The game is played on a randomly generated hex map galaxy board.

Each turn player gains resources from colonised planets which are then used to move their spacecraft, colonise new planets, build infrastructure and crush rebellion.

Originally an entry in the "2014 Solitaire Print and Play Contest"



Files (version 1.2)Due to BGG file size restrictions you will find the PnP files below


Rules 1.2
Rules 1.2 in booklet form
Full Colour Components 1.2
Low Ink Components 1.2
Deluxe Components 1.2 (Cards/boards have backs, larger planet hexes suitable for A3 GalacticMap)
Deluxe Galactic Map 1.2 suitable for A3 printing
categories: Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Monopoly: Offenbach am Main
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Offenbach, in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Air Desa
description: A educational game used in development work in rural Indonesia. The game helps players to experience the holistic life value difference of living with clean water in a village instead of river water. Mechanics are simple, but players are challenged to overcome obstacles of finance, education, and enjoyment while dealing with life-threatening illnesses.
categories: Economic, Educational, Farming, Medical, Print & Play

name: Machine of Death: The Game of Creative Assassination – Death by Genre
description:
150 themed death cards, featuring: 25 Space; 25 Noir; 25 Pirate; 25 Adventure, and 50 Pestilence & Plague. This contains all three themed decks that were previously only available separately.

Machine of Death: The Game of Creative Assassination is a storytelling game set in a world in which a machine can predict how a person will die with 100% accuracy with only a small blood sample. However, the machine delights in being vague and twisted. A card reading "Old Age" could mean you die in your sleep at age 120, or it could mean you're run over tomorrow by an elderly driver who forgot to take his pills today. Players of the game take the role of assassins, who must use the various tools at their disposal -- from storytelling to a slew of items available from specialty Black Market shops -- to create a situation in which a target is killed in a way in line with their Death Prediction. The Machine of Death Game uses this basic idea, of assassins working in a world were cause of death is known to create various game modes.

The General Gameplay of most modes works like this:

A target is assigned, and given certain details (including Death Prediction, and possibly extra details like a favourite food or crippling phobia).
Players – assassins – are given Black Market Gift Cards. This is their inventory, what they have to use in order to accomplish their goal: killing the target.
Players use the Gift Cards to devise a plan.
The plan is greenlit, either by a Chief player, or via consensus, depending on game mode.
The timer starts and the plan is put into action. This is represented by dice rolling to beat a "difficulty score." An unlikely plan hinging on a single item may need to roll a 6 for that item, but a rock-solid intricate plan may need to only roll a 2 for all Black Market Gift Cards used.
The plan is revised, in case of failure of one or more dice rolls. The details of this portion vary greatly from mode to mode, but involve either replacing Black Market Items, creating a new viable plan with the existing items, or calling in "Specialists"
The target is either killed or escapes. Again, depending on mode, this is either the end of the round or the game.


Game Modes:

Head-to-Head Mode that's very similar to Cards Against Humanity or Apples to Apples. There's a judge ("the Chief"), who decides whose assassination plan is the best, and gives them a chance to try it out. Designed for 4+ playes.
Co-op Mode, where you players are a team of assassins, and have to come up with a plan together to kill targets that the group comes up with.
Co-op can be diced further: you can play individual rounds, or Mission Mode, where targets are predetermined and have different levels of difficulty. There's also the more strategic Chief Mode, where there's no timer, but the Chief can rate your plan's likelihood of success and let you take risks on whether it'll work or not.


Cutthroat Mode, where players can actually assassinate each other (should you want a more competitive version)
The Day Off Mode, which isn't about murder at all but rather draws upon your bevy of assassin skills to accomplish tasks like "opening a stuck jam jar" and "transplanting a tulip bulb."

name: Explore Canada
description:
'Explore Canada' is a family board game that tests your knowledge of Canada and allows you to learn more facts about trivia items that you do know.

Explore Canada's questions and tasks are easy enough for school age children and parents alike.

On each turn, you spin and pick up a card. The cards will ask 1 -2 questions or provide instructions on moving your game piece. The person who moves their game piece all around the board and back to their starting spot will win the game.

From the publisher's website:
What is Canada's longest river? What city was nicknamed Pile of Bones? Why did Terry Fox attempt to run across Canada? Explore the people and places that make Canada such a fascinating and diverse country. Learn facts about both the geography of Canada and its rich historical past. Activity cards keep everyone amused and having fun, while knowledge cards help kids learn. Additional facts are included on the cards to make the topics more interesting.

Parlez-vous francais? Did you know that you can "Explore Canada" in both Enlgish and French? It's a bilingual game! All the contents and instructions are proudly written in both official languages of Canada.

name: Nerf
description:
Nerf is a children's card game, part of the "Shuffle" line of games.

There are two types of cards; Target Cards and Dart Cards. The game involves matching the colors of the top Dart card from your deck to one of the Target cards on the table. It is a game of speed, just like the classic game of Snap.

Each target card has a point value and the winner is the person who scores the most from matching their Dart cards with Target cards.

An App is available, with extra gameplay & quickstart.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Combinatorial Climber
description:
This is a cooperative and combinatorial (perfect information, and no luck after the initial deal) climbing game for 2 players, that is also playable solitaire and has a competitive variant. In the game, players alternate turns drafting cards from a 5 by 4 grid of cards regular playing cards face up, with players taking cards from the lower part of the grid first, revealing other cards.

After each player has drafted 10 cards, play begins. Players attempt to play a single card, or a set of cards, each one must succeed the prior one played with a higher value, or greater amount of cards. Players then score points based upon how long of a run their last play was, with points lost for cards left in hands. Players also have jokers that act as wild cards, used to complete the going out in a single run.

The solitaire version works like the 2 player version, but a player plays both sides.

There is also a competitive version that utilizes the same drafting mechanism, but tweaks how cards are played.

name: Cards Against Humanity: PAX Prime 2014 Panel Pack
description: Cards Against Humanity held a panel at PAX Prime 2014 where they took submissions from the audience and either wrote them down or mocked them. The 10 best ideas were submitted to a printer immediately, and all panel attendees could pick up this special set before the end of the convention. It includes 5 white cards and 5 black cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Super Sea Battle
description:
An electronic version of the classic Battleship game.
The main difference between this game and regular Electronic Battleship / Electronic Sea Battle, is the inclusion of land vehicles alongside the regular navel vessels. These land vehicles have a very different shape when compared to the naval vessels and thus have their own unique limitations of placement on the board.

Other features:

electronic setup and targeting
player-versus-CPU mode
Salvo fire mode (fire 5 shots at once)
Live-action mode (be the first to respond to a signal to earn the right to fire a shot)

name: Vermeer Spel
description: Vermeer Spel is a promotional Monopoly-like game developed by Identity Games in commission of the Vermeer Groep (projects in construction and infrastructure). Players try to earn money by realizing building projects. A project can be realized if both development card and realization card for that particular project are in use. Cooperation is important as these cards can be in use by different players when realizing a project. Additional money can be earned by players if an opponent lands on their building project already realized. If all construction sites are built up, the game ends. The player who owns most money at that moment wins the game.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Smoke and Travel
description:
The first board game of it’s kind

Welcome to 'Smoke and Travel: the weed traffic game'.
Risky business, luxury life, excitement, competition, friendship and strategy.
You will have an unforgettable time together with your friends.
Just like the real world, but no crime and no prohibitions, so… no police.

Let see who can accomplish their mission first and can call himself ‘Backer of the game’.

Smoke and Travel it’s gonna blow your mind.

name: Auge um Auge
description:
In Auge um Auge ("Eye for an Eye"), each player controls a six-member gang that wants to hand out eight black eyes before any other gang can do so.

In the dice brawls that take place, any gang can support any other — but of course each gang is interested only in its own victory, so don't rely too much on the support of others. In the event of a tie in terms of which gangs have delivered the most black eyes, the gang with the fewer black eyes of its own wins.

name: Spendit! Now You're a Millionaire
description:
2 to 6 players start the game in Hawaii with a private jet and $20 Million in cash. Players roll dice to determine movement options and attempt circumnavigate the globe on a 26 x 16 map-grid, visiting major cities in each continent.

At each city, players can purchase investments that will either grow their wealth or induce bankruptcy. They can also punish their opponents by forcing them to distant corners of the globe or by performing hostile takeovers of their investments.

The game ends when one player has visited each major city and has returned to Hawaii. Players add up their cash, investments, and other bonuses. The greatest net worth wins!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Stock Holding

name: Zauberer Malefix
description:
The second that Malefix the Sorcerer goes away on a trip, his apprentices secretly explore his enormous book of magic spells! All of the pages are blank upon first glance, but soon enough the sorcerers put the pens to good use by starting to paint! The sorcerer's apprentices take turns guessing what is being painted. This is harder than it seems because the whole picture is covered up by bookmarks at the beginning, so the fastest and most imaginative apprentice will be the first one to guess the picture correctly.

In Zauberer Malefix, the players paint a picture on their easel where the other players can't see it, then they take turns putting their pictures in the magic book while the other players have to guess what they have painted. This is harder than it seems because the whole picture is at first covered up by bookmarks. The bookmarks are gradually unfolded according to how the die is rolled. More and more bits of the picture become visible depending on the roll of the die. The first player to guess the picture correctly receives points, and the less of the picture they can see, the more points they earn. The aim of the game is to be the first player to score the required number of points depending on the number of players.

name: Murder Party à Manhattan
description:
Murder Party à Manhattan is a crime investigation boardgame for 1 to 16 players.

The players are plying either alone or in teams. Each team stands for an official police or law enforcement department : NYPD, NY State Police, FBI, NSA.

The game is turn based. It plays on a map of Manhattan. At your turn, chose where you want to move your pawn to, following the subway lines available. Each move costs points. Depending on where you stop, you open the enveloppe related to this point, that is for example the interrogation of a witness or suspect, or other information that you get in order to solve a case.

At your turn, you can also stop the game instead of moving. In this case, all teams must write down their conclusions, and then open the "Solution" enveloppe.

For each good answer, you get points. For each false anwser, you lose points. If you stopped the game, you get a bonus. If you used the most transportation points, you get a malus.

The player or team with the most points wins the game!

name: Dragoneye Tavern
description:
Dragoneye Tavern is a casual game set in the Fantasy world of Askrias for 2~4 players, and of all ages. Players play a role of an adventurer, enjoying the night in the taverns after their adventures, but of course drinking and eating everyday is not the only thing they do! So, grab a seat and experience one of the favorite game among the adventurers in Dragoneye Tavern and the whole of Askrias.

Players will take control of a Character, and equip themselves with Shard abilities from the ability decks, and play in a fantasy version of Poker Dice with other players! The game comes with 20 custom dice and 72 game cards.

Each player's main goal is to earn the most shards, but this is no ordinary game, everyone knows that, dirty tricks are always used when played in a Tavern! During the game each player will be able to use their tricks to disrupt other players from getting the best hands, but at the same time they will be doing the same to you! So, never play fair, and use your wits to be the best!

name: The Med
description:
(from the introduction:)

The Med is a simulation of the campaign in the Eastern Mediterranean during the years between 1940 and 1943. It is a complex simulation of the same order as FITE/SE. But with experience, an extensive Europa library and this package, you can simulate the strategic alternatives open to the Italian Commando Supremo from the entry of Italy into the war through the three years to the point at which the Allies were poised to invade. As might be expected, initiative rests largely with the Axis. The British/Allied side remains on the strategic defensive until late in the game. While it can be played two-player, a better game ensues with multiple players on each side with different players for ground/air and naval commands. Operational commands, such as the Balkans, Levant, Iraq and East Africa, provide opportunities for temporary commanders to participate within the larger campaign. [...]

Most components used in The Med are available in the published GDW aka GR/D games

A. Counters Available.
Marlta Merkur - German Army, Luftwaffe, Yugoslavs, Greeks, Italian 2nd 9th 11th armies
Western Desert - British Army, RAF, Italians in Libya, DAK, Vichy in Levant, Commonwealth forces
The Near East - Egyptians, Iraquis, Iranians, Turks
Fire in the East - Rules and Combat tables, modified
Their Finest Hour - Some British naval counters, naval gunnery chart
Torch - Americans, Vichy in N.Africa, Italian armor
S8T, issue #128 - Italian East Africa, British African units

B. Maps Required. The maps of the region which are essential for play are:
14, 15A - Marita Merkur [Yugoslavia & Greece]
18, 19 - Western Desert [Lybia & Egypt]
24, 25 - Torch [Morocco, Algeria & Tunisia]
20, 21, 22 - The Near East [Palestine, Iraq, Iran & Turkey]
26, 27 - Unavailable-use sketch in this pack [Italy, which is on Second Front maps, published after this module]

The following maps may be ignored if both USSR and Turkey are excluded from play, which was the historic case:
