3B, 4A - Fire in the East [Southern USSR]
9A - Scorched Earth [Southern USSR]


Contents:


Rules (24 pages)
Allied, Axis and Neutral Order of Battle (27 pages)
Tables (2 pages)
Strategic Display (1 British, 1 Italian - 2 pages)
Ship Status Charts (Britain: 6 pages - others: 1 page - Italy: 3 pages)
6 Port Charts (6 pages)
2 Task Composition chart (2 identical pages)
Italy sketch map (1 page)
Air Units Counters (2 pages)

name: Zitadelle
description:
(from the introduction:)

Operation Citadel was the name given by the Wehrmacht to their summer offensive against the Soviets in 1943. Zitadelle is a simulation of that strategic turning point of the Second World War on the Russian Front. This came to be the final major campaigning season for the Wehrmacht before the growing might of Soviet arms became overwhelming. Within the scope of the Europa series of simulations from GDW. Zitadelle attempts to allow gamers to explore the military possibilities open to both sides using components largely available. A number of major additions to the standard Fire in the east / Scorched earth (FITE/SE) rule set have been made, most of which should be seen as experimental and considered optional by anyone playing the scenario.
These include:

Operational headquarters for armies/fronts
Attack supply effects.
Special effects for German non-div. mot. and Soviet cavalry
Limited intelligence rules
Completely revised air system. using the same counters
Complete optional naval system



Contents:


Rules (18 pages)
Axis and Soviet Order of Battle (13 pages)
Army/Corps display (Axis: 3 pages - Soviet Union: 5 pages)
Ship Status Charts (Soviet Union: 2 pages)
3 Port Charts (3 pages)
1943 Front line maps (2 pages)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Merry Go Round
description:
In the game you play as a Carousel animal who wants to escape the Merry Go Round and become a free animal. the winner is the first to reach the exit on the board and the freedom of the outside world.

The game is made of 3 phases.

phase 1:
in each turn you get 5 movement tickets and 2 special cards. You now plan haw to move. you can play 3 movement tickets and 1 special ticket each turn. Each tickets allow you to move one coloured tile, in the colour of the movement ticket. When you are in front of a coloured tile corosponding to your carousel animal, you can move down.

phase 2: Here the carousel will spin, each circle of the carousel spin one tile clockwise.

Phase 3: now you carry out your planned movement, you move all of your planned movement at once. Each player does this by turn.

name: King's Pouch: Painter & Physician Promo Cards
description:
Two promo character cards for King's Pouch:

The Painter gives victory points depending on the number of citizen colors in the active area.
The Physician assumes the role of any other character during the Great Council.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Clocks: "Silver" Dice
description:
Two extra dice, silver plated, limited to 200 sets, with the following rules:
"Yellow dice increase the tension in the auction: You can replace the yellow dice with the metal-plated dice and add both of the yellow dice to the bag at the beginning of the game.
This is only recommended with 3 or 4 players.
When a yellow die is pulled out of the bag, it is immediately removed from the game.
Therfore, for each yellow die pulled from the bag, there will be one less group of dice created for that particular auction (and two groups fewer if the two yellow dice come out at the same time).

There also are sets of 2 "Copper" dice, limited to 300, and sets of "Aluminum", limited to 400.

name: Flat Cube
description:
Flat Cube is a solo card game consisting of six cards with a picture of half a coloured cube on each side, which will form a whole cube when placed next to the correct side of another card.

The player shuffles the cards then places them face up in a row. The aim of the game is to make all the cards line up with matching cubes (except for the two on either end, which will only match on one side).

In order to do this, the player must pull two (and only two) side-by-side cards out from the row and move them to an available slot — either on one end or in a space created by moving two previous cards. Continue doing this until the objective is complete, leaving no spaces and moving only two cards at any one time.

name: microulette
description: microulette is a single card nano game. Each round, players take turns pushing their luck to collect points by rolling the dice and placing bet tokens. The results of two of the three dice are added together. If the player has placed a token on the number that matches that value, the player scores points associated with that spot. Other spots on the card allow the players to mitigate their luck by modifying the outcome of the dice rolls.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck

name: PirateBay
description:
Your story - your rules!

Rumors tell of a legendary pirate treasure. In the small tavern "Pirate Bay" several treasure hunters have gathered on their hunt for fame, rum and gold. Together, alone or in ever changing teams they will try to reach their goal. But beware: betrayal and deceit lurk on every corner. Who will find the pirate treasure? Who will survive its discovery? And how can the hunters leave the island again? Make your own story and see for yourself what happens.

Pirate bay is a narrative card game in the Mini Story series by Noris Spiele. Cards determine their role, their relations to each other and their secret goals. A game last over five rounds, after which the winner(s) are identified as related to their goals.
mechanics: Hand Management, Role Playing, Storytelling, Trading

name: Play Rugby XV
description:
Play Rugby is a rugby game. Players move their pawn on the board using action cards. Some actions require a dice roll to succeed. If you fail, the ball is lost. You can also rob the ball from the opponent using an action card.

Lineout, scrum, drop, penalty... all of rugby is in the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Terra Schnupperspiel
description:
Terra Schnupperspiel is a promotional, mini version of
Terra.

Terra is a 2014 reimplementation of Fauna; both are educational, trivia-type games, designed by Friedeman Friese.

Terra Schnupperspiel was given for free with any purchase, at the HUCH & friends booth at Spiel '14 in Essen. It was only available in German.

name: Go-Rilla
description:
A part of Milton Bradley's "T.H.I.N.G.S." series, players try to roll barrels across the bridge while Go-Rilla raises and lowers it.

From the box:
Can your roll the barrels to safety before time runs out?

Push the explorer's button. A barrel will roll out of his backpack and onto the rocking, rattling bridge.

Keep pushing the button to roll out the barrels. Will they roll safely into the cabin - or get knocked off the bridge?

When the timer stops Go-Rilla pops the bridge open! How many barrels made it into the cabin?

name: Bugsy
description:
Roll the dice to find out your animal colour combination, and try to find it among the tiles which are spread on the table. Once you find your tile, mark it for yourself and move closer to victory. The winner is the one who first is able to place all of his markers.
Contains three different game versions. A fun game to test the speed of the players' reactions. Comes with great, colourful game parts.

name: Kul genom Sverige
description:
Travel through Sweden to become the first to reach the goal, and thereby win the game.
But be carefull! Landing on an orange spot can be good or bad news for you (move to another place or wait some turns). And if you land on a red place you take one of the 24 Chance cards - this is the same as an orange, but more random.

An exciting drive through Sweden, with a lot of local informations. Family game - also for the little ones.

name: Sjov Gennem Danmark
description:
Travel through Denmark to become the first to reach the goal and thereby be declared the winner.
But be carefull! Landing on an orange spot can be good or bad news for you (move to another place or wait some turns). If you land on a red place you take one of the 24 Chance cards, which is random and unforseen; it could be good - but it could also be bad!.

An exciting drive through Denmark. Family game also for the little ones.

name: Davy Jones' Poker
description:
From the Davy Jones' Poker English rules page:

Yo-ho-ho! Are there three of you here? Okay, let's gamble! Each of you take out two of something as chips for betting. The chips can be anything...candies, toys, coins, stones, etc. Who loves the ocean most between you three? He becomes the first dealer. Shuffle all cards well, and deal one card to each player. Do not show your card to anyone. Put the remaining card face down at the center of the table.

The first turn goes to the player to the right of the dealer and continues counter-clockwise. The active player decides to either PARLAY (trade cards with the player to their right) or KEEP (keep their currently held card). The next player does the same. If the third player chooses PARLAY, they change cards with the remaining card in the center of the table.

After each player has had one chance to PARLAY or KEEP, a countdown...3, 2, 1...is shouted and everyone reveals their card at the same time. The highest numbered card wins UNLESS both the 3 Card and the 0 Card have been revealed. In this case, reverse the order and the lowest numbered card wins! The player with the weakest card pays a chip to the center of the table.

Play more rounds until one player is out of chips. After that, the dealer deals 1 card to each player and 2 cards in a stack, face down to the center of the table. If a player chooses to PARLAY, they replace their card with the top card in the stack at the center of the table. Continue playing rounds until only one player remains and is declared the winner!

name: Blocky Mountains: Starting Player Route Card
description:
The Starting Player Route Card for Blocky Mountains was first released as a PDF available for download from the publisher's website. This card is intended to be used as a more fun, thematic, and prowess-showing way of determining the start player.

Setup
The illustration on the card depicts blocks with and without numbers. The non-numbered blocks are the basic setup, but by adding the numbered gray blocks, you can increase the difficulty to level 2 or 3 (this is clearly depicted on the back of the card).

Play

First, all players simultaneously bid by showing fingers from their fist equal to the skill level each thinks she can complete. Then, the player who has shown the highest level (e.g., three fingers = difficulty level 3), has one attempt at the appropriate route.
If the player masters the route, she takes the white route marker and becomes the starting player on the route map. If she fails, she takes the last position in turn order, followed by the player with the next lower difficulty level, etc.


Very important: If several players have shown the same number of fingers, then whichever of them is first to shout, “Trapper,” is the one who must face the challenge. If there's still a tie, then whoever shouts “Grizzly” first takes the challenge!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, Expansion for Base-game

name: California Spit
description:
From Wikipedia:

Also known as Super-spit in Wisconsin, Spit 2 in Texas, Rush in Missouri, and Spit 3 in Kentucky,[citation needed] California Spit is a fast paced shedding card game that has the added bonus of shuffling the deck.

The two players sit at opposite sides of a vertical playing surface. The dealer deals half of the cards to each player. The cards are held face down. Every round, each player plays four cards face up vertically in between both players and slightly closer to themselves. Once both players have done this, they look for two or more cards having the same number. When a player finds one, he places another card on top of the cards with that number until all of the cards with the common number are covered. In other words if there are three fours out then all three cards can get a new card on top of it. If a four is played on top of a four it is called a double, and the player may place a third card on top of it. This requires that players pay attention to the cards they are laying down on the pile. If a player runs out of cards then that player wins. When there are no more groups of cards remaining, each player scoops up the four piles directly in front of him or her and places them face down on the bottom of his or her deck. That round ends and the next begins.

In some versions of the game, there is a move called "spitting" in which the player is allowed to spit on the other player to distract him/her. It is common that they call "doubles" to inform the other player what they did. ment for {21+ age} a longer period of time usually 3 hours is the min, and 4 is the max.

name: Pirates Enjoy Math (Don't Say Arrrrrrithmetic)
description:
Pirates Enjoy Math (Don't Say Arrrrrrithmetic) is a micro card game for 2-4 players in which players use math and the Order of Operations to try to become the pirate with the most Loot.

The game consists of two rounds per hand and as many hands as players would like (recommended play is first to 29 points). The first round is a card drafting phase where players try to build a Crew that will help them get the Loot. The second round is where players use their Crew to create a mathematical formula that will get them closest to the Loot Value. The winner gains the Loot, plus each player has a chance to earn Bonus Loot based on the cards they play.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Math, Pirates, Print & Play

name: Gav'Gamelle
description:
Hungry puppies want to eat.

There are food bowl for 4 puppies what starting to rise up if You pull from the bone and the dog food (balls in 4 colors) come over the edge. Players are trying to catch the most food with their dog hammers to be the winner.

name: Big Easy Business
description:
In Big Easy Business, 2-4 players are aspiring business moguls in New Orleans buying up businesses and attracting tourists in order to prove their savvy and best the competition. They must compete to buy and utilize nightclubs, popular restaurants, tourist attractions, trinket shops, street bands, and more.

Players begin the game as one of several possible businesses, all with unique abilities. During a round, custom dice are rolled to create the action pool for all players. As players take their turns, they select a die for its action and execute it. Depending on what you choose, you'll be attracting tourists or cashing them out, buying new businesses (with new abilities), hiring new employees, etc. Combine that with blocking opponents out of actions, taking advantages of citywide events, and playing in a high-stakes poker game using the tableau you build...and you have Big Easy Business.

name: Alles Banane!
description:
Fishing, trumpet playing, washing hands: all of these things can be a lot easier to explain with a banana in hand.

The gist of Alles Banane! is simple: Cards that show various activities are laid out on the table, then one player pantomimes one of these activities with the help of a yellow wooden banana. Everyone tries to guess what the active player is doing by placing their player chip on the corresponding card.

name: Do You Know Shakespeare?
description:
Increase your knowledge of Shakespeare and his literary works by playing this fun trivia game. Vote for the correct answers and win some Shillings along the way!

Place your color book pawns next to answers you believe are true. Receive a Shilling for each positive point you earn by selecting a true answer. The player with the most shillings after five rounds wins!

name: 貧乏陶芸家 (Binbou-Tougeika)
description:
User summary:

Poor Potter is the English name given to the Japanese game 貧乏陶芸家 (Binbou-Tougeika) by the game designer Taiki Shinzawa.

The players are a group of young potters, who, due to poverty, can't afford the clay to produce pottery works. Under the circumstances, you show the plan of your upcoming work to solicit clay from other potters, and the player who has supplied the highest amount of clay can receive the work. The produced work may be worthless now, but its value is sure to rise in 10 years time.

Players bid on pottery work cards by the weight of the clay they supply, and the player who earns the highest score by adding the points for the clay and cards wins. An electronic scale is provided as a component of the game and used to weigh the clay, as the precise weights matter to the result.

Designer's summary:
"あなたたちは若き陶芸家です。ですが貧乏なので陶芸を作る粘土もありません。なのでこんな陶芸を作りますという企画を出して材料の粘土を仲間に出してもらいます。そうして出来た陶芸は粘土を出してくれた仲間にあげます。いまは価値の無い陶芸ですが、10年後には立派な値になっていることでしょう。
粘土をお金に重量で、オークショナーが出した陶芸カードを競って、集めていきます。ゲーム終了時にもらった粘土とカードの得点を合計して最も高い人がゲームに勝利します。重量の判定には電子ばかりを使用します。"

name: Pit, such mit!
description:
In the playground, on the building site, on the farm, at the fire station, important things suddenly go missing. Help Pete put things back where they belong!

Pit, such mit! is a children's game teaching the matching of items with their correct environment.

At the beginning of the game, each player receives tokens representing various items that match one of the four board sections. On a player's turn, he rolls a die and moves Pete around the board that many spaces. He then checks to see if any of his items match the section he lands on, such as a fire hose at the fire station, or a shovel at the building site.

The first player to place all of his items wins!

name: Fakespeare
description:
Invent fake endings to real Shakespeare quotes! Great fun for fans of the Bard and ignorant buffoons alike.

We invented Fakespeare one evening when we meant to play Dictionary but picked up a Shakespeare anthology instead. The game evolved as the night went until we were crying with laughter. We knew we were onto something great and decided to make it into a game that we could share with others - thus Fakespeare was born.

name: Presidents Poker
description:
Did you know that nine U.S. Presidents didn't attend college? Or that six Presidents were born in Ohio, more than any other state? And that one President was stopped for a speeding ticket while riding a horse?

In Presidents Poker, players assemble a hand of President cards with the Presidents that have the most in common, including names, birthplace, college attended, number of children, height, and hair color. Each President card also has a fun fact about that President so that these historical figures really come to life. Chips are included for those who like to bet.

name: Melee in the Mines
description:
Melee in the Mines is a print-and-play microgame that pits two players against one another. The dwarves’ silver mine has cut into the tunnels of a monster lair, and now a band of adventurers is fighting for their lives in the narrow confines of the mine against a band of monsters. Each player starts with 7 of 18 characters (18 Monsters or 18 Adventurers). The winner is the party that drives the other from the mine!

Only the first character in each party can use hand-to-hand combat. Other party members can use ranged weapons or special attacks -- provided they have a clear line-of-sight over their companions’ heads. In these tight quarters, jostling for position is important. It’s great to have your troll at the head of your party, given his strength, but then no one behind him can see past him to use a ranged attack. If your halfling is at the front, everyone taller can fire over him, but he himself won’t be doing much damage.

Each turn you can either battle (roll 2 six-sided dice) or take an action (see below) and attack with 1 die. Each die roll is assigned to a character whose abilities match that roll – each card has die faces on it, with corresponding attacks: 1 = Rush, 2 = Strike, 3 = Panic, 4 = Fell, 5 = Do, 6 = Kill.

You can download the 4-page PDF from the Files section. You will need two 6-sided dice.

This game was created for the 2015 BGG Microgame Prototype Design Competition.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: 1, 2, 3 bunter Papagei
description:
Craok! Croak!
Colorful parrots are waiting to fill their plumage with chips of the correct color which can be found in the eggs.
The player who completes his parrot with all the color chips first, has won the game.
Have fun with this thrilling seeking/searching game!

How to play:
At your turn you take an egg and open it.
Hopefully you will find a chip that isn't already on your board.
If this is the case, you can add it to the board.
If not, you put the chip back into the egg and withdraw it with the other eggs. Then it's the next players turn.
The first player who has filled his board with all colored chips has won the game.

name: Masters of Disguise
description:
In Masters of Disguise, players are spies playing and collecting different Spy Gear to add to their Spy Set, and trying to discover the identity of their opponents. This face-up set of Spy Gear cards can score points for that spy, but it can also elude to that spy's true identity! Once you think you know the Identity of another spy, you can make a guess to potentially unmask that spy...but look out, unmasked spies can fight back!

At the beginning of each round, players are given a secret Spy ID card that lets that player know which five Spy Gear cards (of 12 different Spy Gear cards) they are able to score with.

Each turn, spies draw a card from the Spy Gear deck, then play a card to their face-up Spy Set. Once they have added a new card to their Spy set, they must do one of three things:
• Swap any card in their Spy Set for any card in another's set.
• Destroy one of their own Spy Gear cards from their set to use it's ability.
(This can be asking other spies questions, or increasing their own score.)
• Guess the Identity of another spy.
(Add points to your total for correct guesses, and subtract points if incorrect)

If you are incorrect with your guess, you do not eliminate yourself.
If you are discovered, you are considered "unmasked".

Unlike many other elimination games, Masters of disguise doesn't REALLY eliminate players. unmasked spies can still swap spy gear cards around the table, and make guesses on other spies, so "eliminated" spies are still engaged throughout each round.

The player with the least total points between rounds will be the first player of each new round.

Rounds end when there is one undiscovered spy remaining. The player with the most points at the end of three rounds is the Master of Disguise!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Naruto Sugoroku
description:
Naruto Sugoroku is a roll-and-move game that was included as a tear-out insert in the Shonen Jump Naruto Collector magazine for Winter 2007/2008. This game is loosely based on the traditional Chinese/Japanese game Sugoroku.

In this game, players choose a character from the Naruto manga and then roll a die to move their characters along a track. Some spaces have instructions that only affect one character--other characters may ignore the instructions. If two players land on the same space, they play rock-paper-scissors, with the loser moving back one space. Various "stage" spaces along the way allow a player to roll a die and move all other players back that number of spaces or to jump ahead is a one a rolled twice consecutively. Certain events can put a player into a "passive state." While in a passive state, players are protected from most negative effects. The last part of the path splits so each character has their own individual track. Players must roll the exact number to land on the ending space, and must move back any excess spaces. First player to arrive there wins.

name: Druids
description:
The year is 596 A.D. and the Gregorian Mission has decreed a conversion of all pagans to Christianity. Under attack, the Druids - the prophets and scholars of ancient Paganism - must try and prevent the Christians from spreading their new religion, but it won’t be easy. As the church gathers more converts, they grow stronger with each passing day...

Druids is a press-your-luck style dice game with a twist where, with the help of the gods, you play as a priest of the ancient Celts, desperately trying to stop the Christians from converting your believers. The twist is that the other players are rolling against you! If they can convert your believers, the victory will be theirs instead. Use the special abilities of the gods to keep the missionaries at bay and keep your faithful strong.

name: Rocketships to Eos
description:
In Rocketships to Eos, players race to be the first to reach Planet Eos. Players will travel through 10 locations in the solar system, facing seen and unforeseen challenges that could jeopardize not only chance to be first to the planet - but their chances of making it in one piece!

Gameplay Summary:
Rocketships TE uses a combination of cards, dice, and stat tracking. Players choose between 1 of 3 actions each turn: move, repair/rest, and sabotage. For each action, the d6 is rolled to determine the condition for performing that action - sometimes preventing the action from happening, or at least making it very costly. Along the journey, Players encounter malfunctions, asteroid fields, and supply stations in the form of Event Cards.
categories: Print & Play, Racing, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Superfight: PAX East 2015 Promo Pack
description: This is a set of nine cards for Superfight that was released at PAX East 2015. Each swag bag contained 1 random card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: Das Quiz-Spiel mit der Maus
description:
Based on the high-flying German TV franchise "Die Sendung mit der Maus", Das Quiz-Spiel mit der Maus is a family game that requires you to puzzle, guess, combine, and evaluate.

The game board shows many different tasks to solve, placed in a circular course. Your goal is to race once around the course and be the first to reach your starting point again. Each field gives you another task to solve. It is always you against all others. If you succeed, you step one field forward, otherwise all other players step one field forward. The tasks test your knowledge, your evaluation skills, your memory, and your dice-throwing skills.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Road Rally USA: Mud Boggin'
description:
Mud Boggin' is a mini-expansion for Road Rally USA that allows players to place Mud Tiles on the board at start up.

During the game, when a player starts their movement in a space containing a mud tile, the first card they play will give a movement of 1.

name: 大盗賊・猫右衛門 (NEGOEMON)
description: In 大盗賊・猫右衛門 (NEGOEMON), players represent cats who are taking on various roles and you're trying to guess what those roles are in order to collect treasure.

name: Guess It
description:
A game of deduction and bluffing with eleven playing cards, JT98765432A, and two players.

One secret card is laid face-down in the middle of the table. The rest are dealt between the players. The goal is to guess the secret card. A guess ends the game and determines the winner, according to whether the guess was correct or not.

Players take turns either asking the other if s/he has a given card or making a guess. When asked about a card, the opponent must answer truthfully and lay it face up if the card was held. A player may ask the opponent about a card s/he holds, in which case, s/he will lay it face up on his/her next turn. (The idea is that this bluff might make the opponent make an incorrect guess.)

15 ○ 9 × is a two-player deduction game, with each player trying to deduce — and identify through card play — the pairs of cards laid down by the opponent.

The deck consists of 15 ○ cards and 9 × cards. Each player receives ten cards from the deck at random, then creates three pairs of cards, leaving the remaining four cards in hand. Each player now tries to correctly identify whether each pair of cards played by the opponent matches (in which case you need to play a ○ on the pair) or whether they don't match (in which case you need to play an ×).

Instead of making a guess, you can reveal one of the cards in one of your pairs, giving up information but delaying the need to guess.

name: NO!
description:
NO! is a quick and unpredictable turn-based casual card game for 3-7 players, designed by District Games.

At the beginning of the game, shuffle the 100 available cards and equally split them among the players. Everybody draws one card and a random player starts the game.

In your turn, flip the top card of your deck. Every card indicates how the turn passes from one player to the other, so the next player to play is simply the one indicated by the arrow you flipped.

If you have at least one card in your hand, right after somebody else's move you can shout NO! and play one card from your hand on top of the last card played by the active player. This way, that card will be the one to be followed now.

The first player who flips the last card of his deck wins the game.

name: House Rules
description:
House Rules is a 3-6 person card game battle royale, where players clash with each other using absurd weapons in order to build their own stash of weapons the largest!

The game is played in 3 rounds. At the beginning of each round players are given a choice of two rules that will go into effect for that round; once players make their choice, the chosen rules are combined and everybody plays by those rules.

All players have the opportunity to create a rule of their own once per game, and need one other players approval in order for their rule to go into effect.

All the cards in House Rules are dry erase, so players also have the opportunity to tailor their weapons and make them even sillier and more absurd than they already are. House rules is fun and frantic from beginning to end for players of all skill levels!

name: Knight's Journey
description:
Knight's Journey is a game about Knights going on quest for honor and glory. During their quest they collect gold and information, and bring gold to orphans, church and women they love.
This is pickup and delivery game that is played on the chess board using chess pieces and tokens. There are two type of tokens gold and information. Players play with knights, and pawns, queens and bishops are the pieces they are trying to collect. information is used to move pieces toward opponent to block him or make him lose points. You can also attack opponent to get his gold. The game is for 2 players, but there's a variant for 3 or 4.
In the files section you can find rules for the game, and tokens you can print.

name: Tentacle Bento: Tough Cookie Club
description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Miniatures

name: Tentacle Bento: Study Hall
description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Miniatures

name: Gomorraland
description:
Gomorraland is a strategic card game for 2-6 players who must take control of the city, trying to eliminate their opponents to became the only boss.

Every player controls a boss who must take care of their clan, which is composed of criminals of various genres and different abilities. Criminals of a clan have to protect their master from cards, affairs and attacks from their opponents, who are trying to defeat them before the police can! This strategic game system uses both cards and dice, and it pushes every player to move carefully every single criminal to gain useful equipment or directly attack members of other clans.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That

name: Malifaux: Troubleshooters – Ironsides Box Set
description: The Arcanist Enforcer. Ironsides is less a fine dodging and riposting type and more a taking your best shot to her chin and grinning right before you get knocked out. She gets into melee and chains attacks, moving up from (1) attacks to brutal (2) attack action using a resource she generated called Adrenaline. More attacks: More Adrenaline. Get attacked? More adrenaline. Friends get attacked? More adrenaline. Not getting attacked? She can make her opponents charge at her at severe penalties. Oh and she hits back when you hit her. Vicious.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: Laus
description:
A 32 card pack is used, consisting of A, K, Q, J, 10, 9, 8, 7 in each of the four suits, but when playing the game the four jacks are regarded as forming a separate trump suit. So there are effectively five suits: jacks (trumps), clubs, spades, hearts, diamonds.

The ranking of the trumps from high to low is: jack of clubs, jack of spades, jack of Hearts, jack of Diamonds.

In the four non-trump suits the cards rank from high to low A, 10, K, Q, 9, 8, 7.

Certain cards carry penalty points, and the object of the game is to avoid taking tricks containing those cards. First, all the cards carry their normal penalty point values as in Ramsch:

Jacks 2
Aces 11
Tens 10
Kings 4
Queens 3

Taking queens in tricks has an additional effect. The club, spade and heart queens carry extra special penalties which swamp the normal card points above, but these can be neutralised by taking the diamond queen:

Queen of clubs 300 points
Queen of spades 200 points
Queen of hearts 100 points
Queen of diamonds cancels all special queen penalties for the player who wins it in a trick

Nines, eights and sevens are neutral - the carry no penalty and have no special effect.

The player to dealer's left leads. Players must follow suit if they can. A player who has no card of the suit led can play any card.

Jacks count as belonging to the trump suit, not as members of the suits printed on them. This means that if a jack is led the other players must follow with a jack if they can.

[Rules paraphrased from Pagat.com entry.]

name: Tentacle Bento: School Band
description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Miniatures

name: Tentacle Bento: Dodgeball
description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Miniatures

name: Iwanna's Theme Park
description:
You are a super parent who promised your child the best vacation ever at Iwanna’s Theme Park. You’ve read the guides, and heard about how stressful it is for some parents, especially with that top of the hour marketing blitz, but you have a plan and are good at reacting to situations, so you aren’t worried about losing your mind on this vacation. All you have to do is make it back to the main entrance with your child comfortable and satisfied before the park closes, and you’ll win the game.

Designed for the 2015 Solitaire Print and Play contest, Iwanna's Theme Park uses a Mancala style mechanic to deal with potential disasters on your vacation. Cubes of multiple colors move around a Mancala styled "Brain Board," tracking potential problems with crowds, hunger and bathroom needs, and your child's craving for a special souvenir. Grouping too many cubes of the same color create a potential for disaster. The player will have to plan ahead, and deposit the right cubes at the right times to prevent the vacation from getting out of control.

A Vassal module designed by Chad Mestdagh is available at this link:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B0WBVnUE4NbHZWJ2b0VtR0NrZVU...
mechanics: Action Points, Pick-up and Deliver, Simulation

name: En la escena del crimen: Crímenes imposibles
description:
Solve the maximum number of crimes to become an expert in criminal investigation.
The goal is to solve a series of crimes and do it before the opposing team. A player reads the case and the rest will be detectives. Any player of the team makes a question to the master, he responds with YES or NOT, then any player of the other team makes another question. When a team has enought clues, try to resolve the case. If the explanation is correct, the team wins the game if not, the other team ask again. The team that resolved the crime before the other, wins the game.

name: Dig It!
description:
A press-your-luck card game where players take on the role of a team of miners digging for diamonds.

Players take turns sending a number of their miners down into the mine to dig the diamond vein. Each strike of the pick could score the player diamonds, but also risks a cave-in that will injure the miners and leave the player with fewer hands for the next dig. This could even result in the player being carried back to the surface empty handed. The player with the most diamonds once the vein has been completely mined is the winner.

The vein consists of a mix of 1-3 diamonds, cave-ins that injure 1-3 miners, or empty strikes. The player draws cards until they choose to return to the surface with however many diamonds they've mined, or until all the miners they sent into the mine have been injured in cave-ins.

name: Tundra: The Board Game
description:
Chainsaw wielding bears, gun toting dogs and monster fish await you as you race across Alaska to be the first to spell 'Tundra'. Based on the award winning comic strip 'Tundra' by Chad Carpenter, you and your opponents will fall into fits of laughter with over 100 jokes that allow you to reek [sic] havoc on others or reap the benefits for yourself. This is the only Alaskan board game you will ever need to own!

The goal of Tundra is to be the first person to trek across the State of Alaska and collect enough letters to spell T-U-N-D-R-A These are obtained by; T - Ride a dog sled in Nome, U - Build an igloo in Barrow, N - Ice fish on the Yukon River, D - Hike the Chilkoot Trail, R - Commercial fish out of Dutch Harbor, A - Hunt on Kodiak Island.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kribbel-Krabbel
description:
Kribbel-Krabbel, the crazy tile laying game.

Description from the back of the game box:
Each Kribbel-Krabbel ant consists of 3 parts: head, belly and rear end. Each part has another colour. Sometimes the head is red, the belly yellow and the rear end green, sometimes the head is green, the belly red and the rear end yellow. But all ants have something in common: a stenciled out hole. either at the head, the belly or the rear end. The game is quickly understood: each ant must be laid on top of another ant, and in a way that through the hole the same colour is visible. For example: an ant has a red head, yellow belly and blue rear end. The hole is in the head section. You can put this ant on top of two kinds of other ants: either one with a red head heading in the same direction as the ant You are laying - or You change the direction of Your ant and lay it on top of an ant with a red rear section.
Who is the first to lay all his ant cards?

name: Mara und der Feuerbringer: Das Kartenspiel
description:
"The world threatens to sink into the dark and everything still between her and Ragnarok, the Twilight of the Gods, is, you are. Uses as your visionary skills, transgress with the gods in contact and find them, to bring them back to their homeland. Yet all is not lost! But be careful, the gods do not act entirely altruistic. They will try to influence you with deceit and cunning to get at your rune stones and fight hostile gods. Help your clan to strengthen their claim to the throne of Asgard and place the world order restored-because everything depends on you."

With Mara und der Feuerbringer: Das Kartenspiel ("Mara and the Fire Bringer: The Card Game") you embark into the mystical world Maras and the Nordic Germanic mythology. 2-4 players are stalwarts and assume the role of a Spákona and try to stop Ragnarok and to help their respective clan to the throne of Asgard.

Each player tries to collect the most victory point with his cards on the table, victory points stack and rune stones.

Victory points can be gained by playing your own authority cards, but also by stealing opponent cards and rune stones.

The game ends as soon as the first player has 14 victory points.

Players begin with playing their first mythological place open. Afterwards, each player in turn takes on one of the four stacks in the middle of the table, chooses three more cards in hand (without changing the order of cards in the stack) and then puts back these. Now, each player has five cards in his hand and a mythological place in front of him. It is not allowed to have more than 5 cards in hand. This hand limit, however, can be increased by certain card abilities.

The game is played as round clockwise. Each turn consists of four phases:

1. Energy Phase
2. Expansion phase
3. Action & Combat Phase
4. Draw cards

name: Add a Bug Math Game
description: Addition practice is more fun than ever—with a super-simple board game that’s “crawling” with bugs! Kids just roll the dice to move from one space to the next…collecting and losing bugs along the way. The player who collects the most bugs wins the game! 16" game board comes with everything you need for 2-4 players, including 45 plastic bugs, 2 soft dice and 4 clear storage jars with magnifying lids.

name: The King's death
description:
In a distant kingdom. the king's death begins a race to power among the members of the court, the coronation of the new king will be between four weeks, every member of the court is determined to win using spies and assassins to gain power and become the new king.

In the King's Death the players play a member of the king's court. Their goal is to collect more influence points of their opponents. To do this, each player has henchmen (represented by tokens) that may send to other members of the court to spy on them, bribe or kill opponents henchmen. The game play uses the secret roles and worker placement to simulate the internal struggles within the court, so bluff and intuition are fundamental.

name: Égaru Idea to Market
description:
Égaru Idea to Market is a card game where you can learn the concepts of intellectual property and entrepreneurship.

The goal is to create projects starting with an Idea and ending in the Market, going through the different phases of the entrepreneurship process. To do this you must lay down cards in the correct order and possibly add booster cards to your own projects or attack cards to your opponents. A project requires between 3 and 6 phases to get to market - the more phases you get in the more points you will get.

Each player can have as many projects as he wants, but if a project is not closed with the Market card, it doesn’t count in the final score.

The player with the most points when there are no more cards to play is the winner.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: FlitsQuiz
description:
Het Supersnelle Kennisspel.

A quiz game for kids from the primary school. They test their knowledge about school-topics and earn victory points by answering multiple choice questions correctly. There are ways to steal points from other players too.

The objective is to gain the most number of victory points after a predetermined number of questions.

name: Awkward Family Photos Card Game
description:
This hilarious card game combines creative, open-ended questions with all new cringeworthy photos featuring funny family portraits, unfortunate hairstyles, weddings, vacations and holidays throughout the year!

Your ridiculous answers guarantee memorable & awkward fun...and if you know your fellow players well enough and can impress them with your answers, you'll get the last laugh!

Game is completely customizable in regards to rules changes, additions, etc. For example, you could add a couple dice to randomize your question number, rather than "learning the questions and choosing favorites". Really, this open game allows for house rules and so forth. The options are endless and the game can be altered based on your groups play-style.

Note* Dice and 'extras' do not come in this game, they are simply suggestions.


Before the game begins, determine what 'score' you're playing to. Might be 5, might be 10, might be 34! It's up to the group to determine how long they plan to play. (See below, how to win)

On your turn, draw a photo card and choose a number (or roll a die, if thats your thing, completely up to you!). That number correlates to a question to be answered about the photo selected. Maybe you have to come up with a caption for the photo or maybe you decide what the portrait is thinking. Format similar to Cards Against Humanity, best answer wins picture card which equals 1 point. Or maybe you want to play by coming up with alternative answers and the group determines who said what best. Winner of that round keeps picture card and scores a point. First person to win "X" number of cards is the winner.

name: On the Top
description:
On the Top is a game that will test what you know about your teammates and your reaction speed. First is assigned a "nickname" to each player. Then each turn is read a card with a condition like "he has the longest tongue", "he has more brothers", "more holes in the belt" ... and everyone will have to draw who believe that meets at the same time you say his nickname in the game.

First player to guess who meets better the condition will win the card. Game finishes when anybody wins 5 cards.

Do you really know your friends? And your partner?

name: Rugrats: Turn the House Upside Down
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to explore and mess up the objects given to you at the beginning of the game.

In a two player game, each character must mess up 6 objects to win. In a three player game, 4 objects; and in a four player game, 3 objects.

To start, put together the 3D game board, put the neat sides of all the items into their respective slots on the game board. Put the Mom and Dad marker on the spot on the game board with the star. Select a Rugrat and place it in the playpen, then deal two cards to each player. The remaining cards form the draw deck.

On your turn, you roll the die.

If you roll a number:

- Move your Rugrat up to that number of spaces on the game board
- If you reach an object you have a card for place the card face up in front of you and flip the object to the messy side
- You do not have to land on the object by exact count
- If there's another Rugrat or Mom and Dad in your way, jump over that space (don't count it)

If you roll 'Draw':

Add a card from the draw pile to your hand.

If you roll 'Mom and Dad':

- Move Mom and Dad up to 6 spaces on the game board
- If Mom and Dad land on any Rugrat, send that Rugrat back to the playpen
- Mom and Dad can, like a Rugrat, ignore a Rugrat and not count a spot to travel farther on the board
- If Mom and Dad move onto a red dot space in front of one of the house items, they block any of the Rugrats from making a mess of that item until they are moved

From the back of the box:

All right, all you Rugrats, break out of the playpen. It’s time to turn the Pickles house upside down!

Race through the family’s kitchen, bathroom, living room… upstairs and downstairs on the 3-dimensional game board. And what do you do when you reach one of your objects? You turn it upside down!

Mom and Dad try to prevent the mess—but they can’t be everywhere at once. Sooner or later, you and the Rugrats turn the whole house upside down. What a mess you’ve made!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sangokushi Haou
description:
The strategy cardgame based on historical novel "Romance of the Three Kingdoms". Many characters represent by cards. "Sangokushi Haou" is means the Champion of the Three Kingdoms.

Players control one of five warlords. In each turn, player can perform three actions in the order specified: attack a province, draw one card and reorganization in own provinces.
The battle is resolve three steps: stratagem, duel and army combat. These affected by characters.

Winner determined by victory points, mostly gain from control of provinces.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment

name: The King's Armory: Kickstarter exclusive extras
description:
During the King's Armory Kickstarter, several extras were included for backers that are not available via retail.

They include:

Backup Reinforcement Card
Special Aid Reinforcement Card
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Refraction
description:
The playing area consists of four transparent square boards, made of ICI Perspex acrylic, each containing a 4 x 4 array of depressions. The boards are assembled prior to play, and using the 12 supplied Perspex support rods, in the form of a set of offset steps: the lowest is on the right and to the fore, the next one up is back a little and to the left, the next is at the back and to the right, and the highest is at back left. Each of the two players is allocated a pair of boards, a lower one and the upper one on the same side. Each player has 16 glass marbles (also referred to as 'pieces' or 'ollys') in his own colour (black or white) which he/she initially places in the depressions of his/her lower board.
Each player's aim is to be the first to get four of their marbles on the opponent's lower board. Marbles move up to the owner's upper board, across to the opponent's upper board, and thence down to the opponent's lower board, governed by a set of rules stating what moves are permissible. When pieces move across to the opponent's upper board, it is possible to capture opposing marbles, and these may be taken back and re-entered when the opponent gets a marble into his/her target lower board.
The game is one of pure strategy, with no randomising element, but has some similarities to Backgammon.


The configurations of the boards may be varied slightly but this has no bearing on the game play.
The game comes with a separate rule sheet for a solitaire version.
An enclosed sheet states that "additional games will soon be available that can be played on the REFRACTION board, for 1, 2, or 4 players".
The name of the game is spelled in capital letters throughout the box and printed enclosures.
The following tag lines are used:
The Ultimate Game
The Three Dimensional Strategy Game Of The 21st Century
The Game Of The 21st Century
3D Game

name: Musikquizzen
description: Musikquizzen is based on a Danish radio program of the same name. it is a trivia game, where players have to answer questions about music. There is more than 2000 questions in the game, all of them written by the host of the radio program, Kenneth K.

name: Don't Tip The Waiter!
description:
Test your dexterity! Stack the dishes on the waiter's hands but don't be the one to tip him over!

1 or more players:
Each game piece is assigned a point value:

Big Bowls 2pts
Small Plates 1pt
Small Bowls 2pts
Bottles 3pts

Each player takes a turn trying to stack as many dishes as possible onto the waiters hands. Once the waiter tips, their turn is over. After everyone has taken a turn, the score is tallied up. The player with the highest score wins. Or play against yourself and see how high your stack and score can get.

2 players:
Take turns stacking one dish onto the waiter. The person who tips the waiter loses the game.

name: Ancient Sicily (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Rise of Man: Stone Age
description:
In Rise of Man: Stone Age, you are a tribal leader, and you’ll have to gather actual resources from the Stone Age period to triumph. You’ll fight saber tooth tigers, hunt woolly mammoths, gather food and herbs, build shelters, weather the environment, and overcome any obstacle that the Stone Age will throw at you.

Rise of Man: Stone Age is a strategic card drafting board game. Players will choose Resources specific to the Stone Age to overcome Obstacles and Hazards that they will face in each of the 5 Rounds of play.

As tribal leaders, players must overcome a new Obstacle (or Hazard) in each of the 5 rounds of play by choosing and accumulating suitable Resource cards. At the end of each Round, players earn points for overcoming Obstacles, but lose points by failing to overcome their Obstacles. Resource cards accumulate each round so that players can also play “Special Events” to earn additional points. Special Events are played by using different combinations of specific Resource Cards. Special Events include Chieftain, Feast, Shaman, and many others.

You’ll build a life for yourself and your tribe to really create something worth fighting for. Here, it’s not victory or defeat, but life or death, and it’s all up to the choices that you make.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Street Car Game
description:
Typical and simple spin and move race game. The first player, who cross all the road first, wins the game.
The box has fabulous graphics with nice patina. The box artwork is stellar with super detailed artworks of: elephant, lion conductor, hippo, leopard, rhino, ostrich, monkeys, dog and others.
The street car is marked “MONKEYVILLE and ZEBRA STREET”, “No. O 694”.

name: Tiny Garden Growers
description:
TINY GARDEN GROWERS

Game Summary
Tiny Garden Growers is a game about growing vegetable plants and harvesting the vegetables.
This is a dice rolling and placement game that also uses dexterity and counting skills.

Number of players: 2-3
Components: 1 game board and 50 dice (30 green or white, 10 red, 10 yellow) and rules!
Playing time: 10 to 15 minutes
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Number, Print & Play

name: DéliroLinguo
description:
Délirolinguo is as the Tower of Babel! This party game invites you to discover 30 common phrases in 12 languages: English, Spanish, Italian, German, Arabic, Japanese, Portuguese, Mandarin Chinese, Hindi, Russian, Turkish and French.

Rules of the Game: Unmask the language that opponents have!

The game starts with a card showing expressions in all 12 languages. To win, you just have to read this term to your opponents in the language that they have. Each opponent checks the answer on his card in his language and answers "yes" in case of right answer and "no" on error.

If you're right, you choose a Language card of one of your opponents to start your collection.

The winner of the game is the one that has the largest collection of languages. He will become a "polyglot genius".

DéliroLinguo, the languages game ​​which makes you totally crazy!

Material: 24 Language cards, 30 Expressions cards, 16 Special cards, 1 hourglass, 1 pencil, 1 notebook

---

Délirolinguo, c’est un peu l’auberge espagnole ! Ce jeu d'ambiance vous propose de découvrir 30 expressions usuelles dans 12 langues : l’anglais, l’espagnol, l’italien, l’allemand, l’arabe, le japonais, le portugais, le chinois mandarin, l’hindi, le russe, le turc et le français.
La règle du jeu ? Démasquer les langues que les adversaires ont piochées !
La partie commence avec une carte présentant une expression dans chacune des 12 langues. Pour gagner, il suffit de lire ce terme à ses adversaires dans la langue que ces derniers auront pioché. Chaque adversaire vérifie la réponse sur sa carte et répond dans sa langue : « oui » en cas de réponse juste et « non » en cas d’erreur.
S’il vise juste, il choisit une des cartes « langues » d’un de ses adversaires pour commencer sa collection.
Le gagnant de la partie est celui qui aura la plus importante collection de langues. Il deviendra ainsi un « polyglotte de génie ».

DéliroLinguo, le jeu de langues qui rend complètement fou !

Matériel : 24 cartes Langue, 30 cartes Expressions, 16 cartes Joker, 1 sablier, 1 crayon, 1 carnet
categories: Card Game, Educational, Memory, Party Game

name: Killer Karnickel: Herr der Karnickel
description:
Promo Card # 18
If played you can play two cards each turn and all other Special Karnickels are eliminated.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Negotiation
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Trading

name: Bases Loaded Board Game
description:
(From the back of the box)

Get Ready for 9 Innings of Fun!

In Bases Loaded, each roll of the dice represents an At Bat.

Out-Roll your opponent on offense to hit doubles, triples, and even home runs!

Utilize the strategy cards to steal bases, bunt and more!

With two different ways to play, Bases Loaded is fun for all ages!

Bases Loaded is a simple simulation of baseball. One player is "at-bat" and one player is "in-the-field". The both roll three six-sided dice and the highest roll uses their dice result to determine the outcome. It's a single for the "at-bat" player and an "out" for the "in-the-field" player. There are special results on rolls of doubles (two dice having the same number) and triples (all three dice having the same number) for both players (provided they win the roll off).

The come comes with a LARGE set of cardboard stand-up players that are moved around the bases. However, there is no "outfield" players.

In the "advanced" rules, both players are given a set of "one-use" cards which can also affect play. For the "at-bat" player these are: Stolen base x2, Balk x1, Sacrifice x3, Hit by pitch x2, Walk x4, Bunt x2, Double x3, Triple x1 and Home run x2.

For the "in-the-field" player these are: Ground out x4, Pick off x3, Fielder's choice x4, Double play x4, Triple play x1 and Bring it back x2.

That's pretty much it. Other than choosing when to use which card there are not many decisions to make and no way to influence the dice rolled, so that parts primarily luck.

A simple family game with nice components.

name: 日本全国特急旅行ゲーム (Japan Railroad Travel Game)
description:
User summary:
日本全国特急旅行ゲーム (Japan Railroad Travel Game) is a roll and move train game from Japan.

Collect tickets, take trains, and travel around Japan!

Your goal is to take as many express or limited express trains as possible.

During your turn, do the following:
1) Roll dice - Roll a movement die and an event die.
The movement die is six-sided, but printed values are greater than ordinary die. The faces of the event die are either tickets or happenings.

2) Move your pawn - You may move number of stations indicated by movement die.
If you have express tickets or limited express tickets of the appropriate route, you may move faster along that route. Otherwise you have to use local trains.

3) Draw ticket or happening card
If the result of event die is a ticket, you draw a ticket card and keep it in your hand.
If the result of event die is a happening, you draw a happening card and follow the instructions in it.

Publisher's summary:
きっぷを集めて日本全国を巡りながら列車に乗ろう！
１～３の手順を繰り返し、できるだけ多くの特急・急行列車に乗ることがゲームの目的です。
１．サイコロを振る
「数字サイコロ」と「イベントサイコロ」を振ります。
２．移動する
「数字サイコロ」の数字にしたがって移動します。
このとき使用できるきっぷがあれば特急・急行に乗車できます。
３．イベントサイコロの指示に従う
「きっぷ」が出ればきっぷを１枚ゲット！
「ハプニング」が出ればハプニングカードを引いて指示に従います。
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: ろーりん☆つーりす (Rolling Tourist)

name: The Star Adventure
description:
Little stars have fallen from the sky, into the players' room. Help them get back to the sky, to their mother!

A game designed for children as young as 3. Players alternate in throwing the color-coded dice and stepping up the star-ladder.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Colorfind
description:
A memory game in which you must throw the die and find the stick with the colour indicated. If you don’t pick the right colour out it back and remember where it is. Includes 18 wooden sticks with 6 different coloured ends. To start to play just place the sticks in the pot.

The sticks have the point colored but are hidden in the pot, if you pick the right color you keep the stick, if not it goes back on the pot. The player with the most sticks at the end wins.

name: Korean Peninsula (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Nintori!
description:
Nintori! is a Japanese game to win the tiles by rolling the dice.
From children to adults can play easily.

★ What game?

Nintori! It is handy DiceGame you can enjoy from children to adults.
Players, "Nezumi Kozo" [japan's robin hood] to longed (?) Sneaked in castle town Become a ninja apprentice of children,
Use the Ninjutsu using the treasure that was placed in hand and the dice.

★ Most people who use the Ninjutsu is Ninjutsu Master!

Who lot to get the treasure than, it will aim to use a lot of Ninjutsu!
However, that would be caught by scary officials and fail to sneak also ....

Players, Become a child ninja apprentice, you will go to sneak training to the castle town.
Two dice to use.
Using this, you can determine it is where to sneak.

Is from the tail out that crept, you will discover the treasures and items.
This is to become of course score at the end of the game, but you may come out lookout officials in because your attention!

Until the end of the game, the game is to compete a lot of scoring.

Because it is Ninja said that apprenticeship, hand to put the training point is scored by a successful Ninjutsu using an item, in this game called Nin-Point, you can be a lot acquisition.
Of course, it is possible that the success of the Ninjutsu shaking the dice, even during the game, it is massaging me every time even force enters the hand you shake the dice when it becomes your turn!

★ The point here!

● Convenient colorful purse to carry!

Nintori! It is, at any time comes in colorful drawstring bag to play with ease.
Navy blue, purple, pale-blue green, bright green, dark green, mustard, and played a total of eight colors of orange ...!
There is each color only

● Play sheet scroll to fly around the cute ninja!

Scroll to use Ninjutsu also necessary!
With that said, you can use the scroll as a play sheet.
Nintori! is scroll with plum and cherry blossoms and colorful pattern comes with Volume 1.
Scroll of the pattern is random.
Fun after I look at the inside what kind of pattern becomes available!

● Comes also advanced rules!

Nintori! In comes with separately also add advanced rules tile from the normal rules of play even with a small child.

name: Exultate Deo -The Fluffy Rite-
description:
User summary:
Exultate Deo〜ぬいぐるみ工房の秘密〜 (Exultate Deo -The Fluffy Rite-) in English means "Exultate Deo -The secret of the teddy bear atelier-. This is a no-bidding, no-trump, trick-taking game where you must follow suit without using any cards.

The players are craftsmen at a teddy bear atelier and make teddy bears to offer to the god Lord Teddy. The best teddy bear is offered to Lord Teddy and the craftsman who has created that teddy receives a trophy. The aim to receive the highest number of trophies.

Five cubes of different colors are used for the game. At each trick, the player combines two cubes from their hand. One of the two cubes represents the suit and the other the rank.

Publisher's summary:
カードを一切使わない、ノンビッド、ノートランプ、マストフォローのトリックテイキングです。
プレイヤーは、ぬいぐるみ工房の職人となって、ぬいぐるみの神『おテディさま』へ捧げるぬいぐるみを作ります。
最も上手に出来たぬいぐるみを『おテディさま』に捧げ、そのぬいぐるみを作った職人には栄誉が与えられます。
各プレイヤーは、この栄誉に最も多く預かることを目指します。
ゲームには5色のキューブを使い、プレイヤーは毎トリック、手持ちのキューブから2個を組み合わせて手を作ります。片方がスート、もう片方がランクを表します。"

name: Mascha und der Bär: Bühne frei für Mascha!
description:
Masha lives in a little cottage in the woods. With her fun, games and pranks, she really turns the idyllic life of her neighbour, a former circus bear, topsy-turvy. All the bear wishes for is a quiet life, but bubbly Masha keeps on causing havoc, making sure the bear’s life is full of action and adventure!
Today is Masha’s big day: the stage has been erected and all of her costumes are ready and waiting for her appearance. All of her friends are attending the show.
Arrange exciting scenes and make sure to pay attention since also you will play an important role in Masha’s play! Fans of Masha can playfully test their memory with three amusing memo games.

The game comes with three variants, and everytime you play, you choose the variant you prefer:
Variant 1 - Can you see the difference?
Variant 2 - Memo
Variant 3 - True or false

The game ends as soon as each player has had four turns. The person with the most points after four turns wins the game.

name: Train Line: Chicago
description: Train Line: Chicago Edition is a multi- player card base strategy board game that will test your wits, competitive spirit, board navigation, and card management skills. You utilize 3 elements on two boards on you quest to get the required amount of pawns in seated spaces before your opponents. You use the boarding die to determine entry to train or lost of turn, number cards to move along board spaces or action cards; cards with specialized abilities to increase your chances of being victorious.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Zeg geen Ja, Zeg geen Nee Party Editie
description:
Players have to answer questions as quickly as possible but are not allowed to say Yes or No (Ja or Nee in Dutch). There is a timer. When all questions on a card have been answered without Yes or No, the player can keep the card. When the time is over, the next player can attempt to earn as many cards as possible within the time available.
The player who finishes with the most cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia

name: Flip 22
description:
A dice rolling and flipping game with Flip Dice in which players try to make 22 (the total of the high sides of the set of four Flip Dice). In attempting to do so, players must choose to press their luck and play (at the risk of having to double the pot of chips if they roll all the low sides of the Flip Dice) or play it safe, pass their turn, and hope someone else loses.

Once one player loses all their chips at the end of a turn, the other players with chips remaining record their number of chips left (as points). Then a new round is started and play continues until someone reaches 50 points.

name: El Señor de los Campos
description:
From the publisher (translated):
Show your skill for negotiation and get properties.
Manage your territories and countries. You can dominate all the territories and be the "Lord of the countries".
This game is a classic argentine cardgame with variant and more choices to decide, where the players must play with cleverness for making the best business.

From the publisher (Spanish):'
Demostrá tu habilidad para negociar y obtener propiedades. Sorteá las dificultades que te presenta administrar campos y latifundios. Si sos hábil, podrás dominar todos los territorios y convertirte en el Señor de los Campos. Este juego, un clásico argentino, presenta diversas alternativas de desarrollo, donde los participantes deben jugar con astucia y un poco de azar para poder así comprar territorios y realizar buenos negocios.

name: Pörssipeli
description:
This game takes you to the exciting opportunities of the stock exchange, where, with right investments and some luck, you can make a lot of money, but also lose it all.

In the game there are 12 different stocks (in 4 different color, 6 of each individual stock), wich players buy from and sell to bank. At the start of the turn one player rolls four different colored D6 four times, to determine the value of the stocks. Then every player buys and sells his stocks starting from the player who throw the dices. The current price of the stocks is marked on the board.

Basic idea is to make more money then the others. The game ending is decided by the players before the game begins. It can be a money or a time target.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Path Finder
description:
Path Finder is an education game designed to help teach measuring and comparisons of length and area, along with logic and reasoning.

To play the game, players take turns rolling a die and placing a piece of the corresponding color (if able) in the carved wooden path.

In the Level 1 variant the goal is simply to fill up the path.
In the Level 2 variant, each player gets an equal number of pieces and tries to be the first to place them all.

name: Fin finaud joue avec les mots
description:
Discover a new way to play a trivia game!

You don't need to have great knowledge to score points; just be smart.
Each player has question cards in his hand.

Your turn:

Choose one of your questions.
Choose who will respond and how you ask your question.
Predict what the result will be (success or failure, for example).


If the chosen players or respond as you expected: you earn points.

400 questions, 6 ways to score points: no need to be a sage to win!

name: Psycho PAF
description:
In Psycho PAF: Channel Wars, you are the president of a TV station, you create your own programming schedule by buying TV shows and their presenters. While trying to gain the highest ratings, you run into scandals, gossip, intrigues and back-stabbing from other players.

The goal of the game is to have the best channel (victory conditions to meet -- see below).

Each turn, the players play 4 actions (among which you can play presenter and TV show cards, take the top card of a deck and discard it, move shows on your schedule, etc).
You can play the positive and negative gossip cards on your own game or on other player's games. The better your TV rating is each turn, the more actions you get to do on your next turn.

You win when, at the end of a turn, all your 8 time slots for the week are filled (including 1 "best evening") and a presenter is assigned to each show. In case of a tie, the highest TV rating designates the winner.

name: Grand Tour Europe
description: Grand Tour Europe is the game for travel lovers who want to discover the countries and cultures of Europe. The players answer questions using their cards that represent countries, but no need to be a know-it-all to win. The two types of questions — speed and knowledge — make the game fun and accessible. Correct answers let the players advance from country to country and beat the other players to win playing pieces and victory points. The player with the most points at the end wins.

name: Till Eulenspiegel: Schabernack mit Schuhen und Schalk
description:
In Till Eulenspiegel: Schabernack mit Schuhen und Schalk, the playful tightrope act stimulates the brains of acrobats both large and small, with players trying to pick out matching pairs from 32 motley shoes. The first player to collect four or five pairs of shoes wins.

Till Eulenspiegel includes three game modes: a memory game, "Till pilfers", and the quick-playing "criss-cross".

name: Universal Tapestry
description:
Universal Tapestry is a puzzle solitaire game of building a cosmic tapestry with celestial formations.

The player will choose a card from the draw area and it will be placed ortogonally adjacent to other card in the table.

The card placed in the table must comply with two rules:

- The 4 sides of each card can only be in contact with cards of the same color or with the colors that are adjacent in the rainbow.( red-orange -yellow-green-blue-purple )

- The symbols of the borders of the card can not be in adjacent contact with the same symbol

If the card can not be placed then is discarded and another one is drawn .

There are two modes of playing

1) By time : Complete the 8x8 matrix as fast as possible.

2) Discarded cards: Complete the 8x8 matrix avoiding discarding the cards of red and purple colours.

At the end of the game if the Matrix is not completed the player loses.

name: MindMazeMix
description:
In MindMazeMix, as in other MindMaze sets, players take turns asking questions to try to solve mysteries. This particular set features eleven challenges from each of the first four MindMaze sets: Wahre Geschichten, Kriminalfälle, Rabenschwarze Geschichten, and Geld, Ruhm und Macht.

In general, a referee tells a strange story, then the players must determine why and how the story happened by asking "Yes" or "No" questions, with "Not Important" also being a plausible answer. Players take turns asking questions, with a point being subtracted for each question. Players are awarded points for asking certain key questions that eliminate faux versions of the story. The list of useful key questions is attached to every riddle. This sort of gaming procedure effectively encourages players to develop careful analytical questions and eliminates random questions.

name: Yomi Starter-Set 2
description:
Yomi is a fighting game in card form in which physical dexterity is replaced by hand management skills. Just like in a fighting game, you have to know your character, know the matchup, and know your opponent. Each character has a deck that follows the same conventions as deck of playing cards. This makes it easy to learn the contents of your deck: numbered cards are normal moves, face cards are special moves, and aces are super moves.

More specifically, Yomi is a competitive card game specifically designed and balanced to hold up to tournament play with many years of playtesting and tournaments behind it. It tests the skills of valuation and Yomi. Valuation refers to your ability to judge the relative value of moves (or cards) as they change over the course of the game. Yomi, the game's title, refers to your ability to "read" the patterns that your opponent unconsciously falls into. It's designed for high level play to be as interesting as possible and as balanced as possible.

Yomi Starter-Set 2 features two character decks, allowing players to face off immediately. Individual character decks allow new matches to be fought between different pairings.

Game Modes

1v1, the main mode
2v2 Team Battle, inspired by video games such as Marvel vs Capcom
A solo mode to learn basic proficiency against an automated opponent
A 3v3 mode (can be played as 1v1 with multiple characters) inspired by video games such as King of Fighters


Gameplay

Each player shuffles their deck and draws an opening hand of seven cards.
Turns are simultaneous and players draw one card per turn.
Each player plays a combat card face down, then reveals the cards simultaneously.
Resolve combat. Blocking an attack lets you draw a card; hitting with an attack or throw allows you to combo more cards from your hand; dodging an attack lets you hit back with a single move.
Bluff phase. After it's resolved who won combat, but before any combos are played, the player who might get hit by a combo can play a facedown Joker or bluff card. After the attacker finishes their combo, reveal that facedown card. If it's a Joker, the combo does no damage. If it's a non-Joker card, the combo does full damage as usual.
Power up: Players can discard pairs, 3-of-a-kinds, or 4-of-a-kinds to search their decks for Aces (super moves). Also, if they performed any chain combos (straights of sequential normal attacks, such as a 2,3,4,5) that turn, they can also search for Aces.


The game ends when one player is reduced to 0 life, or when one player draws the last card of their deck. In that case, time is out and the player with the highest life wins.

name: Zanzibar: Unguja (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Lucky Dip cards: some are for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city: others give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

Zanzibar has two islands and Unguja may be played stand-alone or with Pemba. The boards do not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks. There are flight options as an extra enhancement.
