There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Regrettable Tattoo
description:
Description from the publisher:

In Regrettable Tattoo players take turns playing ridiculous tattoos on one another. The strategic placement of these tattoos racks up points on the other player's bodies. It’s not actually about how many crazy tattoo’s you have, but how they are arranged on your body! The person with the least points against them is the winner.

Regrettable Tattoo is a fun casual card game that takes less than a minute to learn.

Double-sided hex cards are played on players in a domino like fashion creating an array of weird tattoos. The base game is for 2-4 players with expansions to follow allowing for more players. Or mix two base sets and play with 5-8 players!

name: Mixed Nuts
description:
Mixed Nuts is a party/trivia game with a unique voting element. Each of the trivia cards is double-sided with a question on both sides and the answer to each question on the opposite side; therefore, the person reading the question can play along, too. Each card features an odd trivia fact—and somewhere in the text, there are two possible choices—one is a fact, the other is a fib (these choices are a different color than the rest of the text).

The active player picks one (the fact or the lie), and reads the sentence aloud to the other players. Here's an example: “Al Capone's vault was opened on live TV by (Barbara Walters/Geraldo Rivera) and there was virtually nothing of value in it.” Players then decide if the given answer was correct. For instance, the active player includes “Barbara Walters” in their statement. If a player thinks that's right, they put the voting chip in their hand. If a player thinks that’s incorrect, they put nothing in their hand and have an empty hand. All players then reveal what's in their hand. The correct answer is “Geraldo Rivera,” so those players with empty hands receive one point—in the form of a nut—to put into their score cup. After three rounds of each player having had a turn to read a card, the player with the most nuts wins.

name: Bug Industries
description:
A Card/Dice Game for us IT Nerds.

Bug Industries is a game with cards and dice. Each player has an IT project assigned, in which a bunch of little, nasty bugs are hidden. 64 of these ulcer causing monsters must be eliminated for the project to run smoothly. The first bug-free player wins the game. You're not a developer, but are a part of the IT world? Don’t worry, Bug Industries has enough bugs and fun for you as well.

The game rules: On the game board – the headquarters of Bug Industries – you move your game chip up or down – depending on whether you can deduct or receive more bugs. You roll two dice: a numbered dice called “bug dice” and an “action dice.” The result of the bug dice can be directly deducted from your total bug count. The action dice gives you different options: pause, roll the dice again, draw a bugs card or draw a code card.

There are two kinds of bug cards: The good ones reduce your total bug count and the bad ones increase it. With the second type of cards (code cards) you can influence the whole game. While you have to play the bug cards immediately, you can keep the code cards for yourself without showing them to the other players and then play them when the time is right. Knowing when to drop the code cards on the other players is a key part of the strategy.

name: Carta Fútbol Club
description:
Carta Fútbol Club is a quick card game, in which two teams of up to three players each must alternatively play cards, trying to score a goal. Each can be played either as an offensive play or as a defensive one (two different numeric values in the same card). If a team plays at least three offensive cards in a row without the defensive team being able to stop it (by playing a card with higher value than the offensive one), they can (if they have the proper card) shoot and score a goal. There are also special cards that can modify the game (like fouls, great plays, etc.).
The game is divided in two halves, ending when a player runs out of cards.
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: Mythic Wars: Clash of the Gods
description:
Mythic Wars: Clash of the Gods is a card-and-dice game for 2-8 players, aged 12 to adult. In the game, each player takes on the role of advocate for a faction of four gods and/or goddesses. Each round, the advocate chooses which god or goddess to invoke and bring into the battle, and what attacks (or other actions) the active deities (and any supporting entities) should perform.

Each entity has 3 scores: Attack, Defense, and Energy. Attacks (and other actions, such as Clashes) are resolved by comparing the appropriate score for each opposing entity, and adding a die roll from their respective advocate. Taking damage reduces an entity's energy points, and when they run out of these points, that entity is considered defeated and out of the battle.

Additionally, most of the gods, goddesses, and other entities have abilities that affect the game in different ways, but their abilities only remain active until they are defeated. Once each active entity in the battle has been empowered with a chance to perform an action, the round ends. After four rounds, all of the deities have been invoked, and the battle continues until only one faction remains.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: VIII Corps: The Somme 1916
description:
Introduction
This is a two player card game covering the experience of the British VIII Corps on the first day of the Battle of the Somme, July 1st 1916. The game follows the course of the pre-battle preparation and the first day of the battle itself.

It is not a balanced game and one where the British will find it very hard to win.

Game Overview
To win the game the British player must capture two of the three German Support Lines. To do this they must overcome the First and Second Lines of defence in sequence before succeeding in attacking the final German line of defence.

The game is turn based. The early turns consist of just one phase solely concerned with strategic actions by both sides. Later turns consist of a strategic phase followed by a tactical phase. A tactical phase consists of British attacks, and the much rarer German counter-attacks, played in sequence.

The switch to multi-phase turns represents the end of the initial bombardment and the beginning of the infantry battle. The exact timing of the switch depends on whether the British player decides to prolong the pre-battle barrage or not.

Attacks, be they strategic or tactical, are made by playing a selection of cards. Strategic cards can only be played in the strategic phase and likewise tactical cards can only be played in the tactical phase. Furthermore, many strategic cards must be played immediately in the turn in which they are drawn so players do not have a totally free hand in deciding which cards to play.

The British player always takes the initiative unless the German player has chosen to counter-attack at the end of the tactical phase when the playing order is reversed.

Once the turn contains a tactical phase and the infantry battle has commenced, the British player must initiate at least one attack in every tactical phase. If they cannot attack, this counts as a failure. Only when the British have completed all their attacks may the Germans counter-attack.

To reflect the difficulties faced by the British on the day, the game ends with a German victory if two consecutive British attacks have failed. Failure to defend a German counter-attack does not count toward victory or defeat.

Plan your tactics carefully!
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War I

name: STORY CRAZE
description:
STORY CRAZE uses random PEOPLE, PLACES and THINGS cards as cues to ignite creative outside-the-box thinking to make up 3-chapter tales.

A judge awards points to winning chapters, and the team with the most points wins!

name: Ancient Finds
description:
How Many Artifacts Can You Find?
Explore the Mediterranean searching for ancient artifacts, collect the most valuable artifacts to win the game!

Overview:
Explore the Mediterranean searching for ancient artifacts. Roll the dice to match numbers on your discovery cards and collect artifacts of tile fragments, gold, and pottery. Hire archaeologists, purchase bonus excavation sites and calculate your chances with adventure cards to collect more ancient finds!

name: Match-It!
description:
Players take turns laying triangle-shaped cards, with each of the three corners having one of 5 colors and one of 5 patterns. Depending on the game variant desired, players match colors, patterns, either colors or patterns, or avoid matching anything to empty their hand and claim victory.

Includes 35 triangular cards.

name: The Lost Necklace
description:
From the publisher:

Once upon a time in a far away kingdom, there lived a beautiful princess. One day an evil witch, out of shear jealousy, bewitched her with a deep and empty slumber. The witch ripped apart the princess' magical necklace and scattered its forty pearls in the garden.
You have to gather the forty pearls of the necklace before the last grain of sand falls in hourglass.

Player rolls die in Her turn and either pick a rolled color and place to the necklace or pick a hourglass card if die shows the hourglass.
Players win if they find all 40 pearls.
Players lose if the all the hourglass cards are drawn.

name: Royal Wedding
description:
In the almost resplendent kingdom of the goblins, everything is ready for the nuptials of Princess Koncita. Well, almost ready... The preparations enrage the princess as everything seems to be going wrong for her. Koncita has a difficult character, and all around her hordes of terrified servants bustle about, attempting to satisfy her every tantrum, ahem, desire.

But even in the chaos of these preparations, while trying to dodge the possessions the princess flings at them (have you ever seen a flying chamber pot?!), the true nature of the goblins comes to the fore: Their infamous greed leads them to seek some small amount of vengeance not only against the princess, but against each other, too. Thus, in the excitement of the preparations, amongst the shoves and forfeits they have to put up with, maybe they will even manage to pinch a little treasure for themselves.

Royal Wedding is a fun-filled game for 2-8 disrespectful goblin servants!
mechanics: Acting, Area Movement, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Finders Keepers
description: Finders Keepers is a fast-moving two-sided card game where players try to find a card that contains one or two specific images, but not another. The whole deck of cards is spread out, and the race is on to find a match. With colorful, comical images, Finders Keepers combines hand-eye coordination and visual learning with lightning fast reflexes. Easy to learn but a different game every time, it can be enjoyed by all ages 3-103.

name: Adorable to Horrible
description:
Adorable to Horrible is an adult party game for 2-4 players. It's a game that's easy to learn and play, so you can quickly get to the fun and debauchery! Choose one of the four "Adorables," do your best to keep them safe in their Happy Place cloud, while you push your opponents' characters down the stony steps, toward "The Nasty Void!"

Each player has three pawns, which are moved along a track. Each turn, a player plays a movement card, which moves a specific type of pawn along the track. Alternatively, he can play an event card with some random effect.

The game ends when all three pawns of one player have reached the end of the track - the nasty void. The other players get points depending on how far along the track their pawns are. The player with the lowest score wins the game.

name: The Secret Life of Pets: Home Before Dinner
description:
This is a game for children based on The Secret Life of Pets from Universal Studios. One player represents Max (the dog) trying to get home after spending a day in the city. The other player represents Snowball (a grumpy rabbit) trying to block any path chosen by Max. Players take turns laying pathway tiles around a 3-D board representing a park, city buildings, an apartment complex, etc.

Max wins if he gets home before all of the pathway cards have
been placed.

Designed for two players age seven and older. Includes a plastic pet miniature depicting Max along with the 3-D display and 44 cards.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Socialism: The Game (fan expansion for Monopoly)
description:
Way back during the depths of the Great Depression in 1934, patriotic American and underemployed heater salesman Charles B. Darrow literally took an idea he’d refined to Parker Brothers, who literally bought it.

That idea was the board game Monopoly, and Darrow – who’d claimed he’d invented it himself – became the world’s first millionaire game designer/capitalist.

But he didn’t invent it – he only expanded upon versions of traditional games that had been played for generations. In other words, he made it slightly better.

Way back during the aftermath of the Great Recession in 2016, the founders of Diogenes Games – also underemployed, patriotic Americans and potential millionaire game designers/capitalists – literally took an idea born during the historically weird presidential campaign and literally sold it. To you. That idea was the expansion of Darrow’s board game Monopoly, called SOCIALISM.

OBJECT
The object of the game is to achieve total fairness and equality through the renting and selling of property under a modern, progressive, and populist public policy. The game is over when no one is bankrupt and everyone has $300 or less!

NOTE
The Game consists of an enlightened rule-book, a quick-reference card, 20 “Fat Chance” and 20 “Communism Chest” cards, and 4 new game tokens. The object of SOCIALISM: The Game is not to "win," but instead, is to achieve total fairness and equality through the renting and selling of property under a modern, progressive, and populist public policy.
Requires a copy of Hasbro’s MONOPOLY to play.

name: Safe Crackers
description:
Safe Crackers is a push your luck style card game where you attempt to unlock as many safes as you can each round. A round consist of players solving safe combinations by matching cards in their hand to open locked safes. During your turn you may reserve safes from a pool of sixteen available. All the safes, including your reserve pool, must be unlocked before you can attempt to unlock another player’s safes to score additional points.

Safe Crackers relies mostly on the luck of the draw, but various strategies can be used keep experienced players engaged.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Push Your Luck

name: Top2Bottom Expansion #1
description:
A game for the gays by the gays. The first expansion pack that will make your main package bigger, harder, and better performing!

100 unique cards that is updated with the latest LGBT lingo and even includes some of your filthy ideas!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Trickin' Camel
description:
Collect as many bottles as possible by winning Trickin’ Camel challenges and/or by catching the bottles he flings out of his bottle crate.

There are 3 types of challenges in this game.

Guessing game: the lights flash on the game base and players must remember the last light flashed - If the player chooses the correct light, the camel will make a victory noise and the player can take a bottle out of the crate otherwise camel spits a little bit water.
Memory game: the lights flash on the game base and players must remember the sequence of flashing to earn a bottle.
Speed game: Players must press the lights until the sequence stops to earn a bottle.


As soon all the 20 bottles are taken the player with the most bottles wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Real-time

name: Dalsland runt
description:
Take the role as a citizen of Dalsland and discover the county.

The goal of the game is to collect points by traveling through the different areas of Dalsland by various means of transportation (trolley, bus, canoe, train, boat, bicycle or by foot) and answer trivia questions with a local connection.

You start as a local resident from one of the six cities and start exploring the county. The game ends when one player has visited all areas and returned home. The player with the most victory points wins.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Discover the Bible
description:
Discover the Bible game is two games in one to teach you about the bible: a chronological overview of the bible with 60 key character cards throughout the bible, which can be a card game by itself. The Board game can be played with two to six players with the aim of visiting twelve significant periods of time ("Eras"), as described in the bible. While travelling from Era to Era players can land on bible characters and collect their card if no one else has already landed on it. The aim of the game is to be first to collect as many Era tokens (worth 20 points) and character cards (worth 10 points) and finish on the "Second Coming" and have the most points overall.

The character cards are a helpful tool to get to know some details about certain Bible characters. Some of the characters are examples to us in regard to what qualities a godly person ought to show in the Faith, Obedience, Love, Suffering, Wisdom, and Leadership. The aim of the card game is the learn more about how to be godly in your own character: to have more faith in what God has planned for your life; what it means to be obedient; to show love for each other and love for God above all else; to count it a privilege to suffer for doing what is right; to make wise decisions based on the character of Jesus Christ as found in the Bible; and to be a godly leader who is an example and deals justly with others, who upholds the teaching and example of Jesus, the Servant King.

Discuss and debate the ratings that each character has been given and look up the references to find out more about each character. Each card also gives more information about the name meaning and where you can read more about them in the Bible.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Tic Auto
description: Tic Auto is a racing game in which you start by setting the track with various usual objects, as well as a few wooden cubes and cones provided, and then move your car by flicking it on the table. Players also hold a hand of cards that can be played to gain advantages during the race (one more flick, teleportation...). If you don't suffer an accident, you switch up gears, which gives you more flicks on your turn (up to 3). The first player to cross the finish line wins the game.

name: Status: The Name of the Game
description: To get around the board paying taxes, rates etc ... and to buy more status symbols than your neighbours.

name: Fliegen Klatschen: Rote Fliegenklatsche promo cards
description:
2 promo cards for the Fliegen klatschen.
There are fly swatter on the cards. Once played the players try to "swat" the less numerous color of fly by placing their hands over fly cards of this color. The fastest players get the flies.

name: Attack of the Killer Kittens
description:
Attack of the Killer Kittens is a fast paced action card game, with kittens has your weapon, you've got 9 lives (cards in hand) and the goal is to be the last to survive (still have cards in hand) or have the most card when the drawing deck is empty.

You play one card per turn that affects the player to your left (either attack that does damage, defend that cancels attack or special cards). You can also stack damage cards, for example you play a 1 damage card and if the player to the left has the same card can play it to have is player to the left 2 damage instead of one.

Every time you play a card, you draw a card after. Only when you take damage that you don't draw a card.

name: Monopoly: Yu-Gi-Oh!
description:
Description from the publisher:

Choose your favorite Millennium token and travel around the board collecting and trading Yu-Gi-Oh! Duel Monsters. To defeat your opponents, you will need to have the strongest monsters lke the Dark Magician, Exodia the Forbidden One, and the Blue-Eyes Ultimate Dragon. Upgrade with custom Game Shops and Duel Arenas to make yourself invincible.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Pour les nuls: Le jeu
description:
Move from one room to another in the house (kitchen, bedroom, ...) and answer questions: history, religion, sports, cooking, ...

Accumulate points with every good answer! The winner is the first to get 20 points!

name: Noggin Workshop Word Mixers
description:
Description from the publisher:

Word Mixers card-based brain game plays with words within words within words. Put your knowledge of the English language to the test with these tangled word mixers brain games. Each card is its own puzzle to solve, players race to be the first to come up with their solutions.

Players determine game length by deciding how many cards (rounds) they will play. Games using 3 cards, for example, might play in 10 minutes while games having 10 rounds can be an hour. Game plays well as a party game, a family game, and even as a solitaire puzzle.

Knowledge of the English language is necessary as the primary element of the game is based on one's ability to create or derive solutions based on word structure and composition.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Party Game, Word Game

name: Blood and Carnage: The Battle of Komsomolskoye, March 2000
description:
Description from the publisher:

Blood and Carnage: The Battle of Komsomolskoye, March 2000'. Following the battles of Grozny and Ulus Kert, the Russian forces reorganized and cornered their Chechen opponents in the town of Komsomolskoye. The Chechens took the town in a daring surprise attack, and on the 6th the Russians struck back. However, the Chechens did not flee this time, and instead fought a two week slug fest in a battle in which no quarter was asked or given, and town of five thousand inhabitants was largely destroyed in the attempt to save it. The “sister” game to Perry Moore’s Valor and Vengeance: The Battle of Ulus Kert, Blood and Carnage has the same scale and design in a very interactive and easy-to-learn game.

Each copy of Blood and Carnage has 384 single-sided counters, two 11 by 17 inch map sheets, one Players’ Aid Sheet and 10 pages of rules. As with Valor and Vengeance, Antonio Piñar Peña did the graphics for Blood and Carnage.

name: Tagua
description: In Tagua players try to build a six-card pattern of their color. Cards are drawn from a pool and the players try to be the first in performing the corresponding action (take a certain stone from a pool) according to the colours depicted in the card.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game

name: Government Worker: NSFGW
description:
Government Worker is a satirical card game about avoiding bureaucratic work.
The objective of the game is to get through your work day while performing as little bureaucratic work as possible.
The game progresses by drawing cards that: assign you work, let you avoid work by dicking off, and let you pass work off to your coworkers.
The hand ends when a player draws a time card. The player with the least number of work hours recorded on their weekly time sheet is declared the winner!

NSFGW is the "Not Safe for Government Work" adult-themed expansion pack.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Chicken Cutlet
description:
The most delicious food combination on earth
《Bubble Tea》&《Chicken Culet》!!!
Chicken Culet always tastes best with an ice cold beverage, preferably Bubble Tea with ice. It's an observation that never changes. They go together like burgers with coke, so extraordinary and enjoyable.
This time players not only have to make a bubble tea quickly but have to get a chicken cutlet as soon as possible!
Idea of the Game
According to the Order Card, players have to put the specified ingredients on the Tea Base Card and win the game.
In addition to completely matching the quantity shown on the Order Card, players are available to cover the ingredients of the Tea Base Card.
Whoever finishes the order first gets a Culet Card. The player who gets the most Cutlet Cards wins the game.

name: Galactic Coliseum
description:
Galactic Coliseum is a fast-paced game where cunning tactics and strategy are utilized with a combination of unique game mechanics, gorgeous illustrations, and detailed science-fantasy miniatures. Playable for 2-4 players in Versus and Team Battle modes, you will suit up as high-tech Gladiators, each with your own skills and powers. Get ready to cut your way through 4 stages of flesh and steel as you advance through an ever-expanding gauntlet of massive mechanical monsters.

Let the games begin.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Network and Route Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: 7 Sign Circle
description:
Pulled from the lore of Layman Kingsford's Living Empires stories, 7 Sign Circle is a deck of round cards - The Deck of Fey - with 8 “suits” of 11 cards, one for each signMark. Some people believe in the oracular potency of the deck while others simply use them for gambling and recreational games of chance.

Test your wit at any of the games possible with this deck of cards, a 7-pointed star mat and eight signMark tokens. Games include variations on trick-taking, set collecting and bluffing mechanisms familiar from traditional card games, but each of these games comes with the twist that the suits relate to each other in variable ways from hand to hand and game to game.

name: Bake off
description:
The official board game of Bake off TV Show.
In turn the players play the role of judge, while the other players are competitors and perform 2 tests:

Technical test: each competitor receives a card depicting a sweet and must put on his plate the ingredients that he thinks are appropriate to realize, quickly taking them from those places in the center of the table. The first to complete their own sweet takes the whisk on the table. Depending on the correctness of the collected ingredients, players gain prize chips and cards for the next test.
Creative test: each competitor creates a sweet using the ingredient cards in your possession. The best recipes according to the current judge gain prize chips.


Players insert their chips within their paper cups.
When everyone has played the role of judge the game ends: who has the most chips is the winner.

name: Tar Trackers
description:
The Saber-Toothed Cats are on a scavenger hunt across the tar pit. Watch out! The tar is sticky, and sometimes the cats get stuck. The Saber Toothed Cat that can remember which tiles to avoid will be the fastest tar tracker and win the game!

In this game, tiles (some of them secretly magnetic, some not) are laid out on a board. Each player's task is to move their animal to the 6 numbered tiles on the sides of the board, in a given order (blue saber-toothed cat has to visit blue 1 first, then blue 2 etc., until they reach blue 6). Player pieces start in the middle. An animal can move to adjacent tiles as long as they are not "stuck in the mud" which means they don't step on magnetized tiles. When they do, the player's turn ends and it's the next player's turn. Whoever reaches their 6 first wins the game!

name: Mr. Hu Said What?
description:
Description from the publisher:

Mr. Hu is full of wisdom. Well, almost full. He needs you to
fill-in-the-blanks of his Ancient Chinese Secrets with your own words of wisdom. The question is 'who said what' and who is the 'wisest' of them all. Enjoy!

Player score points by writing the favorite answer and matching which player wrote which answer. The player with the most points wins the game!

name: Spaghetti: alla Granna
description: Spaghetti: alla Granna is a small promo - expansion to the dexterity game Spaghetti. It consist of a special blue pasta strand worth 5 points and one recipe token - alla Granna.

name: NextPress
description: In NextPress, all players reveal cards simultaneously each round, with the cards having letters on them. As soon as a player discovers a word, they call out and claim it on their victory pile — but because all visible letters are allowed to be used by all players in future rounds, the topmost card on each victory pile is not safe from being stolen!

name: Island City
description: Νησόπολη ("Nisopoly" or "Island City") is a game similar to Monopoly, with Greek islands in place of streets.

name: Peacekeepers
description:
Peacekeepers tells the story of 5 factions seeking to bring peace and stability to a war torn nation. Peace must be created without using the factions greatest assets, overwhelming fire-power and military strength.
Imagine advanced western nations with their mech’s striving to keep the peace in a country as it tears itself apart. But imagine being unable to use many of those powerful weapons because your mission is to prevent carnage and civilian causalities. Where the mission to being peace is a harder tactical challenge to your leaders than to invade. Peacekeepers is set a civil war in a mid-European country, 30 years in the future. Where fires of war still darken the night-time skies.

Imagine ingenious insurgents using stolen, scavenged and bolted together machines and monstrous weapons to attack, or welded together parts of western mechs, or black market weapons. While commanders must show restraint and work out who is the enemy or the innocent on the ground. This is the setting of peacekeepers.

Peacekeepers is a 4X inspired game set in a near future world reminiscent of our world. It is a ‘peace em up’ where civilian casualties are the 'countdown' timer in the game and where players can cooperate to protect the populace from events, or compete with each other. Its board game about peace - using giant machines of war.

Peacekeepers thus is a delicate balance of strategy, public relations and maneuvering.
Sometimes not using tactics is harder than using tactics. Sometimes the hardest strategy game of all is to not fight.

name: Superfight: PAX West 2016 Promo Pack
description:
This is a set of Nine cards for Superfight that was released at PAX West 2016. Each swag bag contained 1 random card.

Exclusive to the PAX West 2016 gaming convention in Seattle Washington in September 2016. There were only nine cards that made up this set and these were only available during this convention

The set features four black cards and five white cards all of which are listed below.

9-Card Exclusive PAX West 2016 Set Contains:

Card #1: Giant Robotic
Card #2: Shark With Eight Huge Spider Legs
Card #3: The Ghost of Every Bug You've Ever Killed
Card #4: Killer Robot Designed By A 6-Year Old
Card #5: Hamster The Size of A Whale
Card #6: Turns Into Academy Award Winner Nicolas Cage When Wounded
Card #7: Has Two Giant Crab Claws Instead of Hands
Card #8: Has Rocket Launchers Instead of Legs
Card #9: Trained to Fight By Chuck Norris
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: Flipover
description:
"A Game of Memory and Strategy for Two To Four Players"

Flipover is a memory game for 2-4 players. Players take turns rolling
dice and flipping over numbered tokens. The goal is to flip tokens
that add up to the sum of the dice. Players that succeed keep all
tokens flipped during their turn; if a player fails any flipped tokens are flipped back over, allowing players to remember their location.

Players can challenge the player to their left to flip tokens adding
to a target number - the winner of the challenge keeps all tokens
flipped. Play continues until all tokens have been removed from the
board. The player with the most tokens wins.

The Flipover board is an 8x8 grid. Each circular token is colored
black on one side with a number from 2-6 on the other side. The game
uses two six-sided dice.

name: Jumbalup
description:
Jumbalup plays with words, syllables and sounds, and combines observation, memory and strategy with a bit of luck.

Make strange and fantastic creatures in a race to complete your animals first. The winner is the first player to collect four real animals with matching heads and tails.

Players take turns to draw a card adding a head or tail to their collection or saving a special card to play later - using a Jumbalup card to steal a head or a tail from another player or playing a dodo to slow another player down.

The cards can also be used to play a matching pairs memory game (with twists) for younger players (3+).

A pack of Jumbalup contains 56 standard sized playing cards and a printed rule sheet.

name: Captain Scrimshaw's Digg'n Pirate Treasure Puzzle Game
description: A puzzle, memory matching game in which players try to reveal their treasure pieces from nine piles of tiles that form a treasure map. As players reveal pieces, if they belong to their own color, they play it immediately. Otherwise they hoard the pieces of the other players to force them to "steal" by taking a random tile in order to complete their treasure puzzle. The first player to collect and arrange to form their treasure picture wins.

name: Ratespaß auf Reisen
description: "Ratespaß auf Reisen" is a travel game for children. Questions regarding travelling with a car will teach the children how to act on the street and the meaning of the different traffic signs. The not included Tiptoi pen asks each player a question or gives a task to all of the players like "The first player that finds a red car will win this round and gain 10 points".

name: Moldova (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.

There are also spanners along some tracks which may help or hinder you. The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but there are some options in the spanner pack.

You can scale the mountains for extra points.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn extra points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Superfight: The Mindcrack Deck
description: The Mindcrack Deck adds 24 characters and 76 attributes created by your favorite Mindcrack content creators for all their fans. Now you can finally know who wins: Aureylian with a glorious beard, or Guude wearing a dinosaur costume.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game

name: We Come in Peace: 404 Hope Not Found
description:
This is an alternate race token that can be used. The first time it is damaged you gain an immediate missile action.

This was given away at conventions and is a high-quality poker chip.

name: Book Bugs
description:
Book Bugs is a collectible, deck-building, card game for 2 to 4 players, created by National Library Board, Singapore.

Visitors to any of the participating public libraries can collect Book Bugs cards in three ways:
1. Borrow 8 books from the library to redeem 2 normal cards.
2. Complete a library activity to redeem 1 shiny card.
3. Attend a library programmer to redeem 1 shiny card.

A player deck is made up of 30 cards. These are put in the player's draw pile. The player's play area also has a discard pile and a playing field. Each player starts with 5 cards in his/her hand.

To determine who starts the game, each player draws a card from the top of their draw pile. The player that draws the card with the highest points starts the game.

During each turn, the player starts by playing a card on his/her playing field. The effects of the card played takes place immediately and only lasts one turn. Each player must play only 1 card per turn. The player ends his/her turn by drawing a card from his/her draw pile.

The first player to achieve a total of 20 points wins the game. Alternatively, the game ends when one player runs out of cards in his/her draw pile. All players will then have to count the total number of points from the cards on his/her playing field. The player with the highest total points wins!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Take That

name: Super Heat Skateboard Trading Card Game
description:
Description from the back of the box:

Super Heat is a revolutionary new trading card game built by skaters for skaters. Create the ultimate deck by collecting your favorite skater's cards to link together the highest scoring run.

As an EXTRA BONUS you can collect inserted collector cards of your favorite skaters."

Games are played in a series of rounds, or "heats." Each player creates "lines" or strings of tricks of increasing point value, attempting to score as many points as possible. If a player can't play all of the cards in their hand, they risk dropping out of a heat early while their opponents continue to build lines. Once all players have dropped out of the heat, each player scores points equal to the highest value line they've built in that heat. Play continues over multiple heats, with the high score after an agreed-upon number of heats winning the game.

Available in 5 different 42-card starter decks, or 9-card booster packs.

name: Ridiculous Last-Minute Christmas Shopping Family Brinkmanship
description:
Every Christmas the whole family goes to Grandma's big house to celebrate. But this year Granny went to the Bahamas! Panic-buy your way to a happy holiday and invite relatives who have nowhere else to go - you have to show everyone in the family that you had the best Christmas!

Players take the role of families doing their last-minute Christmas shopping in order to lay on meals for guests on Christmas Day and Boxing Day, and buy and decorate a tree. The board consists of a number of shops; each shop has a separate queue, and each space in the queue offers a different reward - from food items to trees to decorations. On a player's turn they first move all of their limited number of pawns one space down the queues they're in, then choose to either start a new pawn at the top of a queue or retrieve a single pawn from a queue and take the item they've reached. The player must take exactly one of these two actions, meaning they have to carefully plan ahead to make sure they don't run out of pawns before they reach their goals, and don't end up with more than one pawn on a desired space in the same turn.

The task is complicated by the opportunity to bump other players' pawns around in queues or make trick telephone calls that distract your opponents from their shopping, and the juicy bonus points on offer for inviting various relatives to come and have dinner with you... so long as you don't offer anything they don't like!

Ridiculous Last-Minute Christmas Shopping Family Brinkmanship is printable as a single A4 or US-Letter page, intended to be included in a Christmas Card; to play 4 coloured pawns, a pen or pencil and a piece of paper for each player are also required.

name: Crazy Cereal
description:
Grab a spoon and watch as it magically changes color. Then, dig into the cereal serving bowl and scoop up pieces of that color. Cross your fingers for a color flash free-for-all! Collect the most cereal pieces and you win! (From the box)

Crazy Cereal is a children's game for 2 players. Each player gets a spoon which when turned on, lights up with one of 4 colors. Players try to scoop cereal pieces in the color matching their spoon's light as it changes, one piece at a time. When a spoon starts flashing, that player gets a "free-for-all" and must scoop 2 pieces of a time in any color. Players can also scoop orange colored pieces which are only available during a "free-for-all".

The player with the most cereal pieces in their bowl when the serving bowl is empty is the winner.

name: Pixl Adventure
description:
Pixl Adventure: Dungeon Quest is a dungeon crawl/hack-n-slash card game for 2-4 players. Setup takes less than 2 minutes and gameplay takes around 30-60 minutes. Suitable for ages 8- infinity!

The game is played by selecting your hero and relevant health tokens, drawing starting equipment, then drawing monsters/traps/chests from the dungeon deck until this has been exhausted and both bosses have been killed. It is a co-op game that engages all players every turn.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Role Playing

name: Star Force Alpha Centauri
description:
(Not to be confused with the 1974 SPI game StarForce 'Alpha Centauri': Interstellar Conflict in the 25th Century)

Description from the publisher:

Star Force Alpha Centauri covers the initial human penetration into interstellar space, with the map showing the local group of stars in three dimensions. This will have several different races of sentient beings, each with their own psychology, reflected in different capabilities and objectives. Game units will include: star forces (four ships each), star gates, and star soldier strike commands.

There will also be some specialized units, such as local forces of varying capability, weapons packs for star forces, and nova inducing conversion bombs for when things get really desperate.

A deck of cards will generate specialized capabilities for each sentient race as well as game events, allowing for the linking of individual scenarios into one grand game. One mounted map, card stock ships and stands, wood/plastic markers, one deck of cards.

name: Let's Go Sugaring
description:
Very simple childrens/family cooperative game.
Theme of the game is springtime maple sugaring season.

At the start of the game, the game owner shuffles well and places all 16 cards (depicting either pails, a sap collector or bad weather) face down in the 16 spaces around the perimeter of the board. In the middle of the board are 9 spaces depicting tapped trees. Off the board, but within reach of all players, are 16 small plastic pails.

On a players turn, (owner goes first) one of the 16 cards is turned face up. The action that card shows affects all 3 center spaces in the direction the arrow on the board is showing.
SAP PAILS: (depicting 1 to 3 pails) place plastic pails in number
shown anywhere on those 3 spaces. You can never have
more than 4 pails on one space.
SAP COLLECTOR: player takes all pails in the direction of the
arrow, and places them in front of him.
BAD WEATHER: remove all pails in the direction of the arrow, and
put them back in the general supply.

The winner is the player with the most sap pails after all 16 cards have been turned over.

Game instructions also include information about maple syrup.

name: Slicer
description:
Entry into the 2017 9 Card Nanogame Contest

You are an elite hacker known as a 'slicer'. You have recently targeted The Corporation as a prime target. Your goal is simple, find and compromise their database. Armed with your trust cyberdeck and your program routines, you must act quickly before you are detected in The Corporations system. Will you be successful or will the defense prove too much for you to overcome?

Slicer is a Solitaire game using cards to represent The Corporate's assets arranged in different grid patterns. Using blue discs as a time keeping mechanism, you will reveal cards, defeat the assets using a D6 and the orange discs to help ensure success by augmenting rolls, or allowing for a re-roll.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Push Your Luck

name: Welt der 90er Jahre
description:
Description from the publisher:

The 1990s – was that your time? In the game Welt der 90er Jahre, use your knowledge of which song is considered the hymn of the German reunification, what was fashionable, and what Karl Klammer was all about. In this game, you learn everything around the world of the 1990s in a playful way. Answer questions about fashion, sports, movies and TV, music, literature, and politics. Who was the world champion of Formula One? What was heroin chic? What scandal was unearthed about Milli Vanilli?

name: Ladders
description:
Two tradesmen vye for business on ladders of ever increasing height.

Play cards to expand your ladder and score points, or to hinder your opponent.

A card can only be played if the number of spots on its edge matches the card that it joins.
A card is placed so that it either joins the top card of a ladder or overlaps it half way. Some cards may be rotated before being placed and those with creatures on have special actions.

.
Ladders was an entry in the 2016 18 Card Microgame Contest

name: Getaway to Asia!
description:
Players collect various types of resources—money, time, special gear, tour guides, etc.—that allow them to travel to cities in Asia and purchase travel experiences, which have point values. Each player starts with a randomly dealt hand of five (5) unique Experience cards, each detailing a particular travel experience in a particular city. Players are able to draw other Experience cards through the course of the game. Players purchase Experience cards from the five (5) in their hand, or from Experience cards that have already been played by other players. The five (5) Experience cards in your hand do not count for points until they have been purchased by traveling to that particular city and exchanging the necessary Resource cards for it. Only one player may “claim” a particular city and any experiences they purchase in that city. There are five different categories of Experience cards: Adventure, Sightseeing, Romance, Rest & Relaxation, and Culture & Service
The game ends when a player has purchased at least one (1) of each category of Experience card and plays their Go Home card. Players may choose to keep traveling and purchasing additional Experience cards if they wish, before playing their Go Home card to end the game. Players use the Scoring Values card to calculate their total points. The player who plays their Go Home card first to end the game scores an additional 10 points. The player with the highest point total wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Set Collection

name: Spider Pete's Treasure
description:
Spider Pete's Treasure is a children's skill and action game for two to four players. You've caught Spider Pete burying his hoard of ill-gotten goods and it's up to you to steal his treasure using your spinning mechanical hook before he jumps at you. The first player to steal five rings wins the game.

One player controls Spider Pete and the other player acts as the pirate thief. The thief begins by rolling the treasure die to find out how many rings he must steal this turn. He then winds up the mechanical hook and shouts go and begins trying to fish out the appropriate number of rings from the plastic tray. The other player immediately begins rolling and re-rolling the spider dice, hoping to get two spider icons to show. If the thief steals the correct number of rings first, the round is over and he keeps the rings. If the Spider Pete player rolls two spider icons first, he slaps the lever on the back of the box to cause Spider Pete to leap out! If this happens, the thief player must return any rings he stole this turn to the tray. Players take turns being the thief and Spider Pete until someone manages to collect 5 rings and win the game.

name: Zombie Apocalypse: The Dice Game
description:
Description from the designer:

Zombie Apocalypse – The Dice Game is a solitaire dice placement game where you control [4] elite Navy SEALs trying to get home by searching for [5] SATCOM electronic communication pieces, through sixteen possible locations containing a variety of hostile combatants: zombies “slow, fast, mutant and radiated”, plus dangerous Raiders. Each of the sixteen locations is randomly generated to create a PATH that must be followed to reach each building and secure each location. Within five of these locations is one piece of the five necessary electronics components that you must retrieve and install into your portable communication device. This communication device must eventually hook up to the control panel at the final location: SATCOM #1. Each of the sixteen locations may also provide critical supplies and equipment to help you along your mission. Be careful, within each location you will find yourself constantly being attacked by hordes of zombies and murderous raiders that will kill you on site!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Zombies
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Tile Placement, Worker Placement

name: Mobile Suit Gundam Wing: Obiettivo Terra
description:
User summary:

The Oz Army is controlling the Earth, and is your objective to be the first to destroy them.

In Mobile Suit Gundam Wing - Obiettivo Terra you, and the other players, will play as one of the 5 main characters from A New translation: Mobile suit Gundam W.

Each different pilot is suited with is iconic Mobile Suit, which differ not only in design, but in performance too.

For example, Duo Maxwell pilots the Gundam Deathscythe, which is a really fast machine, while Trowa Barton prefer the Gundam Heavyarms, perfect for suppressive fire tactics.

The game is played on a pre-print board, divided in squares.

On the board (which represent a stylized version of the Lagrangian points around the Earth) there are indicated each player's starting point, which represent 4 different Colony, some Asteroids to mine for gathering resources, and the Earth, with is defensive line.

The objective of the game is to be the first to defeat the Gundam Epyon, the mobile suit piloted by the unknown leader of the Oz Army, waiting on the Earth (the center of the board) for a worthy opponent.
Each player’s turn starts by throwing 2 dice: this indicates the numbers of squares you may move on the board.

At the end of the "Movement Phase", you must draw an "Event Card", unless you end your movement on an Asteroid or a Colony: in the first case, you may mine it to draw a "Resource Card", in the latest you may un-load your Mobile Suit in the Colony's hangar bay.

Each “Event Card” may trigger different effect, it could make you challenge some Mobile Suit from the Oz Army, sent to defeat you.
Each time you encounter an enemy Mobile Suit (or you land on the same spot of another player) a battle occur: you throw 2 dice and, by using the "Battle Table", match a particular stat of you Suit with the enemy's one.

Some “Event Cards” will let you boost the performance of your Mobile Suit, or let you avoid the encounter immediately, or give you some other kind of bonus or malus.
Before jumping ahead to the main villain, you will first have to clear 2 missions:

gather enough resources to build the Gundam Wing Zero (even if you like it, your first Mobile Suit will never be able to defeat the Gundam Epyon)
meet the requirements on a random "Diplomacy card" drawn at the beginning of the game;


once you are done, you can go and try to defeat the "bad guy”, finally freeing Earth from the Oz Army oppression!

Description from the publisher:
L’obiettivo del gioco è raccogliere materiali dalle colonie con il vostro Gundam per costruire il potentissimo Gundam Wing Zero.
L’operazione non sarà semplice perché ad ostacolarvi ci saranno orde dei temibili mobile suit di OZ e ovviamente gli altri giocatori. Una volta costruito il GWZ sarete in grado di tornare sulla Terra ed affrontare lo spaventoso Gundam Epyon per l’epico scontro finale

name: Minions Challenge Card Game
description:
It’s game on for minion-against-minion action in the Minions Challenge Card Game! Each one of these hilarious Minion characters comes with 5 cards and a game guide. Deploy your battle cards against your opponent and keep playing until your Minion reaches the top of his score card first to win! (Source: Publisher Website)

Gameplay Overview:

32 Unique Card Decks are available. Each contains 5 Cards and one Minion Figure.


Players combine 3 Unique Card Decks to form their draw deck.
Players draw 4 cards to form hand
Play cards from hand simultaneously, apply any affects
If one minion defeats the other, move that minion up one space in score track. Repeat, re-draw after every 4 cards played, shuffling as necessary.
Once all Minions (or the number of agreed upon minions) on one team have reached the end of their score tracks, that player wins the game
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Seventh Cross
description:
The year is 1920. Beneath the surface of society, an ancient and enigmatic Church suppresses knowledge of the supernatural to protect the greater good of humanity and retain its grip on the world. Vast conspiracies with unknown ends move in the shadows — secret societies and ancient empires — and they seek to restore the lost, mystical power of ages past. Dark magic breeds monsters within the hearts of men, which break through to the surface and consume them. It falls to the hunters of the Church to destroy these monsters before they come to light.

Take on the role of a Church Hunter, a sworn defender of the world against the forces of darkness, in Seventh Cross and delve into the heart of evil as you explore your way through ever-changing castles filled with unique narrative. Meet mysterious and treacherous characters, do battle with terrible monsters, and confront the darkness in your own soul as you walk the narrow line between the pursuit of power and its ultimate cost.

Seventh Cross is a rogue-like exploration game for 2-6 players that combines elements of paragraph adventure games like Tales of the Arabian Nights and exploration elements like Betrayal at House on the Hill together to form a Castlevania/Bloodborne/Helsing sort of narrative adventure.

name: Spin-a-roo
description:
Description from the publisher:

Spin-a-roo is a fun, fast-paced sorting and counting game with two ways to play! Early learners will enjoy the sorting game - a race to match the most numbers and colors on their card! Advanced learners will love the counting game- a race to collect the most tokens by counting up and down from one to ten! With a device that makes colorful tokens appear like magic, Spin-a-roo keeps young learners excited about practicing their sorting and counting skills. There are two ways to play:


The Sorting Game (Green Side)*


The goal is to collect the most Tokens by making color and number matches on your card. A player is chosen to turn the Spinner Handle and fill all seven slots in the Spinner Tray. The chosen player should crank the handle around in a circle until it is back on the starting position. When any player sees a token that matches any color or number on his/her card, he/she calls out the number, takes the token, and places it on the matching space on his/her card. When no player can make a match, or the seven slots in the tray are empty, the next player (moving clockwise) cranks the handle a full turn to reload the slots. When there are no tokens left in the spinner handle and no more matches can be made by any player, players stack all the tokens they have collected. If you are the player with the tallest stack--YOU WIN!


Counting Game (Purple Side)*


The goal is to collect the most tokens by counting up and down from one to ten! A player is chosen to turn the handle and fill all seven slots in the spinner tray. They should crank the handle around in a circle one full turn until it is back on the starting position. When any player sees a token that comes before or after any number on his/her card, he/she calls out the number, takes the token, and places it on the correct space on his/her card. Any number may be placed on the "WILD" space to start. When no player can make a match, or the seven slots in the Tray are empty, the next player (moving clockwise) cranks the handle a full turn to reload the slots. If your stack reaches 10, clear that stack and start over. The tokens that you have cleared will be counted toward your total points at the end of the round. When there are no Tokens left in the Spinner Handle and no more matches can be made by any player, players stack all the Tokens they have collected. If you are the player with the tallest stack--YOU WIN!

name: StoryCards: Die Drei !!! – Labyrinth der Spiegel
description: StoryCards: Die Drei !!! – Labyrinth der Spiegel is a storytelling game of sorts in which a player or team is confronted by a situation that presents them with two options for a journey. Which way should they go to solve the mystery? Once they choose, they lay down the card, then search for the appropriately numbered card that they chose. The more cards they lay down, the more they score. If a card is no longer available, however, then the game ends and the detective trio has failed.

name: Dust Tactics: Mercenary Heavy Machine Gun Squad – "Sisters of Mayhem"
description: Heavy firepower and very strong interception capability. Mercenary heavy machine gun squad is a good supporting in your army. Skillful girls team available for hire, all of them from a different country of the Neutral Nations Organization
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Ninja All-Stars: Shojo
description:
Shojo is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

The captain of the magnificent trading vessel, Tako-Tako, is as famous for her wild ways as for her wondrous wares. Shojo loves a party, and she brings one (or more) with her wherever she makes berth. A fearless navigator, she is equally masterful with the sword, which she hastily employs with typhoon fury—so long as the sake lasts, that is.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Spirited, Swashbuckling, Sake-Slamming Mercenary Hero
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Sports, Video Game Theme

name: Bumpi
description:
Description from the publisher:

The dice in Bumpi are unique in that they do not roll on the table; they bounce! This is because the dice are actually five-sided objects in which four of the sides are attached to the fifth, and to "roll" the die, you push it down onto the table, flattening all the sides, then let it spring up to roll around.

Why are you doing this? Because all players are presented with a task card at the start of each round. Sometimes you want to find an animal, sometimes a color, and often both — and you need to keep rolling until someone finds a solution and wins the card. Whoever collects five cards first wins the game!

name: Labyrinth: Scarabs
description:
When magic items started to disappear from the Labyrinth
And the mages came to steal its ancient power…
The holy swarm struck for the first time.

The Scarabs of the Labyrinth have awoken to guard secrets of their home.
They are extremely small, deadly quick and dangerous beyond imagining…
They will take control over anyone who seeks power of the Labyrinth for himself!

”Heroes delving into the ruins of the ancient Labyrinth…
They were looking for the gift of immortality, with Crystals of Fate as keys to this most noble of gifts.
We do not know if they found this gift. What we know for sure is that they found the Golem - a strange construct build by an ancient race.
But it was not the only creature lurking in the depths of the Labyrinth. There were many more…”
Explorer of the Labyrinth from Tiphere’eth

How does it work?

Scarabs lie dormant in corridors hidden in frame pieces...
They come into life after players take three magic items from the game board.
Each player may spend 1 action to move a Scarab swarm.
When a Scarab encounters a character, this character must make a Scarab Check…
If the check is successful, the Scarab dies and is removed from the game for good.
If the check is failed, the Scarab transforms the character into a monster!
Fortunately, any transformed characters can try to return to their own form!

name: Labyrinth: Undead Warriors
description:
The Ancients who built the Labyrinth millennia ago
Used a race of Saurians, whom they created.

Strong, manlike lizards were their favorites.
They fascinated, amused and surprised the Ancients with their cleverness.

Saurians worshipped the Ancients as their gods,
While the Ancients had devised grand plans for their children.
They did what they could to develop and educate them…
But they failed.

Despite their cunning, Saurians remained savage.
They kept fighting unending bloody wars,
Wars of domination among themselves.
When Saurians were close to extinction, the Ancients chose to keep in the memory of time
A recollection, however fleeting, about their children. Nothing else could be done for them.

From that moment, Saurians have been kept alive by the Power of the Ancients.
They guard their magic buildings and majestic portals.
They do what they have always done best - fight any enemies
Who wish to wrest long-buried, holy secrets from the depths of time.

What can you expect from this expansion?

Efficient hunters prowling the Labyrinth with inhuman speed!
Predatory warriors that aid each other and poison their game!
The Ancients’ Chosen able to come back to life from the underworld!
Cunning lizardmen who steal keys and magic items!
Monsters immune to the Golem, traps, magic of the Ancients and events!
IMPORTANT: Any player may move Saurians once per turn by spending 1 action!

name: Planeta Zwierząt
description:
On Planeta Zwierząt ('Animal Planet') you will encounter various species of animals. Try to determine their characteristics and guess on which continent they live. But you have to avoid the hunter. And better not call the wolf out of the woods.

The aim of the players is the assignment of animal cards to the appropriate continents and prioritize them according to the values of their characteristics. The game allows you to explore the characteristics and habitat of 110 species of animals.

name: Dust Tactics: NDAK Recon Squad – "Desert Scorpions"
description: The Afrikakorps is finally back to where it belongs! And to open the path to its victorious troops, the Recon Grenadier Squad is perfectly suited to find a way. Stealthy, swift and deadly, the Desert Scorpions, as they are known, are always in front of the rest of the army. They can take out high value targets with their own weapons and even call-in artillery strikes should they encounter heavier resistance. Surely a unit feared by all enemies of the Axis!
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Marvel HeroClix: Nick Fury Agent of Shield Fast Forces
description:
Standalone set for Heroclix, which can be used as a starter set or as an expansion.
Contains characters from Tv show Agents of Shield: Agent Phil Coulson, Agent Melinda May, Skye/Agent Daisy Johnson(spoiler:)) ,Dr. Jemma Simmons, Dr. Leopold Fitz , Director Nick Furry and stats cards for all miniatures.
categories: Adventure, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Super Mario Tower
description:
Bowser sits on top of his tower, but it starts shaking as more and more Yoshis and Toads are invading the tower. Super Mario is trying to climb to the top as well, making things even more shaky.

In this game of dexterity, players take turns rolling a die, to see on which of the colored layers of the tower they have to place one of the Toads or Yoshis. As more miniatures get added to the tower, it gets less and less stable. If Bowser falls off the top, the player whose turn it was loses the round.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Dice, Video Game Theme

name: Mask 'n' ask
description:
To find out the character on the mask you are wearing by moving round the board and asking the questions shown on the playing spaces you land on.
Each turn you move and ask the question you land on - then take a guess. You keep track of the answers with your handy YES/NO counters.
Quick to learn and great fun to play, Mask ‘n’ Ask is a hugely entertaining way to get children to develop their logical thinking.
MASK ‘n’ ASK - double sided, TWICE the FUN!
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Deduction, Party Game

name: Project Airlock: Resurgence Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Resurgence Expansion Pack for Project Airlock contains 18 new cards, including new characters and abilities, new missions, and powerful new additions to the deck such as Engine Failure and Nullify. It is shuffled into the Project Airlock game deck to add more variety and allow for more complex strategies.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: On Their Merry Way
description:
In On Their Merry Way, 2-5 players take control of Robin Hood's Merry Men with one goal in mind: Setting crafty traps to make the most profit off the nasty merchants who move along the trails of Sherwood forest!

Each turn, players start by scrounging the resources they need to build their traps. Then players take turns setting traps in clearings along the forking paths of the road, expanding the number of routes the travelers can take. The aim is to prey on the specific follies of the wicked, dim-witted, greedy, and lazy merchants that travel the path because merchants will only fall for traps set specifically to lure in travelers with their folly. The follies of each band of merchants changes from round to round, as does the flow of traffic between the two main roads. Once all players have set traps, built roadblocks, or seized empty clearings for their own, each of the five bands of merchants follow the path based on the follies of their leader. Once they fall for a trap and lose some of their profit, the next merchant in the band becomes the leader and they continue in this manner until they reach their destination. Players must also be careful their plans for wealth are not ruined by traveling guards, which will destroy every trap that match their folly they come across on their patrol.

Once any player has amassed 25 profit ( or 20 in a five-player game), the game is over at the end of the round, and the player with the most profit wins.

name: Zombie Babies
description:
Description from the publisher:

Zombie Babies is a humorous character building card and dice game. The aim of the game is to get the most XP points, by completing quests which involves killing zombies, collecting items and building your characters stats.

Build your Hero - Improve on your skills and gain items to help you complete quests and defeat zombies.
Complete Quests - Choose to fight a zombie or choose a quest to find items and build on your 3 stats, to make future questing easier
Take a Nap - Too scared to venture forth? Regain your health or energy before embarking on your next quest.
Player Interaction - Use special cards to help yourself or make life harder for your opponents.
Each quest requests you to complete a set to skill tests by rolling dice to test your characters stats individually.

You roll the number of dice equal to your characters stat that matches the test requirement on the Quest card. Get that number of symbols on your dice and you get the rewards listed at the bottom of the card, these can be an Item, an increase to your characters stats or XP.

If you fail you might lose some stats you gained earlier in the game or health or energy.

Quest cards include a small funny story which players can choose to read.

However beware the other players might have a trick or two up their sleeve to leave you behind and fall prey to the many zombies wondering the nursery. Special cards spice up the game play and allow you to affect others turns making them weaker or help yourself overcome obstacles in your way.

At the end of each game a random Boss card will appear, all other quests will disappear and players will have to fight the Boss to the death to survive!

After completing quests and defeating zombies you keep the card and place it under your hero building your stats and XP. On the left hand side of the Hero card there are XP rewards to work towards. Be warned that if you fail to complete a quest or defeat a zombie you may need to loose a card decreasing one of your stats and any other benefits it gives!

name: Shinobi just
description:
Shinobi just takes place in the Sengoku period, the period of warring states. Behind the battle for supremacy, ninjas act secretly. Carry out your mission and block your enemy's way to win a fame throughout the land!

The players are ninjas with missions. You can gain more fame for missions with higher risk, but taking too much risk leads to failure. Seek the identity of the player on your left while hiding your identity. The player who gains the most fame points wins.

name: Bibi & Tina: Das große Rennen
description:
A memory and racing game themed on the German audiobook series "Bibi & Tina".

Players race hobby horses over a course of action cards, carrying out the action at each card (eg. jump over or ride in a circle). At the end of the course they use the magnet on the end of the hobby horse's stick to pick up a symbol card that matches on of the four symbols they looked at at the start of the game. Then they run back to the start of the course and do it all again until they have all four symbol cards.

The player who got the most matching cards is the winner. In case of a tie, the player who got back to the start first wins.

The game may be played with two players, or with two relay teams.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Real-time, Sports
mechanics: Memory, Pick-up and Deliver, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: Panzer Attack: War in Russia
description:
Panzer Attack: War in Russia is a fast-paced, easy to learn, deck building, card-wargame that captures the epic scope of World War 2 combat on the Eastern Front. The core game abstractly simulates the war between Germany and the USSR between 1941 and 1945, and the territory cards included allow players to fight along Army Group Center's path between Berlin and Moscow. Additional add-on modules add more cards for greater customization possibilities, and open up new campaign options.

The game uses deckbuilding aspects that allow players to customize their deck to fit their preferred play style, and features play that only requires the cards themselves in order to play a game.

The objective of the game is to either destroy all of your opponent's forces in play, or capture all territories on the board. This is done using troop and unit cards that represent the troops, equipment and historical units that fought in the war, in addition to action and leader cards that add variability and an extra layer of strategy to the game.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Norticles: Hattrick
description:
The “Hattrick” game presents one of the episodes from the Norticles universe, which took place during prince Linnamen’s detective journeys. He was one of the private investigators secretly hired by the town authorities, and it was his conclusions that let the inhabitants of Loch Scarland inform the investigators from the capital city, where to look for the fugitive murderer. Karn did not mention this in his report, so as not to expose the inhabitants to repressions due to the illegal involvement of prince Linnamen.
During the game of “Hattrick”, the players become the characters of this story. They may once again solve the duel between the two antagonists (Karn and Milton), changing not only its progress, but also the final outcome. This variant is available also in the “print and play” version, which can be found on www.norticles.com .
In the box version, you can get to know other characters involved in the story, which will make it possible for you to play alternative scenarios. Among the characters, you will see prince Linnamen, the monks Rafael Gabriel and Augustine, and Mid Guns, the villain. All the characters come from the gamebook titled „The Wasteland”, where some of the events also take place in a wooden hut. The Hattrick game is therefore a perfect addition to prince Linnamen’s adventures in the Kaer-Nar-Nort wasteland.

http://norticles.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/Wasteland_de...

name: Grimoire Quest
description:
Description from the publisher:

Grimoire Quest allows 2-6 players to take the role of powerful wizards in a massive all out war against one another to claim the lost pages of The Master Grimoire ( spell book ) to become the Master Wizard and rule the land.

The game contains 3 decks.
Wizard Relics: These are each players personal defense cards.
Narration Deck - Contains piece of story that is happening on the battlefield as well as a special rule for that round.
Action Deck: The core of the game play: spells, attacks, and special cards.

The game play is simple, each player chooses which wizard they want to be ( Fire, Shadow, Earth etc. ) Each player lays their wizard's 6 relic cards face up in front of themselves. Players then draw 5 action cards and follows any instructions on the cards if applicable. The round begins by the dealer reading the top card of the Narration deck which includes a small bit of story or an event that is happening on the war field. There is an action on each narration card that sets a special rule or action for that round as well. Each player has one opportunity at the start of the round to cast one spell before the round begins. After which players then each take turn attacking the defense relics of the other wizards in an attempt to disarm one another. Once a player has all of his relics "broken", they are "defenseless" and can then be eliminated once a player attacks them with a Mortal Wound card.

The game is won by one of two methods.

. collect all 12 pages of the Master Grimoire, either by luck, chance, defeating a player, or special cards that allow you to take form other players etc.
. Defeat all other players and win unopposed.


Collect and complete Master Grimoire Page pairs to gain special immunity skills and attack boosts!

name: Pawn Command
description:
This is a Chess variant in which you'll use patterns of Rook, Knight and Bishop to command Pawns into the glorious battle to the last pawn standing.
Game is played on 5x8 chequered board with regular Chess pieces so if you have set, you're ready to go.

Designed for 2017 Two Player PnP Game Design Contest.

name: Vikingaspelet
description:
The game is played on a slanted grid using three pieces to a player, representing viking longships; the goal is to cross the playing field to your opponent's starting spaces the fastest. Each turn a die is rolled, with an odd result usually resulting in moving one ship one space, and an even result meaning a lost turn. Opposing ships block but do not capture each other. Some spaces require a specific die result to enter, and other spaces are effectively forbidden, sending a piece back to the start if for some unexplained reason you should enter them.

The game is nominally for 2-4 players, representing the vikings of Sweden, Finland, Norway and Denmark, but it would not be fair to play with 3, since the board is effectively divided in half and with 4 players the two pairs interact very weakly except for the racing aspect.

There is no year of publication, but the Alga logo (or lack of one) suggests the 1940s or 1950s.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Snag the Flag
description:
Snag the flag is an active game designed to teach kids and people of all ages about health and fitness by making it fun and energetic. The players won't even realize they're exercising and learning but just having fun. Snag the flag is all about action!

The players will not sit and hang out but instead they will be on edge ready to chase after flags, act, guess, high five and perform tons of hilarious actions. The game has three different challenge decks to choose including fitness, trivia and showtime. Each deck contains 50 cards. The game also includes a 2" soft foam category die, 6 sets of flags and a game board.

The fitness challenges have individual and group challenges with four levels per card. The trivia challenge cards have four levels of questions as well. The Showtime challenge cards are hilarious stories that have to be acted out for an applause. Than you also have to be on guard for someone trying to snag your flag. So the game is quick, exciting and unlike any other family game night out there!

name: Mit Galileo um die Welt
description:
In this game, players follow tv-reporters from the show "Galileo" on their journey around the world.
In different sectors, players have to estimate about special behaviours in different countries (like How long is the rollercoaster ride in a certain holiday park in the netherlands or "how many liters of icecream eat germans within a whole year?") and with some luck and skills, they can put the nations flags on their suitcases.

Dices are included and will determine, which questions you have to answer.

name: SHRINE
description:
SHRINE: Completion

SHRINE is a competitive abstract strategy game, where two players take turns placing stones on a beautiful board of tiled pentacles. The stones and the pentacles each come in three colors: crimson, cream, and cobalt. Stone placement follows this order, and players take turns placing the next color of stone on the board.
